yuHLOafGlqo60A2dQzLDhg.text: Food was very tasty. Service was timely. The Restautant is so loud you can't hear yourself think let alone carry on a conversation. If Cajun food is your goal, it's perfect. If you are looking for social interaction with friends, you will be disappointed.

aLjqE-Ig6iS3nFgugvwA_w.text: Once again the food is great, and atmosphere is awesome! However, the server and food runner or the guy refill drinks are so so....  We tried the crawfish popcorn, dinner special sirloin steak with crawfish etouffee, and crawfish and shrimp creole. They are very good, especially the dinner special.

FMhyRzbMApEFbGudeFAu4Q.text: The only thing I get here is the pork tenderloin which I LOVE every time. Very consistent! Prices are expensive and service is not very friendly.  Environment is charming! Love the old house.

fLCpkUV8elng5rYJaDoOCQ.text: Loved everything about this place!! The food was so delicious that days later my husband and I were still talking about it!!! The catfish was the best that I have ever had! This is hands down one of my go to restaurants! My husband loved his chicken as well! We can't say enough good things about this restaurant! Great job Cajun queen!

xnh_Vbhs9TZRKekHHPG0pQ.text: Amazing service and the best NOLA inspired dishes in the city. The atmosphere of this place makes me feel like I'm sitting in New Orleans.

I0Oa6REFnayQETL5ktuOLA.text: Why haven't we been here before?? We went for restaurant week. It was crowded and a bit noisy but I didn't mind because the food was absolutely wonderful! Out server was very knowlegeable and offered great suggestions. The food was some of the best that I have eaten in a long time. (And we eat out all of the time!) This is certainly going on our list of "go to" restaurants. The atmosphere is nice and it would be great for a date night out or girls night. Again....the food is GREAT!!

0hFBMmGnpIVd40Y3jKaZKQ.text: Anything but impressed... food was ok.. But not great and comparing it to new orleans or louisiana is an insult.. im writing this review as i am actually in the restaurant!! Decided to eat at bar upstairs was not greeted.. flloor manager i guess didn't even say hello.. he just handed me menu.. on the other hand the bar tender was nice.. she spoke a few times and after i received my food.... nada!!  I had shrrimp scampi which i could tell the shrimp was fresh.. something was missing!! I think it was the garlic... had the crawfish etoufee and the roux was bitter!! Im like wth?? With that being said i decided not to have the dessert.. oh and another thing the representation of new orleans or cajun was not present in the staff that works here.. people that are creole are naturally warm and welcoming!!  grade C

FasLMEQ45h5TYb8MvNSKcw.text: It is in a cute house. The ambiance was intimate but the music adds some fun!  Definitely yummy food and talented Jazz band!  Do: order the cheesecake (we had oreo), to die for!!!  Don't: get a bloody mary unless you LOVE cocktail sauce!  Overall we will be dining there again!

PuBy3V-EaLErAGdxMEwqQA.text: Food was excellent, service was great! I ordered the BBQ shrimp and Cajun Pasta. I used my living social coupon because I like to save.

i2PgPDgkigEo6ro8izy3Pw.text: The food was bland. It's hard to obtain good cajun food outside of New Orleans. I had to add old bay to my Gumbo and shrimp creole. Bread pudding was good.

1i-PP2xUvd_omSUIz2abWg.text: . Great live music and food and drinks , a must go back to restaurant in Charlotte asap , watier was Very good and food was alsome.

nEuSSM27ef6zD2MoNa5t0Q.text: This is (I mean WAS) my first time at this establishment. I purchased a Groupon that was expiring so decided to utilize it. I made reservations for myself, mom & son. Once we were seated, the server proceeded to tell us about the restaurant week menu. I advised that I had a Groupon and was not interested in the special. Well low & behold, I could not use my Groupon. I told the server the Groupon was expiring, thus the reason why we were there. Not my issue that it was during restaurant week. He asked me if I wanted him to speak to the manager about it & I stated "yes". He returns & informs me that the manager stated that I could use my Groupon. Great news or at least until the check arrived. Once I received the check, the amount of the Groupon ($45) is not deducted rather only $25. I inquire about this to now be told that only the amount I paid could be deducted or the manager would allow the Groupon to be extended a month...all of this after we have eaten. We drove an hour to this place trying to use the Groupon before it expired. If I was only going to receive the paid amount of the Groupon, there was not any need for us to drive this hour on a Friday afternoon in rush hour traffic. I am not sure what restaurant week is but we did not partake of the special menu being offered. In addition I would not visit a restaurant that is a permanent Groupon fixture during "restaurant week". I believe the point of restaurant week is to try out restaurants you may not normally visit due to cost but Cajun Queen is a Groupon regular that can be visited for an expensive amount anytime of the year. I patronize businesses that actually warrant my business. Unfortunately this will not be one of them.

P8NRotBLi_jyd-BRFIMKRQ.text: Great food, nice location, complimentary valet, awesome service AND there's typically a Groupon; $25 for $40 worth of food...what more can you ask for ?!

ejVMgCuOb1c1jJpNndvcnQ.text: There were 10 of us here for a work dinner on a Wednesday night. The place wasn't too crowded but our table was right in front of the band upstairs and I was a little worried it was going to be crazy loud. Luckily it ended up being the best spot we could've gotten.  The table started with fried oysters and fried crawfish which you aren't going to go wrong with.  I ordered the ribeye and broccoli with a cup of gumbo. I wasn't crazy about the gumbo, and I thought it was a little thin and lacked any substance. Everyone else seemed to like it though. My ribeye was cooked and seasoned very well though with all that fried food in the beginning I couldn't finish it all. Two guys ordered some bread pudding for dessert and I tried some and it was awesome.  As for the music, they would play a few songs and then take a break so we could have conversations if we wanted. We had some Portuguese guys with us and someone asked them to play some Portuguese songs which apparently they did. You could tell the guy on the keyboards knew what he was doing and seemed to enter another world when he started playing. Overall it was a fun night with good food and everyone there seemed to enjoy themselves.

fHuLnf2sd0z1cssCNRRYOQ.text: Throughly enjoyed the crawfish Diane. Wonderfully flavored and a large plate of yummy. Plenty left for lunch. Nice atmosphere too. Felt like being in Nawlins.

VP073XZP80yhSK3aUVcsxQ.text: Enjoyed the food for Sunday brunch. We had the Fried Green Tomatoes, shrimp and grits and the omelet. Then had the bourbon pecan pie. Everything can out quickly and the service was great. Definitely will be back.

fSXs6Ye5zvyytag01z0O0g.text: It was more than a good meal, it was a great experience. We recently visited New Orleans and loved the culture and food.  Cajun Queen perfectly seasoned / spiced dishes made us feel like we were back there again. A gem without a doubt in Charlotte with impeccable attentive service.  We will be back and refer them to others.

CkwEH2-ICDXGONed-yUOxw.text: Brunch with the family. It was great! Spicy Tassos biscuits, an omelet and shrimp and grits. All shared and all delicious! Service is friendly, fast and suoer-clean. One of our favorite places. The back porch is right and inviting.

G7SjMMM0fAad9BpUckkmEw.text: The setting of this restaurant is great. The food is great. The live band is great. My waiter, Alex, was great. All these things that contributed to the atmosphere of this restaurant which was amazing!

qvXJdPhd7PRxN_-m46YEOA.text: I love Cajun Queen!! I have been here several times and I will continue to go for the ambience, great cocktails, and fantastic food!!! The fried green tomatoes are prob the best I have ever had.  The 7th street stumbler is an awesome cocktail!! Not to sweet, but still slightly fruity. I could have easily drank a few of these but I stuck to one. Ordered the Catfish, if you like spicy you would enjoy this...it's awesome.  The reason I give this place a 4 and not a 5 is because of the service we experienced last time we were there. Our waiter was AWFUL, extremely rude -- prob the worst service I have got in a restaurant in years.  He rarely came by to ask if we needed anything, didnt clear our appetizer plates and we were sitting at a small two top. When we were finished, we waiting around for 25 minutes for him to show up. When he did finally show up he threw our check back at us without saying a word. The ONLY reason I left a tip was bc I use to be a server and even tho he was horrendous, I still can't bring myself to leave a person no tip.  Anyways, the bad service I experienced the one time I went here will not keep me from going here.  Love Cajun Queen!

LYe4p2XeyHNzPQ9jn8Za8A.text: Valet parking was helpful, as it was raining. We especially liked the bbq shrimp appetizer, be sure to have plenty of bread on had to soak up the very delicious sauce. I had the filet diane. My wife had the etouffe. We both loved the preparation and yummy spices. Our waiter, Christian,  was pleasant and helpful. PS. the Cadillac Margaritas were outstanding. We recommend!

e8CTVF0GBDs_EgAX3u3MVg.text: Food was bangin. I got the sirloin special with mashed potatoes and etoufee with just the right amount of kick.   We requested to sit upstairs thinking we would have a nice date with some soft jazz in the background. Oh man was I wrong. The music, in combination with a table of like 20 people, made it almost impossible to commuicate. We literally texted a couple times, it was bad. Overall it was nice and I would go back, perhaps on a weeknight, and will most definitely be sitting downstairs. Enjoy!

K-wv4L3telmkqKP-xhGR4A.text: Enjoyed the creole with chicken. Great spices snd flavors used in dish. Waiter was very knowledgeable and helped with picking the right entree especially it being first time eating Cajun food.  Ended our meal with the toll house cookie pie...YUM!

zlvyQsYATV2nndt_-tex0g.text: Had a great dinner here last night in part because of the great deal we got from groupon and the fact that they have a good selection of Abita beers.    The shrimp etouffee and shrimp diane that we got were both quite good, and the service was pretty decent as well.  They forgot a few things, but were nice people at least.   The location is pretty nice and we were able to take a walk around the block afterwards to help digest (why the hell is 7th street totally paved over into some 5 lane highway... slow down people).  Having just gone to New Orleans a few months ago, I'm glad that Charlotte has a place to get  this type of food, although it's still not perfectly on point.  Live Jazz never hurts (but if you sit downstairs you won't be able to see it and probably can't hear it too well either).

DsQhKuWxc0cGoZrKfDUgWw.text: Always delicious !  The best Cajun in Charlotte !  Ambiance, always a jazz band upstairs. Roof deck dining patio off the upstairs dining,bar area. Every dish is spot on !  Whether you like "Diane" style(mildly seasoned)or Etouffe style (spicy) my personal favorite I usually get the Etouffe chicken and shrimp combo. Craw fish also available.  Had the Blackened fish before, it was delish also. Before that the Blackened Pork Medallions with plantains, off the charts ! Fried green tomatoes are a hit for appetizers, juicy and tart. Good wine selection, and beer also.  Service is very attentive as you would expect. Let the valet park your car, as mainly curbside parking around corner, eclectic old part of town near uptown, small parking lot.  Long story short, you must eat here many times to experience the various dishes available. Weather a simple night out, or entertaining clients, a must on the dining list....

e-qssXMvZJBeUK-TTh2lig.text: Being a Louisiana native who grew up eating authentic cajun/creole dishes, I hesitated to try this. Everyone insisted so I tried it one day. I had the crawfish etoufee and it had very little flavor and it was quite runny. I didn't even finish after about 4 bites. The shrimp and grits were good. The portion sizes are great for the money.  The desert wasn't worth the time. we got it delivered through a 3rd party service and had to warm it up so maybe that was part of the problem. I'd try it again but not the etoufee.

rIOSPRNJ4Sj14_du0enR7A.text: Great food, great atmosphere, and very friendly waitstaff. One of my favorite places to go for dinner and for brunch. I am from Maryland, so I know a thing or two about crab cakes, and the crab cake benedict is the best I have had since moving to NC. Also a big fan of the shrimp and grits!

Mf5zmW-cI8sCi4PVkx6iCA.text: Great food nice atmosphere, service was great. There was a mix up with our food, manager came without requesting and comp our meal. Will definately return!

3sUNjnLoMgxwM2ZQZ05IeQ.text: Great atmosphere so I have it three stars. From someone who has been to New Orleans multiple times I can say confidently that the food here is bland has no flavor. They lack the spices and seasonings that True authentic Cajun food has. I ordered the shrimp etoufee and my fiance ordered the pan seared duck breast. Both looked decent but essentially lacked flavor and the comfort you get from eating good ol New Orleans Cajun food.

wI9Rj0AR3_n1zOJGIgcKvw.text: All around this place was great! Atmosphere is one of a kind and when they had the band upstairs, it's a different feel. The food was very good and plenty. Staff was very friendly and informative. Very close to where we live and we will definitely be back.

CnHYvoE6Zpii1vIFdDqoWg.text: Excellent food the price is comparable especially on the creole dishes. You have to make reservations if you want to get a good seat otherwise come before six o'clock.

F47NdPuSA-S0NCUPJd18nA.text: Nice place, great food, what more can you ask for, just to let you know this is fine dining so be prepare to pay a little

vc7QGF9Da-Jg1Ybf1ikfJg.text: Great atmosphere, Great food. The waiter Alex is the best at what he does. Truly had a great time!!!

CZxYLHDOY5AA-yQpbmWg6A.text: Interesting concept, having a restaurant in a kind of living family house, but that is common for the upscale Elisabeth area in Charlotte. Very good food, not quite Southern as in Louisiana but very close. Very friendly staff and quick service. Had to visist my hometown to go there, shame on me since I lived 5 years in Charlotte and never went eating there. We had a great time and can recommend it to everyone!

HhRa90sgqsmjBs78CE6cgg.text: This place is pretty good. It's more of an upscale cajun joint. If you are looking for fancy cajun - this is your place. I prefer a good dive (there was one down the street from this place - Bayou Kitchen - it deserves honorable mention - it was a better example of real cajun food). The food is good - the location - also nice. I took one star away because it's not as good as the place that was just down the street.

S2e7StC33Sa2dRkaKYTjfA.text: My fiance and I went to Cajun Queen one night as a date night.  I was not impressed by the food nor the ambiance.  We booked a late night dinner due to his schedule  and when we arrived, the jazz band was already on break.  We were seated but our waitress appeared to not to want to be there.  I ordered the New Orleans ice tea and my fiance ordered sweet tea, it took a while before the drinks were delivered and let me tell you - It wasn't nothing to brag about.  The food was spicy not flavorful, just spicy.  Even the couple beside us was a little perplexed about it just being spicy (a little eavesdropping).  Needless, to say not a great experience.  So fortunate that I was able to get a group-on discount and not pay for a $70 experience that I didn't enjoy.  I wouldn't return or recommend this place.

rQEWPoXLkG52v9Tyug-n0w.text: Wow... where do I  start  everything was great from the time we walked the door ! Me and my husband are newlyweds and we were on our honeymoon in Charlotte  and I  must tell you the manager treated us to a glass of champagne and he seated at a nice table, the waiter was great and the food was absolutely  wonderful! It was like we took a flight to New Orleans for dinner!  We will let all our friends know about this place and we will definitely return again!

7CgePGxvXowURScmJE0w2A.text: I mainly visit the bar at CQ and I can only come up with positive comments. Bo, the bartender, is great. He remembers my name and drink choices. That is very wonderful. I highly recommend either dining upstairs or taking out. Very fine.

hMmV1G96AedF446GMlAzow.text: Very good food, great service, nice atmosphere. Free valet is a big plus in that neighborhood too.  I like the food at Boudreaux's a litlte better because I love their jambalaya, but Cajun Queen is very good too and a little nicer inside. A little more pricey too but on par for that part of town.

LlaYLNE4nMkDsPHgv8rwtg.text: Parking sucks. First time here and our waiter forgot literally everything. Ordered a beer and asked for a chilled glass, never came out. Told us all entrees came with salad or soup, never came out. Never was offered bread and didn't realize it until we were leaving. Every time we had to ask for something, he never gave us a chance to ask or talk because he would whisk away quickly. Also the hostess asked if we had reservations... Lol, it was 3 o'clock on a Sunday? Food was okay.

HrkZBiRjfVz5nUjRVqgAzQ.text: Unexpected surprise. And a pleasant one. Cute part of the city (Elizabeth) with other historic homes around it, Cajun Queen has been around since 1985 in this hundred year old house   They have nightly jazz which on cool fall evenings fills the breeze flowing through the southern charm of the house   There are tables on the first floor and a full bar upstairs. They also have complimentary valet.  I tried the 'Cajun popcorn' as an appetizer (they also give you bread rolls and butter). This is fried battered crawfish. A bit rich, couldn't finish all of it. The etouffe  was also reliably authentic and somewhat on the rich side (I chose the etouffe with all three {shrimp, crawfish, shrimp}) although I think the chicken is best left out altogether.  This place is one of the charlotte landmarks I'd say. Five stars for ambience, three for food, four for service. Four overall.

gdTiXVun55oEFvYsPMEGEg.text: Their fried oysters are the best for miles around! We get them every time with the broccoli and excellent Cole slaw.

_K7k4dnBsGqkwITgRlnu8w.text: Amazing authentic creole dishes. Live jazz music playing is perfect for the ambience. Staff is friendly & polite. A great place to enjoy Cajun food anytime.

dlE8bFQhn1pQGvuBxtfLhA.text: I have been wanting to try this place for while and happy that I finally decided to come. Very nice ambiance, we sat on the second floor where there was live jazz. We both ordered something different and loved each others meal. Our waiter was very attentive and our meals came out quick and hot. Ummm...almost forgot about the amazing Mandarin Martini I had.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. &#34;Diane&#34; with chicken(rice,garlic and mushrooms with an amazing sauce)

hMGDC4fBcRN7_0ToqOc9Ug.text: My husband loves the spicy Cajun food. I like the Shrimp Scampi, not spicy at all. I always take him here as a treat, because I am not a spice fan, but he is. It can be crowded, it can be noisy, the tables are sort of crammed in tightly in some areas. The decor is fun, and I love the Mardi Gras beads hanging on an outdoor tree. If you're hungering for a taste of New Orleans, this is your place.

GbLQdHbYi6-h8JCXJxRTBg.text: YES! So good & authentic! Best place to find anything remotely close to the taste of New Orleans around the Charlotte area for sure.

vxzn-yTFQrrZ7uyPoEDKCw.text: I really, really don't like leaving 1 star reviews. But man oh man, this was a bad experience.   There is complimentary valet which is a huge perk. If you choose to self park, read the signs posted so you don't get booted. Tip the valet, they hustle hard.  Me and the boyfriend had a reservation for 7 on a Friday and were running late but we were still seated pretty quickly. I will also note that we had a groupon worth $40 worth of food.   We ordered the New Orleans BBQ shrimp for the appetizer. I know that garlic is an ingredient but I almost died. The shrimp was well cooked but it seemed like they soaked the shrimp in garlic, sauteed it in garlic, used garlic powder- the whole nine. Thank goodness that they provide complimentary bread to negate some of the garlic.  For the entrees I ordered the Etouffle all 3 (chicken, shrimp, crawfish) and the boyfriend ordered the Creole all 3. Most disappointing entrees ever because there was no seasonings. The Etouffle had heat but no flavor. At a Cajun restaurant, I should be tasting at the minimum some Old Bay seasoning and some Lawry's. The boyfriends creole was the same- bland. Needless to say we used the hell out of the salt/pepper shaker on the table. It's actually pretty sad because the meats were properly cooked but so damn bland.   I've been to the NOLA before and loved it. I've eaten Cajun food before and loved it. I've made Cajun style foods myself at home before and loved it. Thank goodness for Groupons because I would've had to hop in the kitchen myself to show them how it's done if we paid in full.   Service was odd. Our server was perfect at first but then it just went downhill. I was almost done eating when I got a refill of water. We didn't get checked on until we were also almost done eating. We ordered beers in cool glasses. The boyfriend wanted a second beer and the server throws a bottled beer on the table and quickly walks away...Um okay.   I'm glad I ate here because of all the rave reviews because I wanted to try it myself but I will NEVER return. This place is borderline insulting.

kfpTjFMuHvZG5AbN21E6XA.text: One of the best restaurants in Charlotte. We had the Cajun fried oysters for the appetizer and i had the New Orleans Platter as my entree. All of it was amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States

GIi0jN-zU4tczzKu610Y0Q.text: Bro's and Holesome ladies, this place is phenomenal!! See my Mahi Mahi dish below, but we also crushed some bbq skrimps that were also amazing. Used the juice to dip bread in and almost asked for a straw! Come by, completely worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States

oIgStqDeecMQrVuVjdEcGw.text: Best BBQ Shrimp north of New Orleans. Great atmosphere and the live jazz band amplified the energy.

9uBoDxpKTFeoXss4NepeQQ.text: Best Cajun/Creole Restaurant in Charlotte. And live music EVERY NIGHT!!! Flavorful, tasty, and downright AMAZING!!! All of the prices are reasonable and the wait times are usually short.

EaRsnSdbZdsFmyIvbByOLg.text: Honestly I'd give it a 3.75. Food was good but not amazing. HUGE portions for food - which is good except the tables are a little small. We had 3 people at a 4 person table and it was cramped - 4 people would've been too much. Table clothes would help a lot I think. I wouldn't recommend the specialty drinks. Andouille sausage was not andouille but it was good. Overall I'd go back but it wouldn't be first on my list.

Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and grits - great shrimp, red sauce was eh and the grits tasted more like cornmeal
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mahi mahi (very fishy) with crab topping (good but tough)

9WbmhH9b6i5n6NfQWDgrzw.text: Always a good Choice! I love the fried Green Tomatoes and the ettouffe, but I can't imagine there being a bad choice on the menu. Great atmosphere as well!!

C8zIdzjexc7yNzZExeWU1Q.text: Came in for restaurant week in Charlotte. I had the seafood gumbo for a starter which was okay. I thoroughly enjoyed the Diane & Bourbon bread pudding was amaaaazingggg. I would definitely recommend the two.

_5sR9ERppqpmnjVN9xf_WA.text: I really enjoyed the atmosphere in here! I've never been to Louisiana but it definitely made me feel like I was there. The service was absolutely amazing and you really get your money's worth along with a great amount of food! I had the crawfish etouffee and my goodness the spices were perfect! I mean just seasoned to perfection! I also had the green fried tomatoes were out of this world! If you are ever in Charlotte please go to this place. Especially if you love seafood.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States

9rOEMrHwEXd2pVXCSnZ0Iw.text: We went for restaurant week and our server MacGregor was wonderful! The food was equally as excellent and we had a lovely dinner, never felt rushed and were really able to enjoy our experience. I will definitely be back! Thank you Cajun Queen!

EWlKp6xf6iGHFUWf-yoopg.text: This was a little taste of New Orleans in the Carolinas. The food was excellent and full of flavor. They have a live band on sunday morning for brunch which wad a nice little addition to the ambiance. It is a small restaurants that looks like it was a house. This adds to the down home feel and warmth of cajun food.  My friends and I had the Crawfish Scampi with grits, BBQ Shrimp, the gumbo and the blackened chicken. It was all very good, but the gumbo didn't have as much flavor as the other dishes.  I DEFINITELY plan to go back again!

j6zOybyBzHf_6b2zWttSjg.text: Went with my parents. Loved it. The Chicken Diane was delicious! I got a cocktail as well. They definitely don't skimp on the alcohol  Overall great experience.

ofJz7CicAHy-yYdBnJtNIQ.text: Great fun place to eat! Food and service is always good. Never a disappointment. The band will have you rocking!!   Nice quaint place for date night!

G1RXQNnp_cjNe_GL3sM6dQ.text: I know people love this place and that it has a cult following but I wasn't impressed. We went for Sunday brunch and it was so crowded and I felt like we were seated on top of the table beside us. The breakfast items were very basic and overpriced. I'm guessing it would have been better for dinner but don't bother with their brunch.

c8jBWQ_G8UDtOzcduOknZA.text: Our hotel suggested the Cajun Queen 7 years ago.  We enjoyed it so much that we made a reservation for our first night in town and were not disappointed. We had the BBQ shrimp-hot but wonderful.  Would not have thought of dipping the bread in the sauce- until it was suggested and glad it was.   Then we had gumbo, also good and finished with chicken etouffee.  Ambience is welcoming and fun, jazz was great, staff attentive, thoroughly enjoyed  the evening.

V3wHGJHd_NOG1701sSOzAg.text: We had a reservation via Yelp and were seated immediately on the first floor. We were provided the menu and the waiter pointed out the daily specials. I wish he spent more time to acclimate us to the menu and what Cajun Queen was known for. I really wanted to be on the level where the Jazz was, but that wasn't offered. My husband got the New Orleans platter and I had the fried shrimp and oysters. Our food was cooked perfectly and my topper of crawfish and artichoke hearts was delicious. We will be back.

jVg1yTeno3H36w__N7qQ5g.text: When I found out we were going here for brunch while I was in town, I was excited.  I had not had beignets since I was in Nola in April and I was craving them.  When we arrived at 10 to 11 (brunch begins at 11), there was already a line of people waiting outside.  The doors opened and people walked in like they had not ate in years, we knew we were in for a treat.  The restaurant is within what appears to be a house.  The dining rooms are where a living room and a den would typically be.  We were seated by the fireplace, which was running since it was 45 degrees outside.  The decor is very quaint and welcoming, almost like you're visiting a relative's house.  The dinner menu is also available all day but you truly go to this place for brunch.  I originally asked for a coffee with amaretto but they don't serve alcohol before noon (I'm spoiled from NY brunches) but their regular coffee was just as good.  We started off with an order of beignets.  6 perfectly sized fried balls of dough were presented with the most delicious strawberry compote in the middle for dipping.  The beignets were perfect and light and that compote made my day.    For our entrees, we each got something different and decided to pick and choose from the other plates.  I got the bacon, egg, and cheese omelet.  This omelet was thick with a whole layer of bacon going through the center.  It also came with a side of cheesy grits, which were also delicious, and fresh fruit.  My friend got the bananas foster French toast.  The bananas were sweet but good and the toast itself was fluffy and delicious.  My other friend got the rice and beans, which yes becomes an entire meal since sausage is also included.  These were some of the best rice and beans the three of us have ever tasted.  And this is coming from a Puerto Rican, who also confirmed their tastiness.  Overall, this is a fantastic place for brunch.  Get there early, and try a little bit of everything.

ROtYVOCU-PjKQ67h28f1Ag.text: This is my first time in Charlotte and only here for a few hours omw back to NY. Recv'd a list of restaurants and we chose Cajum Queen. The food here is some of the best New Orleans based Cajun I've had outside of New Orleans itself! Absolutely worth every penny! The staff  were very nice and attentative without being annoying. Definitely want to return to Charlotte just for this place!

qFo2b1sTYcRAhCPYMsDwIA.text: Went here because all the reviews are 4 stars and up but Yelp fooled me this time. Gumbo was tomato based and very acidic, not crazy about it. Etoufee had a nice roux but what ruined both of these was the SHRIMP! Farm raised, flavorless, they had the texture of a cheese puffs. The food would have been ten times better if they just used a little bit of fresh seafood. I tried my friends etoufee with chicken and I wish I had ordered that. I can't take a Cajun restaurant seriously that won't use  decent seafood products.

WH31HW4Jq5avJp-ccxpoSw.text: Came with a friend and the house is really cute. It's a plus that they also have valet parking when you pull up. Inside is nice. Atmosphere is warm and cozy. We sat by the fireplace. I ordered the etouffee with chicken, shrimp and crawfish. It was good. Very flavorful, I didn't even have to put tobacco sauce in it because the spices were on point. I wasn't crazy about their bread, it was really hard. My friend had the gumbo soup and I tried it and it was delicious. They were pretty busy on a weekday. We saw the waiter maybe 3 times-When he greeted us, when he took our order and dropped off the check. He never came by in between to check on us or fill up our drinks.Service wasn't that great but I will definitely give it another try. Other than that, food was good!

m2vJk9NoyVm0VSPiOFwKhA.text: Cajun Queen is my favorite Cajun Resturant in the world by far!  The shrimp etouffee is to die for. The ambience and service are great as well.  A must stop in Charlotte.

83X0Y8SmSlDoyr5hnLTwTQ.text: Didn't really care too much for the food. The wait was long for overpriced, bland, food.

-I24-nVc1q-Z5o0QwLaABQ.text: Friendly staff, average food, and limited parking.  I had the gumbo and shrimp and grits. My boyfriend had the blackened chicken.   I really felt that the food needed some salt, and there was none on the table. Honestly I can make better shrimp and grits than they were serving. His chicken was very juicy. The atmosphere is very cozy. We went on a Sunday evening not too late. It seemed to not be packed at that time. I regret not trying the bourbon pecan pie.  Thankfully we had a Groupon for half the price!

bP0qHp75KSHq3ylGqvnDIQ.text: Such a huge fan of this place. I visited once with a friend for her birthday, and we were both impressed. Their food is True, authentic Cajun food with the best flavors. My friend got etouffe, and it was the perfect consistency. I got cajun pasta and enjoyed every single bite. Don't forget to order a hurricane--in True New Orleans style, it was delicious.   The restaurant itself is such a cozy environment. It's in an old house. If you're not bothered by walking around nooks and corners to get to your seat, it makes for a really comforting dining experience. It felt a little bit crowded (you sit closely to your "neighbors") but that doesn't bother me. Also, keep in mind that it is valet parking only. There's really nowhere else to park. Also, make a reservation if you can--it gets extremely crowded.    Recommend this restaurant if you're looking for something unique.

Ghnyc09JgBEYbyPhQK-Xng.text: We always love this place it is always spot on and the cajun/creole tastes are True to the origin. Shrimp app is incredible, we really have not every had anything bad here. I recommend you try this place even if you are not a cajun fan.

ncDlZx7R7XDh36a662ca3A.text: Great experience!  Fantastic food and service!  Fernando was our waiter and was very pleasant and attentive.  We had the crawfish scampi, gumbo, and etouffee (with chicken, shrimp, crawfish, and sausage.  Thumbs up on everything!  I made reservations via Yelp and we were running late due to traffic and called ahead and they let us change our time to a half hour later (1:15 min drive turned into an 1:45 min drive).  When I made reservations I stated in the comments that it was our fist time there and we were celebrating our 1 yr anniversary and the gave us complimentary key lime cake to mark the occasion.  We will be going back for sure and hope to get Fernando again.

qKlgAlk1KliwhV83dMSPOQ.text: Found this place via Groupon and I am glad I did. Great food, great service, and a live jazz band. We had the Cajun popcorn, BBQ shrimp, seafood gumbo and shrimp and grits. All excellent! If you happen to be in Charlotte as we were then check them out they will not disappoint!

U0lY8jm226E0D0vs67uGMw.text: We didn't try the food because we just wanted some wine, but it all smelled amazing and when we arrived at 4:30 we were asked if we had a reservation so I'm thinking they're usually pretty booked up!   Service was good in the bar...definitely enjoyed our wine and the atmosphere. Great way to get that Southern feel! At 6pm their live jazz started up. I was hoping for some more lively music, but it was more easy listening which was understandable given the size of the restaurant and the close proximity of the band to diners.

fi9Pbb8Z4bzzlHaxXGEJTg.text: Ok, I love this place.  Is that what you want to hear?  I really, honestly, truly love this restaurant.  "What makes this place so special?" you ask.  For me this place is the perfect marriage of great service and great food, and aren't those the very reasons we go to all these restaurants in the first place?  Service. & Food.    The food was nothing short of pure, delectable bliss.  We (my dad and I) started with a few drinks and the New Orleans B.B.Q. Shrimp, "Sauteed with Butter, Garlic, Beer and a Variety of Cajun/Creole Spices".  It contained, 5 juicy, succulent pieces of shrimp; swimming in a small bowl of "cajun/creole spices"  for $8.95.  Very spicy + very tender = very good.  Don't forget to dip your bread in the broth!    For the main course, my dad and I split the Shrimp Diane.  Now the Diane sauce contains, "Mushrooms, Garlic, Butter, Green Onions, Parsley and Queen's Magic Spices sauteed together. Moderately spiced and served over Rice."  They give you the option of splitting it for only $5.00 more bringing the entree price to 23.95.  Certainly not cheap by any means, but well worth the cost.  The best way to describe the taste, is to image garlic, butter, onions, and a bunch of "Queens Magic Spices" working harmoniously to perfectly marinate the shrimp with the rice keeping things from getting to sloppy.  Its Cajun food at its finest.    At that point, things were so good we just HAD to get dessert, right??  We decided to order the pecan pie.  I mean, pick an adjective - amazing, spectacular, splendid, etc.  It was served to us warm and moist (that's what HE said - LOL), as if it was just taken out of the oven, with dab of whipped cream.  The service was on point from start to finish; from the valet to the host/hostess to the super friendly bartender upstairs.  Everyone was really kind and polite. What exactly separates the staff here from other restaurants?  Its all in the details...for example, every single person said, "be with you in one minute" or "be right with you".  No one ever ignored us, or expected us to wait until we could be helped.  My drinks (adult/H2O) were never empty. We didn't have to think/worry about parking.  There was a plethora of condiments, hot sauces, etc to satisfy even the most particular taste buds.  Bathrooms were immaculate.  They had live jazz.  ...See what I mean about the details?  I'm hooked.  I'll be back very, very soon, maybe even tomorrow!  I love this place.  There.  I said it!

7cDc1t83oDSS4Z4FKFVFzA.text: Nothing fancy, just good food and good service, great value.  I had the crawfish etouffee.  Deep flavor, good portion; chased with a Louisiana craft beer.  It hit the spot.  I also had a crawfish scampi that was a little too garlicky for me, but I ate it with a dinner roll and it was fine.  I was able to order a Caesar salad for just $3.  It was simple, but pretty good.  The restaurant itself looks like someone's house, and you do get a southern neighborhood feel when you step in.    Evidently they have live jazz some evenings, so if I'm back in town I'll check out.

p6bn2MEwsffs3Kq_1O_1kw.text: Good food and some things are the menu are so much better than the others. The gumbo was not as good as I expected but the BBQ shrimp, shrimp and grits and fried green tomatoes were awesome. Do yourself a favor and buy the group on $25 for $40 worth of food. Nice little Cajun gem in the QC.

ebCxeUmUszY1dBIwj6z8zA.text: I was not overly impressed with the food,  it was okay and over priced. We got the seafood gumbo, shrimp an grits, and Creole. The gumbo was watery and overly fishy. The shrimp n grits were tasty, but nothing amazing. The creole was a let down, the only real taste it had was garlic. The shrimp and crawfish were mealy. They were over cooked. The chicken tho was good. It made the dish edible. There was no spices in this dish. Hot sauce didnt help. I would not recommend it.  The atmosphere was pleasant, we sat in a back room full of windows. That was nice.  The staff was accommodating and knowledgeable. They were always around and helpful.

r9wJb58eCXFv4N-W2dxopQ.text: Very disappointing!!! I don't recommend it and I would never go back. The barbecue shrimp and the etouffee were way over spiced, I don't mean spicy hot, it tasted like some one made a mistake and put too much herbs. The same goes for the gumbo. The pecan pie was absolutely terrible, it was nuked and soggy, the crust was wet with no taste and the pecans were ruined because the pie had been nuked. The fried green tomatoes tasted like they were previously frozen. The service was okay, it was clear they wanted us out as soon as possible. Trust me, don't waste your money, there are better places in Charlotte.

oXna3E2kC7iD5LmZSkQXog.text: Let me start off by saying, I REALLY wanted to like this place. I have heard countless rave reviews. Of course, I wasn't expecting it to compare to my food experiences in Louisiana but I was expecting something. My mother and I ventured here on Saturday for dinner and we were both really disappointed.   Fried green tomatoes- 2/5 The breading was really bland and they were topped with a gallon of sauce. They were very unappetizing. I prefer the ones I make at home.  Fried oysters app- really good and the only thing I enjoyed. I would highly recommend.   Salads- Truly out of the bag salad mix. They could have added some tomato or something to liven it up. The blue cheese dressing was good though.  Crawfish etoufee- It was very average with way too much rice.  Service, however, was phenomenal. We simply didn't enjoy most of our food. I really wouldn't even go back to try it again.

nxJ_X-HRfL9tnzrBOgOcnw.text: The food and service was excellent. it was hard to believe I was in Charlotte and not New Orleans.

IujRIpQwkVitddQ-ztohYQ.text: Everyone appeared as if they were extremely busy so rubbed off as rude hostess and servers. My server never gave me the Valentine's Day special nor did he recommend or discuss the menu. It was me and my husband first time going and based off the poor service and probably just wrong choice of dishes due to no guidance from server,  we will not be going back. Our bill was $100 and we didn't enjoy our food or service.

YMd8L8KYsmPJM6AniGCIAg.text: A delish Sunday brunch! I didn't think prices were high for what we enjoyed (okay, maybe a bit steep on the beignets, but those are worth it). My partner's banana bourbon french toast was a sugar bomb in the best way, and I could actually taste the bourbon in the ooey gooey syrup. My crab cakes benedict was perfectly cooked. The crab tasted fresh, not stale or dry, and the eggs were just right. It also came with a nice side of fruit. Overall, for $12 it my benedict was a bang up brunch plate.

c7p9-CeLg_kB5b_pO-mR9w.text: Food was good all of us got the same dish The cajun chicken pasta. The waitstaff was on point with service and refills. Only 1 downside was the parking.

ZmMoqi7-SBuKeOCrui7xxw.text: I want to like this place more but I can't give it more than three stars. Yes, it is different and they have good deals.  Colorful place, bar upstairs.  Frankly, just average though. Loud music that I just wasn't into.

qIFJtUMvR9vmgKbuTGQdVA.text: I haven't really had "cajun" food before, so when I saw an online deal for it I definitely wanted to check it out. We rarely venture outside Lake Norman and into Charlotte, but the thought of some spicy grub was enough to entice me. Man, I'm glad we went!  When we first arrived at 6pm the place was hopping. I highly recommend making reservations. As for parking, they have a complimentary valet service right next to the restaurant, so I recommend using them rather than driving around looking for street parking. The restaurant itself is a converted home, and has a great, quaint feel to it. However, the small rooms lead to tight quarters, and the neighboring tables will be in pretty close proximity to you. We ate upstairs, and if the close tables didn't make the room loud enough, the live band playing behind us aided in turning tableside conversation into a shouting match. Now this would really get on my nerves at other restaurants, but here it worked. I didn't mind the music, and had no problem forgoing conversation for a bit while enjoying the ambiance of the little room and smooth music. Also, they only played about four songs or so, and took a five minute break in between each, so it wasn't a constant barrage of noise.  Our server was quick and efficient, and our food was brought out in a timely manner despite the bustling customer count. For once I did have a cocktail rather than beer or wine, mainly because the mixed drinks were about the same price as a glass of wine. I ordered the Lynchwood Lemonade ($8) which consisted of Jack Daniels, Triple Sec and lemonade. It was a nice, strong drink and went great with the meal and music. The missus ordered a melon martini that she enjoyed quite a bit. It wasn't too sweet and still had a good kick to it.  After placing our orders some complimentary bread was brought over, which consisted of three rolls. These things might have well been hockey pucks based on how flavorless and hard they were. I think they might have fallen off the "bread pudding" rack and into the "fresh daily rolls" basket because there was no way these things should have been served as they were.  For dinner I ordered the steak special of the day ($24). It came with salad or gumbo, and I went with the salad. Big mistake, because all I got was a bowl with chunks of romaine, a slice of cucumber and some shredded carrot. The vinaigrette that came with it was extremely potent and way too strong. After picking at this salad the main course showed up, which was a 10oz sirloin, crawfish etouffee, mashed potatoes and broccoli. The steak was cooked to order, and despite it being a large (as in tall) cut of meat it was still tender. The blackened seasoning rub added a good deal of spice and flavor to the beef, and I was quite a fan. I was equally happy with the crawfish etouffee, especially since I've never had crawfish before. The etouffee consisted of peeled, small crawfish pieces (smaller than popcorn shrimp) tossed with veggies in a dark, spicy sauce. I really liked the crawfish, which tasted more like lobster than shrimp, and the spice level was perfect...not too much where I couldn't eat it but enough that I felt it after each bite. The mashed potatoes were decent, but nothing out of this world. The broccoli was done kind of poorly, as it was just some huge hunks of slightly steamed broccoli. While the sides and salad were nothing spectacular, the entree was one heck of a spicy, tastetacular bite.  The missus' went with the  Crawfish Diane ($18.95) and enjoyed it as well. The Diane was done in a lighter sauce that was not as spicy as the etouffee, so if you want something that's a little milder this would be the dish. This was her first bite of crawfish too and really enjoyed it. The Diane had a little more substance in that it added rice to the protein and veggie mixture, and there was so much that she had leftovers for lunch the following day. While it was tasty, I thought it was just a bit bland compared to the etouffee.  We ended up splurging for dessert when we saw they offered bread pudding, which has become something we can't pass up when dining out. Cajun Queen makes one heck of a Bourbon Bread Pudding (5), and if you are a fan of bread pudding you shouldn't pass this up. The dessert came in a decent-sized ramekin and was filled with this warm treat. The bread pudding had chunks of peach and raisen going through it, and they became hot and gooey from the heat of the bread pudding. It had great taste and texture, with a nice crust on top. There was also a pile of whipped cream and caramel drizzled across the crust, making the dessert a visual and edible offering.   Cajun Queen dishes out some great grub. While some things can be improved upon (sides and rolls), the stuff that counts is pretty banging. Our entrees were delicious and the cocktails were done well. This is one of those places that we will definitely be bringing friends and family to when they visit from out of town.

AIxi-3j6K6hVHZLkk3585g.text: We took our daughter there for her birthday a while ago, per her request.  We had a good group with us, but unfortunately they sat us upstairs right next to the band, which made it very difficult for conversation among all of us.  We've eaten our way through New Orleans a couple of times, but this, to me, was not quite up to par.  Especially at $15-$20 a plate.  I've been here twice, and unfortunately, I don't think I'll be back.  Fun atmosphere, great service, and yes, it would be a good date night.  But not a good group night.

T5N5UYN1Ln9iCA31ORMrrQ.text: The food was incredible, I got blackened catfish and my fiance got Diane with chicken, shrimp and crawfish and a side of andouille sausage and everything was great. The "steamed" broccoli on my plate was more dipped in hot water and still raw but it still tasted great. We also both got desserts, the key lime pie (my all time favorite dessert) and that was incredible and the bourbon pecan pie, which my fiance said was also amazing and was served warm. The reason for 3 stars is the service. Our waiter, Brandon, acted like he couldn't care less that we were there, just kinda threw the food down and walked away, checked on us only once and honestly just didn't even try to offer good service. The bus boy who refilled water, brought bread and took our plates came around more often than he did. However, when a group of older people came in he was so attentive and pointed out everything on the menu to them, went over where the seafood was from and took all the time in the world as he probably assumed they had more money than we did. Needless to say he got the tip that he earned for the service he gave us. I would absolutely go back for the food, just hope I would get a different server.

A6YTO36xEfYrfRqOy72SrQ.text: Great atmosphere!  Located inside a Victorian house with outside upped deck.  Live music and tasty food!!

ZmQGU-mD-V1_-jU8d4WYjw.text: Overall I love Cajun Queen it's usually the first place I think of to bring guests from out of town and for special events like birthdays.  The atmosphere keeps bringing me back I love sitting in this cozy house listening to the band and sipping on my dirty martini and the Mardi Gras beads just put me in a good mood.  I have had great experiences with the food and a couple just ok experiences - but I think now I know exactly what to order you can not go wrong with the appetizers the oysters are some of the best I've had and I love the crawfish scampi.  The BBQ shrimp are beyond tasty but I normally order that as my meal now it comes as an entree too. A couple of things on the menu I don't care for are the shrimp and grits if your thinking you'll be getting some southern shrimp and grits I will steer you away from this entree you will be disappointed. The gumbo was also a big disappointment to me where is the heat.  The fish specials are usually pretty good but can be bland. Stick to the dishes they are known for, etouffee, diane, creole, you'll be happy,

p2bKQ7lTWF2u0CVcUdr7uw.text: Went during the restaurant week and wasn't disappointed. I had the shrimp and grits with andouille sausage and a small bowl of gumbo.  The gumbo was a little hot (seasoning hot) but not too much.  The Shrimp & Grits were excellent as well.  The live jazz by the 3 senior citizens was excellent as well.  Overall everything was great and we'll go back again.

8jcZ1Dqm4rMuE-08TRJQDA.text: We sat upstairs so we could hear the band, that was ok. What I loved was the atmosphere it reminded me of a spot in Brooklyn. The food was excellent I had the shrimp and grits, and the pumpkin cheesecake "LOVED IT".  We would definitely come back.

-zkx1l1YRMmAjk-I4Xqrxw.text: The best fried oysters I've ever had(huge portion) on top of Caesar salad. Too much aioli on the fried green tomatoes but fried very well. Gumbo was tasty but nothing to brag about. The real star of the show is the oyster!

eqMPb81fqqNmCrdIlETJVQ.text: Visited today for Sunday brunch(party of 2)....Had a reservation, seated right away, were given our choice of seating area..We chose the back room(?) with all the fleur-de-lis pictures on the wall..There was a slight "odor" in the air, most likely from the mop water but soon forgot about it once the food came..Our server was Erin(correct spelling?) and he  was very good in explaining the Brunch menu,  etc..We didn't order adult beverages so I can't comment on the bar..We decided to go with the large order of the fried oysters and the barbecue shrimp and a bowl of of seafood gumbo... not  bad but nothing special...would not order in the future...But the fried oysters, WOW!! can definitely say they are some of if not the best we ever had!! Huge, perfect amount of breading, juicy and so tasty!! The barbecue shrimp were just about as good, sopped up every drop of broth with the complimentary bread(warm rolls) provided..And for dessert if you may,  Beignets  !! They looked great, and tasted just as great , still hot from the fryer with a perfect dusting of powered sugar and a strawberry compote(jam?) dipping sauce..Delicious!!  On the way out, we both used the restrooms(madame and monsieur) and both very clean ..And a big bonus, dined with a groupon..I definitely recommend the Cajun Queen and will be back, hopefully for dinner to catch the live jazz band playing there nightly..

UWxWEqQPQN_WotDF_o3IBQ.text: Nice, down home atmosphere. The service is excellent. The food is well prepared.  My only complaint is that while the food was prepared well, it was somewhat bland and forgetful.  Overall, it's a nice place but judging on food alone, it's ok.

MtijaEhv2b3Vn2OF67krrg.text: We had heard a lot about this place and decided to dine in here during the Charlotte Restaurant Week. We have been to this place only once so far. Just to be safe we made reservations. I will say this place has a beautiful ambiance. It looks like a house which is converted to a beautiful restaurant. There is valet parking available. The receptionist at the front gave us a nice seat on the second floor. It was just our luck because there was live jazz music being played that night. During the restaurant week, this place does have a very good choice of Entrees. You will be served with a 3 course meal with the addition of a glass wine of your choice. We had the cup of seafood gumbo to begin with. The soup served was the right quantity. Not too much or too less. Soup was warm enough. The contained scallops, shrimp, vegetables. For the entree, we had Diane with Chicken and Fresh Fish (blackened Tilapia). Both the chicken as well as fish we cooked well. The topping on the fresh fish were great. The diane chicken had a variety of vegetables on it along with rice. You can also have shrimp and chicken together in it. The food was warm. The third and final course is a dessert of your choice. We chose to have the Key Lime Pie. I cant remember much but I don't think a Key Lime Pie can go wrong at all. The server was definitely very polite and nice to us. She was checking on us at regular intervals and the food was served in a timely manner. During restaurant week, I would say the price of the meal is $$. However if you decided to go some other time, then it would be $$$. The restrooms were clean and tidy.

98herIMIuUUXTt6ahKWqfA.text: Cajun Queen is one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte. Not only is their food super delicious, in a quaint neighborhood with lots of charm, but their prices are incredibly reasonable. It is located in a beautiful house and always filled with diners. Make a reservation Friday and Saturday evenings! I love their Diane and Etoufee. It is good with any of their meat choices, but I like it with all four. Their is chicken...two good sized pieces, shrimp, crawfish, and andouille sausage. For me, that is enough for at least two meals. The shrimp appetizer is really good too! The servers are really nice and charming, and your glass will never go empty. Cajun Queen is a winner!

w0-ssvvMCnZb2tvy123hNw.text: Food was very good! Certainly not a creole expert, but felt very authentic.  Certainly beats any others Cajun places in Charlotte.   Service was friendly, was in a cute little Elizabeth house.   Only complaint was the seating was tight. Put four tables where three should have gone.   Overall, I would go back and recommend it to a friend!

5SbuKAKHqFdNj9hoMR7w5g.text: We went to the Cajun Queen for Sunday brunch. We had an 11:00 reservation so we were the first ones in the restaurant. We were greeted by our hostess and two servers who were smiling, friendly, and ready to go.  We ordered the beignets with homemade strawberry jam for starters, warm, light, sprinkled with powdered sugar, yummy!  We had the tasso biscuits and gravy, an omelet, the crab cake eggs benedict, and chicken strips with French fries from the kids menu.  Everything was great including the service and unsweetened iced tea.  The serving size was large, but not excessive.  When we were finished, we were too full to try the Key Lime pie which we were told was to die for.  If I had any complaint, it would be that the tables are a little too small for the generously sized plates, but this is a small place, so the small tables are a necessary requirement. The jazz music is a little loud, but not obnoxious, and is appropriate for the New Orleans Cajun and creole menu.  All in all, a very pleasant experience. We will be going back for dinner to try the regular entrees.

elofzHKXZdHhUVJ4GcDItQ.text: Went here for my wife's birthday.  Made a reservation arrived early and was seated after waiting 30 minutes after the reservation had passed. We came for the Jazz but wound up sitting in a room with no band and canned music.  The food was ok - and if we'd been seated earlier and able to actually hear the music I would give this place a 4 star review.

_YxdBIP-Fiatwn3sxwAdEQ.text: I really enjoyed the bbq shrimp! Great service. Friendly staff. Really cool building and space inside. Valet parking. Must Go in Charlotte!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ Shrimp
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crawfish Etoufee

p73XixUP_tyV0lhU5_4u9Q.text: I came to Cajun Queen with my team from work on Tuesday, May 22nd, 2018.  There were five of us... several of whom had never been to Cajun Queen before.  I made the reservation and was first to arrive.  The prompt and readily available complimentary valet parking is invaluable to guests in an area where parking can sometimes be a nightmare, so that's awesome!  I was seated immediately and asked if I'd like a beverage upon being seated.  The service really was snappy, well executed, and given with a big smile!  We ordered fried oysters and fried green tomatoes as apps which everyone loved, and then our meals themselves were just lovely... a perfect touch of cajun spice!    I wish I could write more, but all I can say is that if you like Cajun Food and a live band, you can do worse than to try out this Charlotte staple.  I've come here to eat several times (often with large groups) and the service and food are always a delight!

8yqt7PfjtbwoqVXOtzNUFA.text: Was excited about my New Year's Eve reservation and couldn't wait to get here. Disappointed at the abrupt hostess service but ignored this because of my anticipation of a great meal, NOT, I ordered the salmon, gumbo combo and had the fried green tomatoes as an appetizer, they were ok. The gumbo had good ingredients but not much flavor ( I've lived in New Orleans so I know what good gumbo tastes like). The salmon seemed over cooked and dry. So as far as the meal was concerned, disappointed. My waiter was great and is the reason for the 3 stars. Also my seat was tight and was positioned over an air conditioning vent that kept me very cool. I may or may not give it

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States

UrA2NwVH-LOVScHeqtYEsg.text: A four star review is very good IMO.  My wife and I flew into Charlotte, NC on our way to Columbia, SC for my son's military graduation.  After "yelping" several restaurants in the area we decided on the Cajun Queen.  Excellent choice, we especially enjoyed the ambiance and atmosphere of the Cajun Queen, it's a house converted into the restaurant.  The upstairs had a "trio" of musicians that were very enjoyable to listen to.  Now onto the food:  We started with the fried oysters, they were cooked to a very tender deliciousness with a very nice remoulade dipping sauce.  I had the shrimp and grits, my wife had a shrimp and rice etouffee dish.  All of which where very nice, although my shrimp was a pinch too spicy, but enjoyable nonetheless.   The service was excellent, well worth the stop.  I notice that there are a lot of 5 star reviews, and I certainly could agree with that, but, I'm giving it a solid 4 star.

cJUFt7mJY5n-xP0HjSMtBw.text: Food was good in comparison to authentic New Orleans style dishes  However the seafood gumbo was missing some flavor in my opinion. The music was a big disappointment though, we heard about 2 songs if that. Our waiter said they take "long" breaks...side note: the lemon drop was exceptional.

9libxl9yrZrxxEfIfv_0-Q.text: This is an alright restaurant, I personally wouldn't recommend this to anyone. I went here for my 17th birthday and it was alright. I first ordered the New Orleans BBQ shrimp, the only good tasting part of this was the shrimp and the rice and sauce to this was very bland. I decided to get something else and I got the fried shrimp which is served with broccoli & mash potatoes = $24 - this is ridiculous pricing and I wondered why it was so slow in there because they have bland tasting food and high prices. The server was very nice and patient about it. Whenever me and my family were walking up to the restaurant also the first window we walked past we saw all the employees just sitting down which is understandable is some ways. My mom also got shrimp with grits and she was disappointed and it was bland as well

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. $24 Fried Shrimp

z5Cs1c5ShkXL-YCvhM1jMw.text: Awesome as always, they never disappoint!! The Cajun pasta with blackened chicken was absolutely phenomenal!!! We will definitely be back again soon!!

nfec6ye8ikqB3_t9-PHh8w.text: I went here on a Wednesday night. There was no wait for seating. As soon as we were seated a gentleman came over and filled our water glasses. Maybe 5-6 mins later our server came over. He was amazing, unfortunately I don't remember his name but he was very personable and knowledgeable of the menu. The gentleman that came over to fill our glasses, never let us get past a half of cup. Our sever constantly peeked his head to make sure we were okay.   I did think the gumbo would be brown stewed instead of tomato based but it was still good. I ordered the Shrimp and grits and it was pretty good. Not the best but it was a good portion, and the blackened shrimp definitely helped.   I'm not usually one to leave reviews, but the service at this restaurant was SUPERB.

C1Nwv-H5vYhN_Ncl9wZzqg.text: We come here a few times a year. They have a good combination of repeat diners and those there for a special night. The wait staff is great. And there is music nightly.  We need to learn when the music starts and come then. They gladly substitute brocolli for the mashed potatoes.

RY-CM-7y7dHpJs-Y9z1qUQ.text: Best cajun food in Charlotte! Highly recommend starting off with the crawfish scampi as an app and ordering the Diane as the entree.

zk4-ddcbhL4QAqytAeUXgw.text: reeee this was weird food my bros

T_Kh47HmpsrFaqcBJdf9fg.text: Fantastic dining experience and McGregor did a fantastic job explaining the menu options and gave great recommendations. Great customer experience and quality cuisine

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States

Jne35zTV7hMmBAQhaVVJRg.text: The best Cajun food in all of Charlotte. The Crawfish Diane is my personal favorite. Endless amountnofncrawfish in this dish and the sauce is Devine. Great service and atmosphere makes you feel at home. You wont be disappointed!

RdP6H0YkaVcapfMdptiHyg.text: Cajun Queen has been in Charlotte for years. It is delicious and spicey. The price is right for the quality!

SlQjc25yHddFcmASZj5vmg.text: Went here with friends, celebrating a birthday.  Made a reservation, but still had a small wait for our table.  We sat in the main dining room on the right as you enter the restaurant - right by the entrance.  The tables are extremely small, and with four people, there was not enough room for drinks, water, bread, etc.  I asked to have some of the items removed, as we were not sure where they would put the food.  The food and service were very good, actually excellent.  We all decided to order something different, and because the size of the table, they would bring each dish out separately, with clean bowl and silverware - we'd all share the one dish, and then they would bring out the next.  The waiter actually put thought to the order on how to present the dishes, due to heat/spice of each dish - very well thought out.  Our server was very tentative, and again good service.  Definitely will be back, as the New Orleans BBQ Shrimp was my favorite, and then followed by the Crawfish Etoufee. Definitely need to have a reservation.

hNQBMibuSLQ223TL3ehN7g.text: Been here twice with my boyfriend and we love this place. We've had the All Three Diane and it was so delicious. Very nice atmosphere too.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States

OkDcbeRmnPJ_KV2JVncPMA.text: Amazing food, staff & atmosphere! We sat in the band room and had a wonderful experience.

J6YUevrHmdOhUABFNGi5tw.text: This is a favorite place for my sister so I was happy to give it a try!  I got the shrimp and grits and I have to say it was really good.  I was slightly jealous of my sisters steak which is all she orders!  I would definitely recommend if you like cajun food.

fLNqtrfwtp_Sx7Sg-Q4NCw.text: I have been going to this staple for over 20 years  And still go when in town. The food is delicious and atmosphere is good. Parking poor but valet parking available. It's a special place to have a great meal with friends. I always get the oysters and the Diane with extra crawfish! Tim keep it going!

MzP9gp632sAytXBif3Xs-g.text: A solid spot. This is one of my fiance's favorite places in Charlotte. We've tried various things - BBQ shrimp, chicken diane, pork chop, fried fish... it's all been great! We often find the gumbo kinda bland but it's nothing that we can't spruce up with hot sauce, salt and pepper. Service is consistently good, as well.   The only negative about this spot is how they seat people. There have been a few times when we've come when it hasn't been busy but they always seem to put us at tiny two people tables, crammed next to other couples. I get it - they want larger tables for larger parties but if it isn't crowded, why cram the customers who are there into small tables?!?  Note #1: we never come without the Groupon. It's a great deal. They have signs everywhere that say you must wait 24 hrs after purchasing the Groupon to use it so get it at least a day before you plan on coming.  Note #2: on an awkward date or don't really like the person you are with? Ask to eat upstairs - the band (which is awesome) is so loud that it's impossible to carry on a conversation. Me? I love talking to my fiance (corny but True) so I prefer to sit downstairs. The music is so loud that we can still hear it but we can also hear each other.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried Catfish
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Diane

Dlxj6Pr4VHuuPGTgarbw2g.text: This is a really solid brunch spot.  I haven't dined here other than that, so keep that in mind.  We started with an order of beignets as well as a fried green tomatoes app.  The beignets were exactly what you want in a deep fried confection: pillowy, soft but not doughy, with a tender outer crumb and a sprinkling of powdered sugar.  The compote that it comes with is also very tasty.  The fried green tomatoes were very good, as well.  They come on a bed of mixed greens with a remoulade over the top.  The remoulade was delicious and the tomatoes themselves were fried well.  My only wish was for a bit more salt in the batter; otherwise a bite of tomato without any remoulade was a bit lacking.  For our entrees I got the spicy tasso biscuits and gravy.  Holy goodness, was this dish rich.  The gravy was probably 50% fat (that's a good thing).  The tasso wasn't really spicy but it was tasty.  It came with a couple eggs scrambled over the top that were a nice textural contrast.  The biscuits themselves were world-class.  Extremely tender, perfectly baked, and an excellent accompaniment for the other components of the dish.  I was practically licking my plate after I'd eaten all the food.  My wife got fried green tomatoes eggs benedict.  I didn't try hers but the eggs were perfectly poached and I know from the app we had that the tomatoes were good.  She also had a little fruit salad on the side from which I nabbed a couple grapes.  Service was prompt, plates were cleared in a timely manner, and our table was in a porch area to the side that allowed us to get a glimpse of the beautiful weather outdoors.  We were stuffed to the gills so Independence Park being right across the street allowed us to take a lovely stroll immediately after.  Definitely worth a repeat visit, maybe for dinner next time.

1AReLzXKmUHUm1es5e1d1g.text: I love this place and can't wait to go back. The food was really good and reminded of my fave creole restaurant that closed down back home. Now that I've been, I know that I have found my replacement.  There was a jazz band playing upstairs that sounded really nica and added to the experience. The only thing I didn't really like was the parking and the dirty glasses. The wait staff did give us clean glasses, so it wasn't a problem for long.

xSfTS-PzGt9a6_t8Sp2Uzg.text: Loved loved loved this place! I had the Bayou blackened fish, chicken, rice and beans and my husband had the Etouffee. We also had the fried green tomatoes. Everything was so delicious! We were there for new years eve and the service was great! Our favorite restaurant. We can't wait to go back.

bGlhAIL0KGm662gNtiYj9w.text: I've been to Cajun Queen a few times now and I've been extremely satisfied with both the high level of customer service and also the food quality.  First, I showed up about 20 minutes late for my reservation (I know, I'm that guy) and they were able to seat us right away on a Friday night.  No questions, no hassle, they simply sent us to an open table as if we had showed up right on time for our reservation.  We had our 3 year old son with us so we each breathed a sigh of relief once seated.  Initially I wasn't sure what to order, until I started leafing through pictures on Yelp.  While it all looked good, the Shrimp and Grits stopped me in my tracks.  It wasn't your everyday Shrimp and Grits as they've given it a nice Cajun twist by adding a tasty creole sauce.  The shrimp had a distinct smokey flavor that worked really well with the dish.  The Andouille sausage also packed a nice punch that really pulled the whole meal together.    For dessert we ordered the Tollhouse Cookie Pie.  I had never had anything quite like it before.  It was really good; however, we both felt as though it could have had more chocolate chips.  The walnuts added a nice dimension too.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and grits

pegmXOJgtNCkwqP9GFaVDg.text: This place was amazing, a small hole in the wall gem! Great customer service and clean. Will definitely be back when in Charlotte area.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Delicious... A must try
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Delicious
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Delicious!!!! A must try

mlo8JBcp9Spb6nNpivAHrA.text: Best creole place in Charlotte we have ordered a number of different items and they are all good.  Had the fried oysters and BBQ shrimp as an appetizer last time and they were really good.  We sat upstairs and listened to the band in the next room.  Not too loud and an overall great experience.

sgqQI6JW3VB3YfS3RFZRfQ.text: Cajun Queen is a must if you are in the Charlotte area. It came highly recommended. It is located in a old renovated home, there is a bar and live music to go along with the amazingly delicious cuisine.   For starters, the drinks are strong, the fried pickles are awesome and the service was stellar. The staff is extremely friendly and peppy and service fast. I ordered the Diane with chicken, shrimp and crawfish and it was incredible, authentic and out of this world!  I wholeheartedly recommend Cajun Queen to anyone visiting Charlotte or any locals who are living under a rock. :)

J_utLEm9SyZmjrfLXVpDPw.text: This was my first time visiting this restaurant on 3/22/17. Cute little place.  I had the Fried New Orleans platter with the gumbo to start.  The gumbo smelled absolutely awesome! It had a little spicy kick but some how there was no flavor.  Very odd.  I received my entrees and it was beautifully presented. The smells were amazing. The fish looked like it was fried to perfection. The taste of everything was extremely disappointing.  No flavor what so ever.  The red beans from the red beans and rice were canned kidney beans with no not a sprinkle of seasoning. The catfish was beautiful. It looked like it was going to be crispy. It was not. One good thing is that you receive a good amount of food. But for the price, its definitely not worth it because the food isnt great at all. I will probably not return

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beautiful presentation!  No flavor

ApF2mwpI7kGABDv6uz8Yjg.text: I'd had this place bookmarked to try for a lonnnng time! So when my friends suggested it for Restaurant Week I was obviously elated. Finally!!!   And they did not let me down!!! It met all of my expectations and more.   I like that their menu for Restaurant Week includes all of their classic dishes and a glass of wine!   I decided to go with the seafood gumbo, etouffee with all three (chicken, shrimp and crawfish) and the key lime our for dessert.   The seafood gumbo was classic. It was warm and hearty with just the right amount of spices. The etouffee was nothing short of amazing!!! I'm basically a fan of this dish for two reasons....one they are not skimpy with any of the meat selections and two it's sooo spicy! I definitely recommend sopping....(yes sopping) up some of that delicious sauce with those rolls. Yum.   Not to be outdone the key lime pie was a great way to end the meal.   Add to an amazing meal a live band and complimentary valet....this place is definitely worth a visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Catfish
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. New Orleans Bbq Shrimp
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ shrimp and Creole Popcorn

9DI9zQ2ZO_cOi0nX3_smOw.text: Great food. Hurricane wasn't boozey enough, but hey, it's not actually NOLA. Go with the fried oysters for sure!!

H9Qrdw5twgjxpnGC-jqKhw.text: Highly disappointed in the level of customer service provided to my friend & her partner by the manager. I recommended Cajun Queen for my friend & her partner to visit during their time in Charlotte. While sitting on the outside patio this past Saturday (May 5), the manager on duty was attentive & courteous to another couple; asking about the quality of their meal, if they had any additional needs, etc. but totally disregarded my friend & her partner. Both couples were sitting in close proximity so this was not an oversight by the manager, he intentionally chose to completely ignore & disregard other patrons. Disappointing. I will no longer recommend Cajun Queen.

V5TkNnhiLr-LjQp-9raSEg.text: Out of town business group tried it out. The Creole was good but the Mahi mahi special was delicious with large serving.  The New Orleans beers were a nice touch.  The key lime pie was very good.  Neat atmosphere in old house.  Seating on the roof was great way to enjoy a beautiful day.

pbgoSIsfoA00xTSmeKVwRg.text: I'm giving two stars because we were one of the first customers there. The staff seemed unprepared for opening for brunch. Our waiter is seeing the incapable or unwilling to answer any questions that we had about the menu. Don't substitute anything because you won't get what you ask for. We were a wedding party that came for brunch and I ordered the salmon and I was given blackened shrimp instead. When I asked about it he said why I could take it back but it would take longer and the rest of your party will have eaten by then. So I was pissed about that. One other person ask for no broccoli they got a plate full of broccoli. Couple other people's orders were messed up and then they added a house gratuity to everyone's bill. There were only 6 people there. There was no offer to comp my order or for me to talk to a manager or to even at fix my meal that I ordered. I would not waste my money going back here again it was truly a horrible experience and the only reason that I gave them two stars was because the bride actually like the key lime pie. Other than that this place is garbage.

pp9pw4Xc9Do9kaqlixGSIw.text: Great place! Had a reservation for 6:30 and was seated at 6:30.  Location is an old house, very cute.  Had the fried oysters and fried crawfish tails as appetizers and both were delicious. The peach martini was great as well.  My husband had the blackened chicken and catfish along with the gumbo and he loved all of it.  I had the shrimp creole and it was tasty and filled me up so I had to take the rest to go.  I would recommend this restaurant for an awesome date night!

fWQrFIUOinWMjsvZpQMRbg.text: This is a cute home that has been converted into a restaurant. Seating is limited so reservations are highly recommended. Upstairs they have a full service bar and often live music. Great place to enjoy some jazz, gumbo and good food.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Deliciousness!!

Jwn98tNVMLhbYHrS03syEA.text: The food & service was amazing! The waiter was very helpful. The food came out quick & was properly cook. Definitely will be coming back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States

Kokmmlwjxw8y_MTel3mj4g.text: Host sat us right next to drums so we couldn't hear to have conversation. Waited without getting acknowledged by a server for about 15 min before walking back downstairs to tell host we needed to sit elsewhere. Fernando wasn't a bad waitor, just didn't smile or give us silverware and napkins until we asked for them after our apps had arrived so he wasn't great either. Drinks were completely empty before refilled. Shrimp app was okay, gumbo was not so yummy. Fried pickles were good, Mahi special was really good, Diane was good and will be good as a leftover. Valet was nice and definitely needed with location we were likely to not find parking on our own.

maDm1msYAiVww_nfgVFvug.text: I went here for NYE dinner. The atmosphere is super cozy being in a old house. I split the Diane w/chicken, crawfish and shrimp with my boyfriend, and it took about 10 minutes to come out after we ordered it. The dish was really yummy. I'm not a huge cajun fan, but if this is how traditional cajun is done, then I'd say it's growing on me.   All in all, our experience was great! The nightly jazz band was a pleasant surprise.

6zIXUfqhpQHgx4XzsKFu5Q.text: I came here because I got a Groupon and I kept hearing about them so I finally got the chance to give them a try. When my niece and I came it was after the snow storm so it was a little bit slick outside and it was really cold. I love the fact that they have valet. When we walked in we were greeted and asked where we would like to sit either downstairs or upstairs with the band. I really wanted to sit by the band but once we got upstairs we realized how congested it was and quickly changed our mind and opted to sit downstairs. The ambiance was very nice and I liked the salt and pepper grinder. The fire place was lit and I could still hear the band playing upstairs but there was a draft coming in from the window.
