For appetizer I ordered the fried green tomatoes. They were okay just a little bit too firm for me. I ordered the all three Dianne with a side salad. I will say that the food was good but very under seasoned. I had to really season my food once I got home. My niece ordered the chicken, mashed potatoes and broccoli. She didn't say anything about the seasoning but I guess to each its own. I am still a fan and I would definitely come back and try some other things I would just ask them for extra seasoning on my food. Something that I definitely don't think that I should have to request at a place with Cajun in the name.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bread pudding to go
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blackened chicken with mashed potatoes
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dianne... all 3...bangin!!

DW7W7xr84CRLuRDWMxaW3Q.text: Absolute best service EVER.  The food was divine.  Atmosphere was cozy and romantic.  Good for families as well.

fXgoZ9dmiG1P9swFKdVxOg.text: "A very flavorful New Orleans' experience without burning your tongue" The restaurant is an old house in a very nice area of town an area called Elizabeth. Open every night for dinner, and they have a Live Jazz band every night. Tried the Abita Beers (Amber, and Fruity) both good. In the second floor of the house is the bar, and in a room next to it is the Jazz Band. Nice art in the walls that is for sale without price meaning - if you have to ask you can not afford it. For appetizers we tried the New Orleans BBQ Shrimp (4.5) - the right amount of spiciness, with layers of flavor. You will want to use the bread to soak all that wonderful juiciness. We also ordered the Craw-fish Scampi (3), it was lemony and not as complex as the shrimp. The Blackened new York steak was nice but uneventful (3)  the Mahi-Mahi with Diane sauce on top of mashed potatoes (4)was very good. I tried the special of the day - Pan Seared Duck Breast ( medium) on top of garlic fried potatoes w Craw-fish Etouffe (4.5) really nice combination. It had the best flavors of Cajun/Creole cuisine but it was not spicy or heavy. The only weak note was the Seafood Gumbo (2.5) it was just OK a bit bland, I added some drops of the hot sauce and it was better.  In conclusion, it was a very nice experience and definitely a high end New Orleans experience.  They do not offer espresso =(. But the Bourbon Bread Pudding hit a perfect mark, it was unexpected light and fluffy, not too sweet. We also had a very good Pecan Pie (3.5).

kzfFgLP3f9mGKEwXfC_fUg.text: We had our first visit last night. Fun, jazzy band, great atmosphere, but the food was the star of the show. Fried green tomatoes, BBQ shrimp, shrimp and grits, fried oysters... all excellent. Fast, polite, unobtrusive service, too. We'll definitely be back. A+

2uD6uGlDBnGOB3MF9ALmZQ.text: Now Ive never been to New Orleans but I love this place!!! Its perfect for my boyfriend and I to go! We love the drinks and the free entertainment oh and the fried oysters!!! I would recommend the Hurricane Drink so good!   The Service is always good and friendly!

2p8b4jeYw7iK56Vf4T91Bg.text: So thankful we made reservations here, folks were waiting at least 35 plus on a Saturday. :) Hostesses were nice. We really appreciated the staff being trained properly. Our server was personable, knowledgeable of the menu&gave good recommendations. He also did not hover. Cool and he got an A from us. We really enjoyed our drinks (get Planters Punch), salads, Shrimp etoufee' and Chicken Diane. We were unimpressed with BBQ shrimp's flavor. The broth was wonderful for dipping the ( cold) bread, yet the shrimp had no flavor. Maybe they can marinate the shrimp with the broth instead of just dropping them in?Also, the bread pudding was just okay. We figured the bourbon&peaches would pack a punch. The seating is tight like others point out, but manageable. Prices match well with portion sizes aka we did not feel cheated. We will definitely  come back for food&drinks only. We will then pickup some Mama R's bread pudding for dessert.

LtyE2c9cMQa6S_2lsMBEBQ.text: We had to visit Charlotte's best cajun joint before we headed home to NYC. 4 stars for the haunted black magic atmosphere of the restaurant. Even in broad daylight, the dining hall had a dark shrouded vibe going on. The beignets let me down a little bit but the shrimp & grits more than made up for it. The fried popcorn shrimp was also very well done but the highlight for me was the shrimp & grits.

7NXoHZtVlfFHXif_MShe7Q.text: Definitely one of my favs. Loved the gumbo, grits, and creole shrimp. Live jazz was the cherry on the sundae. Speaking of desserts, I remember being pleasantly surprised with the bourbon pecan pie.

rxLkp9Yn7yI4FRJJopJo-Q.text: Very enjoyable dining experience.  The service was friendly and timing was good.  Food was very good quality and taste.  Serving quantities was adequate.  Nice menu selections and drink offerings.  Highly recommend dining here.

rppXtN6j00YxcasZAL4MCA.text: Eh. I came in with high hopes for Cajun Queen after being somewhat disappointed with other cajun places in Charlotte. It was ok, but not something that I will go out of my way for again. I tried the shrimp and grits, as it is one of my favorite dishes. The grits were good. The shrimp started out good, but I grew tired of the seasoning by the end. The sausage was by far the best part.

ItUfm6MRMQuwaM0UcJwNVg.text: My girlfriend and I tried this out on a whim based on reviews from Yelp and it was very tasty! I feel like the quality of food and the presentation, don't quite match the prices that they are charging, but they had a great crowd and everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves! I would definitely go there again.

ezj8IvGFtHQsy7TESS4kow.text: My boyfriend and I ate at Cajun Queen last Friday night . We had 7:30 dinner reservations. We pulled up and they had a valet service - nice touch! Parking can be very difficult over there. We were seated immediately at a very nice table next to a window. I ordered the Diane and my boyfriend got the Etouffe. Both were very good! My only complaint was, we felt incredibly rushed. We planned on having a nice, relaxing dinner. From the time we walked in the door to the moment our food came out, it was 14 minutes. A little too quick for me. I felt like our waiter kept trying to rush us out the door. We were finished with dinner (drinks, entree and dessert) in less than an hour. For the amount of money we spent, I am disappointed in their service, or at least the service of our particular waiter.

UDYYsTgLzewEn3OAP-lIWg.text: This place is different. Its not the best food I've had in the world, nor is it the worst. I had the creole. It wasn't bad, but the only option to give the meal a kick of spice was texas pete or their own special jalapeno sauce. The service didn't exist, as that I ate at the bar.   The parking is badly setup. The parking lot is small, and forces people to park at other businesses or on the side of the street.

_msSESZGvMMWYDibMTdEOg.text: I do not understand the hype about this place. Everything is incredibly overpriced and the food is less than mediocre. I did enjoy the bbq shrimp app but the entrees were miserable. I got the shrimp Diane which I'm pretty sure was just shrimp, mushrooms, white rice and chicken broth. Thank God I only went bc I had a groupon.

OTw0xh7oaDs63HswQDR3sQ.text: One of our favorite restaurants in Charlotte.  Food is excellent.  Sometimes it gets a bit loud inside when dining (reason for 4 stars not 5), so we ask for outside patio seating, weather permitting.  Service always good, food always excellent.  I have dined there dozens of times and never had a bad meal.  Highly recommend.

JO9J8zlrRd3nIpgrGOq_mg.text: Good food and cool atmosphere.  If you have a craving for cajun food and you are in Charlotte, then this is the place for you.  There's live jazz music and a bar upstairs.  The etoufee with chicken, shrimp, and crawfish makes for a delicious meal.  The seafood gumbo is pretty good, but nothing exceptional.  There are times when the parking is kind of a hassle there; the private parking area is often full.

5lCtxz0UDesIxLZZETp3sw.text: I had dinner here last night for the first time.  I ordered the Bayou Platter it was amazing.  I will definitely go back for the good and the jazz.

PuKFspqZHBJxXKusT0z3fQ.text: I wasn't quite sure what to expect from this place.  Seeing some of the patrons walking into this place dressed up and at the same time seeing a giant alligator statue sitting in a throne in the front yard.  Once inside it's actually a really nice place.  The service is great, the waitresses are very friendly and attentive and really cared that we had a good time.  There is live music on some nights which always makes for a good time.  Looking at the other reviews, I think the food is kind of hit or miss.  I guess I was lucky with the red beans and rice, it was really good by my standards at least.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States

AmkJvX5mAQQ-4cPNJsVnOQ.text: So I know we're not exactly in Cajun country, but this place is still awesome and, as far as I can tell, super authentic. It's an amazing venue for food--really cool, old house--you feel like you're eating at an actual home--a nice one--on the Bayou or something. Or at least that's how it felt to a transplanted Yankee like myself.   Great southern style cocktails here, so make sure you try at least one before dinner. I'm talking Souther Comfort mixed with all sorts of stuff--just amazing. And they're strong, so go easy.   I had the catfish dish, and it was incredible. Hard to describe, but it was blackened with an amazing tangy sauce and came with mashed potatoes and greens. Their menu is really different, so make sure to check out all that's available. I'll definitely be back do so.

E5LWcHjo8WOWGlG5y73gSA.text: A litle more upscale Cajun joint, but good. They have live music during the weekend upstairs and their bar is nice. On a beautiful day you can sit out on one of their 2 decks. One on the main floor and the other on the 2Nd floor.   The steaks are great here, but make sure you try the BBQ shrimp appetizers and fried oysters. The BBQ shrimp is not your typical BBQ. It is hot and more of a broth base that is perfect to dip with the hot rolls.   Oysters are also lightly fried and not greasy, so enjoy without worrying about your waist.

B3f2_aUoSI0XS8zAHiUuPw.text: If you like your appetizers before your drinks....this is your place. Table had empty salt and pepper shakers. The hot sauce bottles were empty and dirty. This is NOT authentic Cajun food! The Champagne was flat.....horrible experience. Waiter was aloof.

tBQRyhUCKYUodJwJhkdoEg.text: I LOVE this restaurant. So far, I have only been twice, but boy I wish I could afford to go weekly! My boyfriend and I just went for Valentine's Day. Had a reservation, got there a little early, and were still seated immediately, and in the jazz room too! (Side note: the female singer they had on Valentine's was INCREDIBLE. Wish I got her name) My boyfriend and I absolutely LOVE the rolls they give everyone, possibly the best rolls I've had at any restaurant. For my drink, I ordered the chocolate martini, my favorite! Oh, and of course a Hurricane later, also delicious  For my entree I had the special Tilapia with the crawfish topping. OH! First, let me mention, the gumbo that comes before the entree is AMAZING. I don't care if it's not authentic! Who cares about authenticity when the food is THAT good. I ate that gumbo so fast my boyfriend was making comments like, "Slow down, it's not going anywhere!" It had a little bit of a kick to it, which I don't normally like, but the flavor was just too good! Now, back to the entree. Last time, I ordered the same thing, but I didn't even try the crawfish topping; I just gave it all to my mom. This time, however, I realized what a mistake that was! I've actually never had crawfish before, so I have nothing to compare theirs to, but it was delicious, and I'm already craving more! The tilapia, like the first time, was also to-die-for. I will admit I'm biased because I like tilapia pretty much anywhere I go as long as they cook it right, but my boyfriend seemed to like it as well. He also loved his salmon special with the shrimp topping (as did I!).  Unfortunately, neither of us were able to leave room for dessert, so I have nothing to say about that. Overall, this place is definitely in my top 3 restaurants in Charlotte now. The only problem is the parking, which is almost unavoidable whenever you go there. It's such a tiny place with barely any parking, but I'd rather deal with the parking than have them move to another location. The tiny old building, along with the jazz music playing, makes me feel like I've gone back in time. It's such a cozy, romantic restaurant. Definitely a great choice for Valentine's Day, and even my extremely picky, high-maintenance boyfriend (I love him, but he is!) agreed. Believe me, he wasn't lying. He wouldn't hesitate to tell me if I picked a bad restaurant! lol.

Q9kXEG9LifgYU182nRo3MA.text: One of my all-time favorite restaurants! Everything is always so good, staff is friendly and service is great! I usually order the barbecue shrimp dinner and my husband gets the etouffee. We have ordered other things off the menu and were not disappointed, but there is just something about our normal order that we can't get enough of. We have tried other cajun restaurants in Charlotte and they pale in comparison to the Queen. Don't waste your time going anywhere else!

yIvBYTdLFInkDhLS64Ai4Q.text: I love, love, love it here! Wonderful flavors in a cozy home like setting.  The etouffee was delish mix of shrimp, chicken, and crawfish in an amazing spicy sauce.  I will definitely be come back here

ztN1-ZuY5cWrj3mIPsq9bw.text: Great food here.  Had fried crawfish appetizer and the crawfish were incredibly sweet.  Gumbo was spectacularly fresh tasting.  Portion was just right to accompany the meal.  I also had the New Orleans platter that consisted of fried catfish, oysters shrimp and scallops.  The seafood was so fresh and sweet tasting.  If you are looking for Cajun in Charlotte, you won't go wrong with Cajun Queen.

kwqYerpxKUIWx0_ALFkiJg.text: The food, at least what we had, the chicken diane and the biscuits and gravy, were excellent!  Full of flavor, fresh, great portion size. Really delicious!  The service was great too. The decor and atmosphere however, leave a lot to be desired. Very tired, worn out, drab, old. I would go back though, the food was awesome.

vTK7uVKadoiuN_-t1SfFEg.text: We came here for Sunday Brunch at around 11:45am.  The ambience  inside and outside is cool.  Nice place to go to drink eat and chat with a friends.  ~Service was just ok.  waiter seemed bothered...maybe he had a hard night.  (We will try the Pineville location next time....lol)  -Fried Green Tomatoes were delicious (will order again) -Eggs Benedict on Crab Cakes was very tasty. (will order again) -Key Lime Pie was good but its more of a white cream mouse filling style than a yellow custard filling style. ( I prefer the custard style).

-tleNoS0VfINDrhZH05f0A.text: The food was delish. The service was great. Complementary valet parking.The app crawfish bbq was my favorite.  I would give it 5 stars if there was not so much sauce on the entree. My husband got a porkchop and i got fish and both were just drenched in sauce. Overall delish and i will be back. wine and beer selection wasn't amazing but good enough to please the masses.

hiiynnyILPSSUFnoGCTC6A.text: The cajun here is fairly original...considering.  The atmosphere is unique in this old home as you can sit downstairs or up.  I've only been once, but will return if I get back in the area.  They had a live dixie band upstairs so that's where we dined...loud but entertaining!

_MpFlflMFP3rZ24sPyMipw.text: Recommended Place.  The food was great and the staff equally great. A really nice place.

gZgVgtY4lvXpg-WKaP2igw.text: Came here for my wife's birthday one year - had great food and the live jazz is a great plus.

kFgwJGU7g5OnPzjzd4VC_Q.text: Cajun Queen was great.  It is overpriced for cajun food, but the food was great.  I had mahi mahi with some crawfish sauce and vegetables over it.  Excellent!

eXF7r9TTLqQ36RQss1GuwQ.text: What a wonderful experience. Had not been here for many years but it seems to get better with age. It is the best Cajun food I have ever and outside of New Orleans. We had the gumbo and etouffee and Both were outstanding. Service was also top notch.

eUT01wfJMJRjdmnRnm92Fg.text: We came to eat to celebrate our anniversary (this as one of our first dates 14 years ago).  I called over a month ago to make the reservation and explained the purpose of our visit and asked if they could do anything for us when we came.  We arrived that night and were seated quickly.  Very crowded, very loud.  I didn't remember that from the last visit several years ago until we sat down and it came back to me very quickly.  The Waiter seemed distracted, but we managed to get our order.  The fried crawfish were great as a starter.  We then decided to get a few more appetizers and one entree to split.  When the gumbo came, we both decided it tasted like spicy water.  There was no flavor at all.  Even the shrimp had no taste.  It almost tasted like it was diluted to make it last the night or had just been sitting in the pot way too long.  I mentioned it to the waiter and he commented that he has never had it and that the main items are made in such large quantities, he didn't expect it would be very good.  What?!  Why would the waiter say that instead of "I'm sorry sir, can we get you something else?"  The rest of the meal was okay.  The Diane had more chicken than anything else (about 2 shrimp and 2 crawfish to go with three chicken breasts).  It lacked any flavor either and was kind of mushy.  The oysters were good and the crawfish scampi was good, but a bit on the greasy side.  The waiter never asked if we enjoyed our meal and never even said thank you for visiting.  He dropped off the ticket, picked it up and brought it back without saying word.  Customer service is just as important as the food, so that rates 0 stars.  He looked like we were in his way since we were only a 2 topper and he was losing money with us when he had other larger tables in his section.  The manager even walked by us several times and didn't even ask about our meal or acknowledge us.  Overall, we were very disappointed at the experience.  It seems like they are running on their reputation and haven't done much to maintain or improve over the years.  We have eaten here since I arrived in Charlotte in 1996 and have had events there, etc.  This visit will change my mind of a repeat visit.  Oh, by the way, no one even mentioned our anniversary when I specifically asked when I made that reservation a month ago.  That is a big no-no.

bRIfLjGUyRsFtOOS_xTbzw.text: Went here for our anniversary. The atmosphere was nice. I ordered the chef's special cajun pasta and was pleased by the large portion. Making a reservation as the place was really crowded on a Thursday evening. I recommend eating here to people who enjoy creole food.

hSMusVr2smmCSnTgOd6pxw.text: This was my first visit to the Cajun Queen. It will not be my last. The service was excellent and the food was superb. I loved the ambiance as I enjoyed my meal by the fireplace.  The bread pudding was "The Bomb". That alone is worht the trip back to the Cajun Queen.  Two thumbs up!!!!!!!

lbXReig23zJ8dzi-_mYJ5Q.text: What to say about the Cajun Queen..Hmm??? OK I got it..Its not a bad place at all, but I wasn't to impressed with the gumbo, to me it seemed like something was missing. I decide to have the Diane Chicken and it was simply amazing, it seemed to just melt it my mouth and what can i say about the fired green tomatoes( hold one second while i wipe the droll of of my mouth) lol .....The staff is great and the jazz band was awesome and played a over all large selection of music...so over all i would put them on my top ten

h7A-kZvNrPj-jZa5I_rCPg.text: SUCH good food! Traditional Cajun, so rich and flavorful!  Also the bananas foster french toast for brunch is one of my boyfriends favorite dishes he has ever had!

KgITNbIpXQXIFpw6lhQunQ.text: I really enjoyed this restaurant.  The Jazz was fantastic! Only drawback was that although we had reservations, it took about 40 minutes to get seated. We had to wait at the bar. The price for the amount of food was a little much, but it was excellent!!!  I can't wait to go back!

OpS89CmirAnr196MgbLi6w.text: I wasn't much impressed with Cajun Queen during my first visit, mostly because of the indifferent service and average food. The food was just ok -- nothing was really bad or good. The seafood gumbo was pretty tasteless and was probably the worst thing we tried all night. The blackened pork tenderloin was the best, but the meat was slightly overcooked. The fried green tomatoes and Cajun crawfish poppers were both just so-so. They were both lathered in a heavy cream sauce that would have been better served on the side. The crawfish etoufee was very spicy and the crawfish were plentiful and well-cooked, but the meal just did not wow me. Service, by far, was the worst we have experienced at ANY restaurant in Charlotte. Our server was very rushed and hardly gave our table any attention. Not once did he ask if I wanted another cocktail, even though i gulped the first one down in about ten minutes. I guess he figured that people would keep coming to this place (as evidenced by the long waits, even with reservations), and he did not have to do much to keep them coming back. The nicest part of this restaurant is the atmosphere - it is located in an old house and has quite a bit of charm. They also have a live band on Saturdays (and I think other days of the week as well).  I just don't think these things are good enough to make me want to return.

VbVp_VCz3ukRKCLSpk3FGQ.text: I went here Friday night as my cheat night for the diet I'm on. This was a great cheat destination! We arrived for reservations at 8:30. The place was packed! They send you upstairs to the bar to wait until your table ready and I did not even try to get a drink it was so packed. However, our table was ready soon after we arrived. Cajun Queen is in an old house in the Elizabeth community (my community) and has great ambiance. We started off with a crawfish appetizer (not the fried one) and it was delicious! I will definitely get tit again! The cucumber gin drink that was featured was also great. I got the BBQ shrimp as my main course and it was also very good. My date got the salmon special and it was great (Maybe a little better than mine, I had to try a bite!) I ended the dinner with a slice of Oreo cheesecake - yum. Overall this was a great experience and will be my destination when I want some great, spicy Cajun cuisine. (sorry Bordeaux - I won't be visiting you anymore)

O0uKv89j9d9Xy0soFfFSVg.text: Lovely atmosphere, staff and food. Beau, our waiter, was extremely knowledgable about the menu and the wine. I suggest what Beau suggested...the pork medallions with pineapple pico and plantains. Amazing!  We sat on the upstairs patio and had a perfect evening.  Can't wait to eat there when we visit Charlotte again!!

qSW6Dsy63Tnm-OASFC-rhQ.text: I had a very nice meal and the entertainment was great.  This place is a Charlotte classic and always a fun time.

p3aXGViJ5lEKRkC0yA5tDA.text: This is our go to place for date night or anniversaries. We love the service, the chocolate martinis and the ambiance. Try the fried oysters with roulade sauce. Authentic Cajun cuisine right in Charlotte and it's a piece of history as well!

sHc9ivzdn5ledTmLP_7THQ.text: Loved everything about this place, great vibe, amazing food! Huge portions, the leftovers were an entirely new meal! I'll definitely be back

e-NSA08Yj_aESL2LTp15tg.text: What a great place!! New in town was looking for live music & found it at the Cajun Queen along with delicious food. Will certainly return!!

jZ_IVPh3693USZALNTnUXw.text: First time dining at Cajun last night. We had a birthday party of around 12. The service was fantastic and 100% accommodating. The food was excellent! I have a shellfish allergy, so I went with the Etouffee with chicken. The dish had just the right amount of spice for my taste. Very cool atmosphere. Upstairs has a full bar and live music. I will definitely be going back soon.

QzIyLuCXxJcw9mb8lP8wvQ.text: One of my favorite local restaurant in Charlotte. Very eclectic and the hurricanes are strong and good. Now that we got drinks out the way.  During your visit. Get the bbq shrimp for the appetizer and it won't disappoint. For dinner i got the etouffee. It was so savory and spicy. This place is one of Charlotte's best kept secret.

kwQo3u7intnUlEDq04sRsw.text: Great place to visit! Live music and good food. Service was also great! I will definitely visit again on my next trip to Charlotte!

o-gtOgmE0rJm02cuS_lkDw.text: Cajun Queen makes me feel like I'm back in N'awlins enjoying my favorite dishes! Wonderful service, great selection of drinks, and super yummy menu. Our favorite restaurant in the Charlotte area.

XsbsRhruXNCl4UoGSt3VpA.text: My boyfriend and I checked this place out on a Sunday and I fell in love! I love the atmosphere of the entire restaurant. Especially the live jazz! The food is amazing so are the mixed drinks. Will come back again.

ZMEXw4np3dDDPPziNwkMVw.text: I'm a regular here and the food and service is always excellent. Many thanks to the management and staff. Exceptional entrees and apps. Only recommendation- which is minor, would be to change up the dessert selections

ISNlrvc2dPbv90ip9Oo33Q.text: One of the best go-to Cajun restaurants in Charlotte. Terrific gumbo.  I go for the crawfish etouffee every time!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. crawfish etouffee

DYlo2ZSW8utWK90zy6Jndg.text: Cute lil house that was bigger than it looked from the outside was very spacious and big windows there was 4 of us table should have been a lil bigger we had to keep having the waiter take things away for space aT the table but that wasn't a big deal the dishes was great great we really enjoyed our meals I was a lil bummed that the staff didn't mention the band playing on the upper level and they posted on flyers that it was restaurant week no Groupon accepted that should be stated during reservations booking other than that everything was good

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States

g3rJLBaHrEU7TcC6jlKcpg.text: We finally made our way to CQ after living down the road for nearly two years. Full disclosure, I'm not a huge fan of Cajun food, Let's say my stomach isn't a huge fan. With that said, I had bought a living social and few months back and we needed to use it. I made reservations for Sunday evening and we were seated right away. We were right next to the band and a Really large, loud group. That wasn't a problem, this isn't a quiet restaurant and the sever and party apologized for being so loud. If you sit downstairs it is not as loud,   I got the shrimp and grits, Col got the BBQ shrimp both really good and they give you a lot of shrimp. We took two slices of pecan pie to go. Everything was great. Our Server Alex, was on top of it and friendly even when they were really busy. It's a nice spot to go for a fun evening or if you're in the mood for something a little different.

ipVJ7Lyn1sHU9KaO-ZRgJw.text: Cajun Queen is the best place in the world!!! I've been coming here since my parents brought me as a baby. We always order the barbecue shrimp appetizer and then I STILL usually order the barbecue shrimp entree after that hehe. Last time we were here the kitchen was nice enough to serve me pasta with the entree rather than rice. Cajun Queen has a special place in my heart and childhood and always will.

i4fijlArNy72oGy76vcuPg.text: Decided to try this place out based on a recommendation from my roommate. We went for food week so were presented with a three course menu and wine pairings for a good price. The gumbo starter was good but not amazing. The second course was a salmon in white wine sauce and the salmon absolutely perfect. It was a very generous piece of fish and somehow it was perfectly cooked all the way through. The third course was a key lime pie and was a nice finish to a delicious meal. The atmosphere was excellent and the wait staff was very knowledgeable and friendly. I will definitely be bringing family here when they come to visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon in white wine sauce, picture does not do it justice

3j-8I6762T4Lf4zmP-eGxg.text: The ambience and view from the first floor were nice. The New Orleans B.B.Q shrimp appetizer was very tasty and presented well. It is unfortunate this was by far the best part of our meal. My wife got the creole with chicken, shrimp and crawfish but it was average. I got the etouffe with chicken, shrimp and crawfish but it was not as flavorful as etouffes I had in the past. We also got the toll house cookie pie and it was not a chocolate chip cookie pie as we thought it would be. If we went back, it would only be for the appetizer.

v2uPiSAzOByvO-R7pTrD_Q.text: We went there last night to celebrate hubby's birthday - and they made our experience really beautiful !  Fernando C was our server and he was very warm and friendly and always helped with our requests! We have been repeat customers and will continue to be so!

EJZefI1thoZL3mFP6EW8LA.text: I really enjoy this place for brunch, but they need to add a vegetarian option for dinner!

hn-M8Xzv69Ryfr4PyLLQzw.text: Instant classic! Can't believe we haven't tried this place before. My wife and I ate here this evening for the first time. We had the BBQ shrimp and the pan seared duck, per the recommendation of our waiter, Joey. We highly recommend both! They provide complementary valet parking for dinner, which is necessary due to limited parking nearby, so plan accordingly to tip your valet.

jf1Ub0prEpWVfxFDycSyJQ.text: My favorite cajun restaurant in the Charlotte area. Actually, this might be my favorite period. The staff and service is top notch. The food is excellent. The key lime pie.... oh my (I understand this is actually prepared by a 3rd party so credit to them and CQ for carrying it). Always a great night out and a nice date spot for the wife and I.

6wlGBx4kCejNHXjoxj8Cww.text: The food is always great, the service is wonderful, and the atmosphere is festive! My go to entree is the Crawfish Etoufee. If you have room, you've also got to have a piece of their key lime pie!

m9INkZtqlr0X3DAU9QvFOg.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte! The food is always amazing. BBQ shrimp, crawfish etouffee and the duck are some of our favorites. Desserts are great too, definitely recommend the bread pudding. Sit upstairs if there's a spit and listen to the live music!

59T9c9X6CMjh-pfmJ2SCwQ.text: My wife and celebrated our35th anniversary on Friday, September 13, and though it was a great evening for us there are a few details that I feel must be shared. First, forget the upstairs dining room, it is very small, crowded, and the Jazz group it is nothing to write home about. The restaurant would be better off investing in a good sound system and play a variety of Jazz including (Smooth Jazz) to make it more attractive and romantic and use the stage area for additional sitting. The best dining room in the restaurant (where we sat) is the one that over looks the valet parking area; intimate, quieter, and roomier. The one adjacent to it is also crowded, tables practically on top of each other with very little privacy. Now, the food was fantastic!!! The service was good!!! The very small bar is on the second floor and it took forever to get drinks brought to our table. As I said we made it special for us and had a great time. Would we go back? Maybe yes, maybe not.

HJCLRmi1-3VLs7Tx23klkw.text: This is the place that you can experience great southern comfort food! It is a New Orleans style. We ordered gumbo for an appetizer. Then shrimp and grits, crawl fish and shrimp etouffee for main dishes. The gumbo was as good as I tried in New Orleans before. A bit spicy and rich! The portion of main dishes was great and the taste was even better! My craw fish and shrimp eotuffee was perfectly spiced for an authentic southern food. Loved the sauce and crawl fish was already peeled to eat. Shrimp and grits was great too. The shrimp was well seasoned and grilled perfectly.   The service was good and we enjoyed the atmosphere of the restaurant as well. Will Definitely go back when I have a craving  for southern comfort food.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States

OHCf8xJxkjAuOprwr5Vq-A.text: We r visiting from Virginia n Yelped for help. Amazing food. Simply amazing. I had Diane with Shrimp n Chicken n it was out of the world taste. If u live in or around Charlotte or visiting this is the place to visit. With live jazz you can't go wrong with Cajun Queen. A must visit place for ur tastebuds and jazz/music lover inside you. This place is not huge, but very cozy. Fell in love instantly.

7T5b_GNYOelvf3uZA04hKw.text: The best Oreo cheesecake I have ever tasted.  The food was delicious but that cake though...bruh!!! You have to go for the NOLA styled seafood experience.  Oh we'll be back sooner than you think!

UFK6xqBbzbhWU9G9jjR0Bg.text: Ask for macgregor Get the crawfish etouffee "old style" and be prepared for spicy  Goes great with bbq shrimp  Great service

QU_hWnoybiPa4rdbs0MpSQ.text: I'm so disappointed that I have to write this review. So, let's begin shall we? I've had this place on my radar for a while every since I tried Razzos for the first time. I love creole food & can not wait to visit New Orleans one day for the real thing. Last weekend, my friends & I came here for one of my best friends birthdays. As far as being seated, we had a reservation so we were seated quickly. I had a hurricane punch I believe is what it's called. It was very good. Our service was subpar at best honestly. Waiter had a pretty snappy tone but I digress. Anyway, we ordered our food. Food took pretty long to arrive but being with friends was better because we talked the whole time. Otherwise, I probably would have been upset about it. I ended up getting a bowl of seafood gumbo & a salad. The salad was ok. Typical Cesar, nothin spectacular. Did have to re salt it because it didn't have too much of a taste. The gumbo, also extremely tasteless & the biggest disappointment of the whole dinner! Even the appetizer bread was better then it! It had no type of kick to it at all. How do you claim to be creole/Cajun but there's literally NO seasoning on your food? I tried to Salt, pepper, and Tabasco sauce it to death but... it wasn't helping. When I got the bill & seen that it was 38$, for just me, 2 drinks & my food which was only 12$, i was so annoyed because the food was not worth 38$ for one & for two, if you pay for your checks separately, the charge an automatic gratuity! So keep that in mind. Overall, I was very unimpressed & probably won't be returning. I'd definitely rather go to Razzos for their gumbo & fish bowls.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Seafood Gumbo

g7Yw-DmsQiRjKRzxH0FEvg.text: Great New Orleans cuisine in the heart of charlotte. Huge portions and flavorful dishes. They also have a fun bar with music some nights. Be prepared to wait because it's always busy. It's definitely worth the wait.

WkFO7m2WzLpbneDg-ecWtg.text: I love their food. I have only ever gotten it to go or delivered (which they just got rid of delivery service). The reason it is not five stars is because the seasoning on the food has been unreliable a few times which is disappointing.  Overall the portions are amazing and normally the food is better than what I had in New Orleans.

DkmQLBfXHgYKLWWRE_KlAg.text: Went for Restaurant Week. Was fantastic. Got the pasta and the Diane with crawfish, catfish and shrimp. Amazing. Would recommend to everyone to try this place out

DdRncgs3rSwPBgI_xVo7dQ.text: I'm giving Cajun Queen five stars because I have been dreaming of their pan seared duck breast over crawfish etouffee hitting my lips since the moment I left. This was indisputably the best duck I've ever eaten and the etouffee was an AMAZING accompaniment. The decor and ambiance aren't necessarily the glitz and glam you find in DC's five star restaurants but there was a True essence of NOLA permeating the air from the time we walked in. This was largely in part to their house band located on the second floor playin live music we absolutely loved. There are photos / paintings throughout the restaurant of New Orleans staples but honestly..... I enjoyed Cajun Queen's food better than most things I are while I was in NOLA.   Fried green tomatoes were cooked and seasoned perfectly and we ate every morsel on the plate. The Fried oysters tasted phenomenal. My gumbo was better than any gumbo I had in NOLA but I like spicy food so I added a dash oh hot sauce and sprinkle of black pepper that took it to perfection. The barbecue shrimp was out of this world, delicious. The sauce is soooooo good to sop up with the complimentary bread. Then there was this Oreo cheesecake that was one of my favorite cheesecakes I've ever tasted. Hubby thought his shrimp and grits were just ok but since our server was also pretty great, I could not find cause to deduct a star for that.   If you're looking for a unique dining experience in Charlotte that will make you feel like you've walked right into the French Quarter of NOLA without hopping on a plane or train, Cajun Queen is not to be missed. Sit upstairs to be close to the live band and utilize their complimentary valet.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. The best duck I&#39;ve ever eaten!!!

Orup8L3oTymHlmbRO7dNmA.text: Unique Cajun inspired restaurant located in a beautiful old house reminiscent of New Orleans.   Often times I'll just order the appetizers. You can't go wrong with the fried oysters and crawfish scampi.   In the several times I've dined in, the service has been quick and helpful.

qmV3p5_GFuyEWaRy50RpsA.text: Love to get a piece of NOLA Anytime i can ! Great strong drinks for good prices just like NOLA! Sat up stairs with the band ! Of course they were loud so is New Orleans! They took frequent breaks so we could really chat then. Everything was awesome. I sipped in the 7th Street Stumbler. At our table , we had the Salt and Pepper Catfish , Crawfish Etouffee, The Diane , the New Orleans Platter and blackened chicken.   The gumbo was a yummy start but the platter babyyyyy. So yummy . I "thought " i wasn't that hungry but i ate it allll. The batter was thin but packed with flavor. Scallops , oysters , shrimp and catfish with white rice and red beans. Not a lick left on the plate !! Everything was great and i will be back .

jEYU3Lw9BAO6D1ueGfy8zA.text: This is so good!! Yummy! Yummy! Yummy! We started with the fried green tomatoes and then I had the blackened catfish with scampi crawfish topping and my honey had the New Orleans bbq shrimp. Everything was wonderful! I would definitely go back. The fish was light and had a wonderful woodsy flavor like a beautiful steak. We finished with the bread pudding and the caramel sauce did a dance in my mouth.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blackened catfish with scampi crawfish topping sooooo good!
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried green tomatoes with roulade, yummy

jJHGcHdP8oPd1_8TpwikOw.text: Superb! The Cajun Queen is perfect on all fronts! My first time trying fried green tomatoes did not disappoint; the sauce was delicious. I ordered the Chicken Diane- this will be my go to order, for sure. My group had the New Orleans platter, Shrimp and Grits, Chicken Caesar, Washday Blues, and Shrimp Scampi: not one complaint. We were all super impressed. And the Oreo cheesecake is the BEST. Save room no matter what! Our server, MacGregor, knew what to recommend, and was polite and attentive. This beautiful restaurant is not to be missed. We checked out the bar upstairs- and found live music, art, and a lovely patio off to the side. I've found my favorite restaurant in Charlotte!

8Lhdn9kLjHit9TRTnsYfCg.text: Went here for our anniversary dinner. Got the Cajun shrimp which was fine. I should have gotten a pasta dish instead. I made the mistake of getting something that I'm not usually excited about but wanted to try. Love the old house it is set in.

BpvfVlEiwKu6QHgCHVhQrQ.text: Today I visited Cajun Queen with the anticipation of experiencing authentic Cajun food. As a Louisiana native I was disappointed with my experience. After sampling the etoufee' which was over seasoned, I realized this is not authentic Cajun food.

nhoSpaVjPmuyriRXddSikw.text: Excellent Blackened NY strip "rare-plus" with broccoli and I chose red beans and rice rather than the garlic mashed potatoes  It was fantastic and we will be returning!!!

tCE8JUs-8qB--oSsHZljwg.text: The food at the Cajun Queen is excellent. The gumbo though it's not as authentic as one would hope. My problem was that we called in advance to make sure that they knew we were celebrating a birthday point but even though the restaurant told us they would do something special for the birthday once we were there it seemed like he didn't even know about it. in other tables people saying happy birthday and the jazz band even played the song so my husband who tried to organize the surprise was very sad. don't get me wrong the food is good not New Orleans good but still good and the decoration is beautiful. It was just a disappointment in part.

pQy5bGRxF8A8W912cd4luA.text: I've been to Cajun Queen a couple times, once for a work meeting and once on a date with my boyfriend. The meeting was definitely the better experience solely in terms of food, everything was spot on and delicious - I especially loved the crawfish scampi! For my entree I went with tilapia which tasted very good.   The last time we went service was slow (it was a weekday), and the food surprisingly forgettable. We split the calamari appetizer which was pretty standard and each had the steak Diane. I am a rare girl but found the meat a bit tough- usually filet should be easy to cut through, this wasn't the case.   I'd say stick to your seafood options, give yourself some extra time to dine, and enjoy!

I93jFabVMfNdoZ6WqRPTIg.text: Everyone in our party of 3 thoroughly enjoyed their meal. Sat on their outdoor patio which was very pleasant should the weather permit. Would definitely return.

KtYCvDAIDYdSWt0UoZb27w.text: I love the Cajun Queen - the food is great and spicy, the live band is awesome and jazzy and it is fun to celebrate and dine with close friends in this bourbon street atmosphere on the second floor (minus the flashing of course)  I have been here many times over 20 years and will keep coming back as long as I'm around.

Dmg21D2QmHCNKDnpStQ-JQ.text: We are so lucky to have this place in Charlotte!! It is by far one of my favorite restaurants in town (more of a special occasion place for us.) Listen up, they give you a basket of bread but DO NOT immediately dive into it!! Order the barbecue shrimp for an appetizer which has all of this delicious sauce that you must then DIP the bread into. Do it, you will thank me. Everything I've had is fabulous but we always end up going to the "Diane" style with chicken, shrimp and crawfish. The flavors cannot be beat. I have never been to New Orleans, but people I know who have been many times says this is even better than some restaurants in NO, for what it's worth.

Tj3KmPPTIBdQLaI76mYqOQ.text: This place was great! My bf and I went on a Monday night. There was live jazz that was very nice. We both got the ettouffe, mine was crawfish and his was chicken and shrimp. We both loved it and the drinks as well. What attracted us was a deal on groupon but we will definitely be returning! The only negative I would say was the close proximity of the seating in the upstairs room--we were literally right next to another couple and heard their entire (and very awkward) conversation.

A4D10ftEIGXZLKJYb8Tu0A.text: This is a cool place in a historic home in Elizabeth.  We loved the appetizers and atmosphere (five stars for those), but found the entrees pulled down our overall rating.  The spicy shrimp app and fried oysters app were awesome!!  The shrimp app was super spicy and full-of-flavor...save some bread to sop up the sauce!!  The oyster app was perfectly fried and came with a delicious dipping sauce.  We ordered the fried oyster entree (which was overcooked) and chicken, shrimp, and crawfish etoufee (which lacked salt and spices).  For dessert we enjoyed a slice of key lime pie (not as tart as we like but also not too sweet).  You can enjoy live music upstairs in the bar area or sit downstairs for a quieter meal.  This place is definitely worth a visit, especially if you're looking to share some yummy appetizers!

qX_r1UFtFxAP58fjpbGfiA.text: It was one of those unanticipated nights, where a coming together of long unseen friends and everyday acquaintances coalesces into something magical. It was supposed to be a mens night for the men and a ladies night for the ladies, but before we could go our separate ways the men realized they loved the ladies and the ladies too loved their men and so all together we decided not to deny ourselves the company of the other sex. Unanimously, we wanted Cajun Queen. We were all already lit up from our daylight binging, so by the time we stumbled in we were ready for a good time. A milk-skinned hostess in a golf-green blazer and a white and peach paisley blouse batted at us with hazel eyes beneath a mop of perfectly tussled and pasted curls. "We have eight," I said. She glowered. Before she could reply, I little-white-lied her: "We called ahead... they told us to come right now."   Green blazer took off to see what she could manage; we loitered in the foyer, teetering drunk, glazed eyes reeling under the light of the antique chandelier. Green blazer came back and told us it'd be a bit of wait and recommended we hit the upstairs bar. We were already halfway up the steps.  Cajun Queen is one of those big old Elizabeth houses, southern gothic, eclectically arranged and echoing blindly with voices from some other era. It's a chatterbox of ancient heritage and white-hot with flickering, inconsistent lights that make you want to trim your mustache pencil thin and drink only from a snifter. Aroma suffused our consciousness and we all just became mindless, visceral things. At the upstairs bar, this long swan of a bartendress was commanding the room, elegantly and fluidly fetching glasses from the overhead rack, snatching mixers from the under-counter cooler, upturning bottles and dispensing drafts, all motions in succession, all so swift and natural, like something perfectly choreographed and rehearsed. She doled out a trayful of Olde Meck Coppers and we set ourselves to achieving the night. We were led to a corner table near the glassed wall of the little balcony at the back. I took a chair at the end, sat, leaned back, and rapped my knuckles against the abrasive texture of the mud-red stucco. Our very knowledgeable, upright waiter prattled off a series of specials and toppings of the day with juicy detail, but I all heard was 'something unbelievably amazing' followed by 'something else equally amazing'. I requested a couple batches of fried oysters for the table, and then we went in rounds, ordering our blackened catfishes and our crawfish etouffees and our obscene platters of shrimp and fish and sausage and delight. Without needing to ask, our upright waiter returned with another round of beers and a handful of waters. "Good man," I said with an acknowledging nod. Huxley was sitting at the opposite end of the table. We had subconsciously retained the man-woman divide throughout the evening. I looked her way until she felt my gaze and when she glanced back I shot her a clever wink. She smiled. I swooned.  Our food arrived and we all collectively lost our minds. Remoulade-dipped oysters, creamy clumps of spicy rice, mouth-searing fish and peppery shrimp, beer and wine, more wine, and life and love and faces flush and hearts racing. We ate ourselves full, but couldn't stop. Flavors were assaulting us in such unmitigable ways, we were powerless to refuse their beckoning call of mouth-flaming, heart-swelling, eye-watering release. Ryan, at one point, shoved his seat back, sat up straight with hands on thighs, neck rigid like a scout-dog, let out a billowing exhale, momentarily composed himself, then jumped back in for another oyster and few more forkfuls of rice.  At the table behind us, a prim blond let out a squelch of a cry, half-stood, leaned forward, grabbed her man behind his fuzzy dark ears, and kissed him hard on the mouth. She held that embrace for some time, and all the lights and sounds in the room imploded in upon them. When her lips broke free from his, all the noise and clarity rushed back upon us in a crash. She sat down and knuckled a tear from her eye.  I clapped my hands and beamed across the room. "This is the greatest night ever!" I shouted out to the dining area.  Kathryn, a steadying force in our group, narrowed one eye and nodded at me placatively. "You really enjoy the hyperbole, don't you?" "Get up for it, Kathryn!" I threw my hands wildly about in the air above me. "If it isn't the greatest night... then tell yourself it is, believe it, and make everyone else believe it too! Then it really will be!" The prim blond and her man giggled, and a few tables around us applauded. I ceremoniously forked the last fried oyster from our appetizer tray, held it high like a chalice, like a triumph, angled my neck, opened my jaw wide, and brought it down mightily into my mouth. Kathryn looked around, a touch embarrassed, and then began furiously laughing. "Oh, I believe it," she said. "I believe it."

reWAZNJLuCOnmcP8Z1AiIA.text: So delicious! Must try the etouffee and bread pudding! The restaurant offers complimentary valet and the staff is quite friendly.

qdiBtm_duk_SjA3FoO998g.text: Have been there a few times and they never disappoint!  The Jambalaya is second to none.  Perfectly spiced and portioned.  The New Orleans BBQ is also excellent.  Great atmosphere and service.

sVR4h9xUWLiWYTrzOBXqZQ.text: My daughter and I had dinner at Cajun Queen tonight and ordered the sirloin special. It was not very good so the manager, Tim, came over and offered something else. We ordered the tilapia special and it was delicious. We also had the crawfish etoufee, gumbo and keylime pie. All were yummy.

3ekLOCGwru3dMACrq3koHw.text: I agree with Lindsey R. that this area of 7th Street has some of Charlotte's cutest restaurants. Fig Tree, Jackelope's, and a few others along this way are all located in re-vamped houses, and it makes the dining experience much more intimate and exciting.   I usually go for the red beans and rice and the fried green tomatoes appetizer, as there's not a lot in the way of veggie-friendly food...but I'm ok with what I get, as it's really, really good.   And, since I don't eat too heavy on the entree part of the meal, I have room for the key lime pie. The key lime pie is worth the trip by itself. It's just the right tangy and just the right sweet. It's incredible.
