Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dining room photo from the website.

FfHejaqoC_YEBn1haTGKvg.text: now, that's what i'm talkin' about!  definitely one of the first meals i had after moving to the QC. a little on the expensive side, but worth it.  it's in this cute house, with a small parking lot in the back. you can't miss it because there's a GIANT GATOR out front.  i started off with the bbq shrimp app-- oh, man! soooo spicy my nose ran, i love it! i had the red beans and rice with andouille (both sides) as my entree (kind of like a create your own meal :) ) the shrimps were so spicy the red beans and rice cooled me down.  can't wait to go back!

geIE3U3uCr4u8XwiMv6UCA.text: I have never been disappointed at the Cajun Queen.  The old house, renovated into a restaurant makes the experience very unique.  The food is fabulous.  I ordered the special salmon with crawfish topping and it seriously is one of the best seafood dishes I have ever had.   The rolls are hot and fresh, and the gumbo is also really tasty helping to build the appetite for the main course.   I didn't get the bread pudding this time I went, but I have had it before and it is very good.   I'm always impressed with the service and the food.

cu1sasEb8Q-M0a-OdU1iuw.text: BBQ shrimp app was amazing!  Our first time and requested upstairs to hear the jazz band. Great experience and food was True to the cajun experience.

aqyS_6egF6fucXiisrNzzQ.text: This was our first visit to this restaurant. It boasts a Louisiana  style menu. However this dish ( cajun platter) lacked any type of cajun spices. You can't serve red beans and rice with no gravy  and consider that to be a  Louisiana style dish. My husband ordered the New York strip and had to put salt on it because there was no flavor. I certainly have had better and I would not visit again. Overrated!

l4MHvb-zf77D0u27irxVuQ.text: The "Complimentary Valet" came with the complimentary attitude as well. The entire experience of the restaurant starts the second you get out your vehicle. We were greeted with, "You can just park your car right there" - taking away for the service that we are supposedly getting "Complimentary". Fast forward to the food - the choices & portions attached with their magical seasonings are amazing! The service took a bit longer than expected and two tables were served and received their food before we did & we had a reservation. W elect the waiter a minimal tip mainly because we felt as though our orders & the items we needed prior to receiving our food were not met within a timely fashion. Secondly, we asked a guy who was just walking the floor to see if he had an idea of how long our food would take. He said he had no idea; not offering to even check. My friend then responded, "Do you think you can go & find out then....?" He then came back & stated that it was on its way. The "on its way" comment was followed by an additional 15 minute lag time. After dinner, we were met in the parking lot with a different Valet Attendant & I proceeded to hand him our ticket for my vehicle. I told him, "I can actually go & grab it myself because it's right there", (pointing about 10 feet to the right). He stated, "That's not your car" & before he could even hand me the keys, the car horn sounded notifying that it was my vehicle & all I exited the conversation with was a "Thanks". I left him a tip mainly because he was light skinned and cute. Overall, I'd go back there. I could just do without the Valet & possibly a more socially conscious waiter.

M_vQD_JT6UU_HYJy1zQwmQ.text: Delicious!  I've been here twice, once for brunch and once for dinner and I thought it was great both times.  At dinner I ordered the blackened chicken and tortellini special and it was great, only complaint was there werent enough tortelliini but it was made up by the overabundance of chicken.  My girlfriend ordered the chicken diane and it was amazing, I was torn as to which dish I enjoyed more.  Service was great and the food came out blazingly fast.

ZksyGDJjL9kDs_QV9KoJHA.text: I felt like I came to New Orlean's all of a sudden (except for fact that we could find parking pretty fast, not so in New Orleans, in fact, there is no parking there in French Quarter, but that's another story).  There is a bar on the upper level with New Orleans music playing while you wait for someone. Note that you will have to pay for drinks if you have any right there upstairs, can't put it on your meal bill. Just FYI. Downstairs, there is a nice gas fireplace that keeps the place warm and cozy.  I was apprehensive at first because of the cuisine type, not a fan of spicy foods, however, the menu has got variety for every taste: seafood, steaks, pasta, grains, potatoes, soups, salads and even the fried green tomato. No kidding. It was actually pretty good, reminded me of fried eggplant. Unusual.  Portions are humongous! I don't usually leave food on my plate, however, here, it was just humanly impossible for me to finish the buttery blackened chicken over Aveoulle pasta.   Solid four stars for bringing New Orleans to Charlotte.   Take the Cajun Queen steam boat Mississippi tour when you are in New Orleans!

58XoVtYILL6wV82raLS-ww.text: I was quite excited to finally come here after purchasing the Google Offer, and overall, I think I got my $15 dollar's worth. The appetizer (crawfish scampi) was tiny, but delicious. The fried shrimp was very nicely done -- not battered to death. Shrimp "Diane" looked yummy, with plenty of onion and mushrooms. My entree, Crawfish Etouffee, was really good (though I should have tried it with some of the spices on the table), but later on, didn't quite agree with my stomach. I don't typically eat shellfish, so that is most likely the reason. I would have tried one of the fish entrees, but they're pricey. Our server Bob was okay, but kind of standoffish sometimes. The most disappointing part was that NONE of the seafood is domestic. Bob was amused that I asked, but considering seafood is their speciality, you would think they'd take sustainability and safety seriously. montereybayaquarium.org/...

0OV2cpcMJZpU74lAFWf62g.text: Awesome etouffee.  It actually isn't as spicy as I thought it'd be.  I got the shrimp, chicken, and crawfish combo.  Actually wish i didn't get the chicken (even though it was super tender), I just didn't get as much rice...which probably would have been really good with the sauces.  Other than that....pretty cool music by local musicians....great ambiance and good times.  =)  If work sends me back out here again, I wouldn't mind coming back...

wTTra7hjrBIF-fHxE6zC4Q.text: Good service, good food, and great place for family dinner. Weekends are very busy for them so we don't plan dinners there on weekends.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. The New Orleans Platter

Wk2pfZS1syoxAn3tU22IgA.text: Once upon a time in a city FAR FAR AWAY (from HOME = Chicago) a Beautiful young woman and her handsome husband were toying around on Groupon while house hunting  (The Queen City = Charlotte) and low and behold a deal for this place by the name of Cajun Queen.  Considering that we met in New Orleans, LA and my great grandmother is from the French Quarters and cooked Cajun food regularly, we have a distinctive taste bud for AMAZING to Moderate Authentic Cajun Food.  When you approach you would not expect the crowd that this place draws, I ALWAYS make a reservation on Open Table before going ALWAYS. It's a HUGE house that was transitioned into a restaurant and a HUGE house it is in order to fit that many people at tables inside for brunch, lunch and dinner. It's not that large but considering that it was a HOME it's HUGE.  The day we decided on land to build our home on we decided to go celebrate and have dinner using our Groupon.  THIS WAS ONE OF THE BEST GROUPON DEALS WE EVER OBTAINED mainly due to the Southern feel, the TASTE, the SERVICE, etc...  I am not a FIVE star type of woman by far, I have to be pretty impressed and Cajun Queen has been VERY consistent. We've been more than 20 times now and I am just writing my review because I had to wait to ensure that there was consistency with the service, taste and feel of this place.  Cajun Queen is our GO-TO restaurant when we have family or friends visit. We like to take them somewhere that they can't go when they are back in their perspective cities that is also AMAZING and leave a memory in their mouth and mind.   We've had everything from craw-fish appetizer, fried green tomatoes, Fried Oysters, etc.. to Entrees including the Blacken Salmon topped with craw-fish and artichoke & sun dried tomato, Shrimp & Craw-fish Diane, Chicken Diane, Gumbo, Seafood Etouffee', New Orleans Platter (Fried Everything) etc..  All items mentioned are AWESOME, there are ALWAYS deals on Groupon however we go with or without a Groupon because it's WELL WORTH IT.. Be sure to make a reservation and if you don't be prepared to wait, however the bar area is small upstairs but a good time to say the least.  Happy Eating

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Being serenaded by the band..
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yum Salmon topped with crawfish, artichokes &amp; sundries tomatoes for me, Chicken Diane for the hubs &amp; fried shrimp for mini ME

usW_t61_iRFQqFAC2t8bGA.text: Poor showing from the the Cajun Queen last night.  Haven't been in several years, and I won't return after last night.  Service was good, food and drinks where unacceptable.   Gumbo caused indigestion for all a that indulged. Entrees looked like they had fallen victim to severe budget cuts.   Ordered call brand liquor, would bet I received well liquor.   Entertainment dollars could be better spent dining elsewhere.

8ANdpLIrqIvrHCGLK7r3vg.text: I decided to take my guy Mark out since he works way too much and he needed a night out.  The Cajun Queen did not disappoint.  Our waiter Bob was very friendly.  We started the evening with a bowl of seafood gumbo and a side of andouille sausage.  The gumbo was delicious and the andouille was grilled to perfection.  Mark ordered the crawfish etouffee and I ordered the blackened shrimp 'n grits.  Both dishes were amazing and paired well with our Legion beer.  Well done Cajun Queen, well done!

AJtx4QvNHywyUvFbGsPqpQ.text: Great restaurant.  Service and food are always consistently good.  Heres a few pics of our dinner last night: chicken diane, shrimp scampi, fried green tomatoes. Also, love the rolls they start you with. Use the valet parking too.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States

5mYVD_2ntwv37DuR-NVBwQ.text: Sat at the bar upstairs and had a delicious bowl of Crawfish Etouffee added shrimp and sausage which was an excellent combination. The bar tender was very attentive and friendly as well.

sRPoXGPaIxVt29-Yoq5BcA.text: Cajun / Nola in the Charlotte, Yes please.   This place has many traditional New Orleans options in a cool looking old house made into a restaurant. All kinds of meat, seafood, and good grub.   I had the New Orleans B.B.Q. Shrimp (sauteed with butter, garlic, beer and a variety of Cajun/Creole spices. Served over rice). This dish was top notch and made me very happy.  Taking down one star because the service could have been better and more friendly.  They have live music upstairs but since I was here to catchup with old co-workers, we took the first floor so we could talk.  Will be back during a future CLT trip.

MZ2kQqzFmoVv3ze7H0AJJQ.text: Best upscale restaurant in charlotte in my opinion for a few reason. 1. Live Jazz 2. Friendly and consistent servers 3. Food is to DIE for if you don't get the crawfish scampi appetizer your crazy it has about 75 crawfish tails. BBQ shrimp is also referred to as Crack due to how addictive they are 4. Food never changes same dishes for years now. Only complaint is sitting close to one another due to relatively packed seating but I can't blame them for maximizing profits. It's a little pricey but will turn into your anniversary/birthday go to place

oXUufXZDLeB4FiEMFzvkPQ.text: My boyfriend and I went to Cajun Queen for the first time last week for our anniversary dinner. We thoroughly enjoyed our appetizer (Cajun Popcorn) and entrees (Fried Catfish with broccoli and mashed potatoes). The service was good, but not great. The wine was delicious. They have live music in the upstairs room every night. The music was nice and not too loud. We will go back

B0Uuv7R8XyqPtNLh_921Rw.text: Fantastic Sunday brunch...Alex is an awesome server who knew everything about the items on the menu.  Bananas Foster French Toast... Best. Ever.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States

lEFol_pwQBgAS6R-ZwKMPw.text: We came for my sister's birthday dinner and had aN excellent time! They have complimentary valet, great service, good food, and the live jazz music was a nice touch!   For appetizers we tried the fried green tomatoes, fried pickles, BBQ shrimp, and crawfish. All of it was amazing!!   The filet was on point and the Caesar salad and garlic mash were good, too! Literally have no complaints!

Xb7TCydrJB4j0LPNROda5A.text: Well the food was just ok.  The service we received was like a wet dish cloth.   The waiter never smiled are anything.  I think he checked on us like twice and nothing more.    Please do not waste your time ordering the red beans and rice.  The beans are from the can ans have no flavor of cajun at all.   Highlu disappointed, this place use to be really good

Bm7i8WJ76KlfxsBFK2NLAA.text: It's Sunday, upstairs and the 7th St Gator band is playing. Sounds and feels like you are in New Orleans.  Three for brunch and we decided to split all three entrees. Wait, let's get some beignets. Perfect and they have some strawberry dunking sauce that is perfect.  We order French Toast, Shrimp and Grits and Egg Benedict over crab cakes. The Chef crushed it. Literally, each dish was fantastic. But watch out for the French Toast. Simply the best I have ever had. Fresh Texas Toast made that morning with this bananas foster maple syrup glaze. Each bite made you call for more. You can't go wrong with either of the three dishes but you have to get the French Toast.  Also, the waiter offered great service and made the experience that much more enjoyable.

00uCxbfWMm69PXYJQ9JMLw.text: Cute restaurant!  Valet parking has a long wait sometimes but that won't stop us from coming here! Our server was super friendly and nice and the place is pretty clean!  The chicken etoufee is so good! Also, their in house made oreo cheesecake is the BEST cheesecake EVER! I am drooling just thinking about it!!!  If you haven't already done so, definitely give it a try =)

IjKC9VO6w5uTY3I1rFnHjQ.text: Great experience. I wish I was hungier when I visited. Everything I tasted was delicious. The atmosphere was fabulous and everyone was friendly. A must do in Charlotte.

J5ABfWucx-ipmIGo9HhJxA.text: It never fails that every time we come to Cajun Queen we leave extremely satisfied! I recommend sitting upstairs to hear the jazz band but their rooftop patio is super nice as well! Try the Diane chicken and add andouille sausage to it! You will devour the whole plate!

YnFXA1m7ZPrHPUQHq-T6SA.text: This was a pleasant surprise to find in Charlotte. Thank goodness for the valets because parking is a bear in that area.  I ordered the crawfish etoufee and the waiter suggested adding some andouille sausage. Great choice. The roux was spiced just right and was as smooth as silk. Too many places either scorch the roux or make it too watery. These folks nailed it.  Would have loved some French bread garlic toast with it but the dinner rolls were very good.

nucHfI8prI-eI8oNcHv4Ww.text: The lady bartender, i think her name starts with an M is truly an angel. I watched her serve all 20+ people at her bar, and serve the waitstaff their drinks in a very timely manner. We ordered 4 courses + drinks and had no issues with time or food quality. It was completely packed and she kept her whole bar happy! I love her! Food was on point.

s54DuGZ8NTQRJqhYGfAZjg.text: Yummy food and  fun environment.  Don't expect any new age, trendy, food here, they serve True to form cajun food.  Prepare to leave here stuffed.   However, the service can sometimes stink due to it's high volume of patrons.  Anticipate long wait times and mediocre service if they are busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. DIANE

cqUyuV6Yl2pwz2sRRNIabA.text: We went there, for the hundredth time, but this time armed with a Groupon. The process was seamless since hey now scan the coupon at the table with their handheld device.    The food was great!  I had shrimp and grits!  Halfway through my meal, a bug flew into my food from the light over head.  The waiter quickly removed my plate, comped my meal, and gave me a fresh plate.  I was very impressed.    I would def go back!  Their waitstaff have certainly improved their skills with dish removal during the meal. And, they are very friendly and professional.    Great job!

-3aPh24S9U9dVqJd1RJP_g.text: I love the food and the atmosphere. The brunch could be better, it's not bad it just isn't worth writing home about

x-8cTds8I5mEfO2V2ejQhQ.text: Rolled up to the complimentary valet on the coldest Friday in several years with a cute chick and no reservations. Got a little concerned when a group left out complaining about the wait but we were seated almost immediately at a table in the lounge (it pays to travel with a cute chick!) Not too noisy, good mix of hot and cool jazz that pairs well with the foods. Beau showed right up, introduced himelf and got to recommending dinners which was great for me since I know precious little about Cajun. We started with shrimp something; half-dozen shrimps hot off the broiler swimming around a sculpted lemon in a boat of crazy good hot barbeque juice. Lovely bride was quite pleased with the zippiness (flavory spicing, not just heat) of the sauce and got a togo cup for the left over bit. Moved on to Chicken Etouffee while my lovely bride had shrimp-n-grits. Well yeah it was good!! (as if i have a clue how it's supposed to taste) Moist tender chickens sauced up in a warm lingering mellow sort of mood enhancer over a mound of very ricey rice.  MLB was quite pleased with her dinner, thanks to y'all Yelpers who recommended!! Said it was most enjoyable especially as she had missed the bit about the andouilles. Finished the night with a delightful bourboned bread pudding. Yea bread pudding!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Ettouffee &amp; Punch
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. There&#39;s sausage under them shrimps!
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. New Orleans B.B.Q. Shrimp

mhAGZD3AtRKnRQ1pILNKqw.text: I love Cajun cuisine and this was the best by far! The food was absolutely amazing and the service is excellent. I have added this place to my favorites and have recommended this spot as a must visits to all my family and friends who visit Charlotte. Definitely added this restaurant to my top 5 list. Can't wait to visit again!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States

7gdC--5CKXwW-2R16mTm_Q.text: My favorite place to get New Orleans seafood. I either order the chicken Diane or shrimp and grits. Their shrimp comes with a sausage link instead of chopped up but i do enjoy it. They're a little on the pricey side bc we had two entrees and an appetizer and our bill was 90 dollars. We weren't allowed to use our Groupon for some reason that day. I recommend that you come early or make reservations bc they get busy early.   They even have a live band upstairs. I believe this is a good date spot in Charlotte.

RSwITk8uwLtT0YAv5-EiPA.text: This is a great place to enjoy a mediocre cajun meal in a very nice and relaxing atmosphere (an old house).  Little pricey, good service and good food.

VY8b4DHQbeYixb7w2UZGWg.text: I live in the South and visit Louisiana frequently. With that being said, this place does not come close to great creole. The fried crawfish appetizer was the only that was great. The gumbo looked like it was made from tomato soup (no roux) with only 2 shrimp in it. I had the blackened catfish & chicken with rice for my entree. Even with the seasoning they put on it, I had to add salt and pepper and ask (and pay $3 extra) for "Diane" sauce to pour over it.   Beware, they automatically charge 18% gratuity for separate checks even with only 2 people! When I asked about this the waiter was very rude and very defensive. I usually tip generously but the service and food were bad. I am in town for work and I will not be returning.

JuAfY09rIkqmPt5oh3wUCw.text: I'm so glad I gave Cajun Queen another try! I had a really bad first experience, so I didn't have high hopes when I returned for my second visit.   We came here with my parents on a Saturday. Make sure you make a reservation because they were super busy. I started my meal with a hurricane, which was awesome and extra strong!   For dinner I got the creole Cajun rice with chicken, shrimp and crawfish. It had the perfect amount of spice, but you can ask for more spice on the side! Most importantly, there was a huge amount of seafood in it and the chicken included two breast! It was so much food! My parents got the catfish and the chicken Diane. Can't go wrong with the Diane. My husband got it on our first visit and I thought it was delicious.   They also always have a Groupon. Make sure to check that out before you head here!  I'm glad I gave them a second chance!

mt3XQeJY46KJupFYoOrr1Q.text: Used a groupon, great food for the soul huge selection of drink selection and great service- perfect atmosphere with fireplaces and jazz music, a taste of NOLA right outside of Noda- huge shoutout to our waiter, Joey knew everything about the menu and answered all of our questions!

Vh54SIS5mWVOfOpvN6cogA.text: Old favorite, I've been here more than a few times. I love the vibe and the food is always wonderful!! They have a live band upstairs that is fun while waiting for dinner. I try and do a girls night here during queens feast each year.

XKlybnXO4cx_auX9jo1kDg.text: We absolutely loved everything we had at Cajun Queen. I had the crawfish etouffee and it was fantastic. Just the right amount of spice, perfect ratio of rice to crawfish and nice portion size. My boyfriend had the cajun chicken pasta and oh my goodness, the sauce let me tell you...its out of this world!! I loved the veggies in his pasta as well. To finish off our meal we shared the bread pudding, it was great as well and fresh out of the oven. My only complaint is I would have liked more caramel sauce because it was that fantastic!   Now onto the ambiance, this restaurant is actually an older house. I love how they have things split into separate rooms, it gives it a more intimate feeling. The place really gives off a cool vibe.   Service was amazing, our waiter was super personable and friendly. He never let us run out of anything!   We will definitely be back in the future and I recommend that everyone give this place a try!

8jTC6yEzp02nfO8SEfOLUQ.text: Great food and love that they have a band so you get the entertainment as you dine. The only issue is parking... I'm not big on valet so I would prefer to park my own car.

GkyhVt2aaatfJdkx6q3zEA.text: I consider Cajun Queen one of Charlotte's original gems. I have been coming here for years and they have never disappointed me. This is definitely your place if you feel the New Orleans' Blues.   The BBQ shrimp appetizer is a great way to start. The sauce is so good and with the perfect kick.  My favorite was absolutely the Blackened Mahi Mahi served over rice from the special menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ Shrimp
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried oysters
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mahi Mahi served over rice

W2wzS5nDkHXZifgQZoD7kg.text: Extremely good and a really good vibe all around. I would recommend the Diane as that dish is both delicious and pretty well sized. The staff is super attentive and helpful with recommendations. They also have a Groupon usually so if you're ever planning to go there, make sure to check if there's an available Groupon 24 hours ahead of time.

kVP3KQd-ZpaKCXVdkE4sig.text: The only problem I would say with this place is parking. The offer Valet but other parking maybe on the street. The food was amazing. I had the Shrimp and Grits which was great. My girlfriend and I shared the Oreo Cheesecake which I highly recommend it.

THgbhSO1HwwjTEdflyjKKQ.text: Love eating here!  Service and food are always on point and I will continue going back.

g8EEWIil1MK2sKvgjKEwSA.text: Great food great service. Usually can find a deal on Groupon which is what got me to try this spot in the first place. Their dishes are perfectly crafted with flavors that took me to another world! The catfish is excellent! I have been here twice and got the same thing both times because it was just that good! Next time, I will definitely make it a point to try something new next time I go back!

nKn3Lio37EnW2_yJPPforA.text: My husband and I are from Louisiana. Here's what we ordered: fried green tomatoes, side of red beans and rice, crawfish etouffee, shrimp & grits and I had a hurricane. It was great. First, the red beans and rice were good and my husband was disappointed there was no sausage in it but I pointed out it had chopped up ham in it. As long as there is some pork, it's fine. Tasted great. I tried his etouffee and it was perfect. I hate when it comes out cream colored because that is just wrong and probably made from condensed soup and when red, it's too tomato based. It was a brown sauce and very authentic like I make. Heat was perfect. I love we had our choice of La hot sauce or Crystal. My shrimp was obviously small compared to our gulf shrimp but still tasted amazing paired with grilled andouille sausage. That sausage was the star of the dishes. My husband tried to steal it and I normally let him have it but this time we had to split it. It was wonderful! The grits were a little creamy for me BUT they may be perfect for Charlotte natives. Both were really, really good. I would make some suggestions though. First, the fried green tomatoes were fried in fish fry cornmeal. I don't know anyone that makes them like that. The batter falls off and it's not enjoyable to eat. It's grainy and I would suggest if you do cornmeal you at least do it half with flour. This should keeps the batter on the tomatoes. The sauce was awesome. Had a creamy tar tar flavor. Loved that! Also, no one eats red beans and rice without cornbread. Why not serve cornbread muffins instead of hard white rolls? Im perplexed on that one. It's a staple and if you go to Nola, there's no way you would think this was right. Maybe a basket with both would be good. Or one as a garnish on certain dishes like beans n rice. Idk. The hurricane was too sour. The Pat O'Brien's mix directions do cause this but when you make it right then instead of ahead of time in batches, you can see the mix floating around and it's really salty. Fix that! It wasn't cold enough either. *Please tell your staff that it's pronounced, ON-douille NOT AN-douille. It's wrong. Aside from my suggestions, it was delicious and we will be back for sure!! I strongly recommend you get some andouille added to whatever you select! Atmosphere is nice and suitable for a romantic night, date night or even a family gathering. Service is wonderful.

AsGI8n1lr2zV7aWaAq2WXA.text: Came here craving Cajun food and am glad we did. Restaurant has about 8 parking spots in the rear. Service was very subpar especially since it wasn't busy. Had to ask 3 times for more butter. Waiter didn't come back to check on us. First cup of coffee was lukewarm.   But this place makes it up with good food EXCEPT the seafood gumbo. It was more on the watery side and bland to taste. We expected they would have good gumbo but it was not satisfying. Started with the fried oyster appetizer and found it weird to be at market price. The half order was so small and costs $13. It was good but not worth the money. The crawfish etouffee, however, was mind blowing. Maybe the best I had? So much flavor and many pieces of crawfish. Ended the meal with pecan pie and wowwwww! We licked the plate! Definitely coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Seafood gumbo
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pecan pie
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried oyster appetizer (half size)

TkaP-cv_65AUuOZ722iM9A.text: WOW - NOLA in CLT. This was a great choice for dinner on a Saturday night. We tried to get a reservation through the website but there was no availability. We decided to ride over and take our chances because the menu was so tempting. We did alright. We opted for bar seating to get service sooner rather than later (40 minute wait).  We ordered fried green tomato appetizer, an appetizer shrimp fried instead of BBQ style to go along with the chicken Etouffee, the Wash Day Blues (red beans and rice with andouille sausage) and we finished up with the bourbon Bread pudding. Every morsel that touched our mouths was delicious. The fried green tomatoes cooked perfect, nice crunchy flavorful coating and gently firm inside. The tomato remoulade had just enough flavor to not over power the breading. The fried shrimp were perfectly seasoned no need for the Cajun tartar sauce that Bo promised but never delivered to my sister. The Etouffee with chicken was New Orleans spicy and hit the spot. The chicken was tender enough to break with a fork. The portions were huge. There were two large chicken breasts in the Etouffee. The Wash Day Blues was a large bowl of Red beans and rice with 4 half andouille sausages. The flavor was authentic and not over spicy. I only wished that I had cornbread instead of the sour dough roll. Although, the roll was really good as well. Did I mention, we were sitting at the bar.  We were glad that Bo came over to take care of us. He did a FANTASTIC job! I will not to mention delicious bourbon bread pudding. We were lucky enough to get a piece fresh out of the oven, the peaches and raisin with the caramel sauce just made my taste buds SING!!!. I will definitely go back to the Cajun Queen and I recommend it to anyone in the city and craving some authentic NOLA fair.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Bourbon Bread pudding. Without the whipped topping
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried shrimp ..side item
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. WASH DAY BLUES

RMv-Oi4fehaeQxXIVbeDbQ.text: this place is as good as it gets. always top notch, never a disappointment!. the fried oysters are to die for, i have a very hard time NOT ordering them. also, the FEAST, omg, its unreal!!!

n7kBSn-wkjgmPDF2KkNz3A.text: I have been to Cajun Queen Twice and have enjoyed my meal both times. The portions are enough for two to share. I ordered the fried catfish last night and got two big pieces of fish which was way more than I expected. It was well seasoned with a lightly fried coating which didn't flake. My husband order a dish (Diane something) which consisted of crawfish, shrimp, and chicken) which was amazing. We both had plenty of leftovers to go. Our server Justin was on point and very attentive. I usually don't remember names but he was awesome. I love the quaintness of this place. The Groupon deal is awesome. Not sure how long they plan on running this deal but I would go back despite the deal.

8RVZldFggyMoSYz6iXnSZA.text: Good quality food, but lacking the full flavor of Louisiana  seasoning and spice.  We had BBQ shrimp, red beans & rice, fried and blackened shrimp and catfish which were all good, but do not compare to restaurants in New Orleans.  Prompt service and nice atmosphere.

NHtcPP3g7GqnM9oNUcR-sQ.text: We ate here for breakfast, as we were in the mood for beignets. The beignets were more crisp than soft, which isn't to my taste, so that was a miss, but the omelette was very good and the Elvis Presley French toast was appropriately over-the-top rich. The service was friendly and attentive, so we will be back again.

BGUnlu_wz3o_3jiDaM8bZQ.text: Charming restaurant that literally makes you feel at home. Great ambiance. Feels like you're having dinner at a friends house. The seating was cozy and intimate. The food is delicious and flavorful. I ordered the blackened catfish and it was melt-in-your-mouth delicious. My date had the shrimp diane, which he said was wonderful. We had the bread pudding for dessert. It was good. I never had bread pudding with peaches in it. It was unique. Our waiter was friendly and took good care of us. We had a great time at Cajun Queen and we can't wait to go back again soon.

b4PaqHFLTvuX1K8AFvQykw.text: My husband and I went for dinner and ate upstairs, enjoying the bar area first.  We popped outside with our drinks and ran into members of the house band. Had a wonderful time talking to the musicians.  The food was delicious, and the menu has  gluten free options too.   If  you want to enjoy the jazz, reserve a table upstairs, preferably when there isn't a wedding party. Really loved the music!

qiI1VPhKioKyxv7INs5UBA.text: Wow - definitely wanted to like this spot, but it was an incredible disappointment.  The popcorn crawfish was way off - over-breaded with a bit of a funky taste (and I generally love crawfish), although the shrimp appetizer was decent.  My friend ordered the Shrimp Scampi despite my objections, and paid the price.  It was completely bland.  Even the steamed broccoli was poorly cooked.  My 4 way Etouffee was a little above average.  We finished with the bread pudding, which was also unexceptional.  To top it off, our service was efficient, but certainly not friendly.  With tip, our bill was $95, and a poor value.

iVM0LjTDenlfbTnqx2sTQA.text: In Charlotte for a quick business trip, I found this gem on Yelp. My waitress Hanna seemed genuinely excited that this was my first time there and recommended several dishes, all of which didn't disappoint. Started with the BBQ shrimp, spicy yet tasty; sop the sauce with the bread. Next up, blackened pork tenderloin with fried plantains. 3 good sized medallions with an interesting bean chorizo sauce. The plaintains were battered with cornmeal and were very good. I also asked for a single filet of the salt and pepper catfish, which was very good also. Ended the meal with key lime pie. Overall the dining experience went well. I would come back next time in town to try other menu items.

Fc73RIIg97E3C7rlIUWbvg.text: So incredibly let down by this dining experience. Our waiter was simultaneously overbearing and absent-minded. Half of our table got their meals 10-15 mins before the other half and the waiter forgot to bring two of us our desserts. Meanwhile, the food was terrible. The fried green tomatoes lacked any kind of seasoning and the crawfish etouffee was bland and not at all spicy. The tollhouse cookie pie was also a travesty. How does one mess up a cookie pie?! At least the key lime pie was good, but not worth the $250 dollar bill :(

q88TR5Qibz2B9gNd56gz-w.text: I must update my review with some favorite dishes...this is Cajun deliciousness:   Barbecue shrimp: Nom nom nom. The sauce on these shrimp is outstanding and the little crustaceans are perfectly cooked! I could easily make a meal out of these tasty creatures of the sea.   Shrimp grits: Seriously creamy and dreamy. The shrimp are sizeable and plump! You'll want to live in these grits...you know, make a home in the bowl.   Bread pudding: I'm not even a huge bread pudding person and their peach bread pudding is outstanding - the perfect amount of sweet and savory. It's love reincarnated.  Cajun Queen can great really crowded so be aware of that when you plan your evening. And, be sure to catch the Cajun Queen band when you can...those guys are amazing!

8VqDwjuVQNjDlz4iMozdRQ.text: Great service and food! The shrimp creole was really good. We really wanted beignets but those are only served on Sunday.

arglfp4VPJnQ1oNVUxw5PQ.text: Evening was great!!!! Food was delicious!! Live music!!! Atmosphere for great conversations!!! And a shout out to the bartender Harrison who took such great care of us!!!!

G6ZQ1JX69U-b1S4RBKQKYA.text: Sunday Brunch was great. Service was wonderful.  The Diane was AMAZING!  My daughter had shrimp and grits. She loved it. We all had dessert, pecan pie and bread pudding was phenomenal. Great place.

mv9QScpVtAFvR1uZzDaNIg.text: Was recommended to this restaurant by the front  desk clerk at the Hilton nearby. My two co-workers and I were very happy with the food and the service. Portion sizes were more than enough.   I ordered the Blackened Filet Diane and added shrimp. One of my co-workers had the shrimp, crawfish, and chicken etouffee, and the other got the princess cut Cajun barbecued pork chop.  And while each dish was wonderful, the presentation of the barbecued pork chop was simply beautiful! It was certainly the best looking plate of the evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Desserts!

uLIy13OhsLnBxwfGefSpmA.text: Ambiance, atmosphere, service, food... all exceeded expectations. The complimentary valet also add a nice touch. Making reservations on an early Friday evening should allow you to capture the experience at its best. ciao!

pyrM6aaTOgB7iDLr5roBVA.text: 5 hours ago   Had reservations for 5:30. Arrived on time and were greeted by 2 hostesses promptly. Very pleased. Myself, coworker and my sister. Here for restaurant week, we were promptly seated. 5 stars. Server was prompt & attentive. We ordered our wine and 1st course same time. Arrived in 5 to 8 mins. 5 stars. Ordered entrees & dessert when 1st course arrived. No problem, smooth execution. Entrees arrived soon after finishing 1st course. We all ordered the Diane, sister w/chicken, coworker and I, three ways. All were delicious! Dessert was brought to our table boxed for takeout, which we requested. All in all excellent service. No complaints.

FzU5i-EGfO0PrC0ShpiOVw.text: Amazing cuisine and a True focus on the food.  This is the closet you will come to being in the French quarter without actually being their.

OEhpVT7TVH_SCSZf2jKRTQ.text: i looked over their Living Social coupon. It said good only Sunday-Thursday, which was fine because I was going on Sunday. I read the fine print, and it said the usual jargon, but that it was excluded on Fat Tuesday, and Valentine's Day. Since today is neither of those days, I bought the coupon, and drove the 30  minutes to the restaurant. I get there and there is a huge sign on the door say they won't be taking the coupons during Restaurant Week, which is still going on. Would have been nice had they listed that on the actual Living Social coupon, as it only said just Fat Tuesday and Valentine's Day. I didn't even bother going on. I was so annoyed about the lack of communication on the actual LivingSocial form I just requested a refund.

i3DLvKVxnTSLu1R0vWFW1Q.text: Best restaurant I've been too in Charlotte. I ordered the New Orleans fish platter and it was out of this world. The gumbo is so flavorful too! You get what you pay for here! Awesome jazz music too! I will defiantly be going back.

bC_8J0JTYIXzSpCNtG9IEw.text: Needless to say.. I like it hot and I feel like Cajun Queen GETS me. There is definitely enough spice to be had here for all! My bf and I went this past weekend and I always can't believe that I don't come here more often.   We started off with the BBQ Shrimp, which had decent-sized shrimpies swimming around in cajun tastiness and it was just enough to leave us wanting more. I had the 4-way etouffee, yes, 4-WAY ettouffee with chicken, shrimp, crawfish and sausage and it was just what the doctor ordered for my spice addiction! My man ordered the shrimp and grits and loved his so much that he ate it again at home the next night! The etouffee was obviously meaty and spicy, while the shrimp and grits were creamy and plentiful. I, of course, enjoyed my meal with a Dixie's Blackened Voodoo (spiced) lager. Spice, spice, spice!  Bonus while dining at Cajun Queen: LIVE jazz music every night of the week! If you sit  upstairs, you will have the pleasure of  eating and drinking to fun music that totally fits the Cajun cuisine. The band may be a little too loud at times to have a normal dinner conversation but this is what makes the experience fun! If you would rather a more quiet dinner, make a reservation for the downstairs area of the restaurant or for a table outside.   Just a heads up: You may have to wait a few minutes before your table is ready for your reservation...  All the more reason to belly up to the bar while you wait. Duh.  The service may be a bit slow as they are always busy and the servers sometimes get a tad overwhelmed. But most aren't in a hurry while enjoying what the Queen has to offer so it's never seemed to be much of a problem for me.

gvUNSHwGsFwoosT2Dxqodw.text: most excellent dinner. Our table enjoyed shrimp and grits immensely,  as well as the pork tenderloin, and the dianes.   seating is tight,  but I guess popular restaurants try to squeeze everyone in best they can:-)

NtbrOGxfSLOzBIzS95_NnA.text: This is my second time at Cajun Queen. Services were much better than last time, but I got a dirty fork. Four stars for food, not for the rest.

D2rAlnIPFihg4ZZOI9Q79Q.text: My favorite restaurant in Charlotte, bar none.  My wife and I have been at least a couple dozen times over the years.  The crawfish scampi is my favorite appetizer/side dish I've ever enjoyed, at restaurants ranging from greasy spoons to upscale steakhouses.  Savory, delectable, and delicious.  It's the kind of dish I could eat every single day.  Make sure to soak up the remaining sauce with your bread.   I believe we have had every entree on the menu at one time or another, but my favorite has to be the crawfish etouffee.  Generous portions of crawfish paired with a perfectly spiced roux over rice.  It never disappoints. We just got back from New Orleans and had this same dish at 3 or 4 different well-reviewed restaurants, and none of them, in my opinion, bested Cajun Queen's.

3uGAozNOwom3F9cqoqU_VQ.text: Stopped in yesterday to eat dinner. Food and service top notch again. Our servers name was Kevin, he did a good job!!  However, if you go and try to park near the restaurant......BEWARE OF THE VALETS!! One ran up on me yesterday and told me that I can't park where I was parking. I asked him why and he told me its for valet service. VALETS CANNOT STOP PEOPLE FROM PARKING ON PUBLIC STREETS !!!!!!! Or block public parking spots!!!!!

TMcNbCL5wQsNHMOPGs92Sw.text: We started off with what everyone suggested, yes the Fried Green Tomatoes and the Cajun Popcorn (Fried Crawfish). It was awesome. The green tomatoes were not sour and it came with a sauce that made it tangy. This sauce also came with the fried crawfish and it complemented with it well.  I ordered the Diane with all three (chicken, shrimp, and crawfish) my mother ordered the chicken, my father ordered the pork chop, and my brother followed with everyone's recommendation of the BBQ shrimp.  The Diane: absolutely to die for. It wasn't extremely spicy, the spice and kick came from the use of pepper and maybe a dash of cayenne pepper. But it was creamy, and with the mushrooms, chicken, crawfish, and shrimp it was amazing. I have to personally say that this was probably the best dish, or tied with the pork chop at least.  The chicken was probably the worse of the 4 dishes there, but on the bright side we did order the 3 good dishes. Next, the Pork Chop: This was awesome as well. The flavor was just off the chain! It wasn't spicy, but that sauce they added to the pork chop had a tangy flavor and then it was sweet as well. The meat was also well cooked, juices just coming out of it. Delicious.  The last dish BBQ Shrimp: If you're a spicy dish lover, this is the dish you should get. My father as well as brother found it pretty spicy (I did too), but whoa. The flavor on the shrimp as well as the rice was absolutely delicious (before the kick of the spiciness of course). It had a tangy sweet taste to it at first, then it just kicks back.   Parking was kinda crappy, but it goes well with the environment and ambiance of the restaurant. A house/restaurant gives it a homey feel, as well as a high class dining experience. But, parking and getting out of that parking lot is a pain. *Note, there is an exit/entrance at the back of the parking lot as well as the front to 7th street.* (But I would recommend to enter from 7th street)  I hope I have stirred your taste buds in trying something new and unique from Charlotte. Because mine was!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ shrimp
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pork chop
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Diana with all three

J4kfKdvoVOyrAv9sCug-Dg.text: The food was ok, but not great! The service and ambiance were excellent. We would go again, but are in no hurry.

ExsXx6hAzHEkbLsYbNNISg.text: I was excited about eating tasty, authentic Cajun food.  Really confused about the reason our experience and food did not match up to the other reviews that I read before booking my reservation.  We came here to celebrate a successful event at work. We were a party of five very diverse diners but we all left food on our plates because it was average.  The men actually left seafood and meat in the portions they left on the table because the tastes were so bland.  Watery gumbo started off our meals. It was similar to the consistency of Progresso soups, we could have saved these calories and yes it has shrimp, sausage but why is gumbo so transparent and without a hint a peppers, garlic, etc. We pressed on.  Our party's entree choices were all different some had Diane,  Creole and a few combined appetizers to make an entree. No one finished their meal. Only one person even bothered to take home their leftovers.  The hostess was wonderful, the waiter was okay - he was not happy very curt with all his answers, he looked annoyed by our inquiries about menu items.  He should have just said if you don't know about our menu then you should not be here-boom!  The valet staff was pleasant, quick  and accommodating - Bravo!  We will go back because all the other reviews indicate that we had an unusual visit. I will update my review when I return.

6IjhXUXldeXlXzYFpBpVjg.text: Tonight we went here for dinner. The food was pretty good. I had the shrimp and grits the shrimp had a very fishy after taste. Considering that I eat shrimp often I couldn't really shake the after taste. The sausage was burnt. Making it very disappointing. The grits however were solid. My boyfriend got the platter and he said it was good. And my son got chicken tenders. At 4, those are always good. I'm willing to give the place another chance in hopes of it being better next time. We definitely want to try brunch for the live jazz. It wasn't bad however it left much to be desired.

VaDdw1wVtHlgpn7SoINfvQ.text: Amazing place with great food and impeccable service. Order the catfish or the shrimp and grits, Hell, order anything. You won't be disappointed!

5y8TC6O5fXlviLAzwkukGA.text: First time here, The Diane was amazing, big enough to share and very tasty!!! We got all the meats added! Superb!

4jaY1AjgzB3g673SYuK0MQ.text: Not sure if it was just an off night but we had a rough dining experience last night. We called and made a reservation for 8:45pm and were told this would be plenty of time to dine before their closing time of 10pm. As soon as we sat down we were rushed to order because the kitchen was closing at 9:15. Our plates were cleared before we were even able to finish our meals and when we told the waiter he replied with, "I already put the dishes in the kitchen but I can bring them back out." The staff was turning off lights and locking up before we even got up to leave. We felt like we were intruding on the staff and an inconvenience so this made it difficult to enjoy ourselves.

LRC2QR0S9cQ0-nsXMa3vuQ.text: Food was just ok. I have eaten here in the past and it was much better. I had the blackened catfish and fried green tomatoes. The tomatoes were a bit hard but the catfish was great. My husband had the gumbo and etoufee 3 ways. Neither of them had good flavor or seasoning. Not sure if I would give this one another try or not. We may just have to make a trip to NOLA instead.

D6CPmznVgaUEv28bohd4qg.text: First visit to a Cajun Queen, definitely not the last. It was restaurant week and they had a great deal on their meals. I had the gumbo, blackened tilapia and bread pudding. Oh and a glass of Chardonnay...all for $30. Soooo good! My husband had the shrimp and grits the Nate as of tilapia. The atmosphere was great. After the meal we went up to the bar. If you want strong margaritas, you will definitely get it. I'm looking forward to our next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States

vCdRx0S6rzJMGo2D5DXKzg.text: I will start with the positives, the atmosphere is very nice and our waiter Alex was very nice and helpful. They have live music in the evenings which was nice as well. What I didn't like was the food. The food had hardly any flavor in my opinion. When I think of Cajun or new Orleans style food I think of tons of flavor. Also, the prices were a bit steep for something I could have made at home. I did enjoy my french quarter coffee! I would return just to sit on the rooftop deck and have a drink but the food was mediocre. Once again the service was great everyone was friendly who worked there. If you want good service and a great atmosphere to hear some live jazz/blues this is a good spot. If you are looking for delicious food you may want to try elsewhere.

Nk_XVUmbZmJUa0FfhzSukA.text: The service is very casual as is the entire restaurant. Service is great.  The food is ok, nothing special. The shrimp crab gumbo was pretty good but not hot (as in temp.) enough. The blackened catfish was a huge portion but disappointing, all paprika & chill powder no other seasoning! The veg served was thumbs down, room temp. Broccoli and flavorless over boiled mash potato's! One of the few times I left the starch on the plate.  The meal wasn't bad but acceptable at best!

d14tHxrH70q6lqytVhkUeQ.text: We went for brunch. Service was a little slow and food was just okay. I ordered shrimp and grits which was okay and my partner ordered French toast which was tasty but burned a little on edges and needed a little more sauce.

7ICdVSQXKEKxj4jfGQxQ9w.text: Went last night for my birthday. Really good food - got the cajun pasta which was a special that day. Great atmosphere... we sat downstairs as there's a band upstairs. Seems like there was a disconnect between the hostess and the waitress as my mom called ahead asking what they did for birthdays and the hostess said "you get the bourbon bread pudding with a candle brought to you after you're done with your dinner (for free". But the waitress asked us well after we were done eating and boxed up our food what dessert we wanted... besides that it was a great time. Definitely worth going to for a special occasion.

9vehTCQOIQBH-wiKssm9Ng.text: I had the shrimp scampi which was delicious! The service was fast and our waiter was attentive and gave great recommendations. It was our first time there and we will be back for a repeat.

azpceRrJy0RUDBU-U37CEw.text: First time in Charlotte and went to Cajun Queen with my partner. The ambiance was great, our server was perfect and the food was amazing! I promise we will visit Cajun Queen for date night every time we visit Charlotte! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried shrimp were to die for! So good!
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Stone grits were so yummy!

voif-4MRVU8oRgRag7t1-A.text: The amount of food received for $18 was not pleasing. Packaged was a handful of rice and 12 oz  cup of shrimp and spices as my entree for the new orleans bbq shrimp. I probably wont order again.

-UDINmbyp8qiDYrO7-j_aA.text: This place is underrated. Everything I have ever ate was great. It's kind of a weird location which makes it not come up on my radar often when I'm thinking of where Togo for a meal. They also offer valet which is nice and typically there is a Groupon available too.

LCh5H2QdtFCmAPqS9afYcg.text: Service: Our server was nice enough - nothing amazing, but was attentive and we never found ourselves lacking for anything.  Atmosphere: While I felt it's a little run-down on the inside, it didn't bother me on a cold, winter day because it was warm and inviting. There is a fireplace in the front room that I wish we could have been seated near. Instead, we were seated in a back room that felt like an enclosed patio that had parking lot lights streaming in. Oh well. Live music upstairs would have been too loud for our group to sit near it and talk. Valet parkers were friendly and quick.  Beverages: Thumbs-up for some fun beverages. I had the good ol' Hurricane (didn't seem too strong to me) and a fellow diner had the "Seventh Street Stumbler." Both of us enjoyed our drinks. While I don't usually order those types of beverages, it seemed appropriate at a cajun restaurant and I was pleased.  Food: I don't know about everyone else, but I was blown away by my Shrimp Julienne (?) - it was light, but plenty of food and DELICIOUS. I would highly recommend to others and would order it again myself. The bread is a waste of carbohydrates, so ask them to skip that. The fried pickles were pretty delicious and I don't usually like fried pickles.  Overall: I would return here on a date or with friends who were ready to have some drinks.

yvbvd4u8mEDMcGwHZlq_eQ.text: Awesome food and just as amazing wait staff. Highly recommend the Diane with Shrimp. Also dont forget to look at the daily specials. I had a Groupon for todays visit but have gone before on others recommendations. Will be going back for sure.

HUlhw4xarv2Rj0-8NxbcNQ.text: Cajun Queen is pretty much always good. What's not to like about Cajun food? All of the classics are here. The restaurant is located right in the Elizabeth area in a converted house. There are lots of fun legends about the house being haunted. I know they also do live jazz, though I'm unsure of what night. Regardless, you may want to make a reservation before visiting. It's always busy.  Last night, we ordered fried green tomatoes, fried oysters, Cajun pasta, and the steak special. (It was a make-up Father's Day dinner.) All were fabulous. The oysters and the pasta were my favorites and the tomatoes were my least - though, still decent. My only gripe is that it is a little over priced. The portions are large and the quality is good so it's probably justified.   Parking blows.

jJPQltPmA9siysv6LSgTWw.text: One of my favorites here in Charlotte.  Best BBQ shrimp I ever had.  Great music. A fun place to dine.

4oPIBxZILlxf07kcHRP5eA.text: I am not a big Cajun Food connoisseur but I know what a good etouffee tastes like after a few visits to New Orleans and having eaten it at other places.  We wanted to try this place as the reviews were really good. The service was just good -  the live Jazz music OK and the food was disappointing to say the least. 3 stars for the ambiance.

qvU58iiNsvcaJmWMSMhDpQ.text: Visited at the end of December and it was our first time. We were a large group together for a work function. The food was hands down the best- I had the Cajun pasta, the cream sauce was perfection. The owner let us in a bit early and the service was excellent. Such great food and definitely will be taking my family back.

pzM71bXp4ZrQgE3wuBSgKw.text: Each entree came with the choice of salad or soup (GUMBO)! Shrimp and Grits w/sausage and New Orleans Platter was tasty. Downstairs women's bathroom lock broken so unless you are ok with someone walking in on you you may want to go upstairs to use the women's bathroom.

VrFkGcl5JqOFP_6b1CEi6w.text: I am a big fan of Cajun Queen and always try to stop by when in Charlotte.  The food is good. the atmosphere is very quaint.  The catfish was delish, the gumbo was good.  The waiter was less than attentive.... he did not bring our drinks we had to ask /remind multiple times.  I asked that my entree not have carbs /mashed potatoes and instead do a salad.   This was totally forgotten and my plate had to go back to the kitchen.   Other than that unfortunate experience the evening was great

YONOIhUX_HtQEQ4S0TMQMw.text: I planned a brunch for my future daughter-in-law, and it turned out perfect having it here. The food was great, the staff was very accommodating and friendly. Couldn't have asked for a better experience!

jNoDvu_4UCzxOb_F_P5aVg.text: After reading reviews I was expecting so much better from Cajun Queen. Compared to the cooking in New Orleans every dish we had at Cajun Queen was a disappointment. We had BBQ shrimp, talapia with crawfish and etouffee. It felt that every dish had been rushed to be put together. Not enough time had been given to let the spices and flavors blend and develop. I recommend the owners concentrate more on quality rather than turning over the tables as fast as possible.

ELeAIQ4QHKA-J1CD9vAMkg.text: Amazing dinner! Fantastic Service!  The food was one of the best we've had in Charlotte!  The spices, heat and flavors were great and finished by homemade dessert was the best finish.

9xtl3Eoiz-d1roVOzXt6Tg.text: I absolutely love William Julius Kellam The Third!!!!! But the sloppy manager is a different story. The Swamp Water is always good, as well as, my medium ribeye!!!! #noneedforchange!#leftovermediumribeye&eggd

yRmLn6tc56nR_WimXfEpSw.text: Cajun Queen has a very authentic menu according to my husband whose family lived many years in southern Louisiana and who still have relatives there. The Creole Shrimp, Red Beans and Rice, and Etouffee we had last night were incredible but the fried oysters were declared the best he had ever eaten! My only criticism is that the meal felt a  little rushed. We ordered drinks but knew we could not eat much before our entrees, just shared a plate of fried oysters.  Our salads and food came almost immediately. We were in and out in under an hour. That time included changing tables to a quieter area. We'll definitely return but we'll try to set the pace ourselves more.

-6_pnvhMtrs3cw76jsSBWQ.text: Cajun Queen was everything the reviews said it was.  The food portions were huge! The service was excellent.

f0cws5HlJixNX_-dX0P5Cw.text: This was my second visit. I love the atmosphere and the waiting staff is very friendly. I ordered crawfish etouffee and it was delicious. The only change that I think they should make is to have corn bread or garlic bread instead of the rolls.

OwXHPL1tt3fRFXkmDFVTyw.text: Cajun Queen is in a beautiful location. The large house is very quaint with windows so clean they appear transparent. The hostess was well dressed, helpful and charming. It was a Friday night and the place was packed with families as well as couples on a date night.Free valet parking is awesome. But unfortunately, that is were it ends. I write this in hopes of spurring change. The food was painfully bland and the rolls were cold. My husband and I tried the gumbo first. While the taste of the herbs rang through, it just didn't have that, " started with the heads and tails of the shrimp to make my own home made broth taste", that I would expect from a restaurant that markets like an authentic Cajun restaurant and charges the prices that you do. Same with the Shrimp and Grits-bland. The lack of salt would be understandable, if you were living in a nursing home. The mashed potatoes were over cooked and tasted like they had been whipped with water and the Diane sauce was runny. Sad. I feel cheated. I was my birthday and I picked the restaurant and was there with my entire family and everyone had that, " I wish we had went somewhere else look," as the food started to arrive and I can not blame them.  The only saving grace to the entire meal was the pork chops and the fact that the veggies were fresh. When I pay these prices I want to taste the balance of flavors in what I am eating. I want it to taste like home cooked and the food needs to be hot not warm. It is like the food is being cooked with fear-like you might offend the elderly or someone who doesn't like garlic or a little heat. Why have a Cajun restaurant? Yes, I have high standards. You are what you eat and there are tons of other restaurants in Charlotte. The quality for the price is just not there.

c7LiTEwk98tzKI2JC1-buA.text: The most expertly fried seafood that I can remember, and the absolute best fried oysters that I've ever had. If they only did Cajun as good a they do seafood, I would have given them five stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. The best fried oysters I&#39;ve ever had.

or031N6lVr0KinUPsaSYjQ.text: Seated promptly at 5:30 right by the fireplace.  Staff friendly and helpful. Ordered fried green tomatoes. Good and the sauce on top tasty still like the ones from Tupelo Honey better. Next time will definitely try the bbq shrimp. I ordered the shrimp creole and salad my husband had the Cajun pasta and cup of gumbo.  Everything was great especially the Cajun pasta.  Next time I would skip the salad if ordering an appetizer because portions are very generous and the shrimp creole was full of shrimp. Only negative is parking. Which is pretty much non existent so make your reservations early.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States

GMwfCKqhLQSRUtjKrrEiGA.text: Date night!  And where shall we go?  Cajun Queen of course.  This restaurant is located in a beautiful, old house on 7th Street.  Initially, we were seated in the very bright back room.  There also happened to be a ladies' holiday party, and, you know how we gals get when we are having fun.  Very loud.   So, we asked to be moved.  We were told that there were no available tables in the other two dining rooms, but there was space on the rooftop patio.  Huh?  We didn't even know such a space existed.  It was an unseasonably warm December night, so here we go, upstairs to absolute delight! The rooftop featured retro Christmas music, holiday lighting and a most splendiferous view.  We ordered a half order of the fried oysters to start.  They arrived crispy, with creamy Ranch dressing.  For our entrees, we both ordered the etouffee, his with crawfish, mine with vegetables.  Both needed a little salt, pepper and hot sauce, but, after a little doctoring up,  they were good.  As an aside, I have had their vegetable etouffee when it needed no adornment.  Awesome stuff.   And now, we shall request the rooftop each time.  Weather permitting.

TDjykrhGTvd2mtPTbr8r6w.text: I travel to Charlotte, NC once a year for business.  This is my one restaurant in Charlotte that I HAVE to go to when I'm there.  I recently was in Mobile, AL the week before I went to Charlotte and had some excellent seafood gumbo, still doesn't compare the Cajun Queen.  I am partial to the Etouffee has great earthy flavors with a great spicy finish.  I would usually get the Chicken with Andouille sausage.  Most recently I went crazy with it going with Chicken, shrimp, andouille, and crawfish, it was phenomenal.  Great atmosphere with live jazz upstairs.  Seating can be a bit cramped, but you can't have it all.  Make sure you get their Key Lime Pie for dessert.

t6KZxjnDpmbHpMSsCnCF2A.text: This place is very cute, located in a converted house.  We had early reservations (5:15 on a Saturday evening) and were promptly greeted and sat when we arrived.  We arrived vie Lyft, so I'm not sure how parking is for the restaurant.  Our waiter did a great job , except for recommending the steak (I should have gone with the chicken). Shortly after being seated we were brought water and warm rolls with butter.  Ordered drinks were delivered quickly.  I asked the waiter for his opinion on the steak vs the chicken (as I'm not a big shellfish person, and many of their dishes are fish or shellfish or vegetarian).  He sold me on the steak.... It was okay, but not great for $30.  The mashed potatoes served with it we're amazing though!  We decided on dessert and went with the Bourbon Pecan Pie..... While the flavor was good...it didn't have nearly enough pecans in it and had way to much of the lighter filling.  My friend thoroughly enjoyed her main dish (crawfish).  This place is definitely worth checking out, especially if you like Cajun food.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Outside of restaurant

rpqlXxcjSlbLiN5zgB-CYw.text: My review remains two stars. Once again, this is NOT based on the food. The food is wonderful! After finally reaching someone about the bogus charge, the response was "It's because you used a debit card and not a credit card." Of course, this does not explain the charge. The manager never acknowledged what was done; even after we did. What the manager went on to state is that "If we'd used a credit card instead, the waitress would've been able to reverse the transaction." However, it was OUR FAULT that we were charged over double what we'd actually ordered because there's a delay in returning funds when a debit card is used. I'm not a fan of that particular customer service experience and feel that an apology was definitely in order. There was no attempt to have us remain customers or to redeem themselves.

rO_uul8-GzstKOUMA7ZBkw.text: Love, love love this place!  Great food and great music.  Valet is a plus!  Great for a romantic date or a group of friends and family.  We will be going back very soo .

q10pWDDVOSZiTuvlWsPj-g.text: I was born and raised in New Orleans.  I have lived in Charlotte for two years and every one tells me I should try Cajun Queen.  I decided to try the New Orleans classic dishes to see if the hype met up to the real thing.    1.  Gumbo - This was not gumbo.  It didn't taste bad, but it was not traditional Gumbo.  Never have I ever seen a gumbo or made gumbo that was like tomatoe soup with no roux.  Gumbo is usually a very dark brown and the roux is made with love because you literally have to stand there and stir for an hour or else it burns. Then you have to start all over if it does burn.  This gumbo was red, red gumbo is wrong.  2.  Red Beans and Rice - The beans were red, and there was rice.  But the flavor was nothing like I ever tasted before.  The only thing I tasted was something sweet like they had a base with wostechire sauce in it.  It lacked depth in flavor you would get from sausage and hamhocks being cooked with it.  The rendered fat from the meat helps thicken the reb beans up, these were watery. This too was missing love. 2$ Popeyes red beans and rice blows this out of the water.    3.  Crawfish Etouffee - This had a dark roux in it, which in New Orleans it's almost always a light roux and red in color 99% of the time.  This was brown and tatsted like the roux was burnt.  It lacked seasoning and flavor.    4. Fried Green Tomatoes - These were awesome. No complaints.   5. Seafood Platter - The batter they use is very similar to stuff I've had at home.  It's a very light cornmeal batter that caked up on the seafood.  They were on point with this so I wasn't completely disappointed.  I did have a nice bartender and he kept my beers coming as I ate.  The service was great and the atmosphere was nice and the decor of the place was very NOLA homey.  They did have a jazz band jamming which was unique for this city.   To sum my review up, if you are from anywhere near or have frequented New Orleans, this place is going to disappoint you if you order any classic cuisines from NOLA. But if you've never been to the Crescent City, you'll probably think this is amazing.  I can see how people would like it if they never had the real dishes to compare it with.  I'll give them an A for effort, C+ for execution.

8gzLOaAqPiANlxio6Nxdjg.text: This was my first time at this place for restaurant week and i wasn't as pleased as I expected to be.   We had the gumbo for the starter. Nice size but it didn't really taste like much. I had to add a lot of salt and pepper.    I had the chicken tortellini and he had the etouffee with shrimp, crawfish and chicken. Mine was pretty good, the chicken was delicious and moist! My boyfriend said his food had no flavor. I tasted it and agreed. He had to add extra salt and pepper also!  For desert I had the bread pudding and he had the key lime pie. He loved his pie, he said it was one of the best he's had. As far as the bread pudding, I wasn't a fan. it has raisins and peaches which was pretty strange to me.   Our server Taylor was really good! Very efficient and on top of things even with all of the commotion!   Nice atmosphere but I don't think i'll be back because the food just didn't cut it for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States

ROwNoNh-H8HsFGyR7kWLGA.text: Went here for a date night and I was thoroughly impressed. Service was prompt and the entire staff was very hospitable. Serving sizes are big enough to fill you up and you probably won't have room for dessert but do yourself a favor and take something to go you'll thank me later. Complimentary valet parking makes up for the lack of parking. Not a place I recommend for the family unless you're the Bobby axlerod type ( sorry I've been hooked on the tv show billions ) but it's great for a romantic evening out.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crawfish scampi

wPwWpDWl4Em46wLLQXsldg.text: NOT my favorite Cajun food I've eaten. I wanted GUMBALAYA, which the waiter INSULTED as not REAL Cajun food AND he said was like the McDonalds of Cajun food. I wasn't mad at that at all because that may ACTUALLY be TRUE. So I ordered something else that wasn't what I wanted. IT WAS MEH.   THE DESSERT was amazing though. OREO CHEESECAKE nom nom.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States

AWdML2dWLzpSm8zLKjL07A.text: This place is just absolutely fabulous. It's perfect for date night, girls night, or just a nice quaint place place to get a nice meal. I took my mother here while she was in town visiting, and she absolutely loved it. The setting is low lighting in an old house. It's so intimate. There's a bar upstairs, I didn't check it out, but when I visits again, I'll be sure to.   The service was amazing, my NY strip steak was cooked to perfection. It came with mashed potatoes and broccoli. I was absolutely in love. My mother had the gumbo, as an appetizer, and the salmon for her entree. It was absolutely amazing. With the meals seasoned to perfection, the charming and the desert is to die for. I'll be sure to check this place out again.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. NY STRIP steak

5DRHqAtF87nLAZbeEUFfQw.text: Came here when I first moved here almost 4 years ago and we weren't that impressed. Fiancee was craving Cajun food, so we decided to give it another shot. Our opinions remain the same - nothing special and a bit pricey. There is a Groupon, but you have to buy it 24 hours in advance of dining there which we did not do.

vL2hyc3EAKfP6JL0nlg8Ow.text: One of my fav. eats in Charlotte! I tried a few dishes from there and it's always spot on!

0pAJETzRDTNPGpZRTU-bPA.text: Nice stop if you are in Charlotte. It is located in a beautiful home with an outdoor eating area on the ground and 2nd floor.   Live jazz music permeates throughout however if you want the full experience ask to be seated on the 2nd floor.  The restaurant was relatively empty when my husband and I went (Thursday @ 2000 hours). Service was great with a very attentive waiter and busboy.  The food was hot and tasty but certainly not the best Cajun food I have had this far. The fried oysters were THE Best I have ever had. It was juicy and oh so tender.  I give this place two thumbs up and I will definitely  return.  FYI- THE 7TH STREET STUMBLER IS TRUE TO ITS NAME.

Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. View from 2nd floor
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States

yncwH-OSx9u1McsXZIQfIw.text: The food was pretty good, ambiance also pretty good. We went here for Valentine's Day, and it was understandably packed. The gumbo tasted a little burnt, and the dessert was cold. I'd like to go try it on a day when it is less packed.

8Oqd0nTJQtY6Izuu9utEBg.text: the food was good. I got the chicken and shrimp Etouffee. my friend also got the bbq shrimp which was delicious. the sauce was awesome.  the service was good overall.  slow start but was satisfied.  I would go back

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and Shrimp Etouffee

5mXg28nmro4bG_H-RERgRw.text: Came here with a good friend for my birthday.  When I pulled up, I was promptly greeted by the valet (complementary) after looking a bit lost.   We made reservations in advance (thank goodness) but still waited quite a bit.  Upon checking in for the reservation, the flustered the hostesses informed us that it may be some time tried to get us to eat at the bar.   Thankfully, we weren't pressed for time so we decided to wait around.  After about 15-20 minutes of waiting (with a reservation) we were hurried to our table.  Thankfully our server was much more pleasant.    We ended up ordering a few beers and our entrees simultaneously due to our exacerbated hunger.  I got the Shrimp Etouffee and she got the Shrimp Diane.  After about a 10 minute wait, our dinner was served.  The food was absolutely delicious.  The seafood was fresh as were all of the ingredients.  It had that characteristic creole seasoning down to a science which I loved.  The consistency was not too thick or too thin but just right and the rice was perfectly cooked.  The only complaint that I have was that the portion size is not traditionally creole at all.  It was much more gourmet--very conservative--with dessert was barely enough to be full.  HOWEVER, it was still worth it.    For dessert, we had the key lime pie which was spot on.  Fresh, bright lime flavor and perfectly creamy consistency with a nice crunch to the crust.    It was a great birthday experience and I look forward coming back here for brunch to try some of their beignets and to experience their jazz nights.

tyUi3pLZQn5pEvIJGECl1Q.text: Went here when visiting from out of town. It happened to be restaurant week and our waiter was nice enough to let us know that after we initially were going to order a bottle of wine. I had gumbo, etouffee, and bread pudding. All we unbelievable. I would highly recommend.

lHvxh_7EyhCI64bvHdrbqw.text: OMGGGGG THIS PLACE WAS AMAZING!!!!!!!!!!! Definitely will go back. Our server wasn't the best and responded to our requests like she didn't want to help. BUT the food made up for it!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Diane with Garlic Mashed Potatoes

WFBqIsAXCSCubo6mR_lWOg.text: Dinner was tasty. We went in on a recommendation that the Cajun Queen had good food and live music. The food is good. The music was ok. I had the blackened chicken and pasta special and my friend had the shrimp and grits: The portions are hefty. We both easily left a full meal behind on our plates. The wine list is nice. We both had a glass of the Silver Palm cab. Our server, Bo, was very helpful with our menu selections as well as tips about the area. Thanks Bo! We enjoyed the meal.

1IzRT4ljWHcrP-YiRciVeA.text: Ok, so the 1st time was incredible! Amazing & authentic! My first thought at least. My 2nd time, they worse than mediocre.   Bread & butter- ok, the meal had been the best part.  Appetizer: Fried Green Tomatoes- Incredible!! So delicious! These are still my favorite here!   My meal: Tortellini & cream sauce plain & comes with a salad that has carrots, cabbage, romaine, cucumber w/ ranch dressing. 1st time - Everything was so yummy!  2nd time - The salad was the best part! They over cooked the pasta where it was mushy.   French Fries- delicious!  Grits- watery and clumpy. Terrible!   Garlic Mashed Potatoes- Dry and had a disgusting smoked or meat flavor to it.  My friend's order: Diane- her absolute favorite. Lick the bowl clean type of good!  Shrimp etoufee- not good! Not the right seasoning, just like hot sauce was dumped into it.
