OYaDGFPcJN7AkwKYg1vLJA.text: This is a really cool place in an old two-story house.  There's a bar upstairs and valet parking.  The smell from the outside is intoxicating.  The menu has a wide variety.  I had the Cajun fried oysters (excellent with Cajun sauce) seafood gumbo (good spice, but ice cold shrimp) and New York strip with crawfish etouffee sauce on top.  The steak was a perfect medium, well seasoned, and accompanied by potatoes and broccoli.  Friends had the creole and chicken etouffee.  Great restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Seafood Gumbo
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. New York Strip with crawfish étouffée sauce.

LOh21_9fDDqa3nVIEmX3rw.text: Never disappointed! I've been a handful of times and always made a reservation. It is very cozy and they cater to my food restrictions. Awesome place!

B2X9pBM-mg8qI3BdF33Ckg.text: My family and I really enjoyed our visit. The atmosphere was perfect for a family gathering. I really like that there was reasonably priced options for the children. I had the Cajun pasta and enjoyed it very much. Service was great. I also like that tip was figured into the bill.

NysbIMKyfQEKz0JH62uLEQ.text: Excellent authentic Cajun menu with great apps. Can't go wrong with the etouffee or shrimp and grits. The live music is 10/10. Great place to take someone while they're visiting Charlotte. It's been around for forever. Reservations and valet parking will make life easier when dining here.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States

duPNAPoytq1yqi4pOq-IAw.text: Fabulous  restaurant...the food is amazing. The mahi mahi special excellent restaurant we go down here every year when we go to North Carolina to visit family

dKgN2O2CoJIejZdxb1vE1g.text: My husband and I decided to go on a day trip to Charlotte to see his mom since she is in town this week. I typically look at YELP for good places to eat. I was craving for some gumbo and I saw that Cajun Queen had some good reviews and I thought we should give it a try.   I ordered Gumbo Diane with crawfish and shrimp. My husband got the shrimp and grits with salad on the side. While his mom got fried tomatoes for appetizer, 8oz filet steak, a cup of gumbo, and banana pudding.  All three of us agreed that the food was delicious. I would highly recommend this place.   The service was good. The facade reminds me of an old historic home, because it is in a converted house. They redesigned the interior and, with a fireplace, it feels warm and inviting. The only downside is the PARKING. We came around 12:30 pm and we had to park behind the restaurant on a side street. However, after 5 pm, there is complementary valet service.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Diane with Crawfish and Shrimp
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. A bit pricey for 3 people. But the food is worth it.
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried tomato

Vf0ESIT9w9am2CgIilGLIA.text: We found the restaurant on a flyer within our hotel! Looked on Yelp, and saw the comment about make a reservation and get a Groupon, so my husband and I did just that. Called at about 6pm and still got a 9:15 reservation. Parking was a bit difficult, but we will know better the next time. However, they do have free valet, we just didn't want it.   Once we got there, we were seated immediately. Tables are close together and you typically have to sit across from your company but that was ok. The waiter came to our table promptly, and we had water and bread in no time. We order and it was delicious! The food was prepared fresh, and cooked perfectly. We ordered the Duck and the Blackened Chicken and Fish! We literally ate every bite down to the sauce. We took home some Bourbon Bread Pudding and that was delicious as well! I suggest this restaurant only to people who love great food!!! Will be going back asap!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blackened Chicken and Fish with Red Beans and Rice!
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Duck, with shrimp, garlic mashed potatoes and mixed vegetables!

ToOE6f5LFOtDfzR4gV8zMg.text: My sons took me here to celebrate my birthday and we enjoyed ourselves!  The service was friendly and prompt.  The atmosphere was laid back and inviting and the food was absolutely DELICIOUS!!! We all ordered different dishes which allowed us to sample various selections.  All three were perfect!  If you're in Charlotte and looking for New Orleans cuisine, this is the place to go!

D4rwIeghkr5--MLvp-AhSQ.text: Second time visiting. I had the Wash Day Blues this time - very good! Almost as good as the Shrimp Creole I had last time - Outstanding! Husband had the Shrimp and Grits both times- obviously it is worthy of a repeat order. Both times we started with the Gumbo - great flavor. Both times finished with the best pecan pie! Make your reservation and go here.

oJUyVegreOWsSkrZFZcrqw.text: I want to like Cajun Queen, because I love New Orleans and everything about it. I want to go somewhere and be reminded of the hospitality and the spectacular food of one of my favorite cities -- but Cajun Queen is not it.  I took my folks out for Sunday brunch. Our reservations were for 11am, which is right when they open. We got there a few minutes early and sat in the parking lot waiting for someone to open the door. As we walked in -- clearly the only patrons there -- we were walked through the quaint dining room with the fireplace and onto the enclosed back porch, all the way in the corner. The only people there, and they put us as far away as they could possibly put us. There was some sort of heating unit on and chugging over one of the windows. It buzzed and whined through our entire meal. Once someone turned on the music, it mostly obstructed the sound, but it came on so abruptly and loudly that the three of us jumped in our seats.   The food was fine. My omelet was dry on the outside and undercooked on the inside. The andouille sausage inside my omelet was gray and sad looking, but the same sausage in my mother's shrimp and grits was brightly colored and appetizing. Did I get the leftovers?   I've been with my parents a handful of times, and they're always pleased, but Cajun Queen just doesn't live up to my standards. The service, food, and prices are all acceptable, but I can't find anything about this restaurant that shines.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and grits
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sausage and green pepper omelet with home fries and fresh fruit

5UphW1RttVZmtMA29uH9Yg.text: Our favorite place in the whole world! BBQ shrimp is a must! The staff is incredible.

ptgT2fq14uOlieaRb8pG2w.text: I think there is something special about a place that has been able to make it through the changing landscape of Charlotte, Elizabeth in particular. This place is a step back in time, you can tell they haven't changed much with the exterior/interior. It's a place you can take your grandparents to (like I did), or go for a date night or with friends. They have a nice beer and cocktail list. I had the BBQ shrimp and absolutely loved the spicy sauce. Let me warn you, it is spicy! Perfect for dipping bread and butter in though. My grandma got the salt and pepper catfish and it was melt in your mouth! Service was excellent as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ shrimp

slmvhyJVu0AhYaZNWVpF3w.text: This place is amazing! I always begin with the fried popcorn- crawfish! Amazing! The fried green tomatoes are a hit as well! All dishes are great. If you don't like spicy- steer clear of the gumbo....I love spicy so it's great-not too tomatoes favor, but a good consistency. My favorite dish is the New Orleans Platter. The pork chop or other platters are great too!

C-l3-rQ5G0CgaaL4ilojsg.text: Always a great time. I've been on several different nights but I really like Sundays. The band does an excellent job, and the food is always terrific. I really enjoy their fried oysters but I always get something different when I am there. Quite enjoyable. My only down would be that they never change the specials. Ever. Doesn't seem very special.

UQ-dOr-Cx4x3I_KNJ_7zXQ.text: Everything about this place was fantastic. The valet, was very nice and considerate. The ambiance was perfect and quaint from the jazz music to the decorative artwork. Our server, Steph, was very sweet and knowledgeable and spot on with her recommendations. I will definitely be visiting this location again.

LmkigZhTBM0VPTw_pLfXxQ.text: Such great food! I have a shellfish allergy so I don't partake in those meals but their salmon is to die for!

hHQzoej2qkfbyNzue3LwYw.text: Love Love Love Cajun Queen. The food is always on point. The service is pretty good as well. My favorite thing here is the Salmon with the Shrimp and ham topping. So so so good. They also have amazing desserts. The one thing I don't like is their choice of rolls. They're way too hard for me. But the food is amazing, atmosphere and service as well! Will always come back.

B8yt0p_zFvpeM7pvWDbz_w.text: Loved this place. My hubby and I had our first date here, anniversary here, and got engaged here. The food is so good and the customer service is wonderful! My family and I have enjoyed the ambiance and the band. We appreciate the consistency in the food and even the valet services.

7q3ApIb-1v94S1xjtlnStA.text: The food is absolutely delicious, however my concern is the customer service that I experienced tonight from the manager on duty, Tim.  I'm fairly new to this area and had no clue what this "restaurant week" deal is. The waiter explained it , however I ordered from the regular menu. When it came time for the bill- I presents coupon that was given as a gift only to be told I couldn't use it because of this event. When I asked to talk to the manager-Tim came to my table and completely berated me, asking if I knew how to read since there were signs all over the place about this restaurant week event.  He told me that there was nothing he was willing to do even though I didn't have a clue what he was talking about regarding this event- nor did I participate in it! He was probably the most disgusting acting human being I've encountered and I hope that he is not the representative for this very nice restaurant.

04NHfGDabZtsTVLi4LYPkg.text: food was really great. went here to meet an old friend several months ago and the atmosphere matched the food as well as it matched the service.

xRByLSnU3FB-xdfCroiS4w.text: Hands down best Cajun food in Charlotte. I got the Diane all 3 and my fiancee the Etoufee all 3. Both were so good we swapped halfway into the meal. Drinks were good and our server was amazing! Will definelty be frequenting this place.

t97A54fjftKQ3PKg_wzUrg.text: You can have a bit of a wait on the weekends even if you book a reservation but it's usually not very long. I have been there twice and I always buy a Groupon beforehand.  Overall the food is very good. The band is a nice added touch and the drinks are yummy as well.

bkCBn4GDBY3g92mXX1K37A.text: One oft favorite joints in Charlotte. Between the jazz band, etoufee, and shrimp& grits this place takes the cake.

OyhMj1P8JOADde1GscTMyA.text: Excellent!  Had the Diane with chicken and shrimp.  Generous portion - took some home.  Look forward to returning to try other entrees.

lHuUeMt-XaZZ4F0-bZj1Yw.text: I went to college in New Orleans, and so I think I am fairly qualified to judge cajun food.  That being said, the food here was not all that great.  The fried dishes I tried, including fried green tomatoes and some fried seafood, were delicious and accompanied by great sauces.  The typical Nola food didn't fair as well.  The gumbo was heavy on the tomato, and poorly seasoned, and the red beans and rice was virtually flavor-free.  I enjoyed eating here, but I wouldn't return for cajun food (I would return for the fried food, it was delish).  I might have been more forgiving with the food if it hadn't been so expensive (about $20 per person).  Oh, and the tea was instant or nestea or something.

v0tBd5L4EPIHjmslEPryaQ.text: Awesome, delicious food!  My favorite place to eat when I have the money.  Love the cajun popcorn and the dinner specials.  If they ever have the mahi-mahi as a special, get that! So good, I wanted to cry! Also ask your server about the ghost.  I heard some cool stories!

4XtmsCaUDIAbRWupglDghg.text: I used to go to this restaurant quite often several years ago when I lived here in Charlotte. The service was always great, the food was delicious, and the atmosphere and music were very enjoyable. Needless to say, my expectation level was high. The complimentary valet is a plus as it used to be a nightmare to park there. The hostesses weren't very friendly nor was the front of the house manager when we walked in. We were taken to our tiny table shoved up against the wall. Our two top was VERY close to a 5 top with barely any room to move. Our waiter came over pointed to the restaurant week menu and walked off. I should have foreseen then how the evening was going to go. The waiter finally came back and abruptly took our drink order. He brings my wine and walks away without saying a word and then comes back 5 minutes later with my husband's wine. We ordered the exact same thing so why it took so long for the other glass is beyond me. The waiter comes over and rudely asks what do you want! I ordered the Caesar salad which was straight out of a bag with dried out lettuce and croutons hard enough to break a tooth. My husband got the gumbo and thought it was good. I ordered the etouffee with shrimp and crayfish as my entree and my husband ordered the shrimp and grits. The sauce was tasty and not to spicy. There were probably 5 tiny overcooked shrimp pieces , 10 tiny crayfish pieces, and a plate full of rice. The rice overpowered the entire dish. The shrimp and grits had very well done shrimp and bland grits. A guy came over and removed my wine glass without asking if I was finished or if I would like another glass. Our waiter never once checked on us while we were eating to see if we needed anything or how our dinner was. After someone else clears our plates without asking, our waiter comes over and says he guesses we are ready for dessert so what did we want. He brought the desserts out and let's say they didn't look very appetizing. The bread pudding did not look appealing but it tasted ok. The key lime pie crust was greasy and awful tasting. The filling itself was ok but didn't have much of a key lime taste to it. The waiter brings over our check and lays it on my husband's napkin and walks off. We hadn't asked for the check yet and he surely didn't ask if we wanted anything else before he dropped it off. We are excellent tippers as I used to wait tables myself and my husband worked in the restaurant industry. Our waiter did not deserve a tip of any kind other than to find another industry to work in as food service is not for him. We felt rushed the entire time and we were in and out of the restaurant in less than an hour. The area we sat in had 6 tables total and all but 1 of those tables was still occupied with people that were not eating or drinking when we left. They had already finished their dinner and drinks and a couple tables even had their to go boxes on the table. We were looking for a nice, relaxed dinner and that certainly didn't happen. We don't plan on returning that is for sure. We received better service from the valet attendant than we did in the restaurant itself. The guy ran over and got our car right away because he said he didn't want me to stand out in the cold for to long. He was very kind and considerate and was well tipped. There are so many great restaurants in Charlotte but unfortunately this is no longer one of them!

p3qvEn2D0yKGZtFpypm4qw.text: By far the best restaurant in charlotte. When you first pull up you see a huge old Victorian style "home" and are greeted at the front door. We were sat on the second floor in front of the live jazz band. The ambience was exciting and alive, especially for a Tuesday night. We ordered the fried oysters as an appetizer and they serve it with a home made "tartar sauce" which has the consistency of an aioli and is absolutely life changinf. some of the best fried oysters I have ever had... Actually, THE best fried oysters I have ever had. And the tarter sauce makes them even better.  For my main course I ordered the Diane, with chicken, andouille sausage and crawfish. Let me just say that the chicken is so buttery and tender, they have you 2 large chicken breast cutlets over a bed of rice with a delicious lightly creamy mushroom sauce. Now, this isn't my first time at Cajun queen and I can honestly say I have NEVER had a bad experience. The Diane is wonderfully satisfying to your pallete. Another meal I would say is delicious is the pork tenderloin. Luckily, they serve such large portions that I have leftovers for at least two more meals. Cajun queen has become a staple in my house and anytime someone comes to visit we have to take them there. I highly highly recommend it.

axBLuKeF4EwnGmrvSI3HGA.text: This place is great! The setting is wonderful-- the restaurant is in a nice, big colorful house and its filled with lots of vibrant paintings--one of the rooms even has a fireplace which adds a lot of character.  The food is also very solid--lots of New Orleans specialties served by a very friendly staff. I had the blackened catfish which was very good and came with some nice steamed broccoli and yummy mashed potatoes. I also tried the fried oysters and the gumbo which were also both very tasty. Also, another highlight was the bread which came warm and fresh.  Would definitely recommend this place for a Nawlins meal in a fun, warm setting.

48i92i14UHb8vufIBhDO6Q.text: This has got to be the most overrated restaurant in Charlotte. I've been 3 times and I have never been impressed.  But this last time was horrible. This is the McDonald's of Cajun cuisine. Every dish we had was completely flavorless. Fortunately it was only half price because of the Groupon that I used. And even at half off it was overpriced relative the to the exceptionally low quality of the food. I'll never go back.

I98aR821LppxDX3laHen1g.text: This was my favorite joint in the CLT.  I have never been to New Orleans, and because of Katrina, I probably  won't for awhile, but I imagine that this is a pretty good joint even by looziana standards.  I always get the blackened platter with chicken and the fish special with one of their rotating toppings, usually  one with crawfish and corn and a side of gumbo.  MMMMMMMMMM

1sEjBZgIUdrweI8-oNgveQ.text: I'm a huge fan of the seafood gumbo and the crawfish creole. When we weren't able to spare the time to have a sit down dinner, I would sometimes have the limousine drive me here just to pick up dinner. Sigh, if only it delivered...

jHbpNsAH_7Ck4PzqHBNtfQ.text: We had a super tasty authentic cajun meal. We started off with the fried green tomatoes that were perfectly fried in a light crisp batter. We also enjoyed a refreshing Hurricane, because how can you not? I ordered the Chicken Diane, my Honey had the Crawfish Etouffee. My dish could have easily fed us both. Both dishes were busting with flavor, and had a little heat. The rice was cooked perfectly, and so were the chicken and crawfish...which is not always easy. We ended the meal with a slice of the pecan pie that was a sweet ending to a lovely meal. The Queen was clean, full of character, and had a very nice and attentive wait staff (our waters were always full). The presentation of the food was great, and the flavors were amazing. I am looking forward to our next visit!  We sat upstairs in the room with the band, who was excellent. I will say, the music is a bit loud to enjoy dinner conversation, but that's what breaks are for, right?

x1Yb6bkkwppVMcPSs0NaUw.text: I went last Friday to celebrate my 5 year wedding anniversary. Our 2 year old daughter was with us as well. The place was alot busier than I was expecting. It was such an exciting atmosphere. We loved it! My daughter said to us "wow, were at a party". The music band plays upstairs and that is where we were seated. We had a short wait around 10 minutes and the manager seated us right in front of the band as if he read my mind. That is exactly where we wanted to sit. I'm not a fan of spicy food and the waiter recommended instead of blackened, I can order the fish or chicken to be grilled and it was amazing. The popcorn crawfish was excellent. Beers were $3, $4 The whole experience was great, fun and we spent only $80 including the tip. I had spent more than double that at Villa Antonio a few months back for my wife's 30th bday and did not have as nice of a time. I would definitely go back and recommend to anyone wanting to have more than just your average dinner at applebees :)

YcCEIDXG-VTVrEXaONlJ8Q.text: havent been there since i was a kid with my parents and after last night i will not go back. who's ever heard of bland cajun food, well somehow they pulled it off. i can make far better cajun food that at least has taste. the gumbo was terrible and the grits from the shrimp and grits were even worse, thank goodness they had habanero sauce to add some taste to this miserably bland dish. they did have dixie lager and dixIes blackened voodoo lager which is the only reason theyre not getting one star. the bartender was not pleasant either she obviously did not want to be there and it showed, when there are only 3 people in front of you, you should keep their water glasses full and beers a-comin' .  the band was nice and the place itself is nice but im never going back, hotel charlotte, danny's too and especially boudreaux's are all much better with regards to cajun creole cuisine

wpXzD2xIDK629qUh5JHqLQ.text: Doesn't get much better... great cajun food, great staff, fun locale, and voodoo beer. Throw in some live music and it makes a fun summer night dinner! Been around forever... that should tell you something!

qJDUley9Xzz-esE9-54WIw.text: I do not know how this place and Boudreaux's has the same rate. Being a native New Orleanian I am spoiled by my roots. Cajun Queen is as close as it gets to the real deal. The only thing I just do not care for, but just my personal preference is the gumbo, tomatoe-based, so I am just not a fan. The brunch is amazing, and surprisingly I love the pork dish with bananas, yummo

ML6cAwwgjBPMgo1js93wJA.text: Easy to get reservations, prompt service, and DELICIOUS food!  I had the crayfish etoufee - rich and yummy.  Others had the chicken creole, shrimp & grits, & fried shrimp.  All reported yummy!  Nice atmosphere, too.  Took a kiddo (18mo.) and it was fine for her.  I will definitely be back.

leK8pCyQxuIH0yza6SU6qw.text: Authentic New Orleans flavor and great family atmosphere.  Not pricey, and the portions are huge.  The fish is fresh, and the service is friendly.  Live music some nights.

XA8s3AwZXbB30cN1Os4C9Q.text: We were looking forward to eating at Cajun Queen. We had heard good things about it. We had a reservation. Upon arrival, we did not feel welcome. We were seated very close to the entrance. It was noisy and dark. The waiter seemed very busy and did not have much time for us. We were unimpressed by the food: there was nothing special. We used to eat at "Yats" and "Gumbo a Go Go" while living in Indiana and those 2 cajun/creole restaurants were a lot cheaper and the food was a lot better. We felt going to Cajun Queen was a complete waste of our time and money.

DKTgbf-VL6DjRMY03scONA.text: Right off the one thing that I want to mention about the Cajun Queen when we ate there this past weekend was the Jazz band that was playing.....the band was great :)  We ordered the crawfish scampi for an appetizer.  It was tasty, but a little on the salty side for me.  We also ordered the gumbo and it was not that great.  Eehhhh....definitely can skip that....  For the main dish,  I had the crawfish etouffee and it did not disappoint as well the yummy key lime pie.  It was good and I would probably go back.

s-88lG3C3U3pz8VsdrRAqg.text: We waited an hour and a half on a Saturday night for a table.  Bar area super crowded with one bartender and the speaker system screaming out reservation last names every few minutes at deafening decibels. No place to sit--and tarot card reader girl took up a whole table in the bar. Mediocre wine by the glass and only four rubbery shrimp (although the sauce was great--but we had to ask for bread after they brought the dish )in the $9 BBQ shrimp appetizer.  Finally seated in the room with music (which we requested and they honored) and the music was very average and too loud. We asked for water with no ice and the waiter actually rolled his eyes at us.  5 minutes later the waitress came and asked what we wanted with her order pad out, and we said, "menus". She finally brought some for us and the table next to us and left.  Another waitress came by and we asked if there was any way to turn the air-conditioning down since it was blowing directly on us, and she walked away without saying anything. First waitress came back and took the order of the table next to us which was seated after us and walked away without taking our order.  We had to call someone over to say we wanted to order.  They found our waitress and conveyed our request to her, and we saw her roll her eyes too. So, we decided to leave without eating since the charm of the Cajun Queen had long since left before we got there.....hard to park, noisy, and apathetic service.  Next Saturday, we are saying bye to the bayou by staying away from 7th Ave......

o6pEKIP_jC973oHdm07cYw.text: After hearing rave reviews of this restaurant, I was really looking forward to eating here.  Some things were very good and others were not.  For appetizers, our group ordered the Fried Green Tomatoes and the BBQ Shrimp, which were both delicious.  The BBQ shrimp is probably what they are best known for and it is the best thing we ate all night.  It is quite spicy though so, if heat in what you eat isn't your thing, you will want to skip this dish!  I have tried Fried Green Tomatoes several times at other restaurants and just hadn't found any that I liked.  These were absolutely delicious though and I highly recommend them!  For my entree, I ordered the shrimp and grits.  I am a huge fan of grits and cook them often at home.  I prefer grits to be creamy.  These were more watery and it seemed like they were cooked in chicken broth.  They were also not quite done enough to my liking.  The shrimp and sausage included with the grits were both dry and I just didn't care for this dish at all. For dessert, I ordered pecan pie and my husband got the bourbon bread pudding.  His was MUCH better.  The pecan pie was lacking something in the flavor department where the bread pudding just hit the mark on every level.  Overall, I would go back here again but would stick to the tomatoes and the bbq shrimp!

117EUxM3iGpUpGy--8besQ.text: The bar/patio is crowded and drinks are good, but the seafood is just not fresh enough. The etouffee wasn't spicy, and a friend's fried fish was that mushy consistency of something that's been frozen too long. I was with a party of 11 and no one was particularly pleased with the food or the wait time. The best part of the experience was the wonderful jazz group that performed in the crowded dining room with verve and style.

tGyWYtoHen5XJLzH3S8Frg.text: In no way do I feel like I'm a New Orleans style food expert, but I have been to a few restaurants in the past with similar style food, and I have to say, Cajun Queen is pretty much amazing!  I bought a Groupon for this place on a whim- and it was about to expire so I rounded up a friend and headed over there to treat him for a night out.    I have a favorite meal from a restaurant at home that they call Louisiana Shrimp and Scallops- and it is JUST like the "Diane."  The sauce that it is in is DELICIOUS!  A little bit of kick, I asked for it extra spicy.  I had it with all three proteins- chicken, shrimp and crawfish.  It was excellent!!!  I can't wait to go back and get it again.  My friend got blackened Cat fish.  It was good.....pretty similar to most blackened food....not exactly signature like I would compare my dish to!  His meal came with a salad or soup, mine did not.  They started our meal with rolls and butter.....I wish I got to try the bread and oil dip that I saw a few other people wrote about!  THe price point was close to $20 per person.  I do believe it's priced parallel to the meal, but I would save it for a slighty more special occasion.  I did not get to see a lot of the building- we were seated downstairs to the right in a section that was a bit less intimate and was kind of patio-like.  The other dining area downstairs did look a bit fancier and we never went upstairs, which sounded like it was the bar area.  All in all, it was a great meal and great spot!

vlfUNawKHggh2ku8-LVnUA.text: Best of the best...Great food tasty drinks the jazz trio band upstairs thumbs up....My favorite dish Salt and pepper catfish this dish is to die for....cooked just right I highly recommend.

CkrpxnK5yX0bvihm26BbnA.text: Cajun Queen wasn't awful, but it wasn't great either. If you've been to New Orleans and sampled the fare, then you will be disappointed with the cuisine. While not on par with New Orleans, it's not without charm. Still, not the Big Easy.   For scale: 1- ingesting Old Bay seasoning,  2 - a box of Zatarain's, 4 - Cajun Queen,  10 - New Orleans.  The service was great, but we could tell our waitress was overworked even with the servers assistants refilling waters and removing finished plates.   Everything arrived lukewarm; gumbo, the "all 3" (crawfish, shrimp, and chicken) etouffee, and even the broccoli side. And although the etouffee cautioned, "Spicy!," it was tame.   One winning aspect was the Sazerac cocktail, and New Orleans beer on the menu (Abita).   We'd go again for drinks.

jrhCGbljTMY4qJgCO5H7Dg.text: My family goes here every year on my mom's birthday. Every time it's the same: excellent food, excellent service, excellent atmosphere. Keep up the good work Cajun Queen!

87VfWeDkyUwBWdFQNY3GaQ.text: Me and my friend went here for her birthday weekend and it was great. I was a little hesitant because I'm not real big on spicy/cajun food, but surprisingly I enjoyed everything about this place. The place is a house turned into a restaurant and has that cool New Orleans french quarter feel.   The fried pickles are AMAZING!! The Diamond watch out!! I had the blackened catfish with mashed potatoes and it was delicious. I was shocked that I had two pieces of fish as well which was even better. My friend had etouffee and she enjoyed her meal as well. I will definitely be back here again for some more yummy spices!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blackened Catfish

ES8xyP-TFRmsmUxqSFAEZw.text: While visiting the Queen City, I stopped by with my cousin and one of my best friends who happen to live there. Upon arrival I was quite smitten because the place is housed in an old house that has been converted into a restaurant. It was cute and quaint with lots of photos and paintings of New Orleans scenery. We were seated upstairs in what was probably the old master bedroom with the band. The service was good, the young woman was friendly and very helpful.  For appetizers we ordered fried crawfish and gumbo. Both were okay, nothing to write home about. I chose the etouffee with everything for an entree, along with a side of red beans and rice. My cousin ordered the New Orleans Platter, while my friend had the Diane. Both of my companions thoroughly enjoyed their meals and could not stop singing the praises. Again I thought my etoufee was just okay. I have had much better. I did, however, really enjoy the red rice and beans and thought to myself that maybe I should have just ordered that with some bbq shrimp and called it a day.   Would I visit them again? Of course, I always give everything two chances. :)

AFhEPMfS96pwkqIYKrp5vg.text: Best of the Best!   The Fried Oysters are to die for, and is always fried perfectly. The Shrimp & Crawfish Diane is AWESOME! The BBQ Shrimp w/ the bread is Out Of Bounds. They also have great cocktails, and a band of old guys playing some jazz on stage. The balcony is a nice place to sit.... You cannot go wrong at this place, It's A Must Visit!

0dcJXQ5cqBu35ckP1hCyNw.text: We had always loved the food at Cajun Queen, but it had been years since we went there.  It was my husband's birthday and I had a Living Social coupon so we decided it was definitely time again.  It was restaurant week also.  We ended up getting one of the restaurant week specials and it was fantastic.  I usually don't like to go during this time because, in my experience, this week has not given me a good representation of the restaurant.  Not so here....the food was excellent and plentiful, and our waiter, Taylor couldn't have been better!  This dining experience made me realize I shouldn't wait so long to come back here!

hWRnpBI-N7AVCuuXnFEyPQ.text: Excellent food, impeccable service as always. One of our favorite places. We took friends for their first time and they raved about it. Said it was rhe best restaurant they'd been to in Charlotte!

Kz_19g8PDqERBXMfZsKTnQ.text: Tasty Entree..  First visit to the restaurant. I will most definitely be back!! The gumbo was just ok.. lack of seasoning however my entree was excellent. I had blackened chicken with andouille sausage over tortellini in a cream based sauce!!! Yummy

EtR1cJ701G8RoIBQvB1VkA.text: So GOOD! My boss is from Charlotte and he told me I had to come here on my vacation. I did and I loved it! I ordered the Diane with everything and omg it was spectacular...   The bartenders and waitresses were very friendly and resourceful although the hostess needs to check her attitude. either way, I didn't mind because I'm still daydreaming about that food! Nom city!

nfwVbXKAgU8YBpz9zTQdTg.text: Great cajun creole. Lovely wait staff. My family and I are definitely coming back soon.

nCtz9WfJYu44vlw0fAr2Ew.text: I've heard a lot of great reviews about this restaurant. Sad to say it was only mediocre to me. I ordered the seafood gumbo bowl which taste as if it came out of a can, which was very unpleasant. My friend ordered the barbecue shrimp as an appetizer which I tasted and it was great!!! For my entree, I ordered the shrimp creole and I enjoyed it but it wasn't anything fantastic. I'm not sure if I would go back again but the scenery is nice and the waitstaff was very nice and engaging.

hlKW2CxL0IYqlQai8d6zlw.text: This place is great!  The atmosphere is like a southern home in Louisiana.  The food was delicious; however, I give it four stars because our waiter wasn't the best.  I went with 2 of my friends (we're all under 30) and they didn't serve us the way he served the people beside us.  We first ordered the gumbo, which wasn't bad.  It wasn't as tasteful that I thought it would be.  However, using our bread with the gumbo, made it so much better.  The bread soaked up the gumbo and gave it a little bit of a buttery taste.  As for my entree, I ordered the etouffee four ways.  On the menu, it list three ways, but u can get four ways (which includes andouille sausage).  My friend ordered the shrimp etouffee.   As close friends do, we tasted the other and we both found mine to be better because the andouille sausage gave it a little bit of a sweeter taste that mixes well with the spices.  I'd recommend this place!  FYI:  There's sometimes groupons that make it a cheap place to eat! Keep a look out!

cFvC-6Hjn2O3eFxMS9EW9w.text: My husband and I visited Cajun Queen on Valentine's Day and we had great service and great food. We will return again.

8WhX_F--GpmUh7n9M83cmw.text: Awesome Bbq shrimp appetizer! Shrimp and grits with sausage was ol so good! Coming from new Orleans this restaurant was great with a flavor of a nice jazz performance from the 7th street gator band!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and grits
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. 3 meat Diane

lRBXUKCB7sSPYM6avzlAfQ.text: Try to eat here when schedule permits when in town for the race.  Had the blackened catfish for dinner as well as bbq shrimp appetizer and fried green tomatoes. Fish was plentiful and not overly spicy. Fried green tomatoes were the appetizer hit for the table.  Other dishes included salt and pepper catfish and bbq pork chop. Dessert included bread pudding and keylime pie.  Overall, another solid performance and prices are reasonable. Probably 4.5 stars.

cDYhEZhQgdkbQK0R-NCzzQ.text: While parking can be scarce, the food, atmosphere and service easily make up for any trouble. The fried oysters are amazing! The Frieda Rita is my favorite margarita. And the Diane, etoufee, and creole are my favorite menu options. One of my top 5 favorite restaurants in Charlotte!

CQ0xzU2sV7-mbRMxVyM32w.text: I only hear great reviews for this restaurant. So I knew it was time to go when I saw there was a Groupon. They offer free valet which makes it a lot easier since I had no clue where to park and they will tow your car if you  park else where. The manager immediately opens the door for us as we approach and we got seated right away. We did make reservations in advance though. I was shocked to see a live band playing on a Wednesday night but apparently they are there 7 days a week! I enjoyed the live music and fireplace that adds on the ambiance. Our server was okay, he gave us bread and provided enough time for us to look through our menu. We decided to go with the Etouffee and Diane. Both had chicken, shrimp and crawfish. I liked the Etouffee but man... I miss the Diane already. I've been starring hard at the Cajun Queen groupon again because I'm already carving for another dish. My boyfriend just recently told me they are $4 cheaper if you get the voucher on living social. You won't be disappointed if you're looking for a new restaurant to try in Charlotte. We can't wait to come back.

_JzYJaagLzQ21n6AxQPoYA.text: When you're running out of date night locations and your significant other is getting tired of Domino's cheap weekday carryout deals, it's time to treat her to a fancy restaurant. Preferably one that constantly offers $20 for $40 online coupon deals like Cajun Queen does.  The location is very nice - it looks like a converted home with outdoor patio seating and an enclosed back porch for when the weather is nice. There's live music most nights and a bar upstairs if you just want to sit and enjoy a cocktail or two while you wait for a table.  The food was excellent - we got the Cajun BBQ shrimp as an appetizer and couldn't stop raving about it. Save your dinner rolls to mop up the delicious juice! Ask for another basket when they drop the shrimp off! We ordered gumbo too just to splurge but it seemed bland in comparison to that excellent BBQ shrimp juice.  I always feel bad waiting sitting through a waiter's shpeel about the daily specials and not ordering one so I ordered a steak special and my lady got chicken Diane. The steak was cooked medium rare as requested with craw fish etoufee and hearty mash potatoes riding shotgun. The chicken Diane's gravy was rich, flavorful and tasted fantastic. The portion sizes were enough to feel full and take enough home for meals the next day.  The service was excellent as well - our server was very personable and friendly. He make jokes, answered our questions about the menu, and never kept us waiting long when we needed something.   The entrees at Cajun Queen are around the $20 range which makes it really easy to blow your Groupon for a date night. In addition, there's a $5 charge for splitting an entree. I'll definitely be buying another coupon for Cajun Queen. The prices are a little beyond making it a regular spot (even with a coupon) but it's perfect for a memorable date night.

f_tMv1qrdzF3dbrLN4X_2g.text: Got the crawfish ettuofe.  It was the best Cajun food I have ever had. Absolutely fantastic. Spicy and extremely flavorful. A must go for any traveler.

6k15YSIsRJ_WZaj_xt7x4Q.text: I don't think I've ever gone here without a Groupon. I always get the Chicken Diane. There is usually a 3-piece jazz band playing upstairs when it starts getting dark.

gxmIVACfWQ6gL3VHWFWUMA.text: Love this place. I always order the blackened catfish with the shrimp topping in sauce. Stupendous!!! The Oreo cheesecake is mouth watering goodness!! I especially like sitting upstairs near the band after 6 pm!! My 4 year old needs entertainment at restaurants and he loves it!!

616godRT6YfnVD6gIfhZBQ.text: My fiance and I spent our anniversary in New Orleans. Fell in love with thefood. Always trying to track down good Cajun. Prices are up there but the seasoning and flavors brought me back down to the french quarter. There was a woops on the doneness off the steak quickly fixed and removed from the bill. Only thing I could ask for is boudan.

58PwlQVVZIAwu0hrAadMtA.text: Mmmmm, great ambiance, band and food.  We especially loved the BBQ shrimp. Our server told us we had to order and then brought out extra bed to mop up the amazing sauce. Will go again and again!

hef0obtj0qoNxby0RSE7YQ.text: Food good, manager was very much lacking in people skills and customer service. Will not be back. Too many places in CLT where you can get both

lNjS-CqnEJNSp0F5hfbiEw.text: This is hands down my favorite restaurant in Charlotte. I've tried almost everything and have never once been disappointed. Great staff and even better environment. Nothing beats Cajun Queen!!

yyQOnBHHeRzAXYkrKA9vRA.text: My wife and I always have a wonderful time at the Queen.  This time we took a friend of mine from Indy out for dinner and as usual the meal and sevice shined.

RADIlnEVIgxS9hts2Jdnvg.text: Beautiful old house.  Classic and well presented NOLA type favorites.  Great drinks.  Do not miss the music upstairs and the deck.  Made the trip a vacation.

t4NvEQZh1IIfDQH3Yb08ig.text: I went to cajun queen with some friends from work a while back. I had the Diane, which people seem to be raving about on yelp. It was okay. I found the favors to be very mild and uninteresting; there was no spicier or complexity to the meal. The live music was nice but makes me wonder if this place would be appropriate for a quiet, romantic dinner. I will probably give cajun queen another try just in case it was an off night.

F81VR_G9u1MyeZbiGTHw4Q.text: We eat at the Cajun Queen regularly...there are always Groupons!  My dad is from Louisiana so he knows his cajun/creole food, and this place has fantastic food.  Amazing atmosphere!!  One of my favorite restaurants ever.

sGgCyEbTMWJYvM5Ez8YkYA.text: Had a groupon, so wasn't sure how this was going to go. Walked in on Sunday night and got pleasantly surprised with a live jazz band. The tables upstairs are very close together, but add to the close feel of the place! We ordered the gumbo to start, nice big shrimp and okra in it! Dip the bread in it, add a little hot sauce and you are set!  We split the blackened Mahi and chicken, wow! Fantastic blackened flavors, yet not charred! Flavors exploded in your mouth! Red beans and rice on the side were good also! Had to over indulge and order the pecan pie also. Came warm, way too sweet but delicious crust! Overall a fantastic date dinner!

RrgPm_4kBgtRfh-2uHqe7Q.text: Albeit they were a little slow in getting us to our table despite a reservation, the quality of the food and the service made up for the late start.  An appetizer of Barbecued Shrimp kicked off the evening awaking the taste buds and preparing them for the main course.   Of course you cannot let the waiter take any of the broth way from the table remaining from the BBQ shrimp.  That would just be wrong. My wife had the crawfish Diane, a delightful dish with ample spices, but not too much, lots of crawfish and fresh mushrooms. I had the New Orleans platter offering fried catfish, oyster, scallops and shrimp along with red beans and dirty rice. The scallops were huge, the catfish cooked and seasoned to perfection and well everything was just great. Our only negative to post is the noise level in the restaurant. It is very difficult to have a conversation at a table without staining your voice. The beer, wine and mixed drink selections were good although they were out of fresh mint so no mojitos that evening.  I recommend trying the place on a week night when It may not be so crowded and noises. You won't go wrong with the food.

q0mJhJewL64GdiwDmAGgYw.text: My husband and I always have a good time, good meals, and good drinks when we go to the Cajun Queen!  Love the Jazz and make sure we sit near the stage!  Just celebrated my birthday there in January...superb meal and service!  Yay!

ZDylbFH9HG1xVKs0a08d_w.text: This place is pretty good.  Cajun food is my favorite, so I'm a pretty harsh critic when it comes down to it.   I started off with a BBQ shrimp appetizer, which had a great flavor, but the shrimp was a bit overcooked.  I also got a cup of gumbo, which I was very unimpressed with. Something was off with the flavor. Maybe I caught a bad batch of it, but I won't be ordering that again.    For my dinner I had the etouffee trio with crawfish, chicken, and shrimp.  The chicken was amazing.  Perhaps the best I have ever had.  It was very tender and the flavor was awesome.  The shrimp and crawfish were pretty darn good too.  I also tried some of the blackened catfish, which was cooked perfectly, but the seasoning on it was nothing special.  Luckily they had two of my favorite beers to wash it down with, Abita Golden and Purple Haze.    I like how the restaurant is laid out.  It has a nice ambiance to it, and looks great both inside and out.  The prices are a little expensive, but you do get a good amount of food, so I would say overall it's worth it.  If I had the option, I would have given it a 4.5 / 5 rating, but they definitely have some things to improve upon if they want to reach 5/5.

fJbzdc5ekP7MeBzeYFUXWg.text: I have known about this place for a while, they always have the best Cajun food in the area for a good price.

9NKYrcZzplDZjjzFlBko0g.text: Absolutely delicious. The fried green tomato app was my favorite! The salad starter wasn't anything special, definitely get the gumbo. Can't wait to go back.

Q6wne_zeTvMb9PMIjRJr5A.text: Good cajun restaurant in Charlotte.  The fried oysters are out of this world!

BRjL0hg18hnJ5FBQ-UUj8Q.text: Cajun Queen is great for Charlotte but it's not the best cajun/creole I've had.  In my opinion, their food is good but leave's something to be desired if you've had great cajun/creole food. The apps here are good and the etouffee is alright.  Definitely make reservations when you come, as they only serve dinner (brunch on Sundays) and always have a crowd. They have "complimentary" valet service, and I would definitely recommend using it since they don't have an assigned lot. The live band is great and the service is very attentive. Solid restaurant if you want something different from the norm in the QC.

lDKjrOMzQWRzcwxTukd0dg.text: The fried oysters appetizer is super yummy as is the Diane with rice, shrimp and crawfish. Great atmosphere. Made reservations and were good to go as soon as we arrived, which has always been the case when I've made reservations here. Highly recommend it !

8G9gezE-oh1WrAC4fiH-mQ.text: The good was good. We started with the Wash Day Blues, which was excellent!  The gumbo was a disappointment. I'm not sure if they ran out and had to make another batch real quick. The veggies were on the crunchy side which was surprising. We had the duck breast and the shrink and grits for our entrees. Both were quiet tasty.

kGfrkl0T7lB1UscRmc8EBQ.text: You know, I contemplated giving Cajun Queen 5 stars but it just doesn't hold up to some of the best meals of my life in New Orleans.  I don't know if that's even fair, considering I grew up in Pensacola - 2 hrs outside NOLA - and Cajun Queen is better than any place there.  I also lived in Texas - another border state - and never found anything at NOLA's level.  Cajun Queen is a classy spot without being too expensive, and has a few items I really like.    The complimentary french bread with olive oil and herbs is better than you'd expect.  Take this tip - get the "New Orleans B.B.Q. Shrimp" as an appetizer.  The bread is phenomenal dipped in the shrimp sauce.  As far as entrees are concerned I recommend the crawfish etouffee, creole chicken, or the blackened ribeye.

iE8AihppfxbjyMWAZn0pTg.text: I came  to charolette on 11/ 20 for my birthday weekend. My  friend made reservations for us to come to this restaurant. When you walk in, it looks like a house that was converted into a restaraunt which was awesome!  It definitely has a new orleans feel. We ordered drinks & appetizers. The  waiter also gave us a side of red beans and rice. I had a hurricane and fried green tomatoes. For my entree,  I ordered fried catfish,  steamed broccoli and coleslaw and it was amazing!! The catfish filets were huge and plentiful! The  prices are very reasonable for the amount of food you get. The fish was seasoned and fried to perfection. The service, and ambience was amazing! My friend & I were celebrating our birthday,  the waiter gave us both a piece of pie of our choice on the house.  If your looking for a Cajun restaraunt, with a new orleans feel, please go to Cajun Queen you won't be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States

NT0bYGdzSXh96WzOLKa_ng.text: The food was very good. The service was fast and our server was very friendly. I really liked the live jazz band that was playing upstairs it helped with the authentic New Orleans feel. The complimentary valet was a nice touch. We will definitely come back to the Cajun Queen in the near future.

rJA-Dp24OP2rGj9WS5tYrg.text: Wanted to give this place 3 stars, but the waitress was weird.  The bill hadn't even arrived and my date offered to pay by handing the waitress her credit card.  Being old-fashioned, I wanted to pay for dinner.  The waitress was adamant on charging dinner to whoever was the first person to give a card.  I tried in vain, but she refused which was perplexing.  It might get difficult with diners trying to make the waitress take their payment, but they have to deal with it.  Feel it out, be a little patient if need be.  Part of being a good server is being able to adjust and stuff.  Food was average - nothing special.  Three stars because the ambiance is just astounding - live jazz music and restaurant is a house, literally.  dmo out

TnyBkEC_QeZqdplJaPIK0Q.text: The food and portions were great!  In fact,  a wonderful evening out with my husband during restaurant week was perfect until my vehicle was sideswiped while dining.  There servers were polite and very accomodating.

nIaW4nYu_LgpMgY3dJUO1A.text: Crawfish is always good. They open at 11am on Sunday for brunch. Price Avg $10-13. The only thing I don't like about Cajun Queen is their tables are too close to each other but they always have a full house that explain why they need so many tables. I hope they will move to a bigger place in the future.
