M7tkLuwmjvzZrDwp96nT0A.text: I cannot say enough good things about Cajun Queen! The food is delicious and the atmosphere is so pleasant. Dress it up or be totally casual, you will feel right at home. The servers are knowledgeable and friendly. Did I mention the food is delicious?

0CfJOP5jXA7YeZONiYKE6A.text: I have been telling my wife that we have to get back to New Orleans just for the food. I don't have to ask that anymore. This place is amazing!!! We were we in town for a panthers game and saw this place. My entire party loved it. The whole experience was amazing.  And the food was the star. Definitely coming back !!! Do urself a favor and stop by..you'll be glad u did

ItAM8VXcvLvzkWYnGyqWfg.text: Best Cajun that I have had outside New Orleans.  Service was fabulous,  Eat on the second floor for the smooth jazz.

MOMprDQui8ROUz7kUXgfOQ.text: Wonderful ambiance, fantastic food, and great service. I was in Charlotte and visited Cajun Queen for dinner. There was a small wait so our party headed up to the bar and decided to eat in the bar area. While the bar was busy the bartender was very attentive and delivered great service for both our food and bar orders. This being our first visit the bartender gave some recommendations that were fantastic. The bbq shrimp and fried green tomatoes appetizers were top notch. I had the Duck special that was wonderful and full of great flavor. The bourbon bread pudding was another great choice to finish out the meal. If you are looking for great cajun food in Charlotte this is the place.

Q8QFZyJtFj41fOak65t4LQ.text: One word: Flavor.  I snagged a few Groupons for this place after reading other Yelp reviews, and I was not disappointed. The atmosphere is charming (even slightly upscale, in my opinion), the portions filling, and the food spicy and fresh.  I ordered the etouffee with chicken, shrimp, and crawfish. It was as delicious and mouth-scorchingly savory as I had hoped. (Warning: If you don't like a satisfying tongue burn, don't order the etouffee!) Most noteworthy of all, the chicken was fall-apart tender. Yum, yum, and more yum. My boyfriend ordered the blackened catfish by recommendation of the waiter, and it was just as tender and flavorful as my dish. Our waiter was also very polite. Seriously, I'm wondering if there's a way you can even go wrong at this place.  One thing: The parking is dodgy. Spots will run out, and you may get towed if you park in an adjacent lot.

BHl2YvAmCBGuwFSGBZWmeQ.text: We had a great experience at this restaurant. Its a unique atmosphere being in a old house. The place was packed the night we went. You definitely need a reservation here on the weekend. We arrived a few minutes early, and were directed upstairs to the bar area. This area was packed and there was a small band playing blues/jazz. It was a great vibe, great atmosphere. I hated to leave there, when our table was ready. But alas, we were called away to a downstairs table. Downstairs, I could no longer hear the band. However, we ordered the special for the night. They had several different kinds of fish, with several different cajun toppings. The food was plentiful and fantastic. This place just has a lot of character and thus it makes a great place for a date night. I probably wouldn't bring the kids here, because they wouldn't appreciate it. But a great place for a nice couples night out, or a dinner date with friends.

pQpxRza7bdK1yuL1EMxy9w.text: Had dinner here in the upstairs dining room near the live band.  The food was excellent and the portions were generous/filling.  The BBQ shrimp appetizer is tremendous.  An excellent way to start your meal.    The food is prepared well and in a timely manner.  I had blackened catfish with veggies (very well prepared and large portion) and thought it was phenomenal.  I thought the gumbo could be a bit better, but overall, the meal was really good.  Service was solid as well.  Can be tough to converse if you dine in the room with the band...they are really good but, as expected, it is pretty loud.  Overall a very good place to have a meal.

4-uaorQ3sUMN_wKWtCv-MQ.text: Christian is the best server of all time! Yummy delicious food as well! Went to celebrate birthday, bar seemed a little backed up, but wonderful food. Christian. Pork tenderloin! Oh, and Christian the server. A

KmvlIme_TPxfJ93oiP8Z_Q.text: He said:  Got there around 6 with no wait. Seated immediately. No Coke Zero. Fried tomatoes great, hot - roumelade tasty. Water glass never empty. BBQ shrimp good but not crazy good  nice heat to them only 6 shrimp tho.  Crawfish scampi quite spicy lots of crawfish.  Superior service - waitress knowledgeable about food - able to make recommendations. Drinks flowed. Added a star at end of meal because of service.  She said:  The restaurant is located in a neighborhood where many houses have been converted into businesses.  The statue of an alligator in front of the restaurant was sculpted from a tree.  I really wasn't sure what to expect, but boy, was I happy with what we walked into.  This restaurant was warm, inviting, and cozy.  The service was absolutely amazing.  Our glasses were always filled, as was our breadbasket.  In order to sample as much as possible, we decided to split four appetizers between us.  My favorite was the fried green tomatoes.  The remoulade sauce "made" this dish.  It was perfectly balanced and absolutely yummy!!!  If you haven't been a fan of Fried Green Tomatoes, you really should give these a try.  We also had the Cajun Fried Oysters, New Orleans B.B.Q. Shrimp, and Crawfish Scampi.  I've listed those in order of my favorites, though they were all good and I'd gladly have them all again.  This has been one of my favorite Yelp-finds, by far!!!

e6r-5nCvncMhBncgM0JJYg.text: Do not waste your money! The gumbo tasted like the roux had burned and there was no salt whatsoever. I ordered the blackened chicken to be safe thinking "no one can mess up blackened chicken".....I was wrong. None of the food (including the blackened chicken) were seasoned with salt and pepper. This was the most bland, overpriced food I'd ever had in the city. I ordered my toddler the chicken strip little gators meal. The fries were the best thing out of the entire meal. The service was as also dry and not very friendly or inviting from the hostess to the waiter, Brandon. Geez, I know it's a Tuesday night (we arrived at 5:30) but at least show some enthusiasm as I arrive to spend a whopping $123 (4 entrees, 4 alcoholic bevs, 1 kids meal) on a below average meal. It would've been more had we been charged for the uneaten cup of gumbo.

2PxCXS5a9Ts9419706jl2w.text: We came in for brunch one weekend and the banana foster French toast was seriously to die for! Though the interior and decor left me expecting a bit more, the service was wonderful. I'm interested to try their dinner menu though

FRufejyMOjg0lWHGLVnWgw.text: Nice ambiance,  music was jazzy and not too loud. Parking is a bit nerve wracking but valet parking helps.   Attentive servers. New Orleans fried platter and etoufee was tasty. Gumbo seemed to be missing a bit of seasoning. Hurricane was nice but not as strong as expected.  We enjoyed our first visit.

SMAyy0SL7mvGLJCd_6zOMQ.text: Very nicely seasoned Cajun chicken pasta but hard to taste the sausage. The cheese pasta was good. Barbecue shrimp was a bit more spicy than I have had several times in NOLA but good. Sazerac was fabulous and the best bread pudding. Just enough sauce and the edges crispy and sweet. Yum!!

Q-ZmzjfUroilZH8VgD-ecA.text: I just LOVE this place.  Best experience is sitting upstairs at the bar.  Order the NOLA BBQ Shrimp; Crawfish Etouffe; fish specials (seems like these never change, come to think of it....); blackened pork tenderloin with plantains and black bean mash.  PLUS live jazz every darn night.  What's not to love?

DhMK1nDkGIEH3ZO-2j6ViQ.text: This place is worth a visit. My boyfriend and I went for Sunday Brunch. The Banana Foster French Toast and the eggs Benedict with the crab cakes were both excellent. We also got the shrimp and grits, but they were just ok.

94hvFWHxZlTi3FeAFQFI0A.text: My first time. Good good good atmosphere but I only gave 4 stars because the live Jazz band only plays 10 mins at a time and then takes 20 to 30 min breaks constantly.

XJNoDGpYlyT__ms3jxz0tg.text: I haven't been to a lot of Cajun Restaurants (yet), but this has hands down been my favorite. Pulling up it looks like a old historic house. I'd never eaten in a restaurant like this so I was excited to get inside. When you pull in, they have complimentary valet. They work really hard so I always make sure I have cash to tip them. One weekends you have to have a reservation as they are normally booked to capacity. Immediately at the door they have someone waiting to seat you. And inside, the layout is just like a house! I love it!! Tables are spacious and the atmosphere is very nice. I've eaten upstairs once and I will never do it again. The reason is because they have a band upstairs every night. While the music is nice, it is loud. I left with a headache that one time from trying to yell over the music along with all the other conversations going on as the bar is upstairs as well. Downstairs you can still hear the music so I prefer to eat there. I've never had a rude server. They are always so nice. I've tried a little bit of everything here, and the only thing that I can say left me something to be desired was the BBQ Shrimp. Not that flavorful, wasn't really exciting, I'll pass on that from now on. The popcorn Crawfish is soooo good! So tender! They just melt in your mouth. I wasn't a fan of the shrimp scampi. While it was delicious!! It was pretty much shrimp served in a soup of oil and butter. Was wayyy too much! And the seafood Gumbo is really good. It has a small kick of heat and you'll get a couple shrimp in it if you're lucky. My favorite meals are the All 3 Diane and the Special where you pick your fish and either Shrimp or Crawfish topping. Just about everything is served over rice but I prefer Mashed Potatoes. And the hands down best dessert there is the Bourbon Pecan Pie!!! OMG!!!!!! Just think 21 Jump Street in my mouth!! So delicious! We thought the bread pudding was pretty bland though. Not much going on flavor wise, which was disappointing because I was excited to try it. Overall this place is awesome! Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. All 3 (Chicken, Crawfish, Shrimp) Diane served over Rice
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. New Orleans BBQ Shrimp appetizer
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cajun Popcorn Appetizer

xJG7AcvphjROgVKVSTewjw.text: One of our favorite restaurants that's not a chain.  First, if you don't want the Free Valet parking you can go behind by the park and take a little stroll.  Our favorites are Chicken Diane and the Cajun Pasta.  The latter comes with a cup of gumbo or a salad.  The caesar salad is good too.  The BBQ shrimp makes a good appetizer or you can have for a dinner.  The wait staff is good too. We had Mcgregor the other night. Nice young man and on top of things.  Also, check to see if there is a Groupon you can use!

-ZCSb8okLRxi8W1mDkyq5A.text: The service was excellent and the food was amazing!!!  The jazz band added such a great feel and fun experience.

M7P17v2pKxTxE048f4mmCw.text: I visited twice in-town as a flight attendant. Incredible food, music, atmosphere, and service. I'll be back whenever I'm in Charlotte!

rK19EWrmKPgeOxFegPkmXQ.text: Good Cajun food is sometime hard to find, so bookmark this place. If you are in the Charlotte, NC are make sure you plan a dinner stop at this establishment.  The best Cajun Cookin' I've had outside of Louisiana.  The Etouffee was delicious, I had it with Chicken, Shrimp, Crawfish, and Andouille Sausage, and its was perfect. All the protines were cooked perfectly. The spice and flavour was outstanding.

YwltWjHtSavzrA8YPPNqww.text: We were a loud table of 8 in the front left room for a day party. I visited Nawlins and thoroughly enjoyed the native drinks. Sooooo I ordered 5 cocktails at Cajun Queen and they were ALL AMAAAAAAAZING. The Etoufee 3 ways was spicy as hell and delish. THE ENTIRE EXPERIENCE was fun and LOUD and fresh, and friendly and just a great night out. Parking was a bit tricky so get a ride there if you don't want the hassle to mess up the evening. Cheers!

dMYQI_44JCHHlWF1p0eTsg.text: The closest to New Orleans cuisine I've had outside of New Orleans.  Great atmosphere and reasonable prices.  The BBQ Shrimp and Red Beans & Rice entrees are very good.  I will definitely be going back.

OQU2EgEAvNMmNtUMquGHMg.text: The service was great!! Olivia was quick and friendly. She suggested the Diane for me since I've had some bad time with Etoufee at other restaurants. And that was MARVELOUS. I love mushrooms and the spice is off the chain. If you are on a diet, don't get the Asian, let's say BUTTER! My boyfriend had the Creole and he liked it with the Shrimp, it could not top my chicken. The Crawfish Scampi for appetizer I could have ate with rice as a dish!!!! The food was great and FREE VALET, but they work off tips so tip well. I definitely will be coming back until I learn how to make the DIANE sauce

o5brxjoQ6lYGspo7lNi7ng.text: I really love this place. If you are in the area and you like cajun food I really have to recommend this place. It is warm and inviting and you will have a wonderful time. Price wise i believe it is truly on point!

stBbVhoT4vMpxbCDM-vHqA.text: My husband and I flew into and out of Charlotte for a wedding about 4 weeks ago and were lucky enough to spot this place for lunch over the weekend. We shared Chicken Diane (Mushrooms, garlic, butter, green onions, parsley and our Queen's magic spices - all sauteed together. Moderately spiced and served over rice) and some Bignets for dessert (on the brunch menu). We loved the food we ordered so much- and one plate was definitely enough to share. The service was friendly and fast. If we are ever in the Charlotte area, we definitely plan to come back!

SSyqA5BTu5z2Ufja0GhwVA.text: Happy to have the complimentary valet. This restaurant used to be tough to visit because of that! The setting experience was worth it though.  We went once a while back, and returned recently for our anniversary.  The Diane is a must try dish, and if you can manage, go and eat upstairs when the band is playing. It really sets the tone and transports your whole evening.

98E1XfMgPTHMphZ8LBHg0w.text: This is a great place to meet friends after work.  But if you want to talk, pleeease ask to be seated on the main level!  It gets very loud upstairs when the jazz band is playing, because it's a bit small (especially on the side of the floor that's away from the bar).  The servers are friendly and the food has been good (e.g., crawfish scampi, many blackened selections and desserts).  However, they are a little bit of a hit or miss on the seafood gumbo... it had no seasoning whatsoever the last time I tried it?  The food can also seem a bit pricey, but I haven't found another Cajun place that beats this one yet?  In addition, they have complimentary valet, due to limited parking around the building... unless you don't mind parking on a side street across the street, which is usually what we do if the valet looks busy or unavailable.

lLevmkV5y5D0ezR6xB5VEA.text: So I wanted so bad to enjoy this experience after reading all of the reviews, but I was not impressed. I guess if I preferred bland food or had never experienced authentic creole food I would have enjoyed myself or maybe not. It all started with a bad hurricane (not the storm, the thing the waitress brought out purporting to be a drink). This would be a one star review, but the fried crawfish was actually pretty tasty. Other than that my main dish was not seasoned well and they should be ashamed of themselves for using baby shrimp in $18.00 dishes. Even the rolls sucked; very dry and tasteless. Maybe I just happened to catch Cajun Queen on a bad day, but I will not be returning to find out if it gets better.

rXtzs7C5RNSbMJSoyx5quA.text: I'm a transplant from Mississippi so I'm serious about Cajun food and pretty much anything Louisiana(where I spent most of my summers). I went to Cajun Queen on a rainy Saturday night with friends and had gumbo, a delicious cocktail, and a fried catfish platter. Everything was prepared perfectly. I could almost hear the Acadian and Zydeco music playing while I ate my food! I'm a fan.

u_RyzYjBw9d1juIlQ9VByA.text: We had 6:00 reservations on a Friday night. We arrived at 5:35 and were happy when our table was already available (holiday weekend so maybe not as crowded as a normal Friday night). We sat in the back which is a sunroom. We loved it and it seemed a little quieter than the rest of the restaurant.   Bread- good but not spectacular. Side and Caesar salads- also decent but nothing special.  Great beer, wine, and mixed drink selection. They have a small kids menu and there were kids in the restaurant but it was more of an adult place in my mind. I don't think you can overdress because it's a nice (and pretty pricey) restaurant, but you can also come in with a nice pair of jeans.   For appetizers our group split the BBQ shrimp and fried pickles. The shrimp was wonderful, spicy but bearable:) it was large, juicy, and cooked perfectly (not rubbery). The broth is amazing especially using it as a dip for the rolls. Fried pickles were typical fried pickles with ranch dip. Nothing unique, but still delicious.  Everyone loved their meals with the exception of one person in our party. First, the good. I ordered the special for $25- blackened tilapia over rice with a sauce of crawfish, sundried tomatoes, lemon, and artichoke. HEAVEN! Huge piece of fish (I brought 1/2 my meal home) and it melted in my mouth. The mixture of flavors was on point.   Now, the bad. One man in our group is obsessed with steak and got the ribeye. The cut of meat was GIANT but it was pretty flavorless. It was cooked correctly but not what any of us would call worth $30. It came with a side of very dry, almost inedible, broccoli. But, it wasn't my meal (I just tried a bite!), so not knocking my review because of it. :)

t_xyQivraaIC1Cr_vkUAvg.text: The  Etouffe with the crawfish at the Cajun Queen is the best!  There are very few things I find myself yearning for, but the Crawfish Etouffe at the Cajun Queen s definitely one of them.  The crawfish are so succulent, and chewy, and they give you so many, that you can't help but chew on two or three in each mouthwatering bite.  I think the deliciousness is a combination of the crawfish, and this amazing rich buttery,  sauce they cover the crawfish and rice in.  Really Really good.  I also really like their fried oysters, they were fried perfectly and each oyster was big and meaty, and they gave me a ton of oysters with my order, so I was a very happy man.  Yeah baby Fried oysters and plenty of 'em, that's what I'm talking about.  The restaurant can get a little crowded on weekends, but seven  nights  a week they  do have live jazz upstairs.  The rest of the menu is decent, but if you go to the Cajun Queen make sure to try one of their special dishes,  with the Crawfish, you will be glad you did.

o44Gj7d4jUw-92kHdhknlw.text: No such thing as a bad meal here. A nice cozy place to grab some of the best New Orleans Cuisine in Charlotte. I had the Blackened Catfish covered in a shrimp based sauce with peppers and it was served over mashed potatoes and a side of steamed Broccoli. I could not even finish my meal. Washed it down with a local beer and slept like a baby afterwards. Our server was friendly and engaging but I would highly suggest reservations because they stay busy.

JGZfUlR7MwWCWGhBdM3Exg.text: Met some great people, some new (like us) and other return guests to the Cajun Queen! Hurricane (drink) was horrible, unlike any hurricane I've had before. It was very fruity and sour! I asked the bartender to make it less sour which is obviously sweet but it didn't make that much better.  We ordered and shared the New Orleans (fried) platter. If you like catfish, it was the best of the other fried items: shrimp, oysters and scallops. The red beans & rice was prepared differently than I've ever had; the add diced pieces of andouille sausage and raw red onions. Not the worst I've ever had but definitely different... you'll have to try it to determine for yourself.  Overall I give it 3.5 stars (rounded up to 4) because the people (diners not staff) showed the southern hospitality I've been missing since moving to Charlotte. Food was just ok but the catfish was worth coming back for, next time it'll just be catfish.  Sorry no pics

_KF90Gqip86l9I2eRVrNqw.text: The food is fantastic. I recommend the crawfish Diane and the fried oysters! Can get crowded a reservation is always good.

eG-Y-JgCdRopi0ZXZ3ZAAg.text: The service was great. The food came out fast. The food was tasty. Lots of choices. Portion sizes are big.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. The blackened catfish was delicious.
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. The portion sizes are big.

W6nm1E-aJTrveKiDmN6XBg.text: Went on a Friday night to celebrate a friend's birthday.   We were a little early for our reservation,  so went to the bar until it was ready.   The bartender was obviously overwhelmed,  but was able to get to us as soon as he was able.  Drinks were good and stiff!  The food was awesome!  Had the shrimp and grits which was the best I've had in Charlotte.   The band provided a nice backdrop to dinner.   Staff was very friendly.  Will definitely visit again.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States

ymVOc3rZuORxs_aMFOwLWg.text: I visited Charlotte and  I must admit this was the highlight of my stay. Some of the best food I have ever tasted. Authentic food at its best.

PamwF52GhnZC_cAph3kMSg.text: Never had a bad experience here. Food is great. Staff is friendly. Wonderful place! Have been several times and never disappointed. Perfect spot for a date night or family meal. Definitely recommend Cajun Queen to anyone seeking authentic Cajun style food. 10/10 will definitely be back again soon.

xoVeCJY8H-mKAHPkY44Z_w.text: The food was overpriced and bad....it was a 1 1/2 wait and our waiter was bad. Good wine! Thank goodness for wine

kTQ5ueyP8zkt2cTYfqJMZA.text: The Cajun Queen is consistently good. The food is authentic and they often have live music. The restaurant is a little more upscale than some of the other cajun places so it makes for a good date or a nice evening out. I've had a dinner party or two there and the staff have been excellent every time. The etouffee is one of my favorite dishes. The cocktails are also really good. Don't forget to grab dessert!

ea0dfvCaHuY7hPZP-Ttw6g.text: Its kind of sad to say, but I've lived near The Cajun Queen since about 2000, but until recently had never been. My husband and I have driven by more times than I can count and have said so many times "We really need to check them out!", but sadly we never did. At least until about 2 months ago when some friends invited us to dinner and we met there. Afterwards, we were beating ourselves for not going sooner! We liked it so much we went back a couple of weeks later and took other friends to help spread the word! The food was as good the 2nd time as it was the first! I've been to New Orleans and have eaten at a variety of restaurants there, and I can easily say The Cajun Queen was as good, probably better, than anything I've had in New Orleans. Admittedly, I have a tendency to think that in most restaurants "blackened" is used to "cover up" bad/old cuts of meat or cheaper types of fish, but in a place like TCQ, "blackened" is a style of high quality, flavorful, great tasting food.  There's no doubt, TCQ is now one of my regular "go to" restaurants!

aKbAai54lh9G9EvGijwmUg.text: Pretty good food, and I say this as a person who frequents N'awlins and loves the food there.  I will say the portions are large and fillling. So keep that in mind when ordering appetizers etc.  The Diane was good and the fried crawfish is a new fave.  The gumbo...well I've had better but others may like it. Everything though good during my visit was very under seasoned-but easily adjusted with a couple of salt and pepper shakes-maybe that's on purpose to make it more mainstream.  But regardless worth a try and I would probably come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried crawfish-new fave!
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Diane and Mimosa- great combo!

7CmIFxXAsmuknw9AH-H_yQ.text: This place you have to make RSVP on the weekend.. o have to make our RSVP for Sunday morning.. I did not get the pleasure of the live Jazz but when I am back in ty City I will experience the jazz.. Fernando was amazing.. I mean amazing..  So our RSVP was at 12:30 and we did not leave until 5. Our waiters was nothing but kind... the Good was all ALL delicious every sing thing that the four of us orders. My oysters were perfectly fried.... my first time there and every time I am in Charlotte I will be here.. You will not be disappointed at...

55xiKmcPfVooC4kudMU05A.text: Food is just okay. Had a Groupon, otherwise don't think the food is worth it. Way overpriced for some rice and a few pieces of shrimp with minimal flavor. Service was also sub par

NEC93muQYRNpeBXQoHZ1rw.text: Finished business of the day. Made reservation based on Yelp reviews. Strolled a mile and a half  from my uptown hotel. Copped a seat upstairs that was "band adjacent". Ordered the mahi-mahi with crawfish topping. Don't know if the music made the food taste better or the food made the music sound better, but either way the combination was bluesy, spicy and delicious. Friendly and attentive service. Good food. Good music. Sauntered back uptown. Went to sleep full and happy.  Five stars.

0yJInrRyREXUb-pTxBnN-w.text: I always enjoy coming to Cajun queen but after tonight i am completely done!? Went around 6:30pm looking for a great evening with my fiance. We walked in no warm greeting just stares so i politely spoke and asked for a table of two. They looked at us and without any other concern said 45 minutes which was too long we were starving, something didn't fee right, we waited around for a while and watch a couple (different complexion) walk in and grab a seat no reservation no nothing. Nothing to be surprised about in a world this but, i just wanted some decent food and live music. I WILL NOT BE RETURNING.

ClXz8uq7wcGs3KD8IHle2w.text: This place is a staple in Charlotte. My wife is a True Cajun and loves this place. The BBQ shrimp is so good... just be sure to ask for extra bread to sop up that juice!

2GpZCPDCrgB721Z53hutWQ.text: I had a wonderful dinner here tonight of the most delectable bbq shrimp! Mmm,  mmm, mmm!  The crawfish scampi was also great. The service was awesome as well! This place is a must if you get to Charlotte! FYI the items I had were from the appetizer menu and were entree size much to my surprise!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lovely dinner at The Cajun Queen in Charlotte. The bbq shrimp and the crawfish scampi were fabulous!

5AqWihpqul1xweczAD_QTw.text: This quaint spot is a MUST if you are in Charlotte. Excellent food, great service and nice entertainment.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salt n Pepper Catfish
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp Etoufee
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Delicious Mahi Mahi!

6GGjN07maFIu2HaU5fOKhg.text: For this to have been our first time there, it is definitely a spot I would visit again. We had an awesome time and they also sang Happy Birthday to My Baby. Our waiter Alex was awesome also...the food, the drinks, the atmosphere everything was great and very a redo date night for My Love and me!

OJ3mjBAX_EPjtmRao8NHWQ.text: Came in for my friends birthday. Absolutely amazing time. Food and service were outstanding! Fernando, was our waiter and he was excellent. Glad I had a chance to try out! I will be back!

HZImFY60YCZJ1JxHlsn-qQ.text: 6/19/2019 Another visit, another fine evening.  Nice fry oysters, not quite new orlean but pretty nice crawfish etoffe.  Best of the evening, we got some ladies went up the stage and sing some nice tune, "It had to be you", "Misty", etc.  Instead of KTV, I call this K-live, pretty awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States

NY2EFBe2TsVnzZpuNGfd7w.text: You will not be disappointing! Went for Queen's Feast; Think it's one of the better deals because includes: Wine/Beer, appetizers, Entree, Dessert. The portion sizes are hearty and will leave you full. A lot of the popular dishes like the Shrimp and Grits, Diana, and etouffee.  I had : Glass of Chardonnay, Seafood Gumbo, Shrimp and Grits with Andouille Sausage, Bourbon Bread pudding.  Bread for the table is perfect for dipping in the gumbo.  Shrimp and grits big portion of grits and medium sized shirmp I think I had about 6-8 pieces plus 2 pieces of sausage.   Keep in mind the kitchen closes at 9pm but the music and building itself stays open later ( at least for Queen's Feast)  Live Music is played upstairs but seating is limited so try arrive earlier in the night   Service was prompt and courtesy; even boxed up my leftovers.  They have all types of food even though it is New-Orleans cuisine so don't be discourage if someone in your party isn't feeling it.   Definitely recommended and definitely will be back

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and Grits with Andouille Sausage and Creole Sauce
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and Grits with Andouille Sausage and Creole Sauce

i95qF7mThxP5vFtgQXoXww.text: Delicious food. We sat outside and it was a bit dark but the service was good and the food was delicious. The fried oysters were perfect! We will be back.

yJcwYj0_cgKCc0UTP69GSA.text: The food was good except my catfish was on top of my broccoli and mashed potatoes. I am one of those people that does not like my food touching, but besides that it tasted great. There was live music playing and the seating area was neat and cozy, it felt like having a great meal at home.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salt &amp; Pepper Catfish

3ImdWCtOdLNDQvbO2NtNFg.text: I have visited Cajun Queen several times and for some reason, this is my first time writing a review. I am a fan of their Cajun and Creole cuisine. I have finally figured out how to get the best of both worlds without feeling extremely gluttonous. I order fried oysters and the side of crawfish etouffee. Believe it or not, this turns out to be a substantial meal. All of their etouffee options are superb. I recommend visiting on the weekend, you may have the pleasure of hearing some live music. And make sure you try one of their Louisiana craft beers with your meal, that is a nice finisher.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States

wa7p-8oshbpCAHFKbtcp-A.text: I had a fantastic experience eating here! I was in town for a short period of time, and wanted to try out some of the best food in the city. Cajun Queen was one of the highly rated place, and it stands up to its reviews!  Service was great as I had a very nice and attentive waitress. She was able to help answers some questions and point me to some of her favorites on the menu.  The food was brought out quite quickly even though it was during dinner hours on a Wednesday evening. I had the Bayou Platter which consisted of the Blackened Chicken and Blacked Catfish. They were cooked and seasoned very well!! I also had the Peach Aloha, which was a good summer-y drink. I really enjoyed my meal and would recommend this restaurant :)

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Seafood gumbo
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bayou Platter (blacked catfish and blackened chicken)
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Peach Aloha

MZb9KYWQ2IUAcCuSckP8mA.text: We were actually just in search for anything to eat and happened upon Cajun Queen which turned out to be such a great place. The waitstaff was so friendly as accommodating. I had the fried catfish with a mashed potatoes and broccoli and the catfish was very tender and delicious, especially with the sauce it came with. The fry was not to salty or overly bready- it was just right. My boyfriend had the everything etouffe which he couldn't even finish despite his large appetite.   For dessert, I had the pecan pie to go. He had the banana bread pudding. Neither of us were blown away with dessert but we definitely enjoyed dinner and plan to go back soon.

DN-4sh7EctRLKKdg56XAbA.text: Food were delicious, especially the BBQ shrimp! We gave 4 stars was because the service was a bit inconsistent. Two gentleman helped us, one guy was very friendly and tentative but the other was really cold. Also, we love their 7th Street stumbler cocktail.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Etouffe crawfish
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ shrimp
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. 7th Street stumbler

rA2_kVvxb_8gvqQh4U9phw.text: The ambiance, the live music and the good food make this a place that you must visit if you are in Charlotte. The staff are so friendly and the building is very unique. It is a house, two levels and the music is upstairs. Jazz band is great. I got the Cajun Diane and it was good. The Cajun oysters are really good. I put a pinch of salt on all my food to make it perfect. Other than that no complaints. We tried the Oreo cheesecake and it was soooo good. Key lime pie was decent (waiter said it was from local bakery).

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cajun Cajun Fried Oysters
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Key lime pie
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Decor

o3VDO6DAQKB-BWAHmGepXA.text: Valet parking is NOT complimentary....even thought they tell you it is. we went at a time that was not crowded, which was cool. Our waiter was super friendly, and attentive.  The portions were generous, but my shrimp was WAY too spicy! I am willing to give it another try, but this time just ask for bland versions of the craw fish or the shrimp. (I had Shrimp Glenda, and my husband had craw fish creole, which he enjoyed).

5mzR7iC2MsKqXmzvOtqsFQ.text: Fried oysters Yum!  My husband & I always go to the Arboretum location. Usually busy and you may have to wait for a table.  Last time we ate our meal at the bar rather than wait for a table.  It is always delicious.  We always get the Fried Oysters and I get the cucumbers and fried okra as my sides.  It is so hard to find generous portions of Fried Oysters.  Also, they have some fabulous desserts that are big enough for two.  Always the servers are nice.  Try it, you will love it.

jqOmmaBvjc8RaoeMHa6zug.text: I happened upon Cajun Queen on a walk today and decided to head in for dinner. I did not have a reservation and the hostess wanted to seat me at the bar but I asked for a table and got a two top in the back corner of the restaurant. The server was nice and the food come quickly. I liked the food but it's not something I would tell everyone to go out of their way to try. If nearby stop in for  a bite.   P.S. their homemade blackening seasoning is not spicy

ETocD3qx1gOyNqnQm1a_HA.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE! How did it take me so long so come here?!  10/10 - I would go again. I would bring my friends. I would bring my family.   I feel like it's a great place to start to party it up at dinner (with a couple of Hurricanes in hand) or if you want a low-key, intimate dinner with your boo.. it's great for that too!   I miss Cajun food and this place did not disappoint! I wasn't the only Cajun lover at my table and we all ate to our hearts desire. Oh boy, were we full and very happy. From the apps, to the drinks and large entrees - I thought I needed to be rolled out.  I also loved that I was able to sit at a high top upstairs to be able to enjoy the live jazz music. Such a great add to the ambiance and dinner experience. It's not too loud or overly noisy, it was truly such a perfect addition.   Pro Tip: Bring some dollars or a $5 tip in hand because there is complimentary valet! No need to hustle and fight to look for parking in Elizabeth!

cqMz1FXTzmidMZ_VPZyKRg.text: This was my first time visiting Cajun Queen though it's been a staple in Charlotte for years.   Cajun Queen is set in a cozy home located off of 7th St. While this gives great appeal, it makes for a very challenging parking situation. They offer complimentary valet. I also recommend making a reservation, as the space is small and often packed.  The shrimp etouffee was very good. Slightly under-salted but great flavor with the right amount of heat.  The service was friendly, fast and attentive. All 3 of the attributes that I seek at a quaint spot like Cajun Queen.

p291ZsMz0KyqxRuPzFtiXQ.text: Been there a few times and loved it every single time.  We always order anything that has crawfish in it :).  They have great deals on Groupon once in a while.

hdxcBEphHokVUkd2MkXHaw.text: I love them. I always order the Chicken Diane, it's my favorite item on the menu! I've tried other dishes but this one by FAR is the best!

JMgqKJb-Nxe5tP5Z6gDz9w.text: This was a nice chill spot. Gives you the New Orleans feel for sure! The crawfish Etoufee was simple but executed the traditional dish. I would have liked more flavor. The BBQ shrimp was different than expected but nothing to crazy. Cajun chicken breast dish was my friends but she stated it was good. Presentation overall was really good. Customer service was good as well. I'm not in a rush to go back but one day I will give it a 2nd try.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. New Orleans BBQ Shrimp
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blackened Chicken Breast
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crawfish Etouffee

hvgmVZrCa07MZe9CVfFm0Q.text: Delicious as always! The service is so friendly and the live music is great. They are so reasonably priced. I got the Cajun pasta, my parents got the blackened catfish and the salmon. So good!

576qjkVDfNHNpcNk0o_mPA.text: Great location.  Great seasoning.  Great food.  Great complimentary valet service.  I like space when I eat, with that in mind, It was a little uncomfortable. I felt like my table of two was a table of four... We were so close to the party next to us.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States

joXhlEaU9eb7I8Q3Ya6bpg.text: After driving around uptown and going back and forth on where we should go, we ventured to Elizabeth and weaved through construction to dine at the Cajun Queen.  We have known about the restaurant just from location and when I did a quick google search I saw 4.5 stars and knew we were hungry and ready for a table so we valeted and went inside.  When asked if we wanted to sit up or downstairs a customer leaving interjected and said "you have to go upstairs the experience is wonderful!" ... so upstairs into the loud room with the live jazz band it was. We were seated at a 2 person table the similar to the arrangement of Soul Gastrolounge's and were elbow to the the wall and an unoccupied 2 seat table bedside us.  This left me uncomfortable for the entire dinner.  You cant possibly enjoy a full meal, apps, bread, cocktails and water (we ordered bottled flat) at a table of that size and definitely not when you have to awkwardly ask the waiter to remove the salad plate from the middle of the table when he served you an entree, leaving your table cluttered.   I had to ask the waiter about my cocktail that he's never put in 20 minutes after ordering it.  Also, if you're big on cocktails, this places cocktail menu is about as adventurous as a Myrtle beach chain restaurant with its only near feature being the names of cocktails like "Cajun cooler," and "swamp water," but doesn't have any craft ingredients and mixers get as complex as midori liquor and garnishes of lemon or a maraschino cherry. These things would not bother me if Cajun queen was a relaxed, quick service restaurant but this is a restaurant located a quarter mile from the Fig Tree and is in restored 2 story Victorian, and its ambience begs for a larger delivery than it gives. The gumbo was disappointing (how can you let an opportunity go at the only Cajun fine dining restaurant in the city) and lacked seasoning. The salad was a lettuce mix, carrot, radicchio and a large single piece of julienned cucumber on top and had stuffed in it a plastic disposable container of the vinaigrette I'd asked for on the side.  This confuses me as the gumbo was served atop a paper doily and this felt like yet again another missed opportunity. We did not see a ton of options aside from fried items on to the appetizer menu and wished we had more options.  I really wanted to try the fried green tomatoes, but after bread (served with plastic individual butter pods instead of plated - missed simple opportunity) and salad, we knew we'd be full.   I will say the 2 stars that come from two things - the band (who also takes song requests and are super relaxed, fun and personable)and the good entrees. I had a special featuring seared duck breast topped with a crawfish medley atop fried potatoes, onions and peppers and it was delicious - could have been a smidge spicier but I also didn't order it as so. My guest had the New Orleans shrimp which he enjoyed and it was super spicy and the rice was engorged in a soupy Cajun broth.   Desert I wouldn't know how to rate.  We got it almost just to mild out the spicy meal.  It was a nestle tollhouse cookie pie that you could probably get in the frozen aisle by Mrs. Smith and had spray reddi-whip atop it.  We wished we had gone for the bourbon pecan. Moreover, we wished we had just faired the parking hassle of uptown and waited for a table somewhere that would give us a better experience than the one that Cajun Queen gave us on relaxed Wednesday night out.

_rT54eYUN7RiGfJ-xZHQ5A.text: Food was amazing. I had the Dianne and it was everything I imagined it would be. We had a seat next to the fireplace which set the mood perfect!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Étouffée
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Diane

UKc7aSvyAuDp8VFMWeZBmw.text: Parking sucks. Food is high for no reason. Downstairs tables are too close. Not a fan.

jiEK_nYS39P88MFhBNULsw.text: We enjoyed a very nice dinner upstairs in the jazz room. The musicians are great and really add to the neighborhood ambiance of the space. The food was delicious and our server was so thoughtful and attentive.

Fy9SgN-32_KVtr142lhh6g.text: The food here is phenomenal! The reason I gave them 4 stars is because our waiter needed reminded several times to bring out lemons for water. In addition, the gumbo tasted like a tomato soup with shrimp and okra added. I was not impressed with that at all!  We started with crawfish scampi and it was super good. It has a little spice just so youM know but delicious with the bread...M y boyfriend had the pan seared duck (medium). It was cooked perfectly and the Flavors were tremendous. I had the Cajun chicken pasta and it was by far the best if ever had. Even great the next day which is hard to accomplish! I would definitely go back but do not recommend the gumbo unless you like it with a strong tomato soup flavor. I expected way more flavor after trying their various sauces but still a great experience! PS: When a woman asks for lemons more than 3 x you're in trouble (haha).

OJrOCRudewee9vPfLrb-_A.text: Went for a friends bday, and our anniversary, service was excellent and the food was divine. Was seated upstairs by the jazz band and the ambience was very soothing. I had the Diane with chicken shrimp and Crawford and it was mouth watering. My bf head shrimp and grits,  and it was wonderful.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gumbo
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and grits
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Diane

1kj6uULBNCFKvRY22VGUlg.text: So first have to disclose that I lived in New Orleans and worked in top rated restaurants.....so might be little biased.  Service was good....no issues.  Downstairs dining room.....no issues, but not memorable.  Food....well, NOT good Cajun/creole food.  Had the traditional NOLA foods.....Gumbo, Shrimp Etoufee, Red Beans/Andouille.  Gumbo was tomato based.....which if ever been to authentic restaurant in LA, never!  Shrimp in Gumbo were smallest over cooked I have ever had.  Etoufee flavor was good....they obviously used a roux.  Shrimp.....did they buy canned shrimp from WAlmart......ugh!   Beans....not cooked proper and while had heat, had no flavor.  Andouille was tough and just not good.  If you like authentic NOLA....don't go here.  If you want some NE Cajun flavored food......and can't find better......then might be worth a visit.

sWrkkPOXx5LhcVBqhaqX3Q.text: I love New Orleans and they're the closest thing in Charlotte. Love it!  I always get the new Orleans seafood platter.

K-tMZ8fV1x7uSad1dXM-vA.text: The best BBQ shrimp I've EVER had. The sauce is good for dipping the bread. Definitely going back again. Shrimp and grits are okay, but I've been to Hominy Grill in Charleston, SC and theirs is the best. Service was awesome, as our waiter was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ Shrimp... THE BEST!

m3YI5PymvDOViskD8zawqQ.text: The flavors are so rich and the portions are awesome. Service was a little slow given there wasn't a big size. But the food made up for that. I would recommend this restaurant to everyone who enjoys fine dining. Also the ambiance makes it a great spot for a date night or anniversary. Throughly enjoyed my first experience. Can't wait to return.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Diane.
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp Diane this was a delicious dish.

m1Z8ZJjY1cVRJYlx06-Ihw.text: I was checking my photo's only to find out that I have not made a review of this place.   Me and Mine went here a few weeks ago for Brunch.  She had the shrimp & grits I had had the gumbo.. Everything was nice and neat, served hot (We were the 1st there so no wait)  It was close to 12noon, we had finished our food and basically waiting for the clock to strike 12 so we could order a cocktail before leaving. Well it was was sooooooo close, (maybe 5mins or so) that the waiter placed our order.   I asked about the bloody marry (Muddy Waters), never really had one (Bloody Mary). The waiter asked.. ARE YOU SURE (with a devilish grin).... (see picture). Well after a 20 bet.. I reluctantly pulled the oyster out only to find it looks like some bull nuts (sorry for the graphic) But thats what made the bet worth wild.   Trust and Believe, I have video of me taking the "shot" (its really too much drink and biggggg oyster to be a shot).  Everything went well, the waiter found it hill-arry-us.  Cheer's

j7FP0oczmousD_xPI9cX7w.text: I am only in Charlotte occasionally, but I must come here every time. The crawfish is as good as any in New Orleans. The staff is great. I wouldn't change a thing.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. The best crawfish etouffe. Nice dark roux, just spicy enough and worth coming for. Also don&#39;t pass on the fried oysters.

l2a_vwilvP1_B8f6WXFReg.text: They Lack favor in their food. I ordered the gumbo it lacked favor and good ingredients. it was not good. The popcorn crawfish were so delicious but covered in a mayo based sauce that should be served on the side. I didn't like seeing the stations for busing dishes right as you got to the top of stairs. It has potential but think the chef needs to take a hard look at his food.   I want to love this place but the food is not executed well at this time.

30AOuTtCrOhDbmRGsgTa-g.text: I hadn't been here for dinner in years. Brunch in a few years as well. I don't know why I haven't been here more recently. Great service and the food was fantastic. I had the shrimp/chicken Diane with a salad. I think what would have made the dish even better was a little char on the chicken/shrimp. We sat on the outside patio and it was a perfect night for this weather wise. The servers were attentive and did a great job with the flow of our dinner.

NPXOrs7bWkm-5Bh0qaAmKg.text: Average gumbo. Our main meal was better. Very rushed service. Basically, one meal out before we'd put down our spoons on the last. Staff friendly enough. But very rushed. We were done in less than 45 mins with 3 courses. Probably won't go back as if I want fast food - I can get it and for a lot less cost.

B0XnPGT_y8u7BZ1H7kIPBQ.text: Food is spicy and a reservation is ideal. My daughter & I visited on a Friday night around 9 was nervous assuming we would feel out of place but the staff was friendly...gave my daughter mardy gras beads very unpretentious..food was excellent

9ZdvLrom9HJ1n6RE5EZhtg.text: Delicious food, warm atmosphere and delightful jazz band playing as we ate!  It's nice to have Cajun food so close to home.

6EGkL0W-u6NM5jyiP8d6yg.text: Always good food. Rustic Cajun feel inside. Love the live music. Staff is always friendly. Menu is good but does not change often.

NVjSAj4iZP1r4x0OZOTfsw.text: Best Chicken Diane ever. Great staff, service and atmosphere....and the band! Awesome jazz band!

0pKOPUpSOwl4hLlfH7oBQA.text: My husband has been trying to get me to go for ages. I made reservations for roof top but as the weather was unpredictable we were seated upstairs. We had a great time, the live music was great, food delicious and service was excellent! Would definitely recommend a visit!

deP_UmKWk5NRZx8fy6SQJA.text: This place is awful!  Was with friends for a Birthday and it was 19 degrees outside that night.  The reservation was for 13 and 5 of us got there first.  The hostess said we could go upstairs to the bar. So we did. There was no one there and the chairs were already on top of the tables as if they were closing.  We went back downstairs and asked to be seated. There was only one table in the entire restaurant that had 2 people at it.  The hostess told us we would not be seated until our entire party was there. The birthday boy called the other people that we were waiting on and at the last minute they canceled. We told the hostess the reservation would now be for 5 and not 13. She rolled her eyes and looked at us and in a sarcastic demeaning tone said "so you're telling me now that instead of 13 there were only be 5?"  And we said yes. At that point I was ready to leave. But we stayed. The food was horrible and they included the tip without asking. I will never go back to this restaurant no matter what, even if they offer me free food three times a day for life.  I was so mad. I will never never never never never go back.  Horrible customer service and horrible food.

i-VUX8OzxGk2YconcDotAw.text: Probably a 3.5 overall for me.   I met my BIL here for dinner - he said it's insanely popular, so we arrived pretty much as they opened. Be aware that parking in the area is a huge challenge but there is valet service available. They've got signs everywhere warning that if you park in other business lots you'll be booted and towed.   I love that they're in an old house - the room we sat in had a beautifully preserved tile fireplace and I'm told the upstairs has a great bar.   The menu is a nice rundown of classics - jambalaya, blackened this-and-that, etc. we started with a small order of blackened shrimp, which arrived swimming in a wonderfully spicy broth. Pro tip - save those bread rolls they give you to soak up this juice.   Entree wise, I had shrimp and grits which netted me a huge amount of coarse ground grits with a decent amount of shrimp, in s nicely spiced sauce. A few of my shrimp were over cooked but the flavor was there.   We had no issues getting seated since we arrived at opening but it seems like reservations are the way to go. Cajun Queen isn't near as good as real NOLA cooking but it's way better than what most serve.

nAfY_dTpy4fJmbNPtHrRBA.text: wonderful experience with beautiful place and food, fabulous service as well. Everyone was happy that night, and wish the restaurant a better business!

j-3Q7KYJy8kvh4Ea4rqcsg.text: We are in shock. This place is the best hidden gem in Charlotte. I found the Groupon and thought, why not... WE WILL NOW BE REGULARS! I truly can not get over how fantastic the food was. The signature drinks were also phenomenal but this place is a must visit. It is located in a quaint house in Elizabeth and is truly the most unique atmosphere. Great photos of New Orleans on the walls and the staff is extremely attentive. We unfortunately did not get to sit upstairs and experience the live music but we will definitely be requesting a seat upstairs next time.   The meal was great. The fried oysters were fresh, delicious, flaky, not over battered and truly perfect. I then had the cesear salad and my guy had the gumbo. They were both gone in minutes. The cesear dressing is definitely made in house, great flavor, and the gumbo was perfectly spiced and delicious. Our meals were also phenomenal... I had the duck over crawfish etoufee and holy cow was the duck perfect. We also ordered the chicken etoufee... I truly can not stress enough how perfectly spiced these dishes were. I grew up in a large Cajun household and this was honestly better than the etoufee my grandmother made.   Unreal. We will be back AND SOON!  Thank you for a lovely and unexpectedly delicious meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken etoufee..., &#34;didn&#39;t even need a knife to cut apart, just enough spice to have flavor but not too spicy or hot to eat...&#34;
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. The images don&#39;t do the food justice. Phenomenal, and the duck was cooked perfectly. Both etoufee dishes were perfectly seasoned.

TWmJ4ods3-nnZR9ilqYmCQ.text: The food was great, the service was on point, and the atmosphere is fun. We started with the crawfish (Cajun popcorn). They were fantastic! Then my hubs got the chicken etouffee which was delicious with a kick of spicy. I had the blackened shrimp Caesar salad ..yum! We finished the meal with bourbon pecan pie (would get again) and bread pudding (probably wouldn't get again...and note: I love bread pudding). The complimentary valet is great for not trying to find your own parking. All in all ...we'd go back again.

kXMaERE-c0PXziJ1Ajdyyw.text: We came here because we found a Groupon for it and were very impressed. The restaurant is in an old house and is really unique. We ate upstairs on a balcony which was really nice. We got BBQ Shrimp as an appetizer and Shrimp Creole and Shrimp/Chicken/Crawfish Diane for our entrees. The servings were huge and we ended up having enough for lunch the next day. Everything was delicious and I would highly recommend it!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ Shrimp appetizer, Shrimp Creole, Shrimp/Chicken/Crawfish Diane

3ZTdinkBFbdr6Q15hPz5Jw.text: Loved it! Went on a last night dinner with my husband and we enjoyed everything. First off the restaurant is looks like a house and inside had a wonderful homely vibe. We sat upstairs and enjoyed live jazz. I would definitely visit again

wW7FMfCoDJqV8-Mjy_Q4aQ.text: Unbeatable cajun food in the Elizabeth area. The house is so beautiful, and they have live music every day! We love to go for brunch, because their prices are little friendlier for folks on budgets. But even with brunch, I always get a side of crawfish etoufee - it's delicious.

mE_6kD5PNGZ1XE9pTL91tQ.text: Cajun Queen has been a jewel in Charlotte's culinary crown for many years and is a great dating go-to or just great in general, actually. The ambiance is always nice and often there is live jazz for a New Orleans feel! The food has always been great and over the years I've tried just about everything on the menu, never been disappointed whenever I've gone there. It's hard to pick a favorite since everything is good, but I lean towards the etoufee, the gumbos, anything  New Orleans-inspired. The seafood is delicious and always fresh here so if you love seafood, I would go for those options. If you eat here once, you will soon find yourself eating here often.

IzCcBz14iTk9aBVA-zyQcQ.text: The Cajun Queen is my favorite restaurant in Charlotte. I have lived in Charlotte for 7 years and been to 4 birthday dinners at Cajun! The Creole with shrimp, crawfish and chicken is my go-to meal. I always get the gumbo as an appetizer and my wife loves the bbq shrimp. I probably eat a load of bread every visit, because the sauces are so good and I dip the bread in the gumbo, creole and bbq shrimp sauces! The atmosphere is very New Orleans and feels like the Big Easy, especially if you sit upstairs by the bar when Jazz is playing.

_Rav4X_o0r_B1LVlOwA2EA.text: This is a little slice of Naw'Leans!  We ordered the duck breast with home fried potatoes, green beans and duck breast in an etouffee gravy.  That was my first time trying duck breast and it was superb!  Tender and juicy.  However I wish the skin was a little more crispy.  The potatoes had way too much garlic.  The meal came with a choice of salad or gumbo.  We chose the gumbo, of course.  It was delicious!  It had the right amount of heat.  We also ordered the fried green tomatoes.  The breading was great and it was covered in a creamy aioli.  We ended the meal with a slice of key lime pie.  It was a perfect ending to a lovely meal.  The wait staff was personable, friendly and attentive.  It was a great way to spend our first night in Charlotte!

qWrDiRnE5LU61XNW4g5wqQ.text: The atmosphere at cajun queen was very relaxed! Its also amazing how so many people can fit in an remodeled historic home. Great and intimate feel along with very good cajun cuisine equals a satisfying dinner or even a well planned out date night. Either way you can't lose

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Diane w/all chicken, shrimp, and crawfish tails

NJlZA-8Y1UY_yT-1n7ktig.text: This has been a favorite of my families for at least 15 years. Consistent great food like shrimp Diane or the choice of 3 fish specials. So yummy!!!! And the gumbo of course.

kaqZcjhtl0DFtA_2ay08tQ.text: Food was mediocre. Others I was with said the food was better the first time. Also, food was cold when it arrived. Wouldn't give it another try.

uezfAlLX9J95jliajVnQTw.text: Cajun Queen provides a great experience! The ambiance is quaint and engaging. The service we received was great as well...but the food! The food had a wonderful presentation, excellent flavors, and generous portions.

OzXKYL1cymxsJ74PzH_GBw.text: Pro's - Great service. Great atmosphere. Good food.   Cons: Poor parking and the seating is a bit cramped. My wife and I were sat in a corner against the wall & very close to another couple. They were very nice people but sitting that close to other people makes it tough to have a private conversation. The food was good but also a bit too spicy for my liking...even for Cajun food. My wife had the Cajun pasta and I had the crawfish etouffee. Both had GREAT flavor but were also VERY spicy.

l27UcbEvV6R2rKpIIrK9jg.text: Came here when visiting Charlotte from Philadelphia. Great food, great atmosphere and our server Bo was awesome! The Cajun pasta is amazing and the fried scallops speak for themselves!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gumbo
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cajun Pasta

_XUBXoB3oTc-ZDCMLNpLSw.text: I was surprised the second time I went. Nicely surprised! The food was actually awesome. And customer service was on point

CXeDucjNDvWu6eYiCDDP2A.text: I've dined here several times over the years and yep: still delicious, great service, nice atmosphere. My friends and I were celebrating a birthday. I was able to make reservations on the same day with a pleasant interaction with the person on the phone. The seating is tight so be aware if that is an issue for you but not so tight you feel like you're sitting in someone else's lap. We did not have to wait for our water glasses to be filled and they never got empty. Our server Kevin was knowledgeable about the menu, pleasant, and accommodating. Pretty noisy so I would say family friendly. Great restaurant for kicking back and having a good time. Bathroom was clean and private so the trade off for women is there could be a wait. Me personally, I didn't have to. All New Orleans style dishes. Everything we had was good. I'm a spice person so I asked for the spiciest dish and it didn't disappoint: New Orleans bbq shrimp and rice. Yummy! Pricey but the quality of seafood and service is worth it. Oh and parking onsite is minimal but we found plenty of parking across the street.
