Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. The front of the restaurant
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States

AajN2cSWIykEYt_GzYv7Iw.text: Blackened fish with crawfish etouffee was excellent. The atmosphere was very nice but if you sit upstairs be prepared to listen to the jazz band and not your date.

LkvBWpX_SWSKqwUF45Za1w.text: I was pleasantly surprised by this place... I'm from New Orleans and tend to be weary when I see "cajun" restaurants outside the state of Louisiana bc most always miss something or its off by lack of season/spice but the meal I had here was pretty good considering,  I had to add some Tabasco but overall I liked and would go back!

OLkqj65XZSVUcQfjA5ZswQ.text: I was spending the weekend in Charlotte and while doing my "foodie research" I found Cajun Queen's great reviews. The brick house at 1800 E. 7th St. is 100 years old now, and it's been a restaurant for the last 34 year. A really fun and unique experience with great live music and authentic Cajun dishes and drinks  I just knew was a must try for me =]  Went there and was not disappointed! Great, friendly and attentive service and even better food! We ordered a side of Crawfish Etoufee, Shrimp and crawfish Diane and Shrimp Creole.  Food was absolutely delicious! Be aware they serve very generous portions so order accordingly LOL. I will definitely be back here next time Im in Charlotte

VOO4g0g74lh6HnhmposmEA.text: Ohhhhh the food was phenomenal!  Everything from the flavor of the roux to the perfectly cooked shrimp was delicious... including the cocktails.  Every employee we encountered was super friendly and exhibited perfect southern hospitality.  I was in awe of this big beautiful house turned into a restaurant.  I'm so glad they haven't remodeled the inside to look modern, it's so much more enjoyable when you can feel the history and nostalgia of a building.    **I highly recommend reservations.

hYkiwkoZAuM4QVQcsuH3JA.text: This place was spot on!! The food was authentic and the dishes were wonderful! The best Cajun good I've had in NC. So many wonderful items to choose from, so my husband and I got two of the best popular items, that way we can try a little of both.   I got the Cajun seafood and chicken Diane. I absolutely loved everything about it! The rice, mushrooms, seafood (shrimp and crawfish). My husband got shrimp creole. Again, the best taste!  I ordered a mixed drink, Swamp Water. The menu states something like "drink if you dare." Do as it says, lol!!  Service was wonderful and attentive! Loved the live music playing up stairs. Perfect for date night or a group occasion

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Diane
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Care ole
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried Green Tomatoes

tvUq-OAcde9nsdqq_B9Utg.text: Second time at this lovely NOLA inspired and cozy restaurant and if there is one thing I can say about them is that they are consistent. I opted for the all three "Diane" (included shrimp , crawfish and chicken) and it was served over rice . Yummy . Just enough spices but a lot of seasoning and flavor. They give you a good portion size and you could easily have leftovers depending on how hungry you are when you first come. They easily accommodated us when we first arrived especially with it being 12 of us and the experience was good. I would definitely come back and now I will as many of my friends love this place and is the go spot when they are in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Diane

BgXGLVx7wGDAC-mXLCjesw.text: So I was able to visit Cajun Queen on my 1st visit to Charlotte in late March. Since I will be moving to Charlotte soon, it was very important that I found a really good Cajun restaurant to excite my palate during every visit. The restaurant does offer complimentary valet, which I gladly used just to feel fancy ya know but there was street parking near by that was available. The restaurant itself is inside of a older home with a tree out front filled with beads. If you've been to New Orleans then you get it. I had made reservations prior to arriving so I was seated quickly with a glass of water and bread.   I ordered a small BBQ Shrimp for an appetizer, which had just the right amount of flavor to make you want more & more. For the entree, I had so much to choose from but ultimately chose the Chicken Diane. This took me back to New Orleans & I've been thinking about it since my last bite. The portion size was just right & I ate on it for 2 days.   Ultimately, my visit was amazing & Cajun Queen hit every point. Now, I can bring my fiance here for date night to get the same experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Front entrance

p6JgU5-MWko3Gi4sRJNHcQ.text: Cajun Queen is in a large house with free valet. We passed it at first because it looks like a house. Then you notice their sign and all the Mardi Gras beads in the tree out front.   They play jazz music. There are different tables throughout the house. The decor is fun and screams New Orleans. The food is amazing. A bit spicy but it was wonderful.

8ZFTDiwrqz3Bk01w7qX-rQ.text: The atmosphere was very enjoyable. Definitely, a nice place for a date night.  I ordered, cup of gumbo, fried catfish w/ toppings on the side and Oreo cheesecake.   If you are person who knows anything about New Orleans style gumbo,  the roux is dark.  The gumbo was definitely a 0 for me.  It was red and had a heavy tomato taste. The veggies were raw and super crunchy.  I could not finish. However, the fried catfish was very tasty.  The customer service was great!   I was only highly disappointed in the gumbo. Can't be a Cajun restaurant without good gumbo.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. This was the cup of gumbo!
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried catfish platter

3ZtyEfB9NMKaGAGlblp_6w.text: I dined here with friends. It was my first time. The place was cozy. I had the pork tenderloin with plantain. It cameThe pork tenderloins was amazing!!!!! I was a bit disappointed with the plantains since I'm from the Caribbeans. The plantain seem as if they were fried bananas. Other then that everything's as amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu

kaQPRB6ZQpQXpDHUt0K0Gg.text: Cajun Queen never disappoints. I made reservations via Yelp about an hour prior to expected arrival time. Upon arrival, I was seated quickly and immediately offered bread and gave my drink order.   The food did take a little longer than usual, but it was a Saturday evening. Once it arrived, it was worth the wait.   The atmosphere was relaxing and everything was tasty!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States

jwjKSsq_TIXNRWWdAlw5Qw.text: Let me preface this review by saying I am not a Cajun expert.  First off, I loved the atmosphere of this place in that it is set in an older house.  Entrance is from the front porch.  It was about a 45 minute wait for a table.  We made our way upstairs to a bar.  One of the appeals of this place is touting live music 7 nights a week.  It looked like some guys were going and some were staying.  I didn't hear any live music as I think they were on break.  Bar was full but we managed to find two spots together.  Bar tender was quick and attentive.  White Zombie and Copper were cold.  We started with fried green tomatoes and BBQ shrimp as side.  I thought both were quite tasty.  My only qualm is I thought the shrimp were a bit overcooked.  Bread was brought to the bar.  Nothing outstanding about it.  We were seated and our server was Nathan.   He made some recommendations.  I ordered the etouffee with all three.  It came with 2 good size pieces of chicken, shrimp, and crawfish.  It was spicy and I thought good.  Probably best tasting of the night.  Overall, a very solid 4! I reserve my 5s for blowing me away.  The shrimp being a bit dry, the lack of pizzazz on the bread, the lack of live music kept it from being a 5.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States

D3Xjj31W8JGFCOdcFTxG3A.text: Cajun Queen brings New Orleans dishes and flavors right to Charlotte. I absolutely love this place and every time I've gone the food and service did not disappoint. The fried green tomatoes are a most have and of course if you go to a New Orleans style restaurant you must get the seafood gumbo. Appetizers range from $10 - $14 and the sizes are shareable! The menu has many options to choose from. From Blackened dishes to Gator! For my entree, I ordered the New Orleans Platter which consisted of catfish, shrimp, scallops, oysters, and red beans and rice; it is literally a sample the seafood that is offered. The price point for this dish was approx. $25 and it was very filling.   This place is unique because the restaurant is in a "house" and the dining room is very cozy and has a fireplace to create an ambiance. There is live music seven days a week and there is a small parking lot in the back as well as street parking. The ONLY thing I would suggest is more room between the dining tables other than that this restuarant is highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. New Orleans platter
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried green tomatoes

70LfJXIHAvyMFxqP5hdWKw.text: We came to this restaurant because my friend recommend it. The restaurant was a multi-level house and had cool decor. I loved the band that was playing while we dined upstairs. The restaurant also offers free valet parking so take advantage of it.   Our waiter was nice and helpful in helping us decide which dishes to order. We tried the fried crawfish as an appetizer and it was served with two dipping sauces. They were good.   For my entree, I ordered the mahi mahi special. This dish was served with a side of gumbo or a side salad. I opted for the gumbo. Although it was good it was a little too much tomato for my liking. I wouldn't order it again. My entree was plated well. The mahi mahi was good but a little over cooked. It had good flavor and was topped with shrimp and served with mashed potatoes, red peppers, and spinach. I chose to not get the mushrooms on my entree. I would order the mahi mahi again.  I was a little dissapointed that I could not get the drink that I wanted to order due to the restaurant being out of peach schnapps. Overall I would definitely return to check out some of the other dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Band
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crawfish poppers
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gumbo

xmRGH7Lx8zUTwHrgWM1s9w.text: Cajun Queen I love your food, the cute quirky house, the music, and typically all staff I encounter. I don't love how fast you get people out of there. This isn't something I'd typically complain about, your service is too fast. It feels like the minute I'm done with the last bite of salad the server is instantly there to pick up the dish and has my entree in the other hand. With this being said, I love that the servers are so attentive, I'm just not used to getting through a 3 course meal in 40 minutes.  Unrelated to my speed eating issue, the food is delicious. Went for restaurant week over the weekend but have been many times before. Some of my favorites on the menu, etoufee, shrimp and grits, and Cajun pasta. The etoufee is perfect with just the right amount of spiciness, had the combo this time but the crawfish is my fave. Cajun pasta is delicious when I'm not in a major seafood mood. Super yummy night at CQ, just very quick.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Etoufee
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cajun pasta

uq0NgGc6TxMbtGS3XVONKg.text: Went to Cajun Queen today for lunch with a groupon. Was pleasantly surprised - had heard a lot about this place but haven't had the best of luck with Cajun food in Charlotte!   Parking was a bit confusing so we ended up finding street parking. When you walk into the restaurant, it has the vibe of a house flipped into a restaurant. Very quaint! Seating is a bit tight, but the restaurant is smaller.  For our appetizer, ordered a bowl of gumbo. 4/5  Then for main courses, we ordered the Cajun pasta and chicken etoufee - both were phenomenal! Pasta was a little pricey at $25 but the etoufee was a great value for $18 - including 2 chicken breasts.   We were stuffed by the end, but the bread pudding looked amazing.  As far as Cajun in Charlotte, I would say that it is the best and will definitely be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gumbo
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pasta
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu

ryZYRA6lmYW-0on7qSLsQA.text: Popped in here for a dinner date with the girlfriend a few days ago.  I was tasked with picking a place we haven't tried and this place came to mind.  In addition to that I actually had a coupon which actually sweetened the deal even more.  We got there and headed upstairs to the bar to give our appetites a chance to ramp up.  The bar is small but doable and the furnishings are a little dated looking.  Not sure if that's the look they are going for but it is what it is.  Not horrible, just not as fancy as one might expect.  We then were seated outside and I actually preferred the outdoor seating.  It's on a low roof area so it's kind of nice with the view.  The food came out and it was fine, nothing I would shout about but also not terrible.   I think the issue is I just don't think the dollars to dishes ratio is in tact here.  Things just seemed a bit too pricey for what you got.  I'd come back but not without that coupon.

4oyOWFdLy-botzRHuQfj1A.text: We really enjoyed this restaurant.  The creole was excellent, the Cajun shrimp and gumbo had a spicy kick to it but not overpowering.  We enjoyed the bread pudding for desert.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Valet parking

NvbIMdhjhLiM9l4RsTOjhQ.text: Love this place!  One of my wife's favorite places for special occasions.  Seafood etouffee is outstanding and so is the shrimp creole.  Highly recommend!

ZQ_m3SmBvpyQKQ06pXjOQw.text: This was a treat.  Loved their food and service.  The bbq shrimp was memorable.  Everyone loved our experience here.

FYN-NM9Za7czOBsfpSlnTg.text: This is a place that has earned my business for a long time to come after just one visit.  I will be back next time I pass through Charlotte.  Two friends had recommended this place for a business dinner and it did not disappoint.  I brought a potential client here for a laid back, quiet dinner where we could talk and enjoy ourselves and it did not disappoint.  The staff was very patient while we waited for our guest to arrive.  We started with the New Orleans bbq shrimp which were expertly prepared in a not too sweet but slightly spicy sauce.  My party devoured this dish and raved about it.  I then had a bowl of gumbo which came with my meal.  I ordered it sans rice and again, an award winning dish.  Spicy and loaded with seafood, veggies, and sausage.  I could have eaten an entire bowl of this for my meal alone!  Next was the blackened, 14 oz. NY strip steak.  Simply stated, this was HEAVEN!  By far the best NY strip I've had in years!  Perfectly seasoned, cooked, and very, very tender.  I'd eat this meal a million times over.  Now to the staff.  Very attentive and paitent and they gave us plenty of time to talk and relax over coffee at the end of the night.  We talked so long they restaurant had closed and the staff had begun their cleanup duties yet never once asked for us to leave, not even subtle hints like raising the lights.  They let us just sit and talk and talk and talk.  The dress in my opinion varies.  We were in jeans and button downs while some others had sport coats on.  A really good vibe and I'd feel just as comfortable dressed either way.  You will not be disappointed if you spend a nice evening here for your next meal!

0kLUnPUEKCM3x5fHI3CYAQ.text: We were in town for my job this past weekend and decided we were in the mood for Cajun food.  This place is in a super cute purple house in a neighborhood.  The place was packed and I was so glad I had a reservation!  We got there around 7:15 and people kept coming after us.  TIP: there is complementary valet parking so bring some cash so you can tip these guys on the way out.  I started with a Bell's Two Hearted from a nice little beer menu.  At only $4 a bottle this is a great value.  Then we split an appetizer of fried green tomatoes.  I was so glad we decide to split since it was 5 very thick slices of tomato breaded and fried.  The presentation could've been a bit better - they were placed on a bed of greens, but the sauce was just dumped over two of the slices and you had to figure out how to get it onto the other three.  It was just OK.  I've had better at The Roosevelt in RVA.  My entree was stellar.  I had the crawfish etouffee which was nicely spicy and had a HUGE AMOUNT of crawfish.  I am often disappointed with the level of heat and this was just the way I like it.

sSf6yguiZkT22fWlzokuiw.text: OMG -  love love love this place!  Been to CQ a minimum of 15x.  Never had a bad experience.  Staff, music, and food is great!  The blackened catfish in ridiculously good!! And the fried green tomatoes are a great starter!

QNbjZr2dWk-BqCLhKKbysw.text: I purchased a Groupon to use here.  I can't say I'm a good judge of Cajun food, or very adventurous to try many of the spices & flavors of the True Cajun food.    I ordered the Creole Chicken which was not too spicy, lots of chicken and lots of rice.  It was definitely a two meal meal.    They have free valet parking because sometimes it can be hard to find in the area.  There is also a live jazz band upstairs that can be loud - but also very good and entertaining.  The alligator statue out front is broken, I hope they fix it soon!

HC75nmqe-8FTzCIVMijxsA.text: Best Cajun food I've ever had. I should know, I've been to Mardi Gras 4 times. Recommend throwing a dart at the menu, everything is good. Bo was very nice and very patient with us.

1p7WbTWD4fzVj5k_5TpfxA.text: Food was fantastic, tons of flavor. Service was awful. We waited 30 minutes until we were told the bottle of wine we ordered wasn't available. Waited another 10 minutes to get a different bottle of wine. All together we waited an hour and a half until we received our entrees, only after we asked a different server where our food was and a minute later it miraculously appeared. It's too bad that for such great food and nice rooftop atmosphere that the service ruined the experience. It's also a shame that we were celebrating my husband's birthday.

HStffaHdXFzdyMpYRyuGJA.text: Went there for the 1st time- heard its like new orleans food. Nice and spicy which im not a huge fan of spicy but i tried their chicken diane and ate the whole thing! Good portion for price!!!  Sat in the sunroom with only a few tables filled was a great atmosphere with a few friends. they have their own parking lot so its easy access. Theyre always on groupon too!

m_u3TKtsjS-pY1P4ySFK0Q.text: Great Cajun food In Charlotte.  Live Jazz Band upstairs was good, but loud if your are sitting up stairs.    The Creole spicy  was a nice tomato base, not to spicy.  Then I had the and Etouffee spice with all 3 meats (shrimp , crawfish, and chicken).   This had some nice heat and flavor.   I was really happy with my choice.  You are looking at about $20 per plate, but the quality is really good.   I would visit again, I just hope they fix the alligator in the food of the building which seems to have fallen over.

WctriBTgnrdshGEU_yv5Ow.text: I have been dying to try Cajun Queen for a while. I originally heard about it from my sister who was going to meet a friend out there.  I was SERIOUSLY planning to third wheel it and she didn't mind (b/c in her mind it wasn't a date)  .. but when she asked him about me tagging along he responded with a "you mean she comes on our date" Welp... at that point she realized it was a date (duh) and his ego was a bit bruised ... medium story short I never made it out there.   Cajun Queen is in an interesting location I haven't explored this part of Charlotte much.... only in passing. It's a tight space inside , we went at an off time so we had ample room but I wonder about dinner time how crowded it can be. Our waiter was super nice and explained the menu to us as well as made some recommendations on the spicy and not so spicy. I am a huge shrimp fan so I had the Diane with Shrimp. It was pretty tasty and spicy to me, and had me stuffed! It appears that they give you huge portions for your entree which is nice. I also had a side of gumbo , which  honestly tasted a bit like chili. This was my first gumbo experience so I'm not really sure what to think in terms of taste but I have heard from a friend who lives in NO that it's not supposed to taste like chili.   I came on a Sunday afternoon so there was no live band , and it was super cold so we couldn't sit on the patio. Overall I thought it was a nice meal and nice place with reasonable prices for the amount of food you receive. The parking is a bit annoying but I guess you can always park on the street!   Oh it seems that they run on reservations so I would recommend one!

jFHic82hysTnZRx1BJ6uYg.text: Well.i was highly disappointed, because I heard such good things.  I've spent years in new Orleans,and this place was far from being anything like it, in the food sense.I had the seafood gumbo, and it was like someone dumped the rosemary spice box in it. Terrible.. service was good except, just got the gumbo and the main course showed up 1 minute later. So of course, I refused it. So after 15 minutes under the heat lamp..you get the picture. .the etouffe was bland anyway. Trying cajun yard dog next. . If that's a bust, so much for cajun in charlotte.

mC4RqIFAVz9iGnF1tPUA2A.text: One of my favorite restaurants! Food is always good and service is always great! Fun atmosphere!

jzvq7zXpR3TIUBu1du5MJw.text: I've been to this restaurant many times! The food and service are great! I love the shrimp Diane! Previously parking was a nightmare, but they now offer complimentary valet! Definitely worth checking out!

H8Y1xsL0NCkZYbQLGSg0sw.text: Service is good. Gumbo was a bit watery and a pinch of salt wouldn't have hurt. Gumbo was fresh. The same tomatoe soupy water they use in the gumbo they also add to my shrimp and grits. Shrimp and andoui sausage  was good but grits its self were under seasoned i.e pinch of salt.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and grits

HUgT7QBJZdY0JaVg9xobCQ.text: We had BBQ shrimp as an appetizer and blackened catfish which was also excellent. Excellent quality food for the price.  Restaurant is on and old house, lots of character and very charming. Upstairs room with jazz band can be very loud, if you are looking for conversation, you will want to be downstairs.

6ehpvHTUT7rNqklWhT5MWg.text: Good music, great atmosphere, and awesome food!! If you haven't been to New Orleans this place is the closest you will come to it in this city. The blackened fish with rice and beans  is my favorite. The drinks are on point.. I always have a great time here!!

CMehD0K4eg0rXoBUy3ETUw.text: The wife has wanted to try this place for some time now, so when a living social came out, I figured that I would buy one.  Cajun Queen, like many restaurants, has fallen into the category of "why did it take me so long to try".  Our meal was a solid 4 star experience, and it started with great service. Both my bowl of seafood gumbo and crawfish etoufee were full of cajun flavor and spicy, just like I was looking for. The wife got some shrimp as an app and they came with another great spicy sauce.  For her main, it was her standard blackened catfish, which she thoroughly enjoyed, but took half of it home due to the hugeness of the portion. Not being a fan of catfish, I didn't taste it, but rather focused on finishing every last bit of my etoufee.  Cajun Queen is definitely a little taste of New Orleans in Charlotte, and we shall return again soon.

zQuk3DhQoNwwQVdpYYZRUw.text: Well.. I was expecting to listen to a band while eating my food... The waiter forgot my mashed potatos lol....I really wanted it... The food was ok I had the chicken diane my husband had the shrimp and grits. I can say you will leave full and will have to take a to go box.. Oh the gumbo was very under seasoned.

jqbHqE8kN3WxjUEGzhH9Cg.text: What a surprising gem of a restaurant! Each dish reminded us of our many enjoyable meals in NOLA, with a beautiful layering of flavors. The 7th Street Gator band played toe-tapping Jazz to finish a wonderful evening. Thanks!

J6XvVPtgUmOiRKTR0H6xgg.text: Visiting Charlotte from Los Angeles while husband is in town for business.   The good: The upstairs dining room has a live band and lively atmosphere. People are talking loud and enjoying themselves. Have a drink before your dinner comes for an even better time. We each had a glass of wine. The sauce from the barbeque shrimp was the best part of our meal. Not the shrimp, the sauce with bread dipped in.  The bad: Food is mediocre. We had the Cajun popcorn, which is fried crawfish that comes out partially covered in a remoulade sauce. Good, but on the salty side. Tell them to put the sauce on the side when you order so you can dip instead. The sauce took away from the dish and the ones that were smothered in the sauce remained on the place, uneaten. We each had a cup of seafood gumbo, There is no meat other than seafood in the gumbo (yay!) but it was bland and the rice seemed undercooked and flavorless. We ordered a large order of the barbeque shrimp and I got a side order of grits. The sauce in the barbeque shrimp was spicy and delicious; dip the bread from your bread basket in this tasty broth. The shrimp were on the small and limp side; not memorable at all as far as texture.   The final insult: the grits. Grits are a favorite food of mine. I'm a southern girl and make real deal, bomb-azz grits at home. The grits at Cajun Queen were those instant, "add boiling water to reconstitute," grits. Culinary blasphemy.  I will not return. If you want real grits, go to Mert's Heart and Soul.

Xoxf-1mJtKGR8TK9jUcQ8g.text: The Cajun Queen was excellent and the service was fantastic and the food was incredible I highly recommend this place. I had shrimp Creole and my friend had the blackened catfish both were phenomenal.

DbQ4As1erJHMM4J1TBytqQ.text: Incredible food. We had the bbq shrimp, etouffee 3 ways, and the diane 3 ways. I had the leftovers for breakfast this morning, couldnt resist. Our waitress, Hannah, was awesome. Cant wait to try the rest of the menu!

AXMzFtcUdp5AwAEnighW-A.text: I found a living social deal $20 for $40. Cajun food is a personal favorite of mine, especially eating the real deal in New Orleans.  The place is very cute an has a very jazzy,  New Orleans ambiance which I loved. Our server was very helpful by giving us his recommendations. I was very happy they had Abita beer and other great selections from Bird Song Brewery (which I thoroughly indulged in).  We ordered the BBQ shrimp and fried oysters as appetizers. The BBQ was amazing and full of flavor. The only downside was it was a little too garlicy. Oysters aren't my favorite but my boyfriend thought they were great.   I got the etouffee and it was delicious. Generous amounts of meat and the flavor was great. It just sucked at the end of the meal when we realized it was Easter and our coupon couldn't be redeemed :( an excuse for us to go again, which we did!

Su7hEG57lbHgzc-DjaZjhA.text: Went here for dinner and was very happy. The restaurant had a lot of character, our waiter was excellent and the food was delicious. I would highly recommend you giving it a try.

GqnomO9q8x9pROz0ruk6Vw.text: We've been wanting to go to Cajun Queen for a long time.  The stars finally aligned, and we went - with great anticipation.  It was a letdown.  I could explain by making this a long review, but I'll sum it up this way:  The entrees are on one setting: smokin'.  I like it hot, so my etoufee was pretty good.  My wife doesn't, and she tried to play it safe with a "mild" one - the barbecue shrimp.  It was smokin'.  Further, it was identical to the etouffee, except it was more like just a soup with some rice - and the tails still on the shrimp.  With every facial orifice unexpectedly on fire, she sent it back.  They charged us for both the offending volcano and the replacement.  Really?  So I would recommend CQ as a decent place if all in your party like it hot.  If anyone is cayenne-intolerant, split up and send them elsewhere.  And if you send something back, don't expect them to take it off your bill.

JH_DrVSCQ-gduUpnceuFNA.text: My husband and I have eaten here several times and always have a good experience. This time, I ordered Shrimp Etouffee which was very good and not dry. My husband ordered the Fried Shrimp and said it was better than usual.  In the past we have ordered the Cajan Pasta which is very good and the gumbo which is just okay.

PEdiZiL8K8VD-KHoDdJSqg.text: I enjoy Cajun/Creole food as a change of pace and Cajun Queen has always delivered a good enough version of things to keep me happy.  Absolutely adore the BBQ shrimp with the only problem being the "gravy" is so good that I end up eating too much bread cause I can't stop sopping it up!  The gumbo is good though on my most recent visit it could have used a bit more salt.  Same for one of the specials we ordered which was blackened mahi with a crawfish, artichoke, tomato sauce.  It was flavorful with perfectly cooked fish and very lemony artichokes though.  Also got the Etouffee (secret... you can order it 4 way where they add andouille to it to go along with the 3 way version with shrimp, crawfish and chicken).  It was really good with a perfect dark roux and just enough spice to get my forehead sweating.  The shrimp in it could be better/bigger/fresher but that's a minor thing compared to the whole of the dish.  I've had the New Orleans's seafood platter before and it's deep fried goodness to be sure.  No matter what you get, portion sizes are more than adequate.  Overall this place is not New Orleans's good, if it were, it would be getting 5 stars but it's definitely good enough for me to make it a semi-regular stop when craving those flavors.

d2SQJbRd5bqKwiJ4U1DJag.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte. I wish they were open for lunch! Always make a reservation or you will find yourself waiting for a table.  Great food, large portions, relatively reasonable prices. Blackened fish with the topping of the day is always a good choice! I also love the Diane with all 3 ($20.95) - Chicken, Shrimp, & Crawfish plus Mushrooms, Garlic, Butter, Green Onions, Parsley and Spices sauteed together and served over rice. This dish is huge so you won't leave hungry. Ask them to spice it up a bit if you like spicy food. The dishes are a little mild for my taste. Try, if you can, to save room for dessert. The warm bread pudding & the pecan pie are delicious.   Cons:  - awful parking. At least they have valet now, but who wants to wait on their car after stuffing themselves with Cajun food? - seating is packed in way too close together. If you want an intimate date spot, this is not the place. - drinks are tasty, but a bit watered down for the price. Not the place in Charlotte to go just for a drink or two. - no ice cream. Seriously. How am I supposed to eat warm bourbon pecan with no ice cream???

9mlbS5rocII0gqKW7AVaaw.text: The food and atmosphere are great. I would have not gone here based on the name but so glad I went. Also used a Groupon and the service was stellar. I'd recommend this place for a date in a minute. The live band did a great job and made the dining experience a plus. Make sure to make reservations so you can get a seat near the live band.

GwKbwNIIbUepQ1kkVki-Ng.text: Always love this place.  I've eaten here for at least 18 years, and never have never written about the awesome food and service.  Hubby and I went to celebrate our 18th wedding anniversary.  We arrived at 6:30 and was seated immediately.  I had a key lime martini, which was delicious!  We shared the BBQ shrimp,  a little spicy for me but I love the flavors.  Hubby had the blackened Mahi with crawfish artichoke topping.  I ordered blackened pork tenderloin.  Somehow my order was messed up and the server brought out pork chop.  It looked so delicious, I told him I would take it.  Not a bad choice at all.  The gravy was to die for.  The only thing missing were the plantains that came with the tenderloin, which our server brought out, on the house. Did I mention the service is grea.t here?  The portions are generous; easily two meals.  We were stuffed but still got the bread pudding to go. I have always had a great experience, delicious food and excellent service at this place.

zEbNpmCUw00_jIna-CKAIQ.text: If your in Charlotte definitely make your way to Cajun Queen, highly recommend making a reservation you will be seated quickly and highly recommend using there complimentary valet parking you just have to tip the guys, great New Orleans Cajun/creole style food in Charlotte, their Sunday brunch is awesome as well!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blacken Tilapia in Crawfish Sauce, with Mash Potatoes and Broccoli....
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and grits
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Seafood Gumbo

9m9JNXmdTEa4Qihw3Jqv_g.text: Fantastic place with fantastic food, seriously loved the sevice, the ambiance and especially the dishes. Its a nice setting too.  I had the shrimp and the ettouffe, and I will seriously visit this place everytime i'm in Charlotte

RS5aL9MIQy-qq9p5HjAndg.text: Celebration dinner for my niece...wedding dress shopping was successful that day.  The drinks were great...the food was amazing...

jNfLjWG82zX5zt4Ev1gr-g.text: We came here because of the good reviews but weren't impressed whatsoever. Very bland tasting food. Service was good though. Will not be back nor will recommend this place to anyone.

QhnTnaK_uNpvE_Zdwfqh7g.text: We went for early dinner yesterday shortly after 5:00 pm. The place was empty and the hostess tried to usher us to the back of the building to a corner as we admired the gorgeous fireplace and the empty room. We put the brakes on and elected to occupy the best table in the house. We then witnessed a small parade of people refusing to sit in the "back of the bus" also.   It was down hill from there. The waiter had the personality of, well, actually he didn't have one. The service could be described in one word, horrible. We had a groupon to rid our selves of and that's the only reason we didn't casually get up and walk out immediately. We ordered and within two or three minutes, our food arrived. Thankfully the bowls were warm and it was the only item that was warm. The food had very good flavor but the temperature was cool at best. We waited for a moment to see if Mister Personality would at least peek in on us to see if everything was satisfactory. Unfortunately, not to our surprise, he never checked on us the entire cold food meal. Normally, i would have insisted on a manager for some type of explanation but we decided to count our losses and endure it and never, ever return.   Considering this is a service industry and the waiters depend on tips as a return for excellent service, we wonder how he makes a living. My wife constantly reminds me of how I tip above and beyond 20% even when it's not warranted, but i took pride in giving this waiter exactly what he gave us.    I can only hope he was having a bad day and we found him in a moment he was not ready for our company. Maybe it was the electric blue shirt i was wearing, maybe? See where this is going? I'm not going there totally but it made us wonder what his issue was with us. Did we fit the "stereotypical they don't tip" profile? Well, guess what, we gave him the results it appeared he was looking for. Parental Tough love is what he was shown. "Son you must treat everyone with respect or you will not be rewarded!!  Our experience versus some of the other revues here makes us wonder how the service industry has fallen to mediocrity being accepted as the normal standard. Sad, very sad.

1n1NSmXzhkCk2JgRn9PV5w.text: The fried oysters are to die for.  The crayfish scampi looks great but a bit too garlicky.  The BBQ shrimp is just a-ok.  Real cool how they turned an old house into CQ.

8zYVJahj1S_5AJ4LXcAtbA.text: Wow, I can't believe that I haven't written a review of the Cajun Queen before!  I guess because it is such a "Charlotte Institution" that I just imagined I would have written about it before!  Anyhow, this is one of my fav places to go when we actually leave the "Ballantyne Bubble".    We recently purchased a Groupon and went to meet some friends there for dinner.  While I love saving the $$ associated with groupon-type specials, I really dread going to the restaurant when I know that they are going to be swamped with other customers who are also taking advantage of the savings.  It seems that most restaurants do not properly prepare for the increase in business that will result from offering the coupons.  Many times, we have noticed that there is not enough staff to handle the increased number of customers -- so the level of service and also the quality of the food suffers. But enough of that tangent...back to the Cajun Queen...  Since there were going to be 6 of us, we made a reservation.  David and I arrived before the rest of our party, so we went upstairs to the bar while we waited. The bar was pretty full and I must say, the service in the bar area suffered because of it. It took a while to get our beers and the bartender didn't bother offering an orange or a glass for my Blue Moon, which was disappointing. But I had my "big girl panties" on , so I got over it and just decided to try and enjoy the beer straight from the bottle sans l'orange.    Almost immediately after getting our beers, the hostess announced over the loudspeaker that our party of 6 was being seated.  Yay, CQ for having our table ready on time!  And yay friends for not being late! :0  After being seated in a nice big corner table, we decided to order 3 appetizers for the table to share and went with the bar-b-cue shrimp, some sort of fried crawfish thing, and fried pickles. The bbq shrimp was definitely my fav of the 3.  I personally can live without fried pickles, but the other folks in our party seemed to really like them.  I am not normally a huge fan of crawfish, but this dish was really tasty.   Sadly, there were no oysters available for appetizers (although the waiter said they had a few in reserve for one of the entrees).    For my entree, I went with the shrimp etouffee - one of my favorite dishes.  It was spot on!  David had the shrimp creole and I tasted a bite of it - it was very good as well but not as spicy as mine. (I like spicy!)   We ordered some desserts to share among the table and for some reason, ended up with 2 pieces of key lime pie and 1 of the tollhouse cookie something-or-another.  They were both good, but I wish someone at the table had ordered a bread pudding because theirs is delish!   This would have been a 5 star review, except for the fact that there were several issues with the service thorughout our meal.  Nothing egregious, but a series of little things (mostly a lack of attention to detail) that detracted from making this a 5 star experience.    But, all-in-all, we had a great time and everyone enjoyed their meal.  So, with another Groupon waiting to be put to good use, we will definitely be going back again soon!

lXfBnZ7K9xGuvSBpAfrXRw.text: We hadn't been to Cajun Queen in years but returned yesterday. The building needs major renovations - I know it is in an old historical building, but some upkeep is expected. Upon parking in the back and approaching the building l was hit with an awful smell - much like you would expect from the alleys in New York. Upon entering the restaurant the interior needs to be gutted and redone. It smells musty and is very dark. The food and service were decent but nothing to write home about.

Dy6E1haom1hBGxf3Qmz1Ig.text: Great service.  Great setting, Great food. Great value. Its a part of our regular rotation.

5PPfW2K2WYwK-eH2T8A3UQ.text: Very good restaurant.   Appetizer - BBQ shrimp just ok.  Seafood gumbo - just ok.  I just think there tomato based broths need a little more seasoning.     Entree- Shrimp Diane very good full of  flavor.  Free valet, live jazz, nice ambiance

TjmakZCvUH0sN2Q2o-H6lw.text: I've been to New Orleans many times and have experienced some great Cajun style food, so I have pretty high standards.  For the most part, from what I've ordered, CQ does a decent job.  I've been twice and ordered the Etouffee both times because it's very good.  It's got the perfect amount of spice that pairs well with an ice cold Abita.  The BBQ shrimp is a great app as well.  It's not so much about the shrimp as it is the sauce you dip the bread in.  Delicious.  My girlfriend was hit and miss with her entrees in the 2 times we've been.  The shrimp Diane was just OK.  It's a lighter consistency than the Etouffee and doesn't have the kick I look for when I'm in the mood for Cajun.  The shrimp and grits weren't good at all.  The grits were bland and the blackened shrimp didn't hit the mark.  Overall, I enjoy coming here, but the prices are a little high in my opinion.  They have a Groupon & Living Social pretty much all the time, so don't forget to grab one before you go!

hzfaibXMROBSiHLY1gXSlw.text: Great place! I've never been to New Orleans, but my dad has and he is a huge fan of Cajun food, so I thought it would be nice to take him to brunch there. We were all really impressed. My mom and I had the Creole shrimp and grits and my dad had biscuits and gravy. We also got an order of beignets. The beignets are a definite must!  The Cajun Queen is a great brunch place, we will definitely be back for dinner some time.

w-8NEgF17y-1A7Qw1Rx5CA.text: If you love cajun food, you'll love cajun queen. There is a reason they have been a hot place in Charlotte for a long time...great consistent food. I have been a customer for 17 years.

5LR3mAx4UvO7679Bc2YUdQ.text: Excellent food and excellent service. Blackened fish of any variety is great tasting I had the mahi-mahi. Very authentic and NOLA like atmosphere. Only negative is no beignets at dinner only during the brunch.

4CxNkU1nFj9b49aTylfDPw.text: LOVE this place.  I have been there twice and the food has been outstanding.  Try the catfish - it is yummy.

jE6HCRVJ8V7F1hXnfYVTNg.text: This is "our spot". Our go to date night place. We've been coming here since we were in high school, class of '99, so...that's quite some time. Gosh, now I feel old.   There are several reasons why this continues to be a favorite of ours.   First, the neighborhood is utterly charming. An old home converted into a restaurant is adds a bazillion points to character of the restaurant. It's not brand spanking new. Nothing's been razed to the ground and rebuilt in that new minimalist style. I'm a big fan of repurposing without losing the original charm. I love love love that this place is still in a house. Take a chance to walk around the neighborhood if you like old historic homes. Some of the architecture will bring a tear to your eye.   Second, live jazz band. Do I need to say more? There's something about a live band at a restaurant. It provides an old world elegance. I feel like I've taken a step back in time. Like I'm Dolly in the classic movie "Hello, Dolly" and Louis Armstrong is about to serenade me while walking to my table.   Third, the upstairs bar and patio. One of my favorite things to do is get there 15 or 20 minutes earlier then our reservation and hang out at one of the tables in the bar. We order a plate of fried oysters with remoulade sauce, a couple drinks and just enjoy the atmosphere till our table is ready. We've had some of the best conversations just leaning against the counter sipping on sweet tea and munching on oysters.   Fourth, is the bread. Once you make it to a table (be sure to make a reservation or you will wait forever especially peak times on the weekend) you will be blessed with a basket of hot rolls. These rolls are the perfect combination of crisp and chewy. I believe they come from Nova's bakery, or at least that is what I've been told by the waitstaff. It's rare to get bread service at a non Italian restaurant or chain steakhouse. Again, it's a throwback to old classics and deserves a hand clap! The only bummer is the butter. It comes ice cold which makes it difficult to spread.   Fifth, is the food. I could say that food should be in the number one spot, but all these things listed prior are working together in its favor and is why this place is our favorite. The food here is a delight. I love heat and all things spicy. However, when they use spice, it doesn't over power the flavor. It isn't just spicy. It's packed full of flavor with a bit of heat that catches you at the end. One of my favorites is the chicken Diane. Sometimes I switch it up and get shrimp Diane or all 3 Diane (which is chicken, shrimp and crawfish). The Diane is rich and flavorful with mushrooms floating in buttery goodness. It is all things pleasurable. It is a mouthful of happiness and rainbows. Seriously, it's really good. If you are not a fan of garlic and mushrooms, then do not order this. Also, plan on smelling like garlic for a day or two after eating this. No vampire will want to come near you and your lover may avoid your kisses if you don't pop a mint. Trust me. Dragon breath is imminent.   The blackened chicken is well seasoned and not dried out. It is hard to blacken chicken breast meat and still have it juicy but they nail it every time. The blackened catfish is a favorite and is a huge portion. In fact, almost all the dishes here are giant and unless you are The Rock (can you smell what The Rock is cookin'?), you might be taking home a box or two of leftovers.  Definitely try the fried oysters with remoulade. They are lightly breaded and fried. Every time we visit we just have to order them. They are tender and sweet. Perfect start to the meal.   I've had the gumbo a couple of times as a starter. I love gumbo and the one here is good. It's not the best gumbo I've ever had but it's not the worst. I like okra and andouille sausage in addition to the shrimp and I don't think I've ever had a bowl with any of those in it. However, the rice is perfectly cooked every time. So, the gumbo might be a gamble.   They do have a decent Ceasar salad for a starter. Nothing fancy. Just a good salad.   I'm usually too full for dessert, but we have had the bread pudding and the key lime pie. Both are a great way to end the meal but I'd rather have the plate of oysters.   For all the reasons stated above, this place holds the number one spot in our date nights. Cajun Queen Forever!!   P.s. - I miss seeing queen gator. :*(

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. cajun pasta - cheese tortellini w/red pepper, andouille sausage, artichokes in spicy cream sauce &amp; topped w/ blackened chicken
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Diane

ZduEGR1dSvuhcMn8zfE_7w.text: Last night was my first time going to Cajun Queen and it was Awesome! The atmosphere ambiance was great and the food was Ah-mazzing! I ordered the Diane with chicken, shrimp, and crawfish and it was EVERYTHING! My boyfriend ordered the blackened chicken...his food was really good also. The service was great and our waiter made great recommendations for appetizers and drinks. We will definetly be back.

26KJUNmgBYTYqLpSRQGdvA.text: Gumbo is disappointing if you're familiar with New Orleans food. Otherwise, they really kill it! Specials are always delicious, and the crawfish scampi is something else!

_ptZK9MUxkx-2j-k1SQELg.text: My fiance had the blackened filet, the mixed etouffee, crayfish appetizer, BBQ shrimp appetizer, and bread pudding for dessert. Everything was perfectly cooked and seasoned. Totally delicious!

QYGcOFzoCdVa9RC73jrPVw.text: So about 10 years ago I was taken to Cajun Queen by some friends when I moved here to Charlotte from Chicago. Remembering that I was not crazy about it, I still was open to going again to re try it. I searched through all the Yelp reviews to see what to order and what was the best.  First...this old House or Restaurant should be updated..obviously with the amount of people in it  at the time I left...they have the money. Stair case is wiggley..and it is just plain old..Not quaint and old ..just old. We were a big party and we had a good server named IVY, but the food left lots to be desired. We were kindly treated by our hosts to almost ever single one of the appetizers to begin with. This started with Fried Oysters that were for sure fried a couple of days ago and then reheated in a microwave! ..Fried Green tomatoes were straight out of frozen bag and not fried..just barely baked..still cold in the middle..very bland. The New Orleans style Barbequed Shrimp....tiny little salad size and in the same sauce that everything including the gumbo had.  I am going to spare you anymore..but to tell you It will for sure be another 10 years before I go back...thank goodness the company was fantastic!!

yVkWPpvWZUuI7bd9Usjg-Q.text: Although I have passed this location on many trips to  Charlotte as well as when I lived her, today is my first time sampling the cuisine. I started with a very delicious key line Martini and the popcorn  crawfish both a sweet treat. The crawfish for sure should not be missed. Next course was a very fresh and impeccably spice cup of gumbo. For my main course I chose from the specials menu a piece of Mahi Mahi topped with shrimp taoso ham roasted red peppers and mushrooms served over garlic mashed potatoes.  The presentation was beautiful and the taste divine. All if the seafood was extremely fresh.   My husband chose this Resturant to celebrate our Anniversary and I am very pleased with his choice.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Awesome dinner with the love oft life every dish was fabulous.  You can read my full review on yelp

YO3q5SyWiYalb_HQlgPalQ.text: We visited Cajun Queen for the second time tonight & I'm updating my review from 4 to 5 stars. The upgrade is largely due to the fact that this time we sat upstairs & enjoyed some great live jazz! Also, my husband got the same dish as last time (crawfish & shrimp etouffee) & called it one of his "favorite dishes ever" & I tried something new (shrimp creole) & loved it just as much as the dish I got the first time (shrimp Diane). The walls are adorned with great photos of NOLA, the home where the restaurant lives is beautiful, & the service is good. The free valet is a nice touch as street parking in at a premium in the neighborhood. Check out Cajun Queen!

7ePPHmXBrj8f37k4AZaTLg.text: Second time was amazing!!! Diane is the best i ever had. Don't forget to start with the bbq shrimp

yvpngsN2nYRWTctdXAmYcA.text: My wife and I haven't checked out to many cajun restaurants since we moved to Ft. Mill several months ago.   The problem is we've been to Nawlins on at least three occasions and sampled low country food in Charleston, SC on several visits, so although the food was pretty good, it doesn't compare to what we have experienced in NO.  We are still glad we gave it a try.

9d7w3s0reYh5Iz7Yes3CEA.text: I have been in Charlotte for over three years and had never been to Cajun Queen, but I have been listening to Jazz a lot lately and got in the mood for some live Jazz. From what I have been able to find, this is the only place in Charlotte that even has live Jazz, so I booked a reservation (through OpenTable) for my girlfriend and I on a Saturday night.  No problems with the reservation or getting us seated as soon as we got there, but I was immediately disappointed to find out that the music was only upstairs and there would be a "20-30 minute wait" for seating upstairs. We were seated downstairs, right next to the entrance--it's not great seeing everyone come and go, as well as the staff milling about the hostess stand.  Our dinner started with no live Jazz (from downstairs it sounded like pots/pans being banged together) and less than ideal seating. Then came the food. It wasn't awful, but it wasn't anything special. Certainly not good enough to warrant all of the rave reviews here or the prices they charge. It was seasoned, but still tasted very bland to me, especially the crawfish, which I thought was overcooked. The seasoning certainly did not taste Cajun to me. (I got the crawfish Creole and my girlfriend had the chicken Etouffee.)  I was definitely not pleased with my first--and last--experience at Cajun Queen, and left $60 poorer and hungry for better food, although I was full. Given that "Live Jazz 7 nights a week" is prominently touted on their website header, they really need to specify that it is only upstairs. I would have requested upstairs seating when I made the reservation, if I had known that was the only place to hear the music. Either that, or they need to remodel that old, bland house to open it up more.  Bottom line: I will not be going back.

qkQMHcEV6K4_1R1I7hAxOg.text: I was looking forward to dining at the Cajun Queen from hearing about their authentic New Orleans cuisine to seeing their Best Cajun Restaurant in Charlotte status. It wasn't horrible but it wasn't memorable. I wish I could write about the service or the exact taste of the food but it was simply meh. I got the Blackened Catfish Filet with mashed taters (which I do remember and were fabulous) but I think they forgot the blackening on it or don't know what blackening means. I had to put some hot sauce on there just to get a kick.  It's a charming place however they had some live music which I personally found loud (and this moment right here is when I turned old).If you're looking for authentic New Orleans style food like I was, I would pass.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blackened Catfish Filet, looks can be deceiving.

CrJ2tmyIpBdlveL4EfE4kg.text: I'd probably give 3 1/2 if I could but I'm going to give 4 stars for excellent service... love the live music every night, great drinks, outdoor patio.  I like the old house. It feels like going over an old family members house but better.  The food was good overall.  Appetizers Bbq shrimp sauce is great with bread and the Crawfish ceviche was flavorful and spicy!  So when my gumbo came it tasted blah to me. Not very flavorful.  So my dad ate it and liked it. My shrimp and grits were ok but the shrimp was bland and the skin on my sausage was hard. My sister had the dish several times before and said it didn't taste the same. Liked the grits though. tasted the blackened catfish... moist and delicious. Tasty desserts, but nothing to write home about. I do think it's a bit overpriced.   The restroom paper towel machine was broken. And no other dryer or towels available. I know is out of their control but maybe need a backup.  It's quite annoying.  Great place for appetizers, live jazz and drinks.

EJ7MVOmGLpWTISudrwhOIA.text: Food was very flavorful. I had the Diane with shrimp and my husband had the salt and pepper catfish. Both dishes were great!!

p7FeJlRFE1BYR0RDwKYKOw.text: Love the atmosphere, great staff, drinks were amazing and the food was delicious. The 7th Street Gator Band was really cool & they brought that Nawlins flare. Thanks again to staff Aaron for being attentive and welcoming. I will return soon.

Dzz25WH5kVUS52Xf_hUwlw.text: By and large, the food is almost always four to five stars. My latest experience was over all good but the usually great Crawfish Scampi was way off base. With everything else excellent as usual, my wife and I still had a very enjoyable meal. We will most definitely continue to recommend Cajun Queen!

DY-2axxrjP1rbMofwDqxAw.text: I really don't see what the whole hullabaloo is about this place. Food is adequate. Staff is somewhat attentive but as for me and my wife we will probably never return here again. It just was so so. Nothing over-the-top.

s-NDgEuWZHdSekOsuSP-jw.text: The Cajun Queen is probably one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte. Their crawfish etoufee is amazing, and their creole shrimp/ chicken is mouth-watering! I also love going their when they have live music.

wLjodGU6bg23gI8Kt5s7bA.text: Ever go out to eat and order the condiments you want with your meal order? THE CONDIMENTS CAME OUT BEFORE THE MEAL!!!!    BOOM!    (Biggest pet peeve ever! I didn't ask for lemons and butter because I plan to gargle with it after dinner, I want it to put on my hot steak or fish or whatever I am eating that evening)  Kudos to the bar staff and Melissa for excellent service.  Perfect dining experience minus the hot date but that wasn't Cajun Queens fault.   Cheers!  Etoufee is still the best in charlotte.

bkx8xrlQDhoptmko-mSGAg.text: Wow.. this place is incredible. Everything from the atmosphere, the service and the food. I've eaten at some real authentic places in New Orleans and Cajun Queen is right up there with some of them. This is the best Cajun restaurant in Charlotte. We ordered the BBQ shrimp, fried seafood platter and the etouffee. Highly recommend all three. We'll certainly be back

BoFwIP7pyspsHFf6QOJUhQ.text: The food was good. The service sucks!!! The staff is unfriendly and rude. I had a reservation for a big party and we were treated like unwanted guest. If the staff was on point including the valet parkers who were also rude then I would give it a 4 but honestly we will not be returning back!!!

t9nKn0k6ld-7AaOQIKozKQ.text: Very nice place!  Recommended as a good date night place by a coworker. Our bill plus 3 drinks was about $87 including tip. They accept reservations and offer valet parking. The wait staff was very friendly.  Our waiter suggested a few nice bars in the area - which we appreciated because we are not familiar with the Charlotte area.   We enjoyed the food and the ambiance.  My wife ordered the blackened chicken and she thought it was great...great flavor and juicy.  The portions were perfect.  We also enjoyed their pecan pie and key lime pie...both quite tasty.   The meal was excellent the server was excellent also!    We will definitely visit again...

398CIvNNheJJlPxDaCKPzA.text: Always a great experience! The live jazz music was delightful and the food was AMAZING! Get the BBQ Shrimp appetizer and Shrimp and grits for your entree! You will not be disappointed. Will be back again soon!!!

-Eob6j1utVvJ4lOF6szf8Q.text: Disappointing dinner at Cajun Queen.  Been dining at Cajun Queen for many years and wanted to enjoy Mother's Day meal at this restaurant.  Unfortunately, the food was quite bland.  The fried oysters were cold in the middle.  My favorite New Orleans Platter lacked flavor.  The restaurant was not crowded so they have no excuse for such bad food.  No one at my table had a delicious meal.   The server was not too good either. Normally enjoy this place...but not too much on this visit.

OJcnluwZ3Sqb2XNvxrArxA.text: Nothing beats their bbq shrimp...it's liquid Crack, I'd rob my mother if i had to, just for another dish. But the service was outstanding, Shanna (sp?) was extremely knowledgeable about the menu and efficient as well as friendly, almost felt like a home meal...except for the fact that i can't cool like that! Great meal, great srevice and as usual great atmosphere. Look forward to our next visit.

5e57osvhoJlfYbHrRe6csA.text: Mmmm-mmm! I definitely picked the right place for my birthday dinner. We showed up slightly early and got to mingle in the bar for a few minutes- what a fun bar! I'm going to have to go back just for that alone. Then we were seated in the downstairs porch/sun room, or as my grandmother would say, "on the veranda."  We had some trouble communicating with our server- one guest was late, and I think he was waiting on her to get there before we ordered drinks, but I can't hold that against him as he was just triple-sat. Next time I'll be clearer- alcohol now!  They have a great drink selection, including creatively-named specialty cocktails. I was tempted to order the "Seventh Street Stumbler" and see if it held up to it's name, but in the end, a glass (um, or three) of white wine went well with my dinner.  The food was out of this world! We had the fried green tomato appetizer and devoured it. For entrees, I had the blackened salmon special with crawfish and artichokes, and my friends had the catfish, the chicken Diane, and the shrimp and grits, and we were all so busy making yummy noises no one could talk. I think we planned to try each others but they all disappeared so quickly we never got around to it.   We were too stuffed for dessert but that bourbon bread pudding is calling my name for next time. And there will be a next time.

MiRHUHPc5c6CrJ4WhFvNyQ.text: I want to love Cajun Queen, I really do. I try to give restaurants the benefit of the doubt when they fall short, understanding that things happen sometimes outside of their control. That said, Cajun Queen has continually failed to provide a satisfactory dining experience for us on 3 consecutive visits. The food alone would earn 4 stars for the advertised menu prices - although they do offer special discount deals fairly often. The customer service however is consistently dissapointing, to the point where I am convinced that the management staff needs to be changed. The attitude toward customers is not one of "How can I help make your experience better?" it instead seems to me that all of the workers are more into talking to eachother while dropping items at tables without saying a word. This is not just one bad egg, it seems to be everyone from the water boy to the manager. A friendly restaurant employee is the exception to the rule at Cajun Queen. In my opinion the lack of customer service ability is a direct result of the management failing to instill those abilities in their employees.   If you get seated at the two person table in a hallway between the kitchen and 2 dining rooms just ask to be moved. That table is terrible and does not belong in any restaurant that has any respect for its customers. And that's just it, there seems to be a lack of respect amongst the staff for their customers here. The hostess at the door stares at her computer while talking to you without ever making eye contact, the bread boy just drops the bread at your table without a word. Water boy, same thing. Server doesn't exchange pleasantries, just straight to drinks and apps. Manager walks by and talks to his buddy about the game but doesn't acknowledge the guest at the table as his conversation is overpowering ours. Workers come barelling through with a table they are moving without saying 'pardon me' or anything at all. On the way out the door the manager guy just stands there staring at the hostess' computer screen without so much as saying thanks have a good night...  We have kept returning to Cajun Queen always hoping our next experience would prove to be better, but sadly I think we have now given up. The food earns a 4 star recomendation and it is worth experiencing, but the service is 2 star at best.

X4bdcquLDzI2oSYHKcq_5Q.text: Tried to use Groupon, but it was denied due to way too small of a use window.  Food was OK, but very expensive.  Shame on Cajun Queen and shame on Groupon for not allowing a reasonable time window to use the coupon.  Not going back.  This was a real jerk move on their part.  This was our first visit after living in Charlotte for 20+ years.  I guess they didn't want a return visit.

Ysn4agh9ul_xaQ2Eb5jm7A.text: I honestly love the Cajun Queen! From the cozy atmosphere inside (which offers the same fun and authentic feeling of any fine restaurant located on Bourbon Street), to the jazz band playing upstairs, all the way down to the blackened items listed on their menu, this place has made my trip worthwhile every time.  You can usually find a "Groupon" online before heading out which will make your visit a little lighter on the wallet -  or in my case allow for a few more drinks from their New Orleans style drink selections. That's just my two cents! i hope this review helps and I encourage you to give this big two story house with the large green gator out front a try if Cajun cooking sounds good to you.

gYksVwrnPM5KWgQ1Jrfznw.text: Great Brunch on a very rainy morning. Wait staff was friendly and helpful in every way. And food was excellent. Don't skip the Benet's that come with a strawberry sauce as a starter for all to share; they were delicious! As were the Fried Green Tomatoes appetizers. The eggs Benedicts were great and famous shrimp and grits. No complaints. Very delicious food, prepared to perfection. Will definitely come back. Thank you Cajun Queen.

_lKbNTZXWRbwXGCUaR6e4A.text: The food was underwhelming and predominately salty. The service was pushy. We were served bread before we had any silverware. As soon as my girlfriend received her entree a bus-boy came and asked if she was finished (no joke). I still hadn't received my entree and when it finally arrived I was served the Chicken Diane (I had ordered the etoufee). They quickly corrected it. However, without the Groupon this restaurant's service and quality do not match up to the price on the menu. Additionally, there was no live music (which is mentioned as a drawing card in most reviews). We visited on a Saturday night at 9pm.

vDKtG1d2R8kRzw_h7BULKg.text: I had the absolute best experience ever at this location on yesterday evening !!!! The Diane and the Mahi special were both a thing of beauty!!! Wasn't crazy about the gumbo the roux wasn't thick and rich it was more of like an okra soup. The flavors where good though. The service was impeccable!!!!! Every single staff member that past by spoke and was pleasant! They escorted us in and did whatever it took for us to be comfortable as my friend uses a wheel chair. They made space where there wasn't space and made sure that we were happy! I was floored!!!! Because we had just arrived there after leaving Kenndy's Irish Pub around the corner where we were treated like crap! I was so excited and pleased with every single thing at this location!!!! Hadn't been there in years and didn't intend on going but soooooooooo happy I did!!!!!

Al5p1pl3PuRta7H4g1100A.text: I really love the Cajun food here. Shrimp etoufee excellent. It's even better when there is live jazz too. It's an old house, so the place has a distressed feel.

ov61LZIc3Y96sarltw9eyw.text: It was ok. I don't see all the fuss with the restaurant. The food was decent but not spectacular and drinks needed more flavor (Bloody Mary)

A9QyKgBShkgwKZ1NS80tPA.text: Cajun Queen is a really quaint restaurant. It has an old Southern feel to it. The wait staff is PHENOMENAL, very hands on and attentive. Now lets get to the food...AMAZING. Sampled a few items from others and it was delicious. The table was thoroughly pleased. I didn't know they offered Brunch. It was a welcoming surprise. Will be back

XuRWSURd9UN0ARKEVzho9Q.text: The girlfriend is from New Orleans so she had high expectations and she definitely was not disappointed! The food was awesome, the portions are amazing! I feel the best part is the atmosphere and friendly staff; the feel is very cozy and homely and our waiter was so polite! When we asked for his opinion on the best Chardonnay, he didn't try to upscale but gave us his personal favorite. We will definitely be back!

Idw2wVU8ngUeNIkQwKCMXQ.text: This was a wonderful place! The food was so good . I took my wife for a birthday dinner.  I will give you some advice ..please make a resveration

4CGuBGDcID1pmz0fAiBbBQ.text: Love this place and think of it first for special nights out. The crawfish etoufee is excellent. Everything we've order (from the efficient wait staff) has been great.  Every time I go I can't wait to return lol Make this your destination for authentic Cajun dining!

5ywMtQZ5pF7SRNGanLrLSA.text: The service is always impeccable, the excellent live jazz that's present upstairs daily, and obviously the most important part -- the never disappointing food which led me back to what may have been my 10th time dining at Cajun Queen. I moved to Washington D.C. about two years ago and every opportunity I have to come back to Charlotte, I make sure to include Cajun Queen on that itinerary.   My buddy had the blackened catfish with garlic mashed potatoes and the seasonal topping of the day and I had to stick with my personal fav, the chicken based etouffee served over rice. It's so rich with flavors, a good amount of spice, and just the right size for a hearty meal.   Thank you Cajun queen for never disappointing.

zI4CaJzwshP5xpLu5NGV8w.text: If you want crawfish, this is the place. The etouffee is to die for. I look forward to coming back and trying out brunch.

YYIPrqc0Qcu__bFHi7inbA.text: Had a party of 10 here on Friday at 6:30pm. When i arrived, table was ready for us. I was the first to sit and wait for the others.   Layout: 4/5 it can be a little confusing but with the hostess leading we were ok.   Hostess: 5/5 the two hostesses were great and lead us to our table.   Waiter: Brandon, 5/5 he was great. Make sure my water was filled. Never missed anything.   Food: Gumbo soup 2/5. Very watery. And left a funny after taste in my mouth. I had a spoonful and sent it back   Fried catfish w/mashed potatoes and broccoli 5/5. I truly enjoyed this dish.. it wasn't over fried. Fall apart and melt in my mouth that go perfectly with the mashed potatoes!   With my surrounding, the food except the gumbo and the service. I genuinely enjoyed this place.

5PvX4Bj1a-oIj8h2EOF9xQ.text: They have live music some nights and it is a wonderful atmosphere for a casual date. The food is great and portion size is generous. I look forward to coming back again soon!

G6-flLwWicrbcCXKeN3VBA.text: Fantastic food and atmosphere! Live Cajun band upstairs if you want a lively evening. Or downstairs is more quiet and intimate.

9mbbDKByyt57-L9edzJHBw.text: Excellent food! The seafood was cooked to perfection, grits were creamy and tasty and the bread pudding was delightful. We dined on the level with live music and it took me back to my days in NOLA! Artwork displayed celebrated the culture and art of Cajun country. Service was laid back, but embodied the southern charm of the venue. Valet parking available and reservation made via Yelp allowed us immediate seating. I would definitely return upon any future visits to Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tree with Mardi Gras beads like on the parade route!
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bread pudding. yummy!
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried seafood platter with red beans and rice.

xJ6Cu6uxlpYzKI-2ncwI_g.text: Everytime we drive down 7th Street and I see that Crocodile standing in front of Cajun Queen felt I had to go.  I love a good jazz place!!  Well finally after 10 years in Charlotte and thanks to a Groupon we finally went to Cajun Queen on a Saturday night, at 5:00 pm mind you.  Not even the dinner crowd, but the senior crowd.  We arrive before 5:00 only to be confused with the parking lot.  Directly behind the Cajun Queen there must be MAYBE 8 spots and next to the Cajun Queen is a hair salon with an empty parking lot that doesn't want to allow people to park there while they are clearly closed...ahem, I digress.  The Cajun Queen valet did run over to us before we sealed our fate with the eternal fate of a parking boot (I think the hair dresser has a camera watching from a remote area...just saying).  We ending up parking across the street.  Not too bad, luckily there wasn't heavy traffic because my slow poke kid was with us. It was super crowded, even at 5:00 pm.  Luckily we made a reservation.    They seated us upstairs which I thought :WOW !!That's neat, it's going to lovely up there."  Well, not so much.  There are too many tables for too small of a space.  I was butt up against the buffett where the servers were clearly trying to maneuver around me to get their extra plates, water, etc. I think if they would get rid of 3 or 4 tables it would have been a better atmosphere.  The servers were always trying their best to get around the crowded room. The tables are small and wobbly.  Just for a joint like this, I expect better.   Being such a small place it was extra noisey, not from the jazz band, but just from people laughing extra hard, or talking super loud, or what have you.  No close intimate dinners for you!  Our poor server was a bit slow on getting our order and taking care of us.  I just think Cajun Queen tries to do too much with too little.    On to the food!  Well after several minutes of "I don't like anything and I don't want shrimp", our pickiest of eaters chose mashed potatoes and sausage (two sides) as his meal.  Guess what folks?  He actually liked it and ate half of it.  He was trying to convince us of getting a 16 ounce steak. We laughed at that one...well my husband and I anyway, picky eater was convinced he could eat a whole steak.  HHAHAHA.  I had the gumbo and house salad, my husband and other kid had shrimp diane.  All which were pretty darn good.     The jazz band came after we had dessert.  They were cute and not too loud which amazed me because we were one table away from the stage.  So meh, we won't be back.  For a family of four it came to around $80.00 including 2 sodas, and 2 desserts, but not including the Groupon.

jD0v3hlAMcspf9a9lIBnKQ.text: Food is okay, I really love Cajun food and travel often to New Orleans, maybe I'm too spoiled by that. I expected a more authentic experience. Nice ambient.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States

SGsZ5sg1CZnFvklxvsMDnA.text: I really liked this place! This restaurant is located in a very old house, so it's got a lot of character and ambience. We ate outside, which was nice, although we missed hearing the live jazz band.   Lengthy cocktail menu with lots of great New Orleans favorites like hurricanes, swamp water, and such.   We had the fried green tomatoes, gumbo, and etoufee. Very delicious!   Our waitress was really attentive and nice. Excellent server.   Parking seemed a little daunting at first, but luckily, we scrounged up some cash (we're usually a debit card-only household) so we could tip the valet guys. Valet itself is free.   We will be back!

MD2yP81nvN7dAx_ffxvAgg.text: Nightly live jazz music on the second floor, but you have to ask to be seated in that room. Food was good. The options we wanted to order all had a 1/2 portion, which was great as we could try more dishes! Ordered the Crawfish Scampi, etouffee, BBQ shrimp, wash day (rice, beans and andouille) and fried green tomatoes. Environment was happy, music was great, and food was delicious!  Recommend coming for a girls night out on the town type of evening!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States

bbhYCbcnIwRcK3Yqcd6Pew.text: This was a very very nice place to visit. The atmosphere is wonderful the fireplace in the dining room downstairs beautiful upstairs we listen to jazz music and it was very nice. The food is very Charlotte like even though the menu says it's like New Orleans it's very Charlotte North Carolina. That doesn't mean it's not very nice and very good it's just not New Orleans.

bD7CxtAEQhT2M--oPcQKzA.text: If you're looking for a taste of Louisiana, it is here! Well for a place in Charlotte at least. The atmosphere is wonderful & the jazz music they play is fun! If you sit upstairs, it might be a little too loud.  Our favorite dishes that we try to get every time are the following: 1. Crawfish Diane with Mashed Potatoes 2. BBQ Shrimp  3. Mahi Mahi with Shrimp Topping (Special of The Day) 4. Fried Oyster Appetizer   They also have great drinks! We always get the  1. Swamp Water 2. Gator Juice

x3mRkgvbEy1amjekCXBBuA.text: Food was EVERYTHING!!! If you're looking for good cajun cuisine with tons of flavor, Look no further. This is a must try "Hidden Gem"!!!! The BBQ SHRIMP was Amazing... be sure to get extra bread to sop up that broth. The service was great and nice cozy atmosphere. Did mention I'm in love with this place!!!
