fRu0h4Dm4h6SWOnrI3Yjgw.text: I expected the food here to be amazing and flavorful, but it was very bland.  Definitely not what I expected for Cajun cuisine. The wait staff is very slow and it seemed like all the ethnic folks were shoved into the back room.

3Cg31-ZrPEio1hZTOGDTRA.text: My friend suggested this place when I was visiting Charlotte! First of all, it is located in an old renovated home!  It felt very cozy and felt-home like.  Upon arrival, the service was great and even asked us if we made reservation.  You can make a reservation through Yelp if you wish to!    Another great thing about this place is I was able to find a Groupon deal which definitely helped($25 for $40 worth).  I got the Shrimp Scampi which was very well done!  The shrimp was soft and tender and the tail was still on!  I also got the fried pickles which were just delicious!   Overall, I had a great experience and would definitely recommend it if you are in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp Scampi
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Friend Pickle w/ Ranch Dressing

w0EitfX10X7w8MioGuVlXg.text: Stopped by Cajun Queen for a friends birthday, and the atmosphere was nice. We sat on the patio and enjoyed some wine and good conversation. I know my fellow diners had fantastic meals, however my 3 star rating is for their lack of vegetarian dishes. There wasn't anything on the menu (aside from ordering a plate full of sides and that get really old) so the waiter suggested the one item they had available for veggie friendly patrons. It was sufficient but not something I would normally order. Either way, I would certainly go back if there were a few more entree options for peeps like me.

wfpC12qzshw7fnF6Qd2vTQ.text: I was in town for a business event and had a group of 15. We were also celebrating a birthday. We sat on the second level to take advantage of the live music. I initially thought it was going to be too loud because of the close quarters, but it wasn't. The 2 man band sang happy birthday to our celebrant. The food was excellent. Everyone in the group enjoyed their meal. We will definitely go back on our next visit to Charlotte.

P3Gj088cEP2FYqq2h64OCw.text: This is one of the few spots in Charlotte that I constantly find myself going back to. I like trying different things at restaurants, but every time I go in I can't help but get the Crawfish Scampi to start off and the Chicken Diane as an entree. The flavors and seasoning are unbelievable and the atmosphere is great upstairs with a Jazz band playing every night.

Dl_pzoyKlybQ1bpifkncMg.text: Best brunch I've had in Charlotte so far. I got shrimp and grits and my boyfriend got the French toast. Best shrimp and grits I've ever had and he literally said "if I'm on death row, this would be my last meal" about the French toast. Go here!

11qDD-Xnsm0xbd9bQSxW-g.text: Terribly busy during the weekend evenings and the service seems to suffers. But not their fault because they seem to overbook themselves to the point of having customers wait for a while at the upstairs bar. We waited about 20 minutes for a reservation to be ready. The bar was packed and had only one bartender, so it was also very slow.  That said, the food was really AMAZING. Best Cajun place outside of New Orleans, by far. Definitely worth a visit. The Diane and Etoufee dishes are really great. Went there again on a Sunday afternoon and the service was much better.  The drinks are outstanding too!

E-0dkih9Lm1wBoID3nvdTw.text: This was my favorite restaurant in Charlotte 20 years ago.  Many new restaurants have come to town since then...and this is still my favorite.  The food is authentic, the ingredients are fresh and high-quality, the service is friendly, and the atmosphere is great.

h6DV2xCsVWhsvGefkWWbPA.text: We love the Queen and once again we were not disappointed. Outstanding all the way around. One of the best ambiance restaurants I have ever been in. Highly recommend the crawfish scampi appetizer and blackened or fried catfish. Their complimentary valet parking is the icing on the cake. Great place!

pL27i7kRpUUGn5bKOUg5eQ.text: The owner could care less about customers. He is the rudest man. The food is so so. Nothing Cajun about it. They did not use our Groupon correctly. That was fine with us, but why couldn't the server tell us. Not just toss the bill on the table and walk away. Save your money and dine elsewhere. The Cajun Yard Dog is far better, and far more Cajun cuisine.

Jm_VmcEOfiy5eH0kNqpnhg.text: BBQ shrimp... Fried oysters... RBR...  All brilliant.

U-3dLAeMsP4wpesKZn1aCA.text: Had a reservation and was seated on time ordered shrimp scampi and they came out with shrimp diane, took it back and i waited finally brought right dish out but my husband was wlmost done with his meal so he watched me eat, it was good but didnt enjoy my experience because i felt bad for my husband watching me so i ate fast they did give a free desert that was incredible

H7eTVNhVVqEraOGuJ9dnLQ.text: I would absolutely recommend anyone wanting to visit to make prior reservations. It's an intimate environment set up in a converted home.  We ordered appetizers consisting of cajun popcorn((crawfish tails), fried green tomatoes, and Nawlins BBQ shrimp. They all were delicious! The BBQ shrimp was the all time best!  The sauce that they are made in is great for dipping the complimentary rolls into.  It's spicy but not too hot even though we typically enjoy hot and spicy food.  Entrees... Fried Catfish and red beans and rice were the only downfalls. The red beans and rice lacked seasoning. The catfish was not cooked crispy. It was extremely wet and flimsy. I returned it and it came out hot and crispy! Crawfish, shrimp, chicken Diane was amazing and Extremely flavorful!  All in all I will be visiting this restaurant again when in Charlotte.

Tt8F-8kgsY9WT8Zf3LMxCQ.text: I love the cajun queen! It is in my top 10 faves in Charlotte. The service is not always the best but the food more than makes up for it! It can be a little pricey but the portions are a good size and full of seafood!

KD8QFv6GVCqx8OUqiFNJWA.text: Coming from the northeast, me and Cajun anything were not acquainted until I came to the Cajun Queen. Most Cajun food is not vegan friendly, but the chef at Cajun Queen went the extra mile and created me a veg-friendly dish! I had a Creole sauce mixed with a TON of veggies and served with rice on the side.  The atmosphere is what sells me on the Cajun Queen, an intimate setting that is laid out in a big house. Upstairs has jazz music, while downstairs has a bunch of little tables for small parties.  I'll definitely be back! Cajun/Creole is definitely a different type of food than what I usually grab.

huy6aoEbtgR832zUe6OV5g.text: Oh yeah.  I was there in the late 90s and loved it.  My first trip back to Charlotte in 15 years and this place was my first stop.  Excellent meal, especially the crawfish appetizer.  No way I wait that along again before getting back out there!

bldoNK1RgJeLqMz0p8p_QA.text: Loved it.  Loved, loved, loved it.  The shrimp and grits were awesome.  The gumbo was awesome.  The service was great.  The wine list was impressive.  I was totally won over, and want to go again.  Now.  Today.  Sigh.  Too bad I'm half a country away.

7k1nL-WojYHcFlKH3IxqOg.text: Food is always great and service is good! Best brunch in Charlotte. My son loves the beignets and they sell out quick...

Y7w398Qwn_ZA64YRGKgJXQ.text: Excellent crawfish ettouffe and service. An added plus was the jazz trio upstairs. We had the fixed price dinner for Restaurant Week. Perfect dinner.

FvLlyiAMyVlzHW1ohwD5MA.text: Food:   Fried Oysters were nice and crispy on the outside and delightfully gooey on the inside.. The perfect spice for both the oysters and the shrimp.  On the main course... Lay down a bed of rice, throw some "jerk like" chicken and two different kinds of red bean delicousness and BAM... You are set!   Now, I like my food to have a KICK but this was, what I would call, a controlled KICK.  Just enough spice to get the tongue and mouth salivating and begging for more.  You could always add some more Louisiana hot sauce if you wanted.  Then, to top it off.... bread pudding.. Oh Lordy Lord Lord, the bread pudding.. SOOOOOooo good.  I would go back just for the bread pudding.    Atmosphere/Staff:   Bo, the bartender made a mean Hurricane and had extensive knowledge of the shrimp apps that proved to be very helpful.  Everything about the two story restaurant was uniquely decorated and made you feel comfortable and relaxed.  The upstairs outdoor patio was quaint and cozy with a classy touch.  Overall, simply wonderful.    Please give it a try.. You wont regret it.     Enjoy  -Ian M.

sObJOzeU_ePM41BRkJz6LQ.text: Great place to eat... Food is excellent. Always enjoy.  Haven't found Cajun as good anywhere else in this area.

0tsT4fH4-AHLsulXDnBSCw.text: We made reservations online for 7:15; arrived around 7:00 and were seated within 10 minutes. Service was outstanding! We never waited for drink refills; the staff was always on top of it, even though the place was packed. Fried Green tomatoes for an appetizer was perfect! We split the Chicken Diane - delicious! Bourbon pecan pie for dessert. Great dinner, great music, atmosphere was on point. We did sit in the same room as the band (which we requested) so it was a little loud to be having conversation but we enjoyed the music very much. Definitely recommend and will be back!

T1XxkUaEqonJLIOCBJ2j3g.text: Cajun Queen was a great choice. Great atmosphere, live jazz. I had Salmon topped with shrimp, great portions. I left stuffed. Bread pudding was amazing, I will be returning soon.

e-AoZXGP_MgmE3dVNrv3_w.text: Update!  Just had my usual as discussed below- crawfish etouffee. Have to confirm my earlier review. It's just the best. Maybe my personal favorite meal in Charlotte. At least in the top 5.   Earlier Review: Fantastic and flavorful crawfish etouffee-  I like mine spicier than normal but it's just perfect.  Wonderfully satisfying.  A top meal to remember.   Have been going to Cajun Queen off and on for 20 years, so it's about time for this review. Highest recommendation. Other dishes sampled and liked were the Shrimp Diane and a basic fried shrimp.   Decent desserts too. Had the warm bourbon pecan pie (tasty but not much bourbon in it).

KQXAcLsrvm3cJD4Pxc4r5w.text: We knew it would be crowded but never expected how loud it was. OSHA would have require hearing protection if it was called there. Absolutely out of controlled. Clear example of how to take a great restaurant with great food with large (even too large) servings and add it with a server who could care less, and you get a rotten time. Front of the house is a mess while the back of the house purrs. Do not ever, ever sit in the back right room with tile floors - it will leave you deaf. We quickly ate and ask for the deserts to go. Ownership needs to solve this problem because frankly, it's not worth it to go there, great food or not.

K68V3ofkn-1IYHr5dUSG2A.text: Good New Orleans food but a little bit over priced.  I would definitely try it once. Make reservations and ask for upstairs seating near the live music...which they have playing each day of the week. The drinks were excellent and the fried fish made the trip worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gumbo
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States

9Pl84qs9FJLe3sWF7-nJZw.text: Fortunate enough to return during Restaurant Week. I elected to order off the special Restaurant Week menu that was a great deal for $30: wine, shrimp gumbo, blackened Mahi Mahi with crawfish & sun dried tomatoes, and key lime pie. The Mahi Mahi was huge and out of this world good. My wife ordered off the menus & went for the dinner salad, 8 oz filet mignon & veggies. Her steak was superb. Live jazz, fun place, excellent service, delicious food.

qEew2cmi59BZg_TLrQ9EeQ.text: I came to Cajun Queen on a whim Friday evening to try their restaurant week servings. Of course we didn't have reservations, but luckily were able to sit right away after grabbing two stools in their bar area upstairs. It turned out to be a great little spot overlooking the valet area so there were plenty of people watching opportunities :)  I got the 4 course pre fixe - glass of chardonnay, cup of gumbo, crawfish etouffee, and bread pudding - for $30. For the quantity and quality of food, I was impressed. The only thing I didn't like of my meal was the chardonnay - but I almost consider that a freebie since most restaurant week menus don't include alcohol.   I really liked that both the gumbo and etouffee were spicy and flavorful, but not drowning in salt. I love cajun food, and really appreciated that Cajun Queen could satisfy the Bayou flavor and seasonings without being overly buttery or overly salty (think Zatarain's).  While we were there, a live jazz band was playing downstairs. Great spot for date night.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crawfish étouffée
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blacked catfish

FkZ4h5B5KtNrXcWLKxU6Kg.text: The BEST, BEST little known secret place in Charlotte! The food is amazing. Please, please check them out. If necessary or unsure purchase a Groupon .. I promise you, YOU will NEVER be disappointed. The staff is friendly, professional and all around joyful. If you're coming to Charlotte, I'm taking you to Cajun Queen!

H4U48JAOnRDap6mPKtShFg.text: We liked it enough to bring friends on our second visit.  Ambiance: 3 stars  First off, I find this place to be unique as its in an old home that's been converted to a restaurant.  The space between tables and the table tops are small and the noise level is load. I suggest a reservation if you don't want to wait along time to be seated.  It's quaint.  Food: 4 stars  The four of us had three rounds of Shrimp and grits and one dish of the vegetarian plate (not on the menu, special request).  We all agreed, the grits had a very good taste with the cheese and creole sauce but they were a little runny this time around.  We all enjoyed the andouille sausages, but the blackened grilled shrimp had a taste to it that we couldn't make out, and didn't enjoy.  I ate 3 of 8 and left the rest, same for my wife.  Our guest ate his but kept making a comment that he couldn't identify the odd taste.   Service: 5 stars  Our waiter was friendly but distant, apologized if he had to interrupt our conversation and was quick to keep our drinks filled.  Plates were quickly cleared and food came to us hot.    Extras: Valet parking is free, but bring a few bucks tip.

GMKFm07rkBbTMtB7_mgp3g.text: I had not heard of this place until I saw the Groupon for it and purchased it to try something new.  I had no idea what to expect after I went on their website, oddly I didn't read Yelp reviews first (which I normally do).  I went with a friend and we split the fried oyster appetizer, suggested by our waiter and I got the shrimp diane, also a recommendation of our waiter. We ate upstairs and the bar area wasn't too busy since we went during a week night so we had very good and attentive service. Everything I ordered which I finished off with bread pudding dessert was extremely tasty, so much that I am still thinking about it today which is why I am leaving this review! I have already recommended this place to others and can't wait to go back.  The Groupon deal they run for $25 worth of $40 makes it a great deal too.  However, I don't need a Groupon to go back!

-_VhddEHNbW5ExNWcEM-CQ.text: This place is absolutely amazing! Found it on Groupon and gave it a try. Drinks were perfect. Food was delicious. I will definitely be a returning customer :)

iwkrcdpY0V29-F8lmaMezQ.text: My husband and I ate here. I had the Blackened Pork Tenderloin and it was great. The waiter was attentive.

pXbEE_FVKiDCoV8wswG5eQ.text: The food was awesome! The Shrimp and grits was superb and the fried green tomatoes were awesome. It's so hard to find such good southern food in Boston and to come down to Charlotte to visit this beautiful city is well worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried crawfish tails taste like popcorn chicken. Very good.
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried green tomatoes. Yum!
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and grits are definitely on point.

VP61t_TVfZJeAyPBdgBB4g.text: Food was excellent!!! Service was excellent! Found this gem on Groupon and we will definitely return soon!

qRaaqg_zfpCk7bxtgWkJ9g.text: Love NOLA? Then you'll love Cajun Queen. The atmosphere is beautifully inspired bu the best New Orleans has to offer. The food is AMAZING, seriously amazing. i had the gumbo and the New Orleans Platter and it was oh so tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. New Orleans Platter
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bourbon Pecan Pie. Diane with the NOLA Trinity. New Orleans Platter. Gumbo.

-nFpXfBzlbkI6kviG6Q5FA.text: The food and service was excellent! We loved the ambiance and the live band was a bonus. Husband ordered the shrimp and grits, only complaint was the shrimp were a little tough. I had the chicken Diane. It was wonderfully flavored without too much spice. We loved the BBQ shrimp appetizer! We will be back!

V9D66prWO4s2u4d5VP8xPw.text: The vibe was just what I was looking for. Laid back but not too quiet or isolated. It said it was jazz night but maybe they left, we arrived at 9:30 & it close at 10:30. We had the BBQ Shrimp & Bayou Platter. I don't mind spicy but when I was half way through, I wasn't sure I could finish it bc my taste buds were disappearing. Spicy! The Bayou Platter was very spicy. However the waiter said we could've asked for mild spice. Overall, awesome vibe & if you can handle spicy food this is your place. 3 stars bc of the heat...no dig at the restaurant. Just a preference thing.

LeDHhQjlptL6dDYoM4qVhQ.text: Great meal with live jazz. Had the Mahi with a topping of garlic, butter, artichoke, and Crawfish...wife had the creole pasta. Both were excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States

nKyB6njvIv-kdTNtCjqDWA.text: Date Night at Cajun Queen was delectable!  My husband had the shrimp 'n grits and I enjoyed the etouffee! We were running 5 mins behind, but we were still seated within 5 minutes of our arrival.  Highly recommend for date night!  If you're looking for the live jazz atmosphere, be sure to request this when making your reservation.  Thanks, Fernando!  Your service was just right.

8Ds_LwXNbTPR14hp3fZemA.text: These guys need to be open more. The food was good and our waiter was nice. Plan to park a block away and walk.

K6-umdjst9sq81MTdpL5qw.text: Went on the last day of Restaurant Week. I had been here once before but that was 21 years ago. Wow! They've been around a long time. I didn't realize how small this place is. All of the tables are quite close together. Didn't like that. Felt like I couldn't have a private conversation. Our server was good. But he seemed a bit rushed to me. The biggest complaint I had is that my food was not hot. I ordered the Cajun pasta dish and it came out lukewarm AND it wasn't very flavorful. My husband enjoyed his shrimp and grits.  I have a $25 groupon I want to use (couldn't use during RW) so I'll be giving this place another try. Oh! Love the valet parking!

YIGmg8Pu0SvuEOJfRd7sqA.text: Had an excellent meal here last night with friends and family. The blackened catfish was delicious and so was the cajun  scampi appetizer!  My husband said his pork etouffe' was amazing and he had a large, delicious drink to take him through the entire meal.  I will make this place a regular when visiting Charlotte.

-xttbMcZ1YK9JWV2oKD_7Q.text: It's safe to say the Cajun Queen is my favorite restaurant in all of Charlotte. I'm from Texas, so I grew up sampling a variety of Cajun dishes. Since I live within walking distance, I've had the pleasure of coming to Cajun Queen countless times. Sometimes I stray and try a new dish, but overall I usually go for the usual - bowl of seafood gumbo and a side of crawfish etouffee which is more than enough to fill me up. Their fried oysters are divine; perfectly juicy with light crunchy breading. If you go in the evenings, you'll be serenaded by the cutest old men band that croon most big band type hits. Great place!

Ltkvmd-1DxdiOk0kAVb8ew.text: Let me just say the only reason I am giving this place 2 stars is because my boyfriend liked it. We went here as our second restaurant for restaurant week. The wine (cabernet) was decent enough. For the appetizer we ordered the gumbo and the caesar salad. I can't rate the gumbo because I'm not a fan of what's in it. I was told it was good though. The salad was just a salad nothing great. For the main course we ordered the chicken etouffee and the cajun chicken pasta. The chicken in the etouffe was the same texture and taste as you'd get from takeout chinese food which my boyfriend said that's why he liked it. The sauce was okay but it didn't save the dish. The cajun chicken pasta was ehhh. It was eatable but again I'd never go back for it. Dessert consisted of bread pudding and key lime pie. The boyfriend liked his bread pudding but I wasn't a fan and my key lime pie was good but I would swear it was Sarah Lee!! I feel no need to ever come back to Cajun Queen, the food just wasn't great and really a spice let down considering it's supposed to be cajun and it's not a very comfortable restaurant.

qrCh92wl64Nujt4uuyGc0w.text: I had a great dinner here tonight! My party dined on the fried pickle chips, the chicken etouffee, the chicken creole, the bourbon pecan pie, and the oreo cookie cheesecake. Oh we also had the Peach Aloha and Hurricane to drink. Everything was great! We cleaned all of our plates and enjoyed the atmosphere. The set up was nice, albeit a tad cramped upstairs. At times it was a little hard to talk amongst ourselves with the band playing, but this was not a deal breaker because the band took plenty of breaks so that everyone could eat, talk, and relax in peace. I can't wait to go back!

RCEkW4iAOn4f-h2hBzLg5A.text: I usually LOVE Cajun Queen's food. It's been one of my favorite places to eat in the Queen City, but not this particular time. I'm not sure if all the groupons have made them cut back on providing quality food, or if there's someone new in the kitchen, but everything was off. The steak which usually melts in your mouth, was very tough and quite fatty for a ribeye. It was hard to dig through it for an edible piece. The broccoli on both of the dishes my boyfriend and I ordered was very tough as well. In a failed attempt to course out our meal, our waitress left us feeling like an afterthought when we couldn't find her for simple things like refilled glasses or clean silverware. The only plus to our experience was the hostess staff at the door. They were very inviting & seated us quickly right where we would be most comfortable. I really appreciated the extra effort to give us an option. But overall, despite the awesome deal, I doubt I will be back to Cajun Queen any time soon.

z-tdReeBU7IseeISohiZOA.text: Had a tasty dinner here this evening. Average ambience, food came out quickly. It was tasty but not out of this world. Parking was a little annoying, required use of the valet (though it was "free"). Will be back. Edit: we came back again. This visit was not as well. Service was sorely lacking. Food was decent.   ** dont waste your money coming here without a groupon. it's totally not worth it at full price!**

FXw61mN6b2NxbaDHnxqkXQ.text: After waiting and waiting this week me and my spouse finally went to cajun queen and in my opinion it was just ok. We had the barbque shrimp which was ok fresh shrimp in a spicy sauce. My boo did save his dinner rolls for the juice. He had the fried shrimp which was good i had a steak which was ok with potatoes that were ok and bland broccoli. I alsohad gumbo which was not very good. Overall it was ok but fo r 80 i have had better

DgmHFDAKTRSghRzobMMgaA.text: Had dinner here on the night of Feb 28th. The restaurant is in a converted old house. We tied a few of the appetizers. All very good. I had the Etouffee with all 3 options, Chicken, Shrimp and Crawfish. Very good. I am looking forward to the chance to go here again.

1corAe4cH0Q3Sey0gZ0Suw.text: This place was a classic, like so many others that have just run out of steam. Lost their mojo so to speak. (Maybe cause the tree out front is gone.)   My advise, drink up in the bar and in a few hours it want really matter if the food is great or just okay.

O07_Wyq15SrPo79KqXbxzQ.text: What a pleasant surprise!! The fried oysters are the best ever and so is the Diane! I had it with the crawfish and shrimp. Even the garden salad was good to be pretty simple! Definitely a great value! My family and I will be returning:)

S9c022Y7Th01-AAPBYFARQ.text: Maybe it's because I've been to New Orleans or have friends from Louisiana but I don't know what the big to do about Cajun Queen is.  Maybe it's because people have never had real Cajun cuisine before.  The fried green tomatoes were blah.  The batter wasn't tasty at all.  My entree was the combo etouffee with shrimp, chicken and crawfish.  The seasoning was weak.  I must say that the shrimp and chicken were cooked really well.  I just didn't expect a whole chicken breast to be laid over my plate.  The portions were good.  Neither one of my two friends finished their plates.  One said her shrimp and grits were just okay.  My other friend said her fried oysters were fresh.  I will not be going back.  Parking was hard to find and it was loud inside.

7IpW4KM2s6sdD9io16wIcw.text: Awesome restaurant great atmosphere and the Cajun food was delicious. I would highly recommend this restaurant especially for a date night.

h_a4IA2m59vmNIr8wIwLtg.text: I have been to this place plenty of times. I have always had good meals and service. But tonight was bad. I went ther with my wife's work friends. We sat at the bar tables and had a bartender named Bo(very red hair)   We had About 8 people and he insisted that if we sit at the tables we have to order food, which we had planned to do. He seemed annoyed with us because we just ordered fried oysters and lots of drinks(it was Friday and happy hour, so we were sitting around chatting and drinking)  we were actually going to order an entre and stay for dinner but Bo seemed very disinterested in us, until it came time to pay the bill, then he was really nice(tip time! Overall the food is good there, but Bo did not make it a pleasant experience. Smile Bo, it will get you far in life!

ZHWAyfVmRXeZichYjJq3EA.text: The service is great, the food is great.  There's not really anything I can add that hasn't been said in the other reviews.  Other than:  If you don't order the beignets for brunch, you are seriously insense.  (that's 'insane' in french.  i think.)

qiULAfe77TEqcEpYrZl-bA.text: We went there on a Friday without a reservation. We were told that it could be an hour wait. But the hostess was very unfriendly, it was our first visit there and did not feel welcomed at all. We ended up no eating there. I don't care how good your food is if staff is unfriendly I  am not going in there. We drove back to our go to place Razzoo.

OTr1Ggr2Zwq6ZkzdQ1M_Aw.text: The vibe was really nice.  There was a jazz band there that was awesome and not over powering while eating.  And our waitress was totally awesome.  The best server I've had at any restaurant in a long time.  I will definitely recommend to friends and family that ask for such type food and good service.

gFccpz4q98crt5iNoHpg6A.text: I really like Cajun Queen. I have been several times now, and the food has always been great.  The decor is unique and interesting and really helps in conveying a whimsical mood.  Portion sizes are generous and it is hard not to fill up on the main dishes. Dessert, especially the bread pudding is worth saving room for.  The service has always been friendly, although it can be a little slow at time. This is not a place for a quick bite to eat and more of a restaurant for a leisurely 2-3 hour dinner.  Noise levels can get a little high depending on where you are seated.   Overall highly recommended.

n8x3rLF2DFhDYn1w-9-UwA.text: Very dissatisfied and disappointed.  Will not go back.  Went over year ago and was disappointed in the shrimp and grits.  This time,  gave another shot and tried oysters and shrimp.  They were good but the only options to come with it was mashed potatoes and coleslaw and broccoli.   The very bland potatoes were cold, the slaw my husband got was not good, & the broccoli was just a giant tree on the plate.   The side house salad we ordered for an additional $4 was awful.   There were romaine core in the salad and one slice of cucumber.  The leaves were so huge that it looked like it was just thrown on the plate without thought.  The waiter was loud and annoying and our drinks ran out several times.   Having to ask someone to refill drinks.....the "complimentary" valet was not something I want forced on us either but we had no choice.  When it was time to retrieve our car, it was raining and we had to get it ourselves because the drivers were too busy parking other cars to get ours.  Do not go here if you want good food and a nice evening.

zDUtYw_O_MWVXx8-1PPihw.text: Authentic stuff! Gumbo, etouffee, oysters, catfish, all great.  We'll definitely be going back.

4-0nurbAFsdXckMDs61ywg.text: I'm not from New Orleans, and I have no idea what good Cajun food is supposed to taste like. Having said that, what I do know is the difference between Bad food, So-so food, and Good food.. and the food at Cajun Queen is definitely in the Good food category. I was there over the weekend, and got to try the BBQ shrimp, seafood gumbo (appetizers) and the etouffee (entree). Yes, we got a little greedy and tried the etouffee not just with chicken or shrimp or crawfish, but with all three! Every dish was so full of flavor and spice - not the 'my mouth is on fire' kinda spice, but the kind that is enjoyable and goes perfectly with their sweet fruit punch rum cocktail - the hurricane. I could taste the heat in the food, and the basic, yet strong flavors of salt and black pepper, paprika,  herbs and onions, and if that's what Cajun/Creole food is supposed to taste like, I need to get down to New Orleans and indulge in some more of this amazing food! In addition to the food, the service was great and quick. The restaurant was packed, but we never found ourselves sitting around looking for our waiter. He was also kind enough to replace my cocktail when I wasn't pleased with my initial choice (I ordered a Cajun martini, and now I know that that's obviously not the kind of drink you want with spicy food :) )

3oL49wiFLq2CwNLmMki9Gw.text: My family LOVES the Queen! We go for everything from anniversaries to Sunday brunch after church. It's impossible to pick a single thing on the menu to recommend. Even for someone like me who's not a fan of spicy foods there's plenty to choose from.

ciu1KrizvK_T52iAAmCfXg.text: Let me begin by saying that the food and the service here is amazing. Unfortunately we had a pretty bad experience with the valet parking and the restaurant manager.  Towards the end of our meal, I noticed one of the valet guys move my car out of the parking lot right next to the restaurant, and around 5 or so minutes later, return it back to the same spot in the same parking lot. After asking the valet why that would happen, I was told it was to move another car out of the way. When asked why the car would be driven around the block just to move it out of the way, he didn't have a good answer, especially when my car (a sports car), was the only one that was "strategically" moved.  After bringing my concerns to the restaurant manager, I was essentially told that he would have to trust that they had a good reason for moving my car. Needless to say, his answer and lack of action was very disappointing. I would expect the manager to take such matters much more seriously and at the least investigate the issue...  So if you're thinking of going here, enjoy the food but be careful with letting the valet park your car.

Cp_rebdaLPCNuOfAHKtsfw.text: 20 years since last visit. I liked the crawfish appetizer and fried green tomatoes. I should've ordered something other than Etouffee for an entree. I have never had it before. Not for me.  In the past the more mainstream Cajun dishes have been fantastic.  My kids are too young to appreciate it so will probably go elsewhere when we are out. Great atomosphere!

15tKCnuUlXgL2IfUTypbGw.text: I'm so happy that we found this gem. This is the best food I've had in my 3 years living in Charlotte. Very relaxed atmosphere. The Cajun BBQ Shrimp Entree is delicious. Also, the Crawfish Scampie is yummy. They have live Jazz upstairs 7 nights a week. Make sure to reserve a table if you'd like to sit upstairs for the jazz. The servers are all kind and friendly. If your tired of the regular chain restaurants in Charlotte, this is the place to go eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States

w-CqCtIgBZx9vRN5ycrSBw.text: So authentic! Felt like we were back at Mardi Gras! What a pleasant surprise that they also had New Orleans cocktails too! So glad this Charlotte staple is still thriving!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Cajun Pasta was to die for...
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yummy New Orleans BBQ shrimp appetizer!
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hurricane and Swamp Water cocktails were awesome!

UqKvIB351AjjnwFnBUimow.text: We took advantage of a $40 Groupon on a Tuesday night.  The evening was wonderful with good food, good wine, and good service (Thx Anna).  We were seated upstairs in a little corner and listened to the band while sipping an Old Vine Zinfandel--hard to top!  My wife took advantage of their 30 yr anniversary menu for $30; me, a 1 lbs. ribeye with Mushroom Diana on top.  There was so much food we split our entrees and doggy-bagged 8 oz of steak (yummy the next day, too).  The ribeye was cooked a perfect medium rare.  Cajun Queen is a great place with valet parking which is a no-brainer.    PS:  Tried booking through Open Table that stated no openings.  When I called direct, no problem.  Great . . . table for two, please!

vFOAUpXHdiVMCv-zDf4BbQ.text: I really like Cajun Queen. Whenever I am in the area I always suggest we stop by and enjoy some of their authentic Cajun food. Nice atmosphere and reasonable prices. The staff is always pleasant and will make good recommendations.

KGlm93npIErRiKda6uevXg.text: It was a great experience. The service was great, as all the servers check on you as they're passing by to ensure you are doing okay with your appetizers, drinks, and entrees. My family and I had dinner here for Mother's Day and we were not disappointed. We had Cajun fried oysters, yummy, Diane Chicken and Shrimp, Cajun pasta, and shrimp scampi. Delicious

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Our yummy meals!
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. The festive decor

aKY3HZJhC22dTl6g3EaPSQ.text: Selection of "lighter" healthier Options is limited, so I just gonwith the fried seafood and Diane. Yummm. Only complaint would be side selection  cole slaw is like mayo drowned slop and I have found worms in the streamed broccoli!   It can happen as they are grown in dirt... but the staff didn't handle it appropriately. No suggestion of bringing another option. Just sorry. Again what can you do, half the staff looks like college kids who may not know how to deal w worms in the food. Lol.

4WEPDsV6xRQtwen0DYBpzA.text: The Sunday brunch menu offers reasonably priced items that are so delicious. We had some beignets (so good) and the crab cake eggs Benedict (amazing).   TIP: When making your reservations ask to be seated upstairs or away from the downstairs bathroom. We were seated near the downstairs bathroom and kitchen entrance. My chair kept getting hit by servers and guests who were walking to the kitchen and/or bathroom. A small change that could probably make a big difference in your experience.

Xfmv9ExFoauTLV6TLg08KA.text: We arrived at 7pm on Friday  for our reservation and was seated immediately.  We were seated upstairs where the jazz band plays.  The music was good but was extremely loud because it's a small area.  It was very hard to have a conversation with my husband without yelling and/or repeating myself.  The food was good not great.  The Cajun Popcorn was a good appetizer, but next time I would ask for the sauce on the side (some pieces were drenched).  We both had the blackened catfish with garlic mashed potatoes and broccoli.  I added the extra topping of Diane sauce.  The catfish had very good flavor and we received two nice sized pieces.  We each only had 2-3 small pieces of broccoli with thick stalks and they could have been steamed maybe a minute or two longer.    I had read previous reviews about parking, so we used the valet service.  When it was time to leave, the attendants seemed overwhelmed.  After waiting about 5 minutes, we decided to get our own car....the attendant just handed us the keys, no apologies or anything.  When we got to the car, the drivers side window was down.  Luckily, it was a very light drizzle of rain that evening and nothing valuable was in the car!   Overall,  very festive atmosphere, food was good, and wait service was good.  We were never without water or tea. It got extremely crowded  around 7:45 so we recommend reservations.  The Valet Service was disappointing.  The guys need to be trained on basic customer service.  Get a Groupon if possible.

cNi5f1KGNN_FzCxviSPp1Q.text: Before I went to Cajun Queen, I made sure to read a few reviews and noticed that either people loved it or had a mediocre experience. Because I had a Groupon, I decided to give it a try. Unfortunately, my experience was not the best. The waiter was attentive and my glass of water was never empty. I got the BBQ shrimp as an appetizer and it was fantastic. Full of flavor! However, my entree was bland! I got the Shrimp Diane and I had such high hopes that fell flat. If it wasn't for the Groupon, I would've been upset to have paid full price. Not sure if I will return.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp Diane.

-3AtbazeXiZFLtvYc94wCQ.text: Nice lil spot. I went right at 5 so I can avoid a crowd because I didn't know packed it gets. My only problem was the parking. Can't find a spot to save my life. But the valet guy was cool. I gave him a tip to park my car because I just got tired of looking. Seafood was good. But the menu is pretty steep but if u get a living social voucher like I did, it pretty much evens out.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Good seafood

7hFzhh1h5YJPzvdtRn_fSA.text: I love this place. The pork chop is to die for when cooked properly. I've only had one unsatisfactory chop. I got the blackened chicken caesar salad (on a better eating program) and there was so much chicken I had to bring it home. The chicken was absolutely delish, well seasoned and moist. I always get the bread pudding, regardless...another delish...yum!!!  The band is cute, 3 mature gentlemen and they have a new singer. I always sit upstairs. The band starts at 7:30.

6IG5B1UPcPWTFlUjuPsojQ.text: This establishment always has all the goods to impress and satisfy my palette over and over again. Last time I had a 14oz pork chop with BBQ sauce and potatoes that just looked and tasted like one of the best meals I ever had. The dessert Tollhouse cookie pie finished off the night with pure bliss.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pork chops and duck

hHNMa8H6EKQQgVGShl5g7A.text: Had a great dinner here a few weeks ago with our friends who love the place! The hurricanes were on point! My wife had a special with fish and a shrimp sauce on top, and she really enjoyed it. I had the bayou platter and the catfish AND chicken were both cooked to perfection! The intimacy atmosphere can feel a little overly formal or stuffy when you first sit down, but see right past it and get yourself a hurricane, it's totally worth it!

nFP-h4KldlPLAn3B6k1AJA.text: Excellent food.  We each have our favs & always order the same thing.  A bit noisy, but we have good service & food!

RFIxnUUtH7_wvE6P4dCdqw.text: With out a doubt my favorite restaurant!! Most constant service and food everytime. The best  ever. The chicken diane and bbq shrimp are the best. But don't sleep on the salt and pepper fried catfish. Yummy.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Come on really? Yummy

yucyYy-U6j5VpicEPYJtuQ.text: So I had the bayou platter with fish, oysters, shrimp, scallops, and beans and rice. It was really good. The only thing I didn't like was that they put my fish directly on top of the beans which made it soggy on the bottom. The service was really great also. I had a cherry margarita which was super tasty. I'd definitely try this place again and recommend it to anyone looking for some cajun cuisine.

ePRjQ6svtH3Lp3j6CFbZCQ.text: The fried platter was amazing.  The seasoning in the batter was very tasty and the batter was light and crispy at the same time.  The catfish was tender and juicy.  We also had the grilled salmon with the crawfish sauce and it was good not great that's the reason for the 4 stars instead of 5.  The salmon was a little over cooked.  But in their defense, the salmon is usually blackened and we asked for grilled in order to cut back on the spicy ness.  But overall the food was great.

qP8WCB5XkXI9HWUD8HBuHA.text: We popped in before leaving town and BOY-O-BOY were we pleased that we did!  Everything was served quick, fresh and delicious!!  Our waiter, Alex was really attentive so if in the area, definitely worth a drop in-and you might be in for a live Jazz session!

BIij_5XTbLMsp6dOkln3hA.text: Excellent brunch spot. We enjoyed beignets, crab cAke eggs Benedict, and mimosas.  It was nice to be able to get a reservation and not wait a long time. The parking was not great but I was able to find street parking.

AnKZNvDndKQBkkJKVtZXUw.text: Etoufee and Diane are both amazing. We got all three meats with both and we were not disappointed. The fried green tomatoes were great as well.

xqQ6gqBWLoHAMlz_rMAbOg.text: Always always always great food! One if our favorite places in Charlotte! We visit everytime we come to town!!!

ZrbCiZYcgkk9cQph_IZBaQ.text: When you first arrive, it's a quaint cute house. The ambiance was intimate yet lively. It felt divey yet, warm and upscale.  Our bartender Mel was life! She's social, has 18years of experience, and appropriate yet balances with giving you (the patron) space. The drinks were strong and compliments the vibe to enjoy the live band.   My meal was one of those 'slap yo Mama and Grandma good! So that once they realize you've got them you force them to take a bite. Maybe it was just my meal - I probably wouldn't try this in real life, as it wouldn't end well. Leftovers wouldn't save the day either    Digressing, I met a sweet couple who have become family friends. I witnessed a couple get engaged. I ate until I couldn't eat anymore and will be back for more!

iTaGulM9zzNqsNpNuuaVNw.text: Me: "Where do I PARK?! The salon next door is closed, can I park there?" Hostess: "No, you'll still get towed even though they're closed." Me: "Hmm, I guess I'll park somewhere in the streets" (circles neighborhood 3 times) Me: "Where else can I park? Hostess: "We have valet" -__________________-  Me: "Sorry, but I ordered the Diane with Crawfish, not chicken" Waitress: "Sorry about that. Did you want me to take that back?" Me: "Umm.. I'm kind of starving." Waitress: "Let me go see who's fault it is." (..................) (Waitress comes back) Waitress: "I'm not sure how that happened" -__________________- x2  I'm not a fan. Let be backtrack a bit. I used to LOVE Cajun Queen. 5 stars without a doubt. Over the years, the quality of the food and service has significantly decreased while the prices have risen. I've gone back maybe 3 or 4 times in hopes that each time was just a bad day.. no luck. I think I'll stick to Cajun Yard Dog for my Cajun needs.

nrugqOaErx9SHb6SImrXHw.text: Fantastic cajun food with amazing hospitality. Everyone was kind and fun, it was very welcoming to eat alone.   I started with a hurricane then enjoyed the cajun pork with a lovely pino noir recommend by the charming and handsome Bo.  Was not able to finish the pork so boxed up the rest and made room for the Bourbon Pecan pie...you MUST have this pie!!  Live music made the evening an event not just a meal.  Valet was a great surprise since parking is tough in that part of town.  Go and go back often!!

vkr4gEeC-uUgxVWIuqmclQ.text: My third time eating at Cajun Queen & might be my last. Service could've been better. Our waiter didn't seem interested in serving us. Other staff did his job, which is unacceptable.

H-M4qe9jO7ezu9T16lzpdQ.text: I enjoyed my dining experience here! Friendly staff, delicious food & drinks. The Gumbo left something to be desired which is odd considering this is a staple of Cajun/New Orleans Cuisine

x-QB7Xo1HLgWlyXtmyF6_A.text: Delicious food with so much taste and personality! It goes so well with the vibrant atmosphere. I came from out of town and was brought here and would highly recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States

-42mNWxb4ubCEOpNCcLiKg.text: We love Cajun Queen!  We only go probably once a year like on a special occasion but it's always so good!  Huge portions so totally worth the money!  The place has been around forever so it's hard to complain much about the tight spaces but it would be nice if it wasn't so dark. I could hardly see what I was eating.... that's the only reason for not giving it 5 stars.

i6ZmgvGxORCWzmrbVgEURQ.text: This was my favorite restaurant! Specifically, the etoufee (all three) which consists of crawfish, shrimp and chicken. UNFORTUNATELY, I had the worst display of chicken in the past 8 years of eating this dish at this place. (My number 1 dish). I don't know what it was specifically, but it was mushy and I couldn't eat another bite. I will not be returning again. Which is hard to believe after all of the family dinners and Groupon deals that I have taken part in. The staff was so rude and made us wait 25 minutes for a Sunday brunch when they were optimal tables around. It just put a bad taste in my mouth, literally and figuratively. Smh. So sad.

jNZ7K8KUlW4j0Z5sdUphLQ.text: I've been here a ton of times and am just now reviewing it, shame on me! It's usually pretty easy to get a table without a reservation. I would recommend getting the groupon or living social deal ($20 for $40).   Service: Can be slow to nonexistent at times. I almost always find myself searching for the wait staff. This is especially True if you're seated upstairs. Takes forever to get your check.   Ambiance: The restaurant is in an old 2 story house. Tables are really tight. The "booths" are even tighter.  Lots of nice photography from Nola on the walls. A huge porch style dining area off the back. Live band upstairs. About upstairs....seating is sardines in a can. The tables are almost touching along the window. Upstairs is usually very loud. I'm sitting here listening to a woman scream over the music about how many times a day she pumps to feed her baby.  Along with a guy making jokes about his penis....sigh! The bar is also upstairs  FYI.   Food: Great food. It makes up for the loud people and so so service.  My go to is the diane, a mushroom based dish with either chicken, shrimp, crawfish or all three.  Because I'm difficult I get it with blackened chicken and crawfish over mashed potatoes rather than white rice. My other faves are the fried catfish and the bbq shrimp. Too dang good! They also makea decent hurricane.  I've heard Sunday brunch is good, haven't been yet though.  They also offer complimentary valet on the side street next to the restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Diane with blackened chicken and crawfish over mashed potatoes rather than white rice.

i4t4ElQ76Mx4OAiIGMjzrA.text: Pros: great ambiance and food. Ordered the crawfish popcorn and it had a great fried coating and flavor. Wish they would have put the sauce on the side inside of smothering it with so much m  Cons: spacy wait staff as another review mentioned before. They would bring you food and not even notice that you don't have utensils to eat your food with. The quality of service is like your at Applebee's. Their waitstaff ruins the whole experience at this place.

MiO0Rd2D5F7j3UIOwRB-9g.text: The food here was great! We had the Cajun fried Oysters and Seafood Gumbo for Appetizers, I would definitely recommend the Fried oysters but I wasn't a fan of the Gumbo. Entree: Etouffee and my boyfriend had the New Orleans platter. I loved the Etouffee, just had to add a bit more salt and pepper but besides that it was great and the platter my bf had was good. The valet was complimentary which was good, but we still tipped. We were looking forward to the live Jazz band, but we came too early unfortunately. Next time I would definitely come back to catch the band.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crawfish Etouffée and mashed potatoes (front dish) &amp; Seafood Platter (dish in the back)
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried oysters Delish! Most restaurants overdo the batter to the point you cant taste the meat, but this was PERFECT Seafood gumbo back dish

AK7vtFhz-E5lsjp2IXtUyg.text: Cajun queen is always great. The food is authentic Cajun and the fried pickles rock. I always enjoy a hurricane or two as well.

wLtk52MgII_-crOk6DGqxw.text: So I have been putting Cajun Queen off for sometime now but after I kept hearing online others raving about how good the food was I said eh lets go. So myself and others headed out here yesterday. One thing I love is their is complimentary parking here we were panicking when we first arrived thinking we were not going to be able to find a park ,but to our surprise they had valet service. I feel Cajun Queen has a very intimate setting. Also if you looked around that's all we really seen was couples sitting around gazing in each others eyes and such. They did a very good job with bringing that New Orleans Vibes to Cajun Queen far as decorating goes, real laid back setting with Jazz music playing and mardi gras beads everywhere from outside in the grass to hanging over the ceiling fans I thought that part was pretty cool. Now I can't say the same about the food. Our food was okay, I was expecting so much more I feel like what I ordered wasn't that flavor filled as it should be. I ordered the Crawfish scampi with rice, my mother ordered the half half deal half fried shrimp and half fried oysters, she complained about her broccoli being pretty tough but she didn't want to make a fuss so she just left on the plate. What I will say is for an appetizer we ordered the fried green tomatoes and those were to die for !!!!! Not sure what type of sauce those tomatoes were drenched in but I'm definitely going back just for the green fried tomatoes I want to give them another try all in all .

vHcykPMAyQlZwQZBB6ZbpA.text: Delicious crusty bread & shrimp, I almost drank the broth... used the bread to soak up the deliciousness.  Beautiful, intimate atmosphere- loved the live jazz & one of the musicians was very personable & shared info/history of CQ.  He'd worked here for a very long time.  Love this spot!!

pB02xmtLYIBBqqEpXbeJQg.text: Fantastic food and service was wonderful.  Highly recommended! Wonderful atmosphere and good authenticity

VQGAYP0GCVCOarKkojuEHA.text: The BEST cajun restaurant in the area. I had the duck breast and it was amazing. Don't sleep on the shrimp and grits. Wife got them this time and they're amazing. I really like the cocktail options too. I'm partial to the traditional Sazerac   They have  a live jazz band upstairs too.  Free valet located on side street of building.

tijQ9SJCn_AxXC1KjeAcOQ.text: As most foodies know, a large part of the dining experience is the service.  If the food is magnificent, you can get away with slightly lesser service, but Cajun Queen wasn't tasty enough (but it was good!) to counter the experience of bad service.  The free valet is a nice touch, because parking is a beast around there.  The hostess was busy but seated us kindly.  Then the waiter showed up.  He seemed put out with us, but as the night progressed, it became clear that he might have been irritated with a loud party behind us, because he became slightly less aggravated when they left.  The second bummer of the night was where we were sitting seemed to be a hugely traveled path for people coming and going all night long.  I was bumped every few seconds all night long.  Tiresome.  Seafood Gumbo should have been blowing my doors off with flavor, but instead it was just okay.  I was a little disappointed with the mildness of it.  Needed something.  I had the Crawfish Etouffee and it was really too similar to the gumbo.  I should have made a better choice.  But, it had the same problems as the Gumbo, being too bland.  I guess I just expected more.  My friend had Chicken Diane.  It's a sauteed breast of chicken with mushrooms, green onions, Cajun spices, garlic, butter and parsley.  All served over rice.  Though it was pretty rich, it was a solid dish.  Dessert was again, fine.  There really weren't that many choices, so I chose pecan pie.  It was fine, presentation was pretty lame.  I know, what can you do with a slice of pie.  But 3 or 4 puffs of whip cream from a can has to be one of the least fancy ways to dress it.  We may try it again, perhaps we were there on an off night?  I do like to give a few chances before writing a place off, but this night was not a good showing for this landmark Charlotte restaurant.  (This review from my personal blog)

Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Seafood Gumbo

JWXCU_ZaWr2BywxcNNnLJA.text: This place is defiantly done if the best New Orleans style Cajun food in the city! Everytime I go here I always have a great food experience. The atmosphere is homey...literally it's in a house! Unfortunately because of that not all seats are great seats, sit too close to a window in the winter you'll regret it! Also the seats could be too close for comfort. My favorite thing here is the etouffee! It has just the right amount of Cajun spice without it being overwhelming.  Beware, parking sucks here with the potential of being towed or blocked is high! Pay attention to signs and try to find somewhere on the street.

awRDsY46BHne0LcYnUblDA.text: Great food and great service from our waiter Nate! He was knowledgeable about the menu selection and assisted us well being that it was our first time.

eunEqFmjkU5rqhhzD7MGmQ.text: Very tasty with big portions to leave you satisfied. We loved the fried oysters (forewarning: the texture is a bit different), the etouffe, and the blackened chicken pasta, as well as the blackened salmon with shrimp on top. Each meal came with a cup of gumbo and free bread was brought out before anything. To say the least, we were stuffed leaving with full bellies and doggy bags of leftovers. Very flavorful food within a cool, renovated old home.

XW6gbOS9ax1VgjHIYQT0ew.text: The food here is so dang good. Truly never disappoints.  I've tried many things from their menu and loved them all. Plus, I love that they have jazz music on the weekends.  Pro tip - they sometimes have a Groupon. It's not a huge savings, but a little bit helps!  Service is always fabulous, and I love that their location is in an old house. SO charming.   Perfect for date night or somewhere to take your parents!

nDrndjwJxZ1NfXaZFIzXGA.text: Always excellent and check out Groupon to see if they have one available. One of the most consistent restaurants I've ever been to.

FJmNxeGIovKoYlZVS-bUhg.text: I have been here twice with my fiance and would overall consider it an ok place to eat. It is nothing special undifferentiated from other cajun restaurants. The first time we had a jambalaya dish that was on the menu at the time and it was not the best. It was dry and old feeling. We decided to give it a second try and and ordered fried pickles, and cajun popcorn. The pickles were good. The cajun popcorn was fried crawfish with csjun aoli sauce. It was better than the pickles and a large portion. We split the etouffee which was gokd as well but not spectacular.

zHXOgHC1DwnMLhWg4t8WgA.text: One of my favorite restaurants ever. I had the Diane with all 3. It was phenomenal. I am completely addicted to it. I went for the first time a few months ago and I have been back several times since. The atmosphere is awesome. A beautiful old home remodeled as a restaurant. The food is simply great. Somehow though the service is even better than the food. Everyone is friendly as they should be. What really sets them apart though is the knowledge. They know everything about the menu frontwards and backwards.

HEB2v4igNBA7CpKcN8eOdg.text: Thanks for making our anniversary so very special!  The food was great and the atmosphere was charming!  And our waiter, who we grew to know as the "I'm on it" guy, was a complete gem!  I don't think I've had such great Cajun food outside of Louisiana, and I can't wait to experience this restaurant again!

RPTNg4zNsXSSy7wlnPgT7g.text: Parking- it was a bit rough, they do offers valet, however depending on time you arrive there is street side parking in the nearby area that is free  Atmosphere- Inside of what looks like an old home it is very welcoming upon approach. When you walk in the hostess are nice and I was greeted immediately. First level is divided by a simple walkway that leads to the kitchen. On both sides are tables that range from 2 person to 6 person seating. Decorations are very appealing and the setup draws you in and makes you comfortable. If you head up stairs as I did since I arrived prior to my reservation there is a bar. Around the bar are 4 person high top tables (3 to be exact) and there are approximately 8-10 chAirs at the bar. Directly adjacent to the bar is another seating room that has the reservation only tables. The great thing about this room is there is a live band that plays. It was very mellow and relaxing. If you want to be in the room with the live band you have to indicate that when you make your reservation.  If you sit at the high top tables you can hear the music and still be able to hold a conversation without raising your voice (I would recommend this option)   Bo, the bartender was Excellent. Bo made great recommendations, was very conversational, just a all around genuinely good person it seemed.   I ordered the platter with the catfish, scallops, fried claims and shrimp. It came with red beans and rice and gumbo.  The food was great. Had a side of fried green tomatoes, again it was great.   I noticed that the servers worked well with one another paying attention to not just when the people they were waiting on needed assistance but moved from table to table as a team.  Oh yeah there is also an outdoor seating area on the second level balcony, another subtle but nice addition to the restaurant.  Great place, wonderful service, I would go back multiple times. Well worth the prices that I consider reasonable and I'm cheap

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Photo doesn&#39;t do it justice

o85G18pyZ2YvbbBwqVDIIw.text: Took my gf out for her birthday dinner was so damn good it felt like my bday!  Started w the FGT, awesome!  She had shrimp (I think it was the app or something, but she loves it) and I had the filet w broccoli and mash... it. Was. Outstanding!  We had beers, cocktails, and wine all were good.  We sat at the bar, can't recall his name but his was great as well.  Live music was nice, wish they would only let the professionals sing though.  Idk who the one chick was from the dining room was, but nope  We will definitely return!

NtDoduFZJNFBEwuIHdjHlQ.text: First time here. Definitely recommend reservations so you don't wait. Happily we had them. Let's just start with the hot rolls. Yum. We had side salads and house and blue cheese dressings made it. I had the shrimp and grits with sausage. It was the best I've ever had. Seriously. Spiced up just right.  I'll be back just for the shrimp it was that delicious. Husband had the double pork chop

j4Acxim2Pw4mC18iER4ARQ.text: We loved our evening at Cajun Queen! The food was amazing and I love the atmosphere. Valet parking is free and boy do they work hard. The guy working last night ran up to our car and when we were ready he literally sprinted to get the car for us - it was amazing.   The restaurant is in a classic looking building with tons of space and rooms on the inside. It has low lighting and was great for a date night.   We were sat immediately (we did make a reservation through Yelp while we were on the way just in case). Our waiter was great and recommended all the right things. I got the shrimp scampi that was served with tons of shrimp (11 shrimp to be exact) and it was delicious. Nice and buttery. My boyfriend got the cajun pasta special and he loved that too. He also ordered some peach cocktail that was really tasty. They have complementary bread, so keep that in mind when deciding on an app or not.  We didn't try any dessert, but I will definitely be back to try it!

mPu8TkdUxziGRtJa6O6EhA.text: Great Louisiana fare in a cool old house. Not as spicy as I would hope, but the crawfish and jambalaya were brought together very well.

2tDeSzw0Tm96iYLbGk5sPg.text: Ohhhhhhh Cajun Queen is our spot! Fantastic atmosphere and authentic cajun food. I would go as far as to say better than many resturants I have eaten at in NOLA! We love to upstairs with the jazz band while eating incredible crawfish Diane and gumbo. It is so comfortable and laid back you'll stay for hours.

v-_dB0ZHPHkBmn_0HxeyyA.text: Best Cajun place in town. The food is amazing. Right mix of heat and flavor. You will leave full but wanting more. The BBQ Shrimp is food for the soul.  I highly recommend the Cajun Queen evenif your just passing through #cajunqueen

vDz1dZ6e43N00LxZP4B1bQ.text: The Cajun Queen was an awesome experience. The service was great and prompt. The food was so delicious. We started with the fried green Tomatoes and they were very good. Reminded me of my Dads fried green Tomatoes. I had the 3 meat Diane and it was the best food that I have had all year! The seasonings are splendid to my tastebuds! My sister had the shrimp and grits which was great also. For dessert we had the bourbon peach bread pudding and it was one of the best bread puddings that I've ever had and I don't even like bread pudding. I can't wait to come back to Charlotte so I can go to The Cajun Queen restaurant!

-n-eQCwl3HLGztyTwCs9iw.text: Bo is the best ever!!!! The food is outstanding the service is amazing this is my second time coming in less than a week.  The 7th st. Stumbler is very strong but yet good i haven't had anything here that i bad even the water is good... I will always and recommend coming here

g0fY0TbymFqSba0NX0GVJg.text: We really enjoyed our first visit to Cajun Queen! It gets busy so prepare for a bit of a wait to get seated, but the bar upstairs is a nice option. Cool and original location, interesting New Orleans cuisine and good portion sizes.

JrvgxYxkchxSoNWKW80SjQ.text: Let me preface my review by saying I'm a Louisiana native.   I booked a last minute reservation via yelp and thank goodness I did because they were quite busy.  The Parking situation is a bit crazy but they do have a complimentary valet! The ambiance is very casual and the restaurant is a bit overcrowded.    I ordered a cup of gumbo and the New Orleans platter. Our food came so fast... impressive! The gumbo was very bland. I don't recommend ordering it! The New Orleans platter was very big and they offer an option to split it with two people for a small up charge and slightly more food!! This was a great option. I split it with my boyfriend and we each received a huge serving of catfish, a couple shrimp, a scallop and a few oysters. I asked that the oysters be fried hard however they weren't ....so we didn't eat them. The shrimp were fine but they weren't really battered ... weird. The fried catfish was the real star of the show... no complaints. The platter also comes with a serving of red beans and rice. Traditionally red beans and rice is thick. Instead, I received a small serving of watery red beans over a lot of rice!   In total, all this was about $40 which is very reasonable. It could be that I had really high hopes but I found this place to be disappointing.    They do not split checks or accept groupons dated the same day of service. I suggest making a reservation to be safe and bring cash to tip valet.

c7EyMhOEmf7nMKKgGlxHmQ.text: Well well well. I hate to be a negative Nancy here but the food has seriously declined in every aspect since last year when it was fairly good. Once upon a time it was decent.  My group had crawfish Ettoufee, fried green tomatos, seafood gumbo, crawfish tails with sherry remoulade, barbecue shrimp.   My Ettoufee was very old. There was no attempt on presentation whatsoever as they usually did, and it was served it a different bowl. It was literally slopped over loke a pig trough. I didn't eat it.  The gumbo was very soupy, and tasted like instant tomato soup; not reminiscent of any authentic new Orleans version in any way whatsoever.  Fried green tomatoes were good. BBQ shrimp were fine.  I'm not sure, at this point, if they can ever get it together again. They're so far off the deep end now that I have officially given up. I'll never return again.   Good luck to you if you decide to book a reservation based on the positive reviews, you're going to need it.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried green tomatoes and BBQ skrimps

DtQfvLRvjaZnT7eFB4LKUA.text: In a city of chain restaurants, a million breweries,  and overall lack of creative cuisine, Cajun Queen shines. The fried oysters are the freshest I've had since I left New England, and the meal portions arelarge and satisfying (I almost always finish my meals when we go out because I'm a grown man, but I usually take home a whole extra serving from this place). In addition to the oysters, I typically order the "all 4" Diane, which is chicken, crawfish, shrimp, and andouille sausage. Definitely bring your appetite to this place! Service is always great, and the ambience is unique, it's inside an old two story house. The upstairs bar is always fun with live music every day (or close to it). Downstairs is great for a more traditional dining experience. Price points are in the mid-range, bill will be about 60 bucks between my girlfriend and I without drinks and about 100 with drinks, so good for a date night that won't break the bank.

qienfQtLpS1Bs0NVAz5jvA.text: We dined here with friends for the first time and I can't wait to go back. The ambiance, the music, the wait staff and most importantly the food was absolutely amazing. So fresh and flavorful. When we have company next time around, this is definitely where I want to take them!

e4xvghBgUkaKxZ8BzTkS8g.text: Review for Brunch!  *Hidden gem for brunch in Charlotte  *Menu is light, but food and service are incredible   We visited Cajun Queen for Easter Brunch. I wasn't sure what to expect since it was Easter. I don't think CQ did anything different to their menu- it was one page of items but the offerings were so compelling that we did not mind.   I had the fried green tomatoes Benedict and my boyfriend had the bourbon french toast. We also ordered the beignet. The beignets were devoured in 0.5 seconds. The jam they serve it with is absolutely incredible.   This was my first time at CQ. What stood out to me was the service. We ate around 11, so it was right when they opened on Sunday, but the servers were constantly asking us if we needed any additional coffee or anything else.   Only reason why it gets 4 stars was because of the limited options (not sure how often they change up the menu) and because they only serve plain coffee. Sometimes I like to spice it up and get a latte or cappuccino with brunch.   They did have a drink menu (including hurricanes!) for brunch but we stuck to coffee this time.   I was impressed with the quality of food and pricing. We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried green tomatoes benedict, hash browns (which were amazing) and fresh fruit.
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beignets!

eGdc4EHCqalbOoawbQ8skQ.text: Was able to get a 9:00 pm reservation on short notice and was excited to try this restaurant! The band played in the other room but we were able to hear the music just fine. The server was very professional and the food was delicious. I recommend the 3 meat Diane, delectable! Would highly recommend going!

HrFwZLDwKIDmntPLGXS3RQ.text: Why haven't I ever been here before, it was so good. My family has been here Numerous times but for some reason I've never been. We started out with fried pickles and crawfish scampi. It was to die for.. then we all got different main course I have the special salmon with a crawfish, artichoke heart and sun-dried tomato sauce over rice. It was the best thing I've ever had. Most of my family got fried shrimp and oysters, they loved it. We ended with three desserts cheesecake , bread pudding and key lime pie, all were delicious. I'll definitely be back. This place really is that good! We had awesome customer service! There was nothing wrong with this meal.

zLK6ZO5rQOHyrNmpiFbGpw.text: About me: I'm a foodie. I love New Orleans/Cajun/Creole cuisine. I've traveled all over the country and see food as an experience.   Restaurant/Staff: Awesome Experience! My boyfriend and I celebrated my birthday last night and the staff of Cajun Queen definitely made it a night to remember. We were greeted upon arrival. I wanted to enjoy the live jazz and asked if we could be seated upstairs, the hostess had no issue accommodating this request. Within minutes we were greeted by our waiter. He was so polite, sweet and attended to each of the guest with the same care. Service and music were superb.  Before leaving the band/staff and guest sang Happy Birthday.   Food: I honestly can't say enough about how good the food was. The Diane w/ all three meats (crawfish, shrimp and chicken) *dramatic pause*... is in my top 5 of incredible dishes. Honestly, the garlic butter sauce wrapped me like a warm blanket. The portion was appropriate for the price and I didn't feel slighted. My boyfriend had the shrimp and grits and really enjoyed that as well.   Drink:  I ordered the Hurricane and it was definitely worth the price. They didn't hold back on the alcohol.   Parking: Do NOT park behind the salon!! Use the valet or park across the street.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Diane w/ Shrimp, Chicken and Crawfish
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp &amp; Grits

D17F1aGcc-O5kf1Us1fvwg.text: I ordered salmon with shrimp sauce and mashed potatoes. It was seasoned well and the portion was sufficient. My friend ordered shrimp and grits and she wasn't impressed. There was a small amount off red sauce, possibly a tomato based sauce, that covered a small portion of the grits. My friend did not like the sauce. The grits seemed to be a little runny and the portion size seemed small. Both entrees were served with a choice of gumbo or a side salad. I was impressed by the waitress's concern that my friend didn't like the shrimp and grits. She offered to provide a different dish And when the offer wasn't accepted, she removed the entree from our bill without being asked to do so,which tells me that Cajun Queen values their patrons.

8JQro-t8ZBlzkrrdaiVWzQ.text: Went during restaurant week and can say that I wasn't impressed. Food tasted rather bland. The parking is a headache, parked in a spot but was told to move. Didn't  know they had complimentary parking until at the front door. They parked vehicles in no parking areas. Overall I wasn't impressed, but glad I tried it for myself. But try it for yourself.

jyafX1fVCPnwZQ-nIJ6cRw.text: Five star service from all of the staff. Five star food served in a vintage setting with low ambience. OMG I've  been to New Orleans & their food qualifies as authentic Cajun food.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Roasted duck with crawfish over potatoes aside green beans  and peppers

s-Kh248X09Og25nCOgk1Ig.text: It was ok not as good as i remembered. I was excited to drive up to Charlotte just for Cajun Queen.

2IdY1s5cZFOVcyiWFm8Ihw.text: Super good food. The BBQ shrimp is to die for. Make sure you get the bread to soak in the juices! I could eat that as a meal. The etuffe was very well done and my husband couldn't keep his hands off my entree  (no pun intended!). The bread pudding is the real thing too! Go ahead of time and hang out for a while. We enjoyed the love music but they only played for 30 min per hour. Was hoping for a more continuous roll. But can't complain. Great experience overall.

jzg0S61zxz9opPCRsdvUPg.text: From the time we were seated until the time we walked out of Cajun Queen, this was a 5-star experience. Our waiter quickly took our order and -no joke- we didn't have time to eat our bread before our entrees came out. Everything was hot, and the portion sizes were all "I will need a to-go box" worthy. I had blackened catfish, which was done perfectly! My husband got the popcorn crawfish (delicious!), and washboard blues, which is red beans and rice w andouille sausage. He loved it! We split a piece of creamy, very tasty Key Lime pie. YUM! The entire meal, from start to finish, took less than an hour! It is noteworthy that we were a little uncertain about eating at CQ, because we were disappointed the last time we came. Glad we gave it another chance, because it was excellent!

sbxtk1GXrF80PLyGLtggWg.text: The friendly staff was very professional and always attentive to our needs. Loved the very relaxed atmosphere. The food portions were amazing, you definitely will not leave hungry. The food was absolutely perfect. So much flavor......delicious!!! You must try the Bread Pudding for dessert. Complimentary Car Valet was a nice touch too.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States

P3FGwLelxAcGN_9sYGXcMA.text: Good but not great shrimp Diane and a bit overpriced. Good service and cute ambiance though.

ZpOHnsb9hfiChvTs25xOkg.text: Step into a little bit of the Cajun lifestyle at the queen! Went for a friends birthday and they were able to accommodate 12 of us decently. There is definitely an old school charm to the restaurant, probably because it's inside a retrofitted house.  They have a surprisingly extensive booze menu. Didn't try the cocktails but they looked good coming out. You have to get the traditional etouffee... Shrimp or crawfish. It's the right amount of spice and heat to go along your heaping pile of rice. The surprise of the night was the bourbon bread pudding, warm and delicious.  Service was good. No complaints and everything came out as expected.

fg13mp3xq-_rA8A-hW2GVg.text: Unique restaurant located in a 2 story house. Food is really good. You can also visit the bar upstairs where you can to listen to live music. great place

f9Vgg5JYzNZeEbjw8LySYw.text: Great food!  awesome place - I love restaurants in hold houses.  Parking was a little strange, until you figure out only valet is available.

yhNvlG9xJgF2_mkCk7VeEQ.text: Go here ! This place was delicious ,  had great service , and was a cool location . All the food that we ordered was so satisfying . We started with the fried crawfish  and it was great . Our entrees were the shrimp etouffee and the blackened  salmon with broccoli instead of potatoes . The etouffee was amazing , perfect blend of spices . If you're not one for spice , maybe stray away from this one . The blackened salmon and its toppings and sauce was much more mild , but still delicious. I also had the one of the spiked coffees and it was one of my favorites , tasted yummy and woke me up . This was a great date night spot .
