OatKuL9-E3QMmajq4hPgrQ.text: I am new to Charlotte and was suggested by a local to try this place which she raved about, so for my birthday I decided to go. The food was great. For my appetizer I had the Cajun fried oysters. For my entree I had the Creole Shrimp with rice it was spicy, which I like. There was a live jazz band playing which was nice. The only con I had was it being a little tight. It's in a house which was made into a restaurant. I dined on the 2nd floor and it was 8 of us. The waiters had us sit directly behind a table that had all the utensils and drinks. So they'd constantly have to come up behind us to grab napkins, more water or lemonade, or utensils for other tables. Other than that it was nice. Not sure if I'll go back but if I do I won't go with a large group, most likely for a date night with my hubby.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cajun Shrimp with rice

rYnbTrTcpHjgFKr2_52Gog.text: Went to the Cajun Queen this weekend and I really enjoyed the Shrimp Etouffee it was just spicy enough and was a really big portion.  My wife does not like Cajun food and had the steak it was probably the worst steak I have ever had, the spice on it tasted funny.  Overall I was happy I had a groupon and would only go back for takeout.

i0JE_RhWsGV-YrMXGHN8Dw.text: My husband and I went here for dinner on a Thursday night. Atmosphere was nice. Nice and cozy.  Although, It was very dark, so dark that I had to use the flashlight on my phone to see the menu. The band was a disappointment. Pretty dull much older gentleman playing. The fried green tomatoes were delicious. The fried catfish and the red beans and rice were bland and lacked seasoning. My husband had the blackened catfish which was very good. Service was excellent. Overall it was just an ok experience. We probably wouldn't go back

cou5iBrh4Byb-CLExzoYIA.text: I don't usually go for Cajun, but there's so much here that there's always something I'm "in the mood" for.  Plenty of food, so good value for the prices.  Service was fair, and probably the only thing that could be improved upon.   Best shrimp and grits ever!!

CLFtYc35tYLmTsMe7Im7og.text: My wife and I went to this Restuarant with another couple, and we were pleasantly surprised. The environment with the social scene, jazz music , and the diverse make up of the crowd is what really liked. The service, food was also good we would recommend this Restuarant as a place to go.

i1EpAfaD4BMGQkYLt20p8Q.text: A little overpriced but the food is really great! And the restaurant has a fun New Orleans feel to it. Great date place!

UwYfkEHuAKB3EZRz16-SJw.text: We had a the best experience last night at the Cajun Queen. The food never lets you down. All dishes are delicious. Last night we had the fried pickles appetizer (perfect!), a house salad and shared the salmon (with Diane sauce) entree.  It was out of this world. Really, everything was perfect. Service included. Five stars from me!

I6qdnp2NMk0Cb07DU-Nvpw.text: Good food usually very consistent....Great bbq shrimp. Seating can be tight.

KZseymjzRPvikB6mUBYkmg.text: We stopped by for Easter brunch however we were 15 min too late. I had the Diane shrimp which was tasty and spicy. They get a 3 from me because the portions were small and the sweet tea tastes awful!  May give this place another try based in its cool location and my friend said their fried food taste better.

qj1XhmEuF9OtazxuQPHv6w.text: 3 people sat down... Interesting old house feel to the place.  #1 - Etouffee shrimp - good shrimp, pretty good spice to it, nothing special that would bring me back #2 - Etouffee crawfish -  good crawfish but just like any other (customer 2 preferred this over the shrimp) #3 - Wash Day Blues - red beans and rice were blander than usual and the sausage was not cut up, hot sauce only can do so much  Fried Green Tomatoes appetizer was a hit with the whole table.  Dixie Blackened voodoo was delicious.

rc_22KOw0tJjHjsAWkiwGw.text: It has an amazing atmosphere and very unique. Our server was very polite and was on top of everything, even the hostess was great she found us seats upstairs near the live music and the food was everything I expected and more. It makes you feel like New Orleans in Charlotte...we're already planning our next dinner here, I definitely recommend the restaurant as a must visit

9baiKxTMdrp5jheEAM_vwg.text: The food is awesome. The fried clams were fresh and were the best 'Ive ever had.  Great neighborhood. Perfect for Sunday brunch

95xrxfj1F-e_svPjB9vjsg.text: I take everyone that comes to visit me to Cajun Queen!  From the great food (my favorite is the bbq shrimp and bread to dip into the sauce), to the live jazz and great service, this is a restaurant not to be missed!

2x-iKdv4K3CqwBxyQRNcwg.text: I went here last night with our neighbors for drinks and some spicy cajun fare. The ambiance was interesting...basically the restaurant is in an old school home. The downstairs was quiet but the upstairs was the total opposite. The bar and the live jazz band is upstairs. The jazz band is actually reall good but if you are going here for a good conversation then you might as well let them know upfront that you would prefer sitting downstairs. Personally our group liked the live music. Prices are decent and food is as well. The service was a bit slow mainly coz the place was packed!!  I ordered the Spicy chicken etouffe which was awesome. I ordered it extra spicy and man they meant it. My hubby however said that his blackened catfish was "eh". Still this is a good place to chill out with friends on a Friday night.

PVA2TfcKVagxijo5UE0Stw.text: I travel to Charlotte frequent for business and must say that all of my Business Associates and I truly enjoy the food at the Cajun Queen.  The craw-fish scampi and barbeque shrimp are excellent as starters.  The daily specials are usually phenominal.  I recently had the mahi special which I have ordered on multiple occasions.  The Duck special is also great...well prepared and very flavorful.   The environment is somewhat noisy at times and with the tight spacing can be a distraction.  I would highly recommend a visit if you are in town as I don't believe that you would be disappointed.  Enjoy MB

ruVo5g5JkbcYfwH76vCZbg.text: This place is awesome! I bought a groupon spend $20 get $40 so a few of us went to check it out.  They had a live jazz band upstairs which was great.  We shared fried green tomatoes, calamari and chicken/shrimp creole.  It was all fabulous.  Definitely a great girls night or date night place!  I took my husband there last week and he loved it!

v0Qf5B5Fgfa2LNfuZVblBA.text: When I came to Charlotte in 2009, Cajun Queen was one of the first restaurants I visited.  The food was amazing!!!  When family and friends came to town I took them there. They all raved about the food.  The past three times have been very disappointing!  I went there yesterday for dinner. The service was good the food not so much.  I ordered the Etouffee with all three my sister ordered the Diane with chicken and shrimp.  We both were unhappy with our food and the basket of biscuits that were rock hard. I don't know if there is new management or they're cutting back on seasonings to cut cost.  Either way I will not go back. Sad, I really liked this place!!

mALxbqgIsyxaydOzWFqMMA.text: We've been in Charlotte for about 6 months, transplanted from Long Island, and quite frankly, we're sick of chain food! We wanted something different, and that's exactly what we got at Cajun Queen.  We were seated quickly, and offered the choice between inside, inside upstairs where the live jazz was playing, or outside. (We went with outside, why not?)  Our waiter was attentive without being over bearing, and our drinks refilled without having to ask. He explained not only the specials but the "house favorites" as well.  We both chose something off the regular menu, wanting to see standards rather than one offs for our 1st visit, and we were not disappointed at all! We both enjoyed food that had flavor, and character, and didn't taste like everything else. I suppose coming from NY, we we're a bit spoiled by the variety and quantity of food choices, and it was nice to see with a little bit of poking around, it can still be found in our new home.  The food and the service were wonderful, and the prices were very reasonable for the amount and quality of the food we received. This is definitely a place we will return to, and will recommend to others.

_1kd6y8BBPHkFYFvKYjqCw.text: The crawfish scampi and Tilipia with crawfish topping was awesome as always, extremely consistent, exception being the gumbo, it is not typical Louisiana roux based gumbo, I will not order again. I also only give 4 stars, as Brandon, our Server, must have had something or someone else on his mind as he barely had us on his mind. Next time we will ask for Samantha, or Sam, best server in the house.

5MKyCw6WPJm5I3qu8uNrxA.text: I love this place.  Went with my gf on a random Monday.  The food, service, and live music was all great.  Drinks were beyond strong.  The seating is a little close, but I still loved it.

jdUrbo0SxQQtj2e0s8I8Dw.text: I had the fried green tomatoes and chicken shrimp and crawfish etouffee. DELISH!!! I've had authentic Louisiana dishes many times before. This is it! Will come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried green tomatoes!

-aBXXD_sheUzRUtgLjw-Fg.text: This place is great. It looks small on the outside but it's gigantic on the inside. Very quaint and reminiscent of an abode in the French quarter. I had the popcorn crawfish and the red beans and rice here. Both dishes were awesome. The pop corn crawfish was meaty and had a slight hint of spice to it not salty or anything. Let's not talk about the sweet tea. That was just marvelous. Not too sweet. It was just right.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. The popcorn crawfish was delicious!!!! And so was the red beans and rice.

8G4GJBKG_rGQlqGq1RVkOQ.text: I had the chance to taste the creole with shrimp, and it was pretty good to say the least. I would recommend using some additional spices because there was non to it. I was grossed out by a waiter taking someone's order and scratched his butt.... that just ended my dinner.

RX-Gf1OkKqS64qcAcPq0qw.text: Cajun Queen serves up consistent cajun food in a fun environment.  It's not exactly what you would find dining out in NOLA, and it's a bit pricey for what you get, but if you have a craving, it will fix that.  The one thing that makes Cajun Queen stand out is the rooftop dining.  It's a great place on a nice night.  There is also live jazz in the upstairs dining section.    Word of warning - if you order a cocktail, you only need one.  ;)

m0O07c90iR4En778Wvr_LQ.text: Terrific restaurant!   Duck was amazing!!!  Service was terrific, and music was a nice addition. Anxious to visit again!

3rK6E5lrrS5PvCJEtrthFA.text: I took my mom and grandmother for a Mother's Day brunch. The food is excellent and service was fast (especially for a holiday). Our server wasn't very engaging, but that could have been a fluke. All in all, great choice!

EzysBpv6Vx5IoJM32N2zPA.text: VERY rarely do my boyfriend and I leave dinner completely satisfied, elated and already planning our next trip. Well, Cajun Queen happened to be one of those meals.  Neither of us eat cajun/creole very often so we were a little hesitant at first. After holding on to a Groupon for a few weeks we finally made the trip...what on earth took us so long?!  One step through the doors and you're immediately transported to a raucous, lively setting reminiscent of 1980's New Orleans. Tables are tightly packed; patrons share drinks and laughs; and sounds of jazz echo from upstairs. The walls are adorned by "Nawlins" inspired artwork and an appropriate purple, gold and green palette is interwoven throughout the house.  The Gumbo was the only thing that I wasn't completely impressed with. It had good flavor and an ample helping of shrimp but I felt it was missing something. The consistency was thinner and more watered down than I anticipated. Keep in mind I am no cajun aficionado.  The boyfriend ordered the pasta special: Two blackened chicken breasts over a heaping portion of tortellini in a spicy pesto cream sauce with peppers, Andouille sausage, peppers, and artichokes. WOWEE MAMA. This was one of the most delicious meals (yes, it wasn't even my meal) that I've had in a while.  My etouffee was delicious as well, thought admittedly, not quite as impressive as the pasta dish. It did kick some heat but it was good flavorful spice heat. Large portions seemed to be the theme of night and despite force-feeding ourselves to the point of pain, we both managed to leave with decent-sized leftovers.  From the camaraderie and excellent service to the food and drinks...everything seemed to be perfect and I cannot wait to return!

5spRxRYDeayWJyK63br72A.text: Sat upstairs with a live jazz band and had a wonderful time. Must order the BBQ shrimp (tip: dip your bread in the sauce!) and Diane style entree. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ shrimp

mP9cczMd0gJOy_cSw-1wfw.text: This was our umpteenth visit to the "Queen" but brought first timer friends. It is Queens Table Week and therefore the service, while efficient, was hurried. We all felt a bit pushed.   Being a big fan of the Crawfish Etouffee my choice was easily made. We each ordered a different entree and seemed pleased with our choices. Did I mention the service was swift? We could have finished our meal in an hour flat. Our server assumed, correctly, that we were ordering from the special menu and removed the regular menu because "you won't be needing these". If you want return Customers you may want to allow sufficient time to peruse the regular menu to see what other choices are available.   Food was good, as always, but wouldn't recommend visiting during this promo week. My usual rating is 4 's but not this visit.  Sorry got to run.............

t5BpmJMPqlBu9wVIIi5O0Q.text: Cajun Queen is so good! Basically everything they have on the menu is filled with flavor!! The atmosphere is relaxing and the food is definitely well worth the price for good Cajun food. I recommend this place to everyone!

C4kbN145yBmqtWxl_ptwug.text: My friend  from New York came to visit. Read the reviews were good so we decided to go.  We arrived about 940pm Saturday night....it was a bit crowded, noisy and somewhat of an unfriendly environment.  Once greeted by the host,  she proceeded to take us to a crowded room with children and loud conversations.  We asked to move to the other side of the restaurant,  but she stated the server wasn't taken anymore tables. (hence they were closing soon).....once seated in the upstairs sectio. We were quiet happy with our table sevtion ...our server Taylor was superb gave great recommendations and was honest about the menu items.....  The food was not as  good as expected ....I ordered the crawfish  etouffe half order. It had no taste as though they scrapped the bottom of the barrel with a somewhat burnt taste......my friend ordered the fried oysters for an appetizer which she said was extremely good.  She also order a signature cocktail which I tasted and agree it was strong and good......I would give this restaurant  another try and however; I would definitely arrive before  closing hiurs....great location and nice abeyance

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried Oysters and dipping sauce

gsK0G543uWU1sKZ4qZtY5g.text: Having been to NOLA and experiencing the amazing food scene it's hard to imagine anywhere outside of LA being able to match the quality of food; however, this restaurant is awesome.  The etouffe was spot on, shrimp and grits creamy, the Cajun popcorn was a delightful surprise and the scampi unlike any other ever tried.   Great place to celebrate or just enjoy a great taste of new Orleans.

ZQeKhUuIKHlS6YGooAUvTg.text: Can you believe it took me 20 years of living in Charlotte before I tried the Cajun Queen?  I guess i have preconceived notions as to what Cajun food is like crawfish, beans, rice which are typically things I don't go for.  Yeah, I was wrong.  Not everything has all that including what I had last night.  The Blackend pork tenderloin was truly amazing.  Just the right level of spice and it was served with crispy fried plantains.  I'm still trying to figure out what the covering on the plantains were.  Also served with a black been puree which was tasty.  The side salad had a spicy vinagrette.  The only disappointment with the salad is that the carrot strips looked like they were right out of the bag you get at Harris Teeter.  Another flaw is that this dinner was with the dinner group.  I called a week in advance to reserve space for 12.  When we got there, they weren't ready for us.  We waited for a tables to be pushed together after being told the patio was full by one person when there was only one table in use.  After waiting a short time at the bar, we asked another person if we could sit outside and she said that would be easier on her.  So why couldn't we go out there to begin with.    Oh well.  That's my only complaint.  Otherwise, the service was spot on.  Water and other drinks were refilled promptly and plates were taken away quickly.  Yes, this is a place I must come back to.    Word of warning...parking is a bear here.  It might be easier parking across the street.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blackened pork tenderloin

6PRwbMNmRI0G8Epp6t_p7Q.text: Even without a Groupon I would visit Cajun Queen! The food is a taste of New Orleans, right here in the Queen City. The ambiance of this restaurant reminds me of the charm of the French Quarter.  A live jazz band plays during the week and adds that perfect touch to a wonderful dining experience. I always say I'm going to try something different, but I usually order "Three Way Diane": chicken breast, shrimp and crawfish sauteed with mushrooms, garlic, green, onions, and parsley served over a bed of rice. This dish has a hint of spice to complement the dish. The portion is perfect and depending on my mood, I have some to bring home or I eat every morsel.  Other visits to CQ, I've ordered the BBQ shrimp, shrimp etouffee and the fish of the day. I've just never written a review. The gumbo is good, but on my last visit I felt that it was missing something...just couldn't put my taste buds on it.

koGsWvVg7TDstNKbBPJbXA.text: The food has gone BLAND! I've always enjoyed Cajun Queen for the food, atmosphere and service. This time the food just didn't cut it. My 3 way etoufee had the heat but lacked flavor as did my New Orleans BBQ shrimp appetizer which looked considerably small for the large portion I ordered. My cajun martini was a bad choice as it was not chilled enough and too hot to enjoy. I'll chalk that up as my fault for trying something different. I think I'll wait awhile before returning here.

JKfNHvF-rJaWj06KMs0mPA.text: We come here every year after the Heroes Con. I think this is our 5th or so year. It's a damn shame we only get to come once a year since we don't live in Charlotte. We ordered the shrimp and grits, the etouffe, the Diane- party of 8. Everyone looks forward to this meal and we were not disappointed this year. Lovely loaf of bread as well. Service was friendly and efficient (started a tiny bit rough but corrected quickly)   It was Fathers Day but the place was empty. I'm worried! Hope it was just a slow night for them. I don't know why it's not packed every night. They solved the parking issue with Valet parking so you have no excuses.

KuL9V5tN5wmDaXaXPx6l-g.text: Reservations at 5:30 on a Saturday and it was packed. Somewhat slow on the intro and our hipster server pretty much asked our drink, appetizers and entrees at once.   Fried pickles were great as were the fried green tomatoes and fried oysters (get a half portion).   Entrees were just ... Blah. Creole tasted like a can of crushed tomatoes. Etouffee was bland as well as the pasta special. I swear they must have ran out of salt and spice. It was just embarrassing to New Orleans. We ate there some time ago but they just threw three strikes for us.   The bread pudding was good.   So, good going to the apps, smack the chef and kudos to the desserts.

dx7nh5m3FKmzgzMWENqM7w.text: I thought it was a good time..food was good..music was good..space was a little tighter than I expected...staff was very nice and on point..all n all I'd do it again

pSMoKSNTkXb2_iuglHG6zg.text: Food was tasty but the seating could be more comfortable to a point of wanting to hang out for a bit to listen to music and have some drinks. Wait staff are very nice a knowledgable about the menu. Highly recommend the "Shrimp and Crawfish" app to start and "7th St. Stumbler" as you drink. Do the complimentary valet parking sons not to have parking issues.

Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States

RE7bNZPXGgmQPQeu9Xg6IQ.text: This is my ABSOLUTE FAVORITE restaurant in North Carolina!!! I have been here several times and order the Diane every time and I am NEVER disappointed!!! Thank you for making my taste buds happy!!!

PlQgtAc32aTVeODbQTnyLw.text: I went to Cajun Queen to celebrate my birthday. My entire dinner party was very satisfied with their meal. Plus the service was excellent!

hIqCgcGGQT7j4KtHyz_JbA.text: My wife and I love the bar upstairs. The BBQ shrimp app is amazing. Save the sauce from it to and dip your bread in it. Bartenders are great and mingle well socially with customers. Makes it feel like home.

MYFVCRuUqPyCcAf45EmK6w.text: Wonderful Cajun cuisine, great live jazz music, and fantastic wine selections. Such a treat for date night!

93y7clNkL3V9UAqYMvcNFA.text: Food was delicious!   Service was great!  Table was too small for a party of four; at best, two customers.

8fr9J4hOCb7j6H-_Kc937w.text: Very loud, bad service, and the food doesn't met the expectations. We came w a party of 10 people, we didn't even get menus for a while, it was so loud we could hardly listen to our server. Dirty plates were sitting in our table for a long time. Super disappointed

4fla8Qm-UrugTTkgBo-j7Q.text: This wasn't my first visit at Cajun Queen, and as always, I leave this place with a huge smile on my face and full belly!  The food is flavorful and simply delicious! This is really the only place in Charlotte that I bring my friends who visit CLT from other States, because I know they gonna love the atmosphere of a smooth jazz and the exquisite dishes! By far this is my favorite "go-to" place in Charlotte to impress my friends that visit out of town.

w0sn8SxKK14l-20m68KVEw.text: Service was quick from the valet to the seating and food. The food was just right! The blackened catfish was awesome.

xBBBhUn3vXmyYVayTHJU8Q.text: Took my hubby (whose parents and grandparents all grew up in Mississippi, super close to Louisiana) to the Cajun Queen for some cajun food!   We entered into the foyer (lobby) and were greeted by two cheerful hostesses. They told us it would be about 15 minutes for a table and steered us upstairs to the bar while we waited for our table. We ordered two drinks and were quickly called for our table. We were seated in the small dining room to the right of the foyer. The rooms are all full of dark furniture, paintings, and dark wood. There were many people seated on the downstairs patio, and it looked to have been cooler than the small (packed) dining room. However, the cocktails we ordered when we were seated at our table quickly cooled us off.   We started our dinner with the fried green tomato appetizer. The tomatoes were artfully displayed with a creamy sauce. The sauce, in combination with the tomatoes, was fabulous! Both dinners came with our choice of gumbo or salad. The waiter highly suggested the gumbo, and it was really good. For entrees we ordered cajun shrimp and grits and crawfish etouffee. Both dinners were full of flavor and were large in size.   The upstairs dining room, adjacent to the bar, features live jazz music 7 nights a week. Definitely worth a listen while seated at the bar, or eating in that dining room.   Be sure and pick up some mardi gras beads in the front foyer, and have a sit on the front porch while you let your delicious dinner settle. Grab a photo with the giant queen gator in the front yard as a souvenir!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cajun Shrimp and Grits
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gumbo
Photo of Cajun Queen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried Green Tomatoes

ZQiAziXktLR7V3CLzjdxcQ.text: What a great place. Great building, live music, and service. Had the fried green tomatoes (yum) followed by the Chicken tortellini and the sirloin.  Will be back again

Zj0lm0ZAgQ_YzcrfupiF0w.text: This is one of our favorite spots.  HIGHLY recommend the fish specials and the crawfish scampi.  My husband has also enjoyed the blackened ribeye and the pork.  Note, however, that some things are sub-par, namely: the dinner salad, the gumbo and the bread.  While dinner ranks as outstanding in my opinion, these items are surprisingly unsatisfying.  Wine list could be better, too.

1VmXeiTlLXLLhvbHVrJFug.text: I absolutely love the food here. With the perfect mix of fresh, delicious cajun food and eclectic decor in an old, historic house turned restaurant, you really can't go wrong. The parking can be a pain on weekend evenings and the quarters can be quite tight, for these reasons I typically visit Cajun Queen on weekday nights. The fried oysters are my favorite - and I typically don't do fried!

nwA0HIsPre-C0tKg6AZYJA.text: Two recommendations.  1. Get the Duck.  2. Order one of the fish specials and pick your toppings.  Oh wait three recommendations---eat it upstairs with the Gator Band.  The guys are as funny as they are old.  Warning:  By far the best dish on the menu is the BBQ shrimp.  My mouth is watering just typing the name (no kidding).  But it will give you some "special" breath.  Bring mints.  Tip: The Etouffee, Diane and Creole travel well and are good for catering.  We actually had a sampling for our Christmas party years back. Yum.  If you can handle the calories the BANANA FOSTERS french toast is crazy good.  I mean crazy crazy good.  It's a good thing I think they only do breakfast once a week.

nPMNbInz_NpEQzCaO88-7A.text: This.food.is.delicious. Please eat here. Do I sound like I'm begging? Because i am. I want someone to taste these shrimp and grits! I also had the popcorn crawfish as an appetizer and though i wish it was a little warmer, it was cool enough that i could immediately start tasting the goodness that was laying in front of me. The waiters seemed to have a strange energy, but I didn't care because the food was so good. Must Go!!

wnfrgpce5fHRQIth0ZIYMQ.text: Elizabeth is one of my favorite parts of town; I love how old houses have been remade into restaurants and offices.  Too often charming old buildings are paved over and replaces with concrete boxes.  The Cajun Queen is in one of these old homes, and this lends it a very intimate and warm atmosphere.  Of course, atmosphere isn't everything when it comes to restaurants, but the food at the Cajun Queen was fortunately spot-on as well.  Our tables started with the fried oyster appetizer, and it was a hit: emarkably light for a fried dish, it was like eating little oyster clouds.  For my main course, I ordered etouffee with all three (chicken, shrimp, and crawfish).  It was creamy and deeply, darkly spicy.  I was a little worried about the protein aspect, since those three items have different cooking times, but all were perfectly done.  The Cajun Queen provided us with a delicious dinner.  I knock a single star off only because the service, while not bad, wasn't great either.  The place isn't exactly cheap, so our waiter earned a nice tip.  He could've paid just slightly more attention to our table.  Oh well, everyone has an off day.

ze9WAm7fBEj9tRN1_gpI2w.text: LOVE me some Cajun Queen.  Love it.  Love the intimate atmosphere, love the jazz band upstairs... and the hubster loves the 7th Street Stumbler (have you ever seen a 6'4, 300lb man stumble? It's not pretty).  FGT's are to DIE for.  I'm a northerner, so I don't really have a ton of iterations to compare them to, but they are pretty damn good.  Crawfish. Etoufee. 'Nuff said.  So flavorful and delicious.  This is one of our top 10 restaurants in the QC.  Worth a visit, fo sho!

lcU8P5IX-U7u6R3w5-uwOQ.text: Amazing Fried Green Tomatoes and Blackened Pork Tenderloin.  I will order both of these next time I go back.  Very cool atmosphere in a cozy old house.  Live bands play upstairs and it can be loud, so sit downstairs if you want to enjoy your conversation.

2fFscHeOIN4T7djK4BDY2A.text: Very quaint location and decor! Just me on a Monday night. Sat upstairs at the bar and had a very nice experience with live music and a very friendly bartender.

Q0H4SGwHbp_K_kOQpGRiSg.text: LOVE the Etouffee! The chicken with rice and beans is amazing. I can't wait to go back. I love the casual feel and the food is just down right good.

l7wn8tW5O-7KwUCdV9-kMQ.text: This place was great and the food was spot on however the wait staff I noticed were all men and they could be more friendly.

XxTFTWZW_DKBG0OovtgNQA.text: This was my first time trying this particular restaurant.  I've visited New Orleans quite a few times, and was excited to get the opportunity to go there.  The atmosphere had a very intimate setting. However, I was looking forward to their catfish.  When the waiter stated that they ran out 10 minutes before we got there, we had to pay for an uncharge for a better fish.  Didn't quite understand that, since they were the ones that ran out of the catfish.  I'll go back there, but not anytime soon.
